description:
Temporal Aria, Temporal Aria
A breathtaking contemporary circus spectacle exploring the profound tension between control and surrender.

About this Event


WINNER - Momentous Movement Award (NZ Fringe 2025)
WINNER - Take Your Breath Away Award (Reykjavik Fringe 2025)

Step into a world where gravity bends and the boundaries of the human body are redefined. Temporal Aria is a breathtaking contemporary circus experience that fuses the ancient art of hair suspension with acrobatics to explore the profound tension between control and surrender.
Inspired by performer Nicole Maisey’s recent ADHD diagnosis, the show becomes a deeply personal exploration of distractibility, executive dysfunction, and the pursuit of inner peace. Through feats of extraordinary strength and vulnerability, Nicole transforms struggle into artistry, expressing a journey toward balance and self-acceptance.
At its heart, Temporal Aria is about learning to release control and accept support, a powerful shift from isolation to connection. As Nicole navigates the physical and emotional extremes of her art, she discovers that surrender is not weakness, but a pathway to strength, resilience, and unexpected grace.
Set to a mesmerizing soundscape, Temporal Aria is both a spectacle and a meditation. a poetic intersection of circus, emotion, and identity. It’s not just about the act of letting go, but about what we discover in the process: joy, contentment, and the redefinition of success as peace within.
Prepare to be captivated by a performance that truly takes your breath away.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf, Experience the world through the lens of award-winning photojournalists at The World Press Photo Exhibition at Tākina. This event showcases this year’s best visual journalism, featuring powerful and thought-provoking images from New Zealand and around the world.
Additionally, visitors can view "The 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf: The Friends, Influences and Inspirations Exhibition," curated by Simon Woolf.
Photos on display will feature images by Ronald Woolf and Spencer Digby (Te Papa Tongarewa Collection), alongside works by Wellington’s own Simon Woolf, internationally renowned photographer Brian Brake, and legendary sports photographer Peter Bush. The exhibition will also display images by Barry Durrant, former chief photographer of The Dominion, as well as photographs by acclaimed recent talents, including Pulitzer Prize winner Melanie Burford, celebrated international photojournalist Simon Townsley, and esteemed photo historian Graham Stewart.
Don't miss your chance to see Kiwi photographers on show at Tākina.
Epson NZ sponsors the 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf.
Event Details:
• 5 September – 5 October: 10 am – 5 pm
• Tākina Exhibition Space
• Host: New Zealand Academy of Fine Arts.
Tickets available online or at the door.
Photo: © DAVID UNWIN / The Post.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Amber Temple at Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington, The Amber Temple marries mysticism with gritty, ghoulish escapades of rogues and renegades. Vignettes of characters similar to you, similar to me, similar to someone you may have been or may one day become, all on the path towards the Amber Temple.
From the bowels of the molten earth, to the jowls of the predatory opportunist, to the angel casting light from celestial constellations, you will find yourself wrapped in a web from a sliver of time, a faraway place, perhaps an unknown space, as musician and dancer weave their tall tales of trials and tribulations, mortal life and looming death, unwavering love and venomous hate, environmentalism and satirical social commentary.
An original music and interpretive dance collaboration between singer-songwriter Julian Temple and contemporary dancer Amber Stephens.
Temple, known mostly for his work in the eponymous Julian Temple Band has written all new works for the project while Stephens, a trained contemporary ballet dancer and choreographer who ran her own dance company in Vienna, has choreographed the interpretive dance for this unique performance.
“A live dancer added a visceral element to an already emotional performance. Having a responsive artist interacting and interpreting the music through movement only heightened the experience. It bridged the gap between performer and audience.”
- Ed Castelow - Dictaphone Blues
“You’ll be a converted fan of The Amber Temple before they’ve even finished their first song. There’s an obvious sense of originality, coupled with carefully crafted dance moments and some of the most intense and outstanding folk songwriting you’ve heard. There’s a feeling though that nothing is premeditated and that improvisation is the star of the show - the kind of performance that requires decades of experience. Luckily for us, Julian and Amber have this in spades. Do yourself a favour, I guarantee you’ve seen nothing like it.”
- Sam Cullen - Singer/Songwriter
“Even having an understanding of the type of show The Amber Temple would be putting on when booking them - I was blown away by the amount of drama, tension and world-building Julian & Amber are able to accomplish in such an agile performance. The Amber Temple is a totally unique and utterly engaging experience which should be seen and celebrated.”
- Chris Scott - Seaside Music
Show starts at 7 Presale tickets $20 (+BF) via undertheradar.co.nz or $25 on the door
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be

space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com”

description:
The Art of Ikebana exhibition, The Art of Ikebana exhibition
Step into a world of elegance and precision at The Art of Ikebana Exhibition, presented by Ikebana Wellington. This two-day showcase celebrates the centuries-old Japanese art of flower arranging, where every stem, leaf, and bloom is placed with care and intention.

Wander through the Begonia House and enjoy a stunning display of spring arrangements that combine natural beauty with artistic expression. Members of Ikebana Wellington, a passionate group connected through the Wellington Sogetsu Teachers’ Association, will be on hand to share their love for this timeless craft.

Free public demonstrations:
Saturday – 11:30am & 1:30pm
Sunday – 1:30pm

Whether you’re an avid gardener, an art lover, or simply curious, this is a chance to slow down, be inspired, and experience the quiet artistry of Ikebana.

This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.

description:
The Book of Will Auditions, The audition form is available here: https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSdBs0sCiXD.../viewform...
“Those words are our lives’ work, Will’s life. If we don’t find them, they die with us.”
London. 1619. William Shakespeare has been gone for three years, and the other members of the King’s men are starting to make their final exits. The remaining members of the company are horrified to realise that their dear friend’s plays, the plays that they spent their lives bringing to life, are in danger of being lost to time. It’s a mad scramble to find what copies they still have, fill in the blanks with their memories, claw back the rights to print from unscrupulous publishers, and find enough money to print a giant book in an era where the majority of people couldn’t read. Without this labour of love, most of the works of a beloved playwright would have been lost to time.
This play is a celebration of theatre, a meditation on legacy, and a (mostly) true history of loyal friends.
Shakespeare is for everyone and London in the 17th century was not all white. The genders below are the gender the character will be played as, but don’t let that limit you. While this play can be done with 10 actors, if you’re new to the theatre and want to give it a go, there are smaller roles available.
There will be some moments of intimacy and physical affection between characters, such as hugs and other gestures of closeness, and a kiss or two between the married couples.
Character Breakdown
- Henry Condell (male, 40s - 50s) - Feisty, actor in the King's Men, the optimistic one (will
not double with any other role). Shares a kiss with Elizabeth.
- John Heminges (male, 50s - 60s) - A good and serious gentleman, financial manager of
the King's Men, owner of the Globe Tap House, the reasonable one (will not double with
any other role). Shares a kiss with Rebecca.
- Richard Burbage (male, 50s-60s) - Seasoned lion of the stage, loud and proud (will double with other roles).
- Alice Heminges (female, 30s) - John's daughter, knows everyone, one of the boys (will double with other roles).
- Boy Hamlet (male, 20s) - Young, thinks he's Burbage but definitely isn't (will double with other roles).
- Ben Jonson (male, 50s) - Poet laureate, a drunk with big feelings (will double with other
roles).
- Elizabeth Condell (female, 40s) - A lot of fun and very sharp. Henry's wife (will double with other roles). Shares a kiss with Henry.
- Rebecca Heminges (female, 50s) - A strong, independent woman who has seen a lot.
- John's wife (will double with other roles). Shares a kiss with John.
- Ed Knight (male, 40s-50s) - Stage manager of the King's Men, an odd duck (will double
with other roles).
- Ralph Crane (male, 40s-60s) - The original Shakespeare nerd, quiet and shy (will double
with other roles).
- William Jaggard (male, 50s-70s) - A used car salesman of a man even though he's a few
centuries early (will double with other roles).
- Isaac Jaggard (male, 30s-40s) - A not-so secret romantic and a lover of the theatre (will
double with other roles).
- Marcus (male, 20s) - A blunt printer's apprentice (will double with other roles).
- Emilia Bassano Lanier (female, 50s) - the dark lady of the sonnets (will double with other roles).
- Anne Hathaway Shakespeare (female, 60s) - The lady who got the second best bed (will double with other roles).
- Susannah Shakespeare (female, 30s) - Shakespeare's daughter (will double with other
roles).
- Additional roles (any age) - Barman 1, Barman 2, Fruit seller, Horatio, Marcellus,

description:
The Conditions of Rapture: Amy Marguerite, Sophie Van Waardenberg & Emma Barnes | Writers on Mondays, Three extraordinary poets introduce their new collections, books of poetry brimming over with feeling, and taut with intellectual curiosity. Amy Marguerite (over under fed), Sophie van Waardenberg (No Good), and Emma Barnes (IF WE KNEW HOW TO WE WOULD) talk with Anna Jackson about the conditionality of rapture, the loveliness of loneliness, the difficulty of living in a hungry body, how it has felt to keep writing through a pandemic, heart-break and grief, and why it matters to make space for metaphor and memory, for sparrows and bees and a guinea-pig, eating a dandelion, its mouth full of gold.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.

The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball will celebrate five years of Marama excellence and the legacy of the growing Wellington Ballroom* scene.

This event is for adults only.
*BALLROOM
Ballroom is a subculture created in the late 1960s in Harlem, New York. Forged by Black and Latinx trans women and queer communities, it began as a protest against the racism they faced from White counterparts within the LGBTQIA+ community, as well as the transphobia and queerphobia they faced from mainstream society.
It is a space held to protect trans women of colour. Therefore, guests and participants of this culture alike must uphold respect and honour for this sacred space and those from which it came from. Homophobia, transphobia, or any discriminatory language and/or beliefs will not be tolerated. Remember to check your privilege at the door.
Learn more about the culture of Underground Ballroom on Google Arts and Culture.
Be sure to check out the growing Wellington Ballroom scene and community by following @houseofmarama and @ova_collective on Instagram.

description:
The Life of Henry the Fifth, A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Victory or ruin rests on his shoulders, yet his newfound power isolates him, leaving him lost, uncertain, and deeply unsettled.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past. It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
With only ten dynamic performers, this is Henry the Fifth like never before: stripped back, sharp, and driven by the raw intensity of Shakespeare’s text.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.
Full show duration: 95 min including a 15 min intermission.
“This production epitomises what can be achieved when talent, teamwork, hard work, opportunity and passion combine.’”
NZ Herald on The Tragedy of Macbeth

description:
The Monster in the Maze, The myth of the Minotaur is a tale almost as old as storytelling itself, but with The Monster in the Maze Jonathan Dove and Alisdair Middleton have excavated rich, new life from this classic. In this brand new staging by director Anapela Polataivao (Red White and Brass, Wild Dogs Under My Skirt), this story will be told as never before.

When King Minos defeats the Athenians, he metes out his punishment in the cruellest way possible: by destroying their hope for the future. Every year, the king compels the conquered Athenians to send him their youth, to be fed to the terrible beast at the centre of his island’s maze: the Minotaur. As King Minos triumphs, his great monster “will eat your future, it will rip your hope, it will stamp your youth, your children in the sand.”

As the vindictive king will soon learn, however, these youth will not accept their fate without a fierce challenge. The Monster in the Maze is a story about resistance; about justice; about finding power not in oppression, but in collectivism. Fittingly, then, it’s also a groundbreaking work in its form: a community-focused and community-driven opera in which young and community singers and players stand proudly shoulder-to-shoulder with their professional counterparts, and in which both are integral.

The Monster in the Maze has been roundly praised by audiences, participants and reviewers worldwide, and in its Aotearoa debut season, it will serve as a gorgeous articulation of New Zealand Opera’s reciprocal community kaupapa.

Sung in English with surtitles.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Māori Sidesteps, Māori made mischief

Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes

description:
The Pantoloons Present: Cinderella, The Pantoloons Present: Cinderella
Glass slippers, royal balls, and a Fairy Godmother who’s still on her learner’s licence, what could possibly go wrong?

Prince Percy is hopelessly charming (emphasis on hopeless), the Queen is busy approving new royal wave techniques (it’s very hard work being a Queen!), the step-sisters are causing chaos in couture, and Buttons has big dreams!

Will true friendship win over fairy-tale romance? Will Buttons dreams come true? And who is behind the kingdom’s mysterious gossip vlog? Packed with music, mischief, and magical mayhem, this is Cinderella with a twist, a tune, and a whole lot of sparkle! Step into a spellbinding world of wonder where dreams shimmer, magic floats on the breeze, and anything is possible… but only until the clock strikes twelve!

REVIEWS FOR RED RIDING HOOD

“You guys were amazing, thank you so much. Me and the kids had an amazing time. We can’t wait for the next holidays t come see you again.”

“My kids had a blast! My little man was in hysterics at Mr Moa.”

“Love everything that you do and each time gets better and better.”

description:
The Wellington Comedy Club with Ben Hurley and Friends, The Wellington Comedy Club Christmas Special heads to the Fringe Bar, with guest MC Ben Hurley

Ben Hurley - As seen on The Project, Seven Sharp, and more
With a massive but hugely likeable stage presence, Hurley can win over even the toughest room. A sharp improvisational mind and well honed original material make Hurley a popular act with audiences and critics alike.

Featuring:

Cori Gonzalez-Macuer
7 Days regular and star of What We Do In The Shadows, Cori Gonzalez-Macuer has been performing his unique brand of self-deprecating observational and deadpan comedy since 2003.

Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee
Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian. She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.

Kipling DC - 2026 Billy T Award nominee
Kipling is the self proclaimed ‘Big Dog’ of Wellington comedy. This jack russell with a microphone uses his quick wit and killer crowdwork to leave his audiences in stitches and constantly guessing about what’s coming next.

Mo Munn is a multi-award-winning stand-up comedian, improviser and writer based in Wellington, New Zealand.
A regular on the professional stand-up circuit in Pōneke, Mo has taken shows to the NZ International Comedy Festival, NZ Fringe Festival, NZ Improv Festival and Chicago iO Festival.

This event made possible with support from Pub Charities Ltd, and Wellington City Council

Helping raise funds for the 2026 Wellington Comedy season, including the Wellington Comedy Club Rainbow showcase, and the 2026 Wellington Raw Comedy Quest

description:
The hand of the architect — John Scott, Delving into the Futuna Chapel Trust archive, the Scott family archive and the newly established and digitised John Scott Drawing Archive at the Alexander Turnbull Library, Nick Bevin will explore and reveal the extent and significance of the work of architect John Scott.
Join us at the Library or online. Register for a Zoom link: https://dia-nz.zoom.us/.../WN_gAVkcTdRRASW9zyDCrU4Zg...
Insights from the John Scott architectural archive
Join us for a talk by Nick Bevin, former architect and Futuna Chapel Trustee, as he delves into the life and work of one of Aotearoa New Zealand’s most influential architects — John Scott (1924–1992).
This presentation will showcase newly digitised materials from the John Scott Drawing Archive at the Alexander Turnbull Library, including never-before-seen sketches, architectural drawings, photographs, and audiovisual recordings.
John Scott: Architect — Website
Designing the iconic Futuna chapel
John Scott, a pioneering Māori architect, is celebrated for his bold, culturally resonant designs — most notably the iconic Futuna Chapel. Drawing on years of research, Nick Bevin will offer fresh insights into John Scott’s creative process and enduring architectural legacy.
The Library welcomed the John Scott archive of architectural records into the Alexander Turnbull Library collections in 2020.
Caring for the John Scott collection — Blog post: https://natlib.govt.nz/.../caring-for-the-john-scott...
A Friends of the Turnbull Library event
The Friends of the Turnbull Library, Ngā Hoa o te Whare Pukapuka Turnbull, offers a monthly programme of free public talks. These talks are held in the National Library in Wellington and on Zoom. Some of these talks will be repeated in Auckland. The public programme highlights the work of researchers who draw on Turnbull material for their projects and staff who care for and research the collections.
About the speaker
Nick Bevin practised as an architect from 1984 to 2024 and was made a Distinguished Fellow of the New Zealand Institute of Architects in 2022.
In 2006, Nick first became involved with the Futuna Chapel Trust. He was drawn in by an early childhood memory, triggered by a black and white image of the opening of the Chapel on 19 March 1961, where he remembered accompanying his parents to the opening of the chapel. Since then he has developed a growing admiration for the chapel’s architect John Scott, and was involved in the gifting process of the John Scott Drawing Archive to the Alexander Turnbull library in 2020.
Nick chaired the Chapel Trust from 2009 to 2024 and remains a trustee. With fellow trustee Greg O’Brien, Nick co-edited the book Futuna – Life of a Building published in 2016. In 2024, Nick participated in the organisation of an exhibition at Futuna Chapel that included a number of John Scott’s drawings from the Turnbull Collection.

description:
Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland, The impact of colonisation and urban drift are themes in a theatrical reboot at the next Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. ‘Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland’ was originally commissioned by the festival in 1992. Its return 34 years later at the 2026 festival is highly anticipated. It has become a landmark piece of New Zealand theatre — exploring the tension between past and future. Set in the summer of 1965, the play follows Hone, who brings his family from New Zealand’s East Cape to the South Island in search of a better life. As they gather for a beachside birthday hāngī with their Pākehā guests, buried secrets and cultural tensions rise to the surface. Far from their  tīpuna , the family must navigate questions of identity, belonging, and survival. 
Waiora Te Ūkaipō was conceived, written and directed by Hone Kouka (Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kahungunu). The multi-award-winning writer/director has penned 13 plays. Many have been staged in Aotearoa and further afield in Canada, South Africa, New Caledonia, and the UK. Waiora Te Ūkaipō is presented in partnership with the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts, Te Ahurei Toi o Tāmaki Auckland Arts Festival, Auckland Theatre Company and Tawata Productions.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Wellington Photographic Society - Annual Exhibition 2025, The Wellington Photographic Society’s annual exhibition is a highlight of our year, bringing together the creative work of our members and sharing it with the wider public. For us, it’s not just a chance to hang photographs on the wall – it’s an opportunity to celebrate the art of photography, showcase the talent within our community, and invite others to discover what makes photography such an inspiring and accessible pursuit.
This year’s exhibition offers a diverse collection of images captured both close to home and further afield. You’ll see photographs from all around the world – landscapes, portraits, street scenes, and wildlife – but the heart of the exhibition is firmly rooted in Wellington. Our members have drawn inspiration from the beauty and variety of our own backyard: dramatic coastlines, majestic mountains, vibrant cities, and the small, fleeting details that make life unique.
We are also proud to display images created during our group meet-ups, workshops, and learning sessions. These gatherings are at the heart of what we do as a society, offering members the chance to connect, experiment, and grow their photographic skills in a supportive and friendly environment. The exhibition is therefore more than just a showcase of individual work – it’s a reflection of the shared learning, encouragement, and passion that our community thrives on.
Visitors can expect to see a wide range of styles and techniques, from classic black-and-white to bold digital artistry. Whether you are a seasoned photographer, someone with a casual interest in the medium, or simply curious to see the world through a different lens, there will be something here to inspire you.
Opening Night: 29th September, 7pm (private event, by invitation only)
Public Viewing: 30th September onwards
Opening Hours: 10am – 6pm most days, extended to 8pm on Friday/Saturday
We warmly invite you to join us, explore the exhibition, and experience the world as seen through the eyes of our members. Who knows – you may even feel inspired to pick up a camera yourself and consider becoming part of the Wellington Photographic Society.
For more information, visit: wps.org.nz

description:
World Press Photo 2025 exhibition, This photography exhibition features powerful, thought-provoking images from around the world. The event brings together photographers and storytellers whose work highlights pressing social, environmental, and political issues.
This year’s event coincides with the 70th Anniversary Retrospective (1955-2025) – a celebration of iconic images and stories from seven decades of the World Press Photo competition. The retrospective offers a historical journey through the evolving art of photojournalism and marks an era that also gave birth to rock ‘n’ roll.
Also featuring :
• Photography by Woolf 90th Anniversary Exhibition
• The Photographic Society of New Zealand
• The Nature Photography Society of NZ
• The Woolf Te Papa Collection includes special archival and historical content and work by leading NZ Photographers such as Brian Brake.
• Dates: Daily from Friday September 5 – Sunday October 5, 2025
• Venue: Takina, Exhibition space, Ground Floor Wellington
• Host: New Zealand Academy of Fine Arts (NZAFA)
• Tickets: Adults $21. Under 14 $11. Ticket sales at the door.

description:
Young Photographer Award 2025, Join us for an evening of inspiration, creativity and photography
Join us for the inaugural Young Photographer Award, the first event of its kind in New Zealand celebrating young creative talent aged 7 to 18.
Over the past year we have run more than 80 workshops and inspired over 180 kids to try photography. Many arrived with no previous experience and discovered a new way to express themselves. Some even chose photography as their future career. Our workshops are fully inclusive and also support kids who may need extra learning help, giving them a space to slow down, focus and build confidence through creativity.
Held in Lower Hutt, Wellington, this evening is all about creativity, wonder and community. Students who took part in our photography workshops will have their work displayed at the event, and our nominated young photographers will receive special awards recognising their talent, effort and unique way of seeing the world.
A creative evening for everyone
The event will be inspiring not only for young photographers but also for adults, families and anyone who loves creativity and photography. It is a great chance to support young talent, enjoy beautiful images and be part of a welcoming creative community.
Bring your friends and whānau. The more support we show our young photographers, the more their creativity shines and inspires others.
Guest speakers
We are excited to welcome two inspiring speakers:
Tushar Sharma

Landscape and nature photographer, conservationist and founder of IMAGEn8, an Auckland-based charity offering photography workshops for kids. Tushar’s work focuses on connecting young people with the natural world through the lens.
Chris McKeown

Chris is a Wellington photographer whose images have been nominated for multiple awards and published widely. His work appears in calendars, fine art prints, canvases and magazines. His photos are also licensed for annual reports, websites, branding, headshots and large public-space murals. Chris photographs events, family gatherings, performances, sporting events and weddings, bringing a warm and thoughtful approach to every project.

description:
ration the Queen's veges, Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum
Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho
Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho
In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No. Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien. ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood. While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.
Ration the Queen’s veges is a story of how one action can inspire change in unlikely places. It is a story about the quiet voice of defiance that still burns within us even when we are silenced – a piece of gum and Brian, Te Wehi’s ingenious cellmate, were all that was needed to fan the flames and hear them roar.

description:
1st Joint SETAC AU & ACTRA Conference, We are excited to invite you to join us in Te Whanganui-ā-Tara Wellington, Aotearoa New Zealand from 25-28 August 2025 to experience the first ever joint Society of Environmental Toxicology and Chemistry Australasia (SETAC AU) and the Australasian College of Toxicology & Risk Assessment (ACTRA) conference.
The theme of this year’s conference is:
“Building a lasting legacy: Our choice, their future”
What legacy will our work leave for future generations?
Rooted in an understanding of the impacts of chemicals and emerging challenges, this conference will explore how diverse knowledge systems, collaborations, and innovative educational and engagement strategies can secure a better outlook for generations to come.
Scientists, knowledge keepers, practitioners, and end-users from diverse fields will share their research, insights, and strategies, fostering collaboration for improved environmental outcomes.
Hosted by The Environmental Protection Authority Te Mana Rauhī Taiao
https://www.epa.govt.nz/

description:
Analytics Forum: Social Investment (Wellington, Tue 14 Oct 25), Join us for an NZ Data Science + Analytics Forum event, hosted by the Social Investment Agency / Toi Hou Tāngata (SIA). This event will cover the Agency’s work using data and analytics to support evidence-based decision-making across the social sector, with four speakers each sharing their work, with opportunities for Q&A and networking.
This is a great opportunity to hear direct from SIA and connect with your peers in the Data Science and Analytics field, to learn from some of the leading voices in analytics, data engineering, evaluation, data-driven outcomes, and economic modelling.
Thanks to the Social Investment Agency for hosting this event.
Welcome and Introductions
Sara van der Velde, Chief Executive Officer (Acting), Nicholson Consulting, and Christopher Reid, Manager Pae Ora Data & Insights, Ara Poutama Aotearoa, for NZ Data Science & Analytics Forum
Kylie Reiri, Deputy Chief Executive – Transformation, Technology and Enabling Services, opening remarks for SIA
Speakers
1. Louise Pirini - Manager, Evidence and Insight service
Social Investment and data driven decision making
Explore why data is the power behind social investment – – and how evidence, outcomes, and impact measurement are driving better insights for decision-makers.
2. Peter Holmes - Data Engineer
Feedback loops and data tools
The importance of feedback loops in developing and delivering useful data products such as the Regional Data Explorer.
3. Dan Young - Senior Analyst, Data Science
Analysis and accelerators
Discover how automation and tools like cost-benefit analysis are accelerating evidence-based decisions across the social sector, drawing on linked data using the Stats NZ Integrated Data Infrastructure (IDI) and beyond.
4. Andrew Webber - Chief Economist
Learning and impact measurement
Exploring how the Social Investment Fund is moving from burdensome reporting to practical learning conversations that generate more useful insights for decision-making and provide a clear view of causal impact.

The New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum events are free to attend (with an Eventbrite ticket) and open to anyone that has an interest in Data Science and Analytics. Please note that SIA have an in-person event capacity cap of 65 tickets so those getting tickets early will get priority access. This is an in-person only event to allow for discussion and questions.
For more information on the New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum, check us out at https://analytics.org.nz/. Sign up to receive notifications of our future events!
label: Business & Networking

description:
Annual Compliance Forum 2025 - Wellington, Solving Compliance Together – From Chaos to Confidence

Audience: IQPs | Facility Managers | Council Staff
Purpose: To deliver updates, explore common compliance gaps, and model a solution pathway through real-time, cross-role collaboration.
Your Host: Rosemary (Rosie) Killip
Rosie is the go-to expert in building compliance training. With over 30 years of experience breaking down complex rules into actionable insights, she has been a trusted authority in the field since the 1990s. As the founder of Building Networks in 2000, Rosie has dedicated her career to making building law accessible and practical—whether on an international platform or right here in New Zealand.
Plenary: Compliance in 2025 – What’s Changed & What Still Trips Us Up
Start the day with a high-level overview of recent changes in compliance legislation, audit findings, and council trends. We’ll explore how the same problems show up differently for IQPs, FMs, and Council staff, and introduce the 5-Step Compliance Navigator Blueprint to help untangle the chaos.

Session 1: Group Problem Solving – “Start with the Schedule”
Activity: Fix the Faulty Building
Join a mixed-role group and work through a fictional building scenario with missing links, handover gaps, and a messy compliance schedule.
Facilitators will rotate with role-based prompts as you:
Identify what’s gone wrong
Map who's missing what
Explore how the CLARITY phase of the Blueprint can get things back on track

Debrief: The Real Cost of Getting it Wrong
Explore real-world case studies of where compliance failed, from fines to stand-offs to failed inspections.
This session highlights how better role clarity and cross-role collaboration could have prevented most issues.

Session 2: Step Into Clarity – Your Blueprint in Action
Format: Guided Workshop
Get hands-on with the first step of the Compliance Navigator Blueprint: CLARITY.
Through self-assessment, small-group reflection, and practical tools, you’ll uncover where your current system is falling short, and how to start fixing it.
You’ll receive:
A CLARITY self-assessment questionnaire
A sample Roles & Responsibilities Matrix
A “Top 10 Common Gaps” cheat sheet
A quick-start guide to the 5-Step Blueprint
Walk away with a clearer picture of your compliance gaps—and the confidence to tackle them.

Final Session: Your Compliance Compass – Staying Aligned Over Time
Format: Mini-Workshop

Join us on Thursday, 28 August at GHD for a Project Spotlight on the digital delivery of Heke Rua Archives — one of Aotearoa’s most ambitious façades, and a truly industry-leading example of BIM in action.
Hear from Revizto, Thermosash, Warren and Mahoney, and WT as they share how digital technology helped overcome the project’s extraordinary complexity — enabling seamless collaboration and unified digital workflows that crossed traditional disciplinary boundaries.
Revizto will kick things off with a short sponsor presentation, highlighting how their platform supported project delivery from design through to construction.
Roja from Thermosash will share how their team continues to evolve digital workflows to meet the demands of an ever-changing, collaborative landscape — and the unique challenges of delivering a façade of this scale.

Because your future doesn’t wait for finals.

description:

Just as companies need a board to guide them, you deserve a trusted circle to help with career decisions, fresh perspectives, and ongoing accountability.

This interactive 2-hour session is for women at every stage - from new graduates to senior leaders. Over a few drinks and snacks, you’ll:
Learn: What a professional board of directors is, how they work and why they’re so impactful.
Connect: We’ll pre-match you with 4-5 others at a similar stage and situation. This will be your board for the evening!

Designed for busy people, Powrsuit combines bite-sized learning, peer coaching, and micro-networking in one all-inclusive membership. With weekly live events and on-demand access through our web and mobile apps, you will make step-by-step progress in your career, on your terms.

Not many honest conversations about what it actually takes to use it in real products.
Most teams can get a demo working.
The hard part is everything that comes after. Reliability, trust, cost, UX, and fitting AI into how teams actually build and ship software.
This meetup is about that gap.
We’re hosting a relaxed, in-person session for people who are past the hype and want to talk about how AI is really being used day to day. Expect practical examples, candid discussion, and time to ask questions rather than polished slides or buzzwords.
Speakers:
Nik Wakelin, Founder of Sterling
Nik will give a genuine look under the hood of Sterling, showing how they’re using AI both in the product and to build it at speed, including the tooling and workflows that are helping them move fast.
Hirtarth Sharma, Founding Engineer at Grw AI
Hirtarth will talk candidly about how they are using AI today, the trade-offs they’ve made, and what’s surprised them along the way.
No buzzwords. No thought leadership. Just builders talking shop.

description:
Compliance made SME-asy: Employment basics with ATH Consulting, Are you confident in navigating the complexities of employment relationships in today’s ever-changing workplace? Join us for a comprehensive workshop designed for managers, employers, and business owners who want to deepen their understanding of employment fundamentals and people management best practices.
What You’ll Learn:
Foundations of Employment Relationships:
Explore the essential components that shape every employment relationship, including relevant legislation, terms and conditions, and the pivotal role of workplace policies and procedures.
Understanding Employment Types:
Distinguish between permanent, full-time, casual, and seasonal roles, and learn how each type impacts your obligations and management strategies.
Employment Legislation Essentials:
Get a practical overview of the 10 key employment laws that influence your workplace, ensuring you stay compliant and informed.
Good Faith and Agreements:
Discover the importance of acting in good faith and the differences between Individual Employment Agreements (IEA) and Collective Employment Agreements (CEA), including mandatory clauses and recommended “nice to have” terms.
Managing Change:
Learn best practices for handling variations to employment agreements and implementing effective workplace policies and procedures.
People Management Mastery:
Gain insights into the employee lifecycle, building a strong employment brand, and managing common workplace issues such as performance improvement plans (PiP), disciplinary processes, attendance, and health and wellbeing.
Leadership and Succession:
Identify the hallmarks of poor leadership and develop strategies for effective succession planning to future-proof your team.
Support Systems:
Know where to get help—learn when to trust your gut, when to rely on facts, and how to access the right support at the right time.
This workshop is your opportunity to build confidence, reduce risk, and enhance your leadership toolkit. Whether you’re new to managing people or looking to refresh your knowledge, you’ll leave with practical insights and actionable strategies for every stage of the employment relationship.
Don’t miss this chance to strengthen your employment management skills and connect with peers facing similar challenges. Register now and take the next step toward becoming a more effective, knowledgeable, and resilient leader.
When: Wednesday 10 September 9.00 am - 11.00 am
Where: Carterton Community Courthouse (next to Events Centre) Holloway Street, Carterton
Cost: Members $65 + GST, Non-Members $120 +GST
This workshop needs a minimum of 15 attendees to go ahead.

About this Event

Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass is an intensely practical guide through the essentials of contract law, exploring such details as when a contract will be required, when you have a contract (and don’t necessarily know it), what types of contract exist and the effect of legislation on your contractual arrangements.
This masterclass also scrutinises what happens when things go wrong, including how you can get out of a contract, options for assessing damages and remedies for breach and looking at the contractual implications of working in an e-commerce environment. You will grasp the crucial ingredients required for a good contract, and gain tips to better understand and manage your contracts.

description:
Cultivating a Positive Workplace Culture for High-Performance Teams, This course is designed for leaders, managers, and organisational change agents who want to foster a positive workplace culture that drives high performance, collaboration, and employee wellbeing. Participants will explore the essential principles of creating an environment that nurtures trust, accountability, inclusivity, and engagement. Through practical strategies, case studies, and interactive discussions, participants will learn how to develop a culture that motivates teams to excel, encourages open communication, and supports professional growth.

Key Topics Include:
• Building a culture of trust and psychological safety
• Fostering open communication and feedback loops
• Aligning values and purpose with organisational goals
• Promoting inclusivity, diversity, and belonging
• Recognising and celebrating achievements
• Encouraging work-life balance and wellbeing
• Developing strategies for conflict resolution and collaboration
By the end of the course, participants will have the tools and insights needed to create a workplace environment that not only supports but accelerates the success of high-performing teams, driving both individual and collective achievement.

Key audience:
This course is designed for leaders, managers, and anyone responsible for shaping the culture within their teams and organisations.

Learning outcomes:
Implement strategies to cultivate trust, psychological safety, and high performance within their teams.
Lead teams that foster open communication, collaboration, and inclusivity.
Align team goals with organisational values and objectives, ensuring a shared sense of purpose.
Develop effective strategies for conflict resolution and team cohesion.
Create a workplace culture that encourages growth, well-being, and work-life balance.

description: Customer Service Excellence, A fantastic one-day course to get staff communicating professionally and confidently with customers. Keep your customers coming back by empowering staff with core communication and customer service skills along with a ‘can do attitude’. For the better part of every day, we are communicating to and with others. This workshop will equip participants with the skills and techniques required to transform how you manage relationships with customers, colleagues and stakeholders. Have you ever thought about how you come across to others and what it’s like to be on the receiving end of you? This workshop will help participants to understand the different methods of communication. Whether it’s the speech you deliver to your customers and work colleagues, the level of attention you give your spouse when they are talking to you, or the look that you give to the cat, it all means something! Each and every one of us serves customers, whether we realise it or not. Maybe you’re in a frontline position serving the people who buy your products. Perhaps you’re serving staff members in other departments within your organisation. Learn ways to communicate with customers in a professional and positive manner, build rapport authentically, provide a great customer experience each and every time, build loyalty and repeat business, handle conflict and much more. This course also covers telephone etiquette, email and face-to-face. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.

description:
Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 22-24 September 2025, The ultimate starting point for brave leaders, courageous cultures and organisational change.

"Highly recommend."
"Inspiring."
"An amazing experience."
"One 'aha moment' after the other."

Founded on the research of Dr. Brené Brown, Dare to Lead™ is an empirically based courage-building programme, delivered by Boma New Zealand CEO and Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator Kaila Colbin.
Brené has spent two decades studying shame and more than seven years specifically looking at leadership. During her research, she interviewed leaders from all over the world — from Fortune 100 companies, non-profits, public sector entities, and more — and asked one question: what is the future of leadership?
Remarkably, their answers pointed to one thing: we need braver leaders.

We need more courage.

The most significant finding from Brené’s latest research, and the foundation of Dare to Lead™, is that courage is a collection of four skill sets that are teachable, measurable, and observable.

After completing the three-day Dare to Lead™ programme you'll understand how to:
Effectively navigate vulnerability and unlock change
Turn values from fluffy language into tangible, practical behaviours
Build a common culture of trust in your team
Cultivate the skills to rise from setbacks and be more resilient

This curriculum is essential for teams who want to:
Be better equipped to deal with difficult conversations
Reduce unhealthy and unproductive behaviour
Be more creative and innovative
Build resilience and improve alignment
Foster a culture of accountability and trust

This experience is for you if:
You're in a position of leadership within your organisation
You see the potential in people and processes, and are willing to take responsibility for achieving that potential
You’re passionate about accelerating performance in yourself and others
You have to navigate organisational change as part of your role

Need help with the cost?

Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.

description:
Dealing With Difficult People & Situations, Transform conflict and difficult situations with co-workers and customers into opportunities by equipping your staff with the skills and techniques required to manage these situations with confidence, professionalism, and pride. Learn ways to resolve conflict with customers and co workers, influence successful outcomes and develop a peaceful workplace. We have all experienced the stress that comes from having unresolved conflicts with our customers and co-workers. Conflicts that are ignored or resolved poorly don’t go away, they cause people to feel resentful and to avoid each other. The effects on the business are a loss of productivity, turnover, and absenteeism. Wherever two or more people come together, there is bound to be conflict. This workshop will give participants a six-step process that they can use and modify to resolve conflicts of any size.

Participants will also learn crucial conflict resolution skills, including dealing with anger and using the Agreement Frame. Key Learning Outcomes: - Transform conflict into opportunity - Develop constructive strategies for dealing with difficult behaviour - Develop communication skills to diffuse the situation - Increase confidence and assertiveness in dealing with difficult behaviour - Manage your emotions and deal with stress - Understand the power of words and how to use them to your advantage Workshop Overview: - What are the behaviours that we find difficult to deal with? - Develop an understanding of how flight or fight reactions prompt difficult behaviour - Controlling your reactions and choosing how you respond - Strategies for staying calm and keeping your cool when dealing with difficult behaviour - How attitudes play a part – What’s it like being on the receiving end of me? How do I come across? - Dealing with the situation/problem, not the individual - Dealing with anger, your own and others – Be able to use basic anger management techniques - Developing communication skills, such as the agreement frame, active listening and open questions - Applying techniques to deal with difficult behaviour - Understand what conflict and conflict resolution mean - Understand all six phases of the conflict resolution process -Understand the 5 main styles of conflict resolution and be able to adapt the process for all types of conflicts - Speak up assertively and confidently when dealing with difficult behaviour To book: email info@biztraines.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.

description:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course 20th November - Central Wellington, ECD Emotional Leadership Development 1 Day Certification Course
Become a Certified Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Practitioner
This course is designed to enhance leadership development by equipping leaders with the tools to understand and manage emotional drivers and dynamics within themselves, their people and their teams. The course focuses on developing emotionally aware leaders who can effectively foster a positive workplace culture. Participants will engage in practical activities that promote self-awareness, team cohesion, and emotional intelligence, all grounded in The Emotional Culture Deck framework.
"Emotional culture is shaped by how all employees—from the highest echelons to the front lines—comport themselves day in and day out. But it’s up to senior leaders to establish which emotions will help the organization thrive, model those emotions, and reward others for doing the same. Companies in which they do this have a lot to gain." – Sigal Barsade & Olivia O'Neil, Manage Your Emotional Culture

Why this course is a Game-Changer

In today’s fast-paced and complex business environment, the ability to lead with emotion is more critical than ever. Our ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course is designed to transform the way leaders understand and harness the power of emotions to foster a more dynamic and responsive workplace.
What to expect
This hands-on one-day course is designed for immediate application, ensuring that you can translate insights into action as soon as you return to your team or clients. 
What to expect from this 1 day course experience:
Understanding the power of emotions in leading others effectively
Development of effective emotion-led leadership strategies. 
Learning how to use and embed our ready-made Emotional Culture Deck Leadership Tools
Active learning through interactive activities and group discussions.
Exploration of personal leadership and team leadership.
What's included in this course?
Enrol in the ECD Emotional Leadership Development Course and unlock a wealth of resources including:
ECD Emotional Leadership Development Toolkit - Valued at 175 NZD: Get this invaluable toolkit filled with a robust selection of physical and downloadable resources designed for immediate impact. Its comprehensive nature will extend your learning and application of the course content well beyond the Course.
1x Emotional Culture Deck  - Valued at 155 NZD: Receive your personal ECD, an essential tool for applying courseprinciples in real-world settings, adding even more value to your toolkit.
Exclusive 60-Minute Group Coaching Call: Enhance your course experience with a group coaching call, scheduled six to eight weeks post-course. Hosted via Zoom, this session provides an opportunity to solidify your learning, address any questions, and ensure you're applying your new skills effectively. Whether you attend live or watch the replay later, this call is a key step in your continued development.
Continued Learning Discount: Enjoy a 50% discount on future purchases of The Emotional Culture Deck to support your ongoing practice.
ECD Emotional Leadership Certificate of Practice: A formal acknowledgement of your dedication to enhancing your Emotional Culture Deck skills. This certificate serves as a testament to your commitment to emotional leadership and amplifying human conversations about what really matters in the workplace
90-Day All Access Pass to our Online Elephant Rider Community: By enrolling, you gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development
Gain access to an ECD Emotional Leadership package with resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to leadership development.



Is this course right for you?
This course is great for executives, leaders and managers within organisations as well as those who consult or coach on leadership, culture and emotional intelligence. 
The course is ideal for:
HR Professionals: Who aim to enhance leadership qualities and traits and train their leaders to develop emotional intelligence within the workplace.
Leadership Coaches: Dedicated to developing emotionally smart leadership practices in diverse environments.
Organisation Development Managers: Focused on building adaptable, resilient organisational cultures through effective leadership.
Coaches and Consultants: Specialising in personal and professional and personal leadership development.
Project Leaders: Committed to managing project teams with empathy and emotional insight.
Team Leads and Supervisors: Looking to improve team cohesion and performance through emotional awareness.
Aspiring and experienced leaders: You could be a developing leader OR if you are an experienced leader who wants to develop in the emotional leadership space then this course is for you.
Whether you are leading initiatives within your organisation or providing expert advice to others, the Emotional Leadership Development Course provides the tools and insights necessary to develop more effective, emotionally aware leaders and teams.
What previous participants had to say about this workshop.
10/10 - "Giving everyone regardless of their emotional literacy a way to express themselves and to form authentic connections is genius! Learning how to use this to help teams and organisations change their emotional culture in an intentional way is super exciting! Lotty was an amazing facilitator. Her energy and passion were 100% contagious. Her approach gentle and inclusive. I’d do it again in a heartbeat!" - Cordula Plassmann
9/10 - "This course opened my eyes to how emotions can be surfaced and navigated in leadership. A key takeaway was that we all have emotions, it's how we surface and leverage them." - Julia Anderson
10/10 - "A wonderful investment! Highly recommend this course to anyone looking to strengthen their collaboration and people leadership skills. Great fun, very practical and helpful tools to use in a wide variety of situations." - Rosaleen Smith
10/10 - "This course was truly inspiring and deeply motivating. Its mission to rehumanise workplaces and life really resonates with me and I’m excited to put these learnings into action.  Lotty was amazing - She has a very special way of explaining things. I was massively inspired and very empowered." - Phoebe Edge
10/10 - "Lotty was (and is) amazing, the size of the group was perfect for me, the amount of content and the explanations of how and when to use them was explicit, doing an in-person workshop was so much more useful to me personally. I've gained a load more confidence and I am excited to share what I learned." - Kelley Oliver
10/10 - "Extremely meaningful and engaging - a wonderful opportunity to first look internally at how I lead myself in order to focus on and improve how I achieve and support effective emotional leadership of my team." - Karinna McDonald
10/10 - "Absolutely loved it. I now feel informed and equipped to facilitate emotional culture conversations and workshops. Such important and powerful stuff - I believe every leader should know about and understand the difference between cognitive and emotional culture, in order to enable a truly thriving workforce. Lotty is an incredible facilitator - bringing energy, insight, kindness, and passion" - Teressa Betty
What is the Emotional Culture Deck?

The Emotional Culture Deck (ECD) is the number one game in the world for better workplace culture designed and created by Jeremy Dean of riders&elephants.
The ECD is currently used by over 400,000 people in over 55+ countries, it is a uniquely powerful way to create human conversations about what really matters in the workplace. 
The game facilitates face-to-face human conversations about what matters. It nudges vulnerability. Builds empathy. Creates connections and fosters trust within teams.
It's the ultimate card game toolkit for more successful and human workplaces.
Click here to learn more about The ECD and watch the origin story video below of the founder of riders&elephants sharing the story behind the game.
Join Lotty and learn how to use the Emotional Culture Deck to enhance your leadership
Learn from one of the worlds most experienced Emotional Culture Deck Consultants and Facilitators - Lotty Roberts, Founder of MiND.U, Master Elephant Rider and Certified ECD consultant .
Lotty Roberts is an Emotional Culture Coach, Consultant and Facilitator. Since completing the ECD Masterclass Course in 2018, Lotty has become one of the most experienced Emotional Culture Deck consultants in the world and the first to ever become a Master Level Certified ECD Consultant. Lotty has delivered over 200 Emotional Culture Deck client workshops, as well as dozens of 1:2:1's, helping teams of all sizes, in a variety of industries create more healthy and high performing cultures. 
Lotty is also a regular on the speaking circuit delivering talks and presentations on all aspects of emotional culture including change, leadership and resilience.
Lotty's speciality and passion is all about helping leaders, teams and cultures to thrive, flourish and flow in a fast paced world, through the power of mindfulness and embracing emotions.
Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 330 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

description:
Epigenetics Congress, Sciinov Group is elated to announce the Epigenetics Congress, scheduled as a hybrid event on October 23-24, 2025, in San Francisco, CA, USA.

The Epigenetics Congress 2025 is set to be a transformative international conference, bringing together a distinguished group of researchers, scientists, clinicians, and industry professionals to explore the rapidly evolving field of epigenetics and gene regulation. This prestigious event will serve as a collaborative platform for exchanging innovative ideas, discussing groundbreaking discoveries, and fostering interdisciplinary partnerships that drive scientific advancements and therapeutic innovations.

With a focus on cutting-edge research, emerging technologies, and translational applications, this congress will cover key topics related to epigenetic mechanisms, chromatin dynamics, DNA methylation, histone modifications, non-coding RNAs, and their implications in human health, aging, cancer, metabolic disorders, neurodegenerative diseases, and regenerative medicine. Attendees will gain insights into how epigenetic modifications influence gene expression and disease progression and explore novel therapeutic strategies, biomarker development, and precision medicine approaches based on epigenetic profiling.

FLINT Wellington: Get to know a CxO, Ever wondered what it really takes to make it to the top? Join us for an evening of speed networking with some of Wellington’s most inspiring executives.
At Get to Know a CxO, you’ll have the chance to move around the room and chat one-on-one with a range of senior leaders. Expect candid conversations about their career journeys, lessons learned, and the moments that shaped their leadership.
This isn’t your typical panel event. It’s relaxed, interactive, and designed to help you connect directly with the people behind the titles. Whether you’re curious about leadership, thinking about your next move, or just love hearing great career stories, this event’s for you.
Come for the insights, stay for the connections ✨
📅 Wednesday 26 November, 5:30 PM
📍 Venue: KPMG - Level 6, 44 Bowen Street, Wellington
🎙️ Speakers: 
Anna Darling, GM People Experience at Sharesies
Phillip Whitmore, Partner - Digital at KPMG
Anna Mitchell, Executive General Manager, Frontier at Chorus
More to be announced!
Spots are limited, with FLINT members taking priority over non-members so register now to secure your spot!
We look forward to seeing you there.
_______________________
About FLINT
If you’re in the early stages of your career and you’re interested in digital technologies, come join the FLINT programme in your local city. We host events, webinars, podcasts and social catch ups that offer valuable networking, learning and growth opportunities. 
Find out more about the Wellington FLINT team here.
  Anna Mitchell, Executive General Manager, Frontier at Chorus
Anna is Executive General Manager, Frontier at Chorus, with accountabilities for fibre footprint growth, copper exit, property optimisation, and corporate affairs, as well as championing Chorus’ sustainability and digital equity ambitions. She brings broad expertise in telecommunications policy and leading strategic initiatives, with experience across both public and private sectors, including roles at Deloitte, SweeneyVesty, and as a senior advisor to a cabinet minister.
  Philip Whitmore, Partner, Cyber and Digital at KPMG
Philip is a Partner within KPMG Cyber with over 30 years’ experience across a broad range of cyber security disciplines. He has worked extensively in New Zealand, as well as throughout the wider Asia Pacific region.  His cyber security knowledge and experience is supported by his wider business consulting background, giving him the ability to readily translate cyber security risks into a business context. Philip’s experience saw him win the New Zealand Cyber Security Person of the Year award in 2023.
  Anna Darling, GM People Experience at Sharesies
Anna is an experienced HR leader with 15 years’ experience across the public and private sectors in New Zealand and the UK. Passionate about human-centred design, she focuses on creating meaningful employee experiences and driving diversity, equity, and inclusion. Anna is especially committed to increasing Māori and Pasifika representation in tech and expanding opportunities for underrepresented groups, drawing on her background in developing women’s rugby and promoting gender equity in sport in Aotearoa. She also serves on the Board of Nuku Ora and was part of the Sharesies team recognised as the Overall 2025 Best Place to Work in October.

In-Person Location: Microsoft, Level 13 , 10 Brandon Street, Wellington.

About this event:
About this event:

Effective governance reporting is essential for successful project, programme, and portfolio delivery. Join us for an exclusive webinar where two industry experts—each representing leading software tools—will share insights on how to optimize reporting processes, enhance decision-making, and track progress with precision.

This session will explore critical elements of governance reporting, including the dashboards and key information decision makers need to ensure transparency and accountability. Our speakers will showcase best practices for structuring reports, selecting the right performance indicators, and using real-time data to drive strategic outcomes. Learn how to streamline reporting workflows, reduce manual effort, and leverage technology to provide stakeholders with clear, actionable insights.

Whether you're managing a single project, a programme, an entire portfolio, PMO, or a member of any delivery governance committee, this webinar will equip you with practical strategies and the right tools to improve oversight and control. Gain valuable knowledge from experts in project governance and software solutions that support effective reporting.
About the Presenter:
About the Presenters:

Youssef Mourra is the founder, Director, and Principal Consultant at Nonsuch. He delivers consulting across all the layers of Project, Programme and Portfolio Management (P3M) in organisations of any size and type. He is known for developing practical and pragmatic solutions that help organisations achieve their desired business outcomes and to execute their strategies.

Bruce Aylward is the "Chief Everything Officer" of Psoda, isn't your average tech CEO. His journey took him from the starry skies of rocket science to revolutionizing cloud-based project management software.

description:
Impactful Leadership, Impactful Leadership:
What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.
Welcome to the final conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
What good leadership looks like has changed, but many of the methods we rely on to deliver it haven’t. This conversation will showcase what horses can teach us about impactful leadership in modern workplaces, and how anyone can turn those lessons into action that delivers.
Why be part of this conversation?
In this thought-provoking session, BBC journalist-turned-leadership coach Janine Sudbury will share how she discovered what really works in leadership development, and why traditional approaches often fall short.
You’ll take away insights including:
The three secrets of the horse whisperer that unlock authentic, presence-based leadership
How to overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing to lead with clarity and confidence
Why horses give the most honest feedback—and how that feedback creates lasting breakthroughs
Who’s the speaker?
Janine Sudbury is the founder of Impact Leadership and the creator of a truly unique experiential leadership programme that swaps the boardroom for the paddock. specialises in helping women overcome Imposter Syndrome and People Pleasing Syndrome to lead with more confidence, clarity, and authenticity.
With powerful insights and unforgettable stories, including her work with former All Blacks coach Steve Hansen, Janine invites you to lead with more purpose, presence, and impact.
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Janine Sudbury speaks
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
7 August: Strengths & Superpowers - Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.

description:
Leadership And Management Part 1, Learn how to make the transition from buddy to the boss and lead a successful team. Managing staff can be a very rewarding, interesting and fun role, it can also be a tough and demanding job. Between managing your own time and projects, helping your team members solve problems and complete tasks, and helping other managers, your day can fill up before you know it.

This workshop aims to maximise your leadership and management potential and help you become a more confident, effective and efficient leader and manager with information on understanding personality types, effective communication, setting expectations and goals, assigning work, effective delegation, motivating staff, leadership styles, giving feedback and having courageous conversations, understanding what is required to be a good leader and manager and encouraging teamwork.
 
The workshop is designed for those who have been promoted recently into a supervisory management role or for those who have been there for some time but need to improve their leadership and management skills. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.

description:
Leadership Play Day - Wellington, Leadership Play Day: Wellington 17th October 2025
Friday 17th October 2025 | 8:30am–5:00pm
Location: Nairn Street Cottage, 68 Nairn Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011

What this day is all about
Leadership Play Day is a full-day, game-based learning experience that takes leadership development out of the boardroom and into play. Instead of being talked at with boring slides, you’ll step into three carefully designed games that let you actually practice leadership.
You’ll be experimenting, problem-solving, laughing (a lot), and walking away with insights that stick because you’ve lived them, not just heard them.
This isn’t theory. It’s leadership in action.
Learn more at our website.
How it works
The day is made up of three 2-hour games. You can book individual sessions ($99 each), or join us for the full day ($297) to play all three and unlock The Leadership Playbook - a bonus 60-minute facilitated debrief where we connect the dots and help you take away a clear set of personal leadership shifts.
Here’s what’s on in Wellington:
The Moonlit Market (8:30–10:30am)
Pitch, trade, and negotiate under pressure. Build agility, creativity, and bold decision-making in a playful, high-energy marketplace.
The Broken Bridge (11:00am–1:00pm)
A fantasy quest to practice difficult conversations. Explore courage, clarity, and how you show up when the stakes feel high.
The Inner Tides (1:45–3:45pm)
Use the Emotional Culture Deck in a role-playing game to strengthen emotional awareness, resilience, and confidence in leading with empathy.
The Leadership Playbook (4:00–5:00pm)
Available only with a full-day pass. A guided reflection session to connect your learning, extract insights, and leave with a practical playbook you can use back at work.
Why you should join
Practical skills, not theory - you’ll walk away with tools and insights you can use immediately.
Safe practice, real challenges - rehearse tough moments without real-world consequences.
Energy + engagement - no sitting back, you’ll be on your feet, in the mix, learning by doing.
Unique approach - game-based leadership development you won’t find anywhere else in NZ.
Whether you’re a leader, facilitator, HR/People professional, or just someone curious about growing your leadership edge - this day is designed for you.
Tickets
Individual game session: $99
Full day pass (all 3 games + Leadership Playbook debrief): $297
👉 Ready to roll the dice on your leadership?

Spots are limited - grab your ticket today.

description:
Leadership and Management Part 3, Leaders today are expected to be the driving force of their teams. They are constantly under pressure to lead effectively in a business environment that is characterised by constant change. Our leadership and management courses offer participants the opportunity to develop the necessary skills to embrace this challenge and lead their teams through these times with confidence and pride.

Our Leadership & Management - Part 3 workshop is a practical skills training course designed for people already in a leadership/management position, or those about to take up a new role, who want to explore the latest thinking and models for effective management and leadership and build on the techniques acquired in our Part 1 and 2 workshops.

In today’s world, emotional Intelligence is a critical and powerful component of effective leadership. This 2-day course will equip leaders with the skills to become more ‘people smart’ by developing ways to lead with emotional intelligence. Participants will also learn how to inspire their people with a shared vision and align teams to company goals, along with the tools to lead and manage change, ways to become a more influential and persuasive leader and the tools to raise awareness and manage unconscious bias in the workplace.

description:

Create your small business marketing strategy and action plan in just two days, with marketing coach and strategist Rachel Klaver

About this Event




Create a marketing plan in just two days
Designed to fit YOUR business.
Designed for you to take action


Time is precious, so let's make it count.

Join marketing trainer and coach Rachel Klaver for an immersive two-day face-to-face workshop tailored for service-based businesses.
This event will take place on the 19th and 20th of November, at The Bolton Hotel, Wellington.

This is designed to transform your marketing strategy from the ground up.
Over two days you'll explore and learn up-to-date marketing practices and strategy, and write a strategy customised for your business.

You’ll then create a clear action plan designed to attract, engage and convert your ideal customers
Numbers are limited to ensure you can get individualised help and support.


Here's what we'll cover over the two days:
How to best explain what you do
Simplifying your message to cut through a busy marketplace
How to define your target market (beyond demographics)
Defining your positioning
A check on pricing and profitability pillars
Identifying gaps and differentiation from competitors
Unique selling proposition
Improving word of mouth, influencer and referral marketing
Customer experience and the customer journey
Who owns the marketing role
Appropriate use of AI in marketing
Website Optimisation
Email Marketing that works
Creating a social media strategy framework
Printing and branding needs
Traditional marketing (Radio/Print/Other)
PR, Expos, Conferences
Business owner brand

(Everything will be taught for small business needs, rather than large organisations.

Guided pre-workshop tasks to make the most of your time.
Individualised analysis of key marketing areas.

Who is your marketing strategist and trainer?Introducing your Marketing Strategist Rachel Klaver

Welcome! I'm Rachel Klaver, content marketing coach, marketing strategist and small business owner.
I’ve worked with over a thousand small business owners on their marketing strategy either in small groups like this, or one-to-one.
I use real language, story, and simple explanations to break down marketing strategy.
I’m able to provide a range of options and ideas for you to use as you take action.
I want that for you.
(The other stuff: I work full time as a marketing strategist, coach and trainer. I co run our business Identify Marketing with my husband Rod. I've written 28 books, the last one on content marketing (it's called Be a Spider, Build a Web.). I write a fortnightly column for NZ's Stuff newspaper on marketing, and have two podcasts: MAP IT Marketing, and Confident Content. )

So... would you like to come join me?

DON'T MISS OUT ON THIS VALUE PACKED, two day intensive - AND THE POSITIVE IMAPACT ON YOUR BUSINESS


REFINE YOUR STRATEGY. CREATE YOUR ACTION PLAN
This two-day intensive will get you ready to make the next 12 months a year of growth, and more profit. Get a handle on your marketing, develop an action plan and know exactly what you need to do to create consistent marketing output targeted at the right people.
