description:
Hutt Valley (Upper Hutt/Lower Hutt) Mathematics Leadership Community 2025, Are you the maths lead in your school? Do you feel equipped to lead the roll out of the new mathematics and statistics curriculum? Would you like to be part of a group of like-minded leads?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to:
stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum
build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school
investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics
connect and network with other leaders and teachers.

Testimonials from 2024
“These days have been invaluable in supporting me to lead whole school maths review with our teachers.”

“It has given me more knowledge and confidence when leading my own meetings, knowing I have research and work behind me when I lead.”

“I love the resources and the connections that develop through these meetings.”

“This year the mahi we have done around the curriculum refresh has been instrumental in beginning our school’s development of our localised curriculum.”

Meeting dates
20th March, 9.15am - 2.45pm
12th June, 9.15am - 2.45pm
14th August, 9.15am - 2.45pm
30th October, 9.15am - 2.45pm

What does it cost?
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees)
$100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees)
*Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school*

For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Integrating Creative Writing Into Painting - 4 Week Course, Creative writing and painting are both powerful forms of artistic expression. By integrating creative writing into your painting practice, you can enhance your imagination, storytelling abilities, emotional expression, attention to detail, and personal style on the canvas. Please bring along a journal or laptop.

COURSE CONTENT
Each session presents a key idea backed by research or concrete examples, followed by practical writing exercises with optional sharing. We learn by doing and from each other.

1. Generating work from the interior: tapping into memories, conflict, emotion, and observation to generate art.
2. Figuring out what matters to you, then learning how to grow your fragmented ideas into something whole. For example, how do you turn a feeling, or a fleeting moment in time into a story? Into a painting? Into a work of art? What are the building blocks you need?
3. Inspiration from other creative sources: people, music, poetry, reading, random incidents. Ways to generate fresh ideas. How to clarify and focus in writing and art.
4. Structure and boundaries. Dreaming big but being real. How do you find and stick to a creative process? Understanding how you learn and what kind of feedback you need. Designing your next project.

Thursday mornings, 9:30 - 11:45 am.
4 - 25 September.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Intro to 2D Traditional Animation, This is a beginners course in 2D animation where you'll learn the time-honoured principles of hand-drawn animation and how to apply them to your own animation project. You may work on a project incorporating your own ideas, or if you'd rather, an assigned a project from your tutor.

Your tutor, Ross Payne, is a 30-year veteran of traditional 2D animation, and loves to share his knowledge about it for you to love it as much as he does.

In each lesson there will be examples and demonstrations of the animation principles with follow up exercises to put your new skills into practice. You'll work on your project both during class and at home, applying the animation principles to your individualised project.

You can choose to draw your animation on paper then scan/capture into your device, or choose to draw your animation digitally, directly into an animation programme. whichever you choose instructions in class will be provided to give you the skills needed for this step.

You can use any device, ipad or laptop you already own (except a mobile – it's really not big enough to do good animation on). The school does not provide any digital equipment. It's important that the app/programme is installed on the student's device before the course begins, and that they have had a play on it to get used to how it works. This is so that the student is at least a little familiar with their chosen software so that it's enough to begin learning animation techniques on day one. Additional information found at our website.

Ross will advise you on a variety of animation apps/programmes available online to use, ranging in price from free to not very much. Note - A computer mouse can be used for 2D animation, but digital pens are much easier to use. Prior to the course commencing, you'll receive details of recommended programmes to use for the course.

Suitable for a range of ages, from teens to adults.

Tuesday evenings, 14 October - 2 December, 6:30-8:30 pm
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Intro to Musical Improv | A PopRox Improv Course, Musical improv can be absolute magic. Whether it's a whole musical show, or single song that bursts out of an emotional scene, music adds so much to our improv.
This course for improvisers will give an introduction to musical improv. We'll cover basic song structures, how to get into a song from a scene, how to support a song through chorus work, and why and when we use music to add to our improv.
Participants should be confident in scene-work and have at least 2 years improv experience. This course will not teach you how to approach scenes and characters, so you should have a solid foundation which you can add to with this new toolbox of musical skills.
The course includes 6 workshops which will run 6:30pm to 8:30pm on Wednesdays from August 6th to September 10th. As it is an intro course, we do not anticipate a showcase for this course.
ABOUT THE TEACHERS
LIA KELLY is a theatre-maker and teacher based in Pōneke. She is an established director, actor, improviser and musician and has been a part of productions across the city over the last 10 years. She directed One Night Band which won 'Most Original Production' at the Wellington Theatre Awards 2023, and performs regularly as both a player and musician for POPROX.
ISAAC THOMAS has been an improviser and improv musician for a decade in Pōneke and Whakatū/Nelson. He's played with Body in Space, Playshop, Poprox and been musical director for musical improv powerhouse The Pāua Ballads. He has worked with almost every major improv company around the city accompanying them through improvised piano, guitar and vocals.
THE STANDY-BY LIST
PopRox firmly believes that improv is for everyone, especially when it comes to sharing skills and knowledge. So we're offering "the stand-by list" for all our workshops in 2025. We'll giveaway any spots remaining a few days before the first workshop of the course, on a first-come-first-serve basis. No need to provide a reason, no questions asked. If the entry fee is a barrier for you to come along, then simply email poproximprov@gmail.com and we'll pop you on the SBL. Everyone on the list will be notified whether there was a place available for them 3 days before the first workshop.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Introduction to Taiko Drumming, Experience the power, rhythm, and energy of traditional Japanese drumming!

Taiko is a high-energy blend of powerful bass tones, synchronized group rhythms, and dynamic, full-body choreography. Often called "the heartbeat of Japan," Taiko is as much a workout as it is an art form.

Whether you're looking to try something new, get your heart racing, or connect with a centuries-old tradition, this one-off workshop is the perfect place to start.

In this one-off introduction to taiko drumming we will cover:
- Basic drumming techniques and simple rhythm practice
- Learn a simple piece of Taiko rhythm and play as a group

Workshop Details:
Cost: $15 (Includes a $10 discount for our upcoming 8-week beginners course starting 1 March 2026)
What to bring: Wear comfortable gym/movement clothes and bring a water bottle.
How to join: Spots are limited. Please register via our website to secure your place.

Taikoza is Wellington’s longest-running Taiko group. Founded in Hiroshima in the mid-1980s and calling Wellington home since 1991, we are dedicated to keeping the ancient spirit of the drum alive.
You may have seen our high-energy performances at Cuba Dupa, The Japan Festival, or at Blossom Valley. Most of our rhythms come directly from Hiroshima’s Taiko Hozonkai, preserving beats that have echoed through Japan for hundreds of years.
Ready to find your rhythm? Follow us on Facebook and Instagram for updates, or visit our website to book your spot today.

More info on Taikoza is available on the website.

description:
Japanese Homestyle Cooking, Would you like to be able to cook delicious and nutritious Japanese food at home? Let’s have fun cooking attractive and healthy Japanese food together!. All ingredients included in course fee.

We will prepare simple, traditional Japanese home-style meals consisting of rice, soup, and a main dish (Ichijyu-issai). In each class, we'll make a different-flavoured miso soup along with a popular Japanese dish -- for example, teriyaki chicken or tonkatsu (crumbed pork cutlet).

We'll introduce you to Japanese food that's easy to prepare, tasty, and made with simple fresh ingredients plus we'll show you how easy it is to incorporate tasty and healthy Japanese food into your daily diet.
All ingredients are included in the fee. You just need to bring an apron, a dish cloth, a tea towel, and a container to take your food home in. Don't forget your smartphone if you want to take photos!

By the end of the course, you’ll:

become more familiar with using Japanese ingredients
feel more confident to cook authentic Japanese-style dishes at home
have the know-how to make delicious, well-balanced, and nourishing meals for the whole family.

Note: Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups. While we wish to create an inclusive environment for all participants, it is important to note that our courses are unable to accommodate specific food allergies or deviate from the preplanned dishes and menus.

Duration 4 weeks, Wed 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM
$189

description:
Jazz and Beyond Workshops 2025, Jazz and Beyond for students 19 and under
December 15–18, 2025
Coordinated by Chris Beernink, Dave Wilson, Daniel Hayles, and Lance Philip. Proudly supported by the Tauranga Jazz Society.
Take your playing to the next level at the Jazz and Beyond Workshops! Young musicians from across Aotearoa come together to dive into jazz and connected styles, working closely with some of the country’s leading performers and educators. In a friendly, inclusive environment, you’ll grow your skills, make new musical connections, and learn alongside other students your age from all around the motu.
Here’s what’s in store:
small group ensembles led by professional musicians
developing improvisation skills in supportive settings
an introduction to music production
listening sessions that expand your skills
inclusive jam sessions where all are welcome
ensemble performances at the end of week concert
And more!
If you're 19 or under with at least a year of experience on your instrument or in vocal training, you’re welcome to join. Choose from trumpet, trombone, saxophone, clarinet, flute, bass, piano, guitar, drums, vibraphone, or voice.
The workshops are held at the New Zealand School of Music—Te Kōkī at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. Follow the Jazz and Beyond Workshops on Instagram or Facebook for the latest updates. Email jazzandbeyondworkshops@gmail.com with any questions.
Schedule
The workshops run 9:00am–4:30pm Monday through Thursday, with evening activities including concerts and our inclusive jam sessions Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Students perform in a closing concert on Thursday afternoon.
Accommodation
Students arrange their own accommodation. Often students from outside Wellington stay together in groups with a parent chaperone. Options for housing near Victoria University of Wellington include backpacker hostels and hotels. If you have a group of 15 or more, University Student Housing can been booked at Cumberland House. Contact info for this option is via email at Cumberland-House@vuw.ac.nz or by phone at +64 4 463 4770.
Meals
Lunch for the four days is available for purchase at many convenient locations on campus, or students may bring their own lunch.
Equipment
Provided equipment includes drum kits, guitar and bass amps, pianos/keyboards, microphones and PAs for vocalists.
All brass and wind players should bring their own instruments.
Drummers: you are required to bring your own cymbals, sticks, and hi-hat clutch.
Guitarists and bass players: you are required to bring your own instruments as well as cables (leads).
Preparation
All students with one year of experience on an instrument or in vocal training have the skills required to participate, so no musical preparation is required. On the first day, students will play a very short audition to be placed in an appropriate ensemble. Guidelines for this short audition will be sent to all registered participants in advance of the workshops.
Cost
Early bird price: $325 - register by 19th October
Standard price $350 - after 19th October
Registration is open to all until all spots are filled.
We are dedicated to ensuring all students can participate in the workshops without financial constraints. If the cost poses a barrier, please email us at jazzandbeyondworkshops@gmail.com and we will find a solution to facilitate your participation!

description:
Jewellery Making - Lost Wax Cast Rings, Evolve and advance your jewellery-making abilities with exciting lost wax methods to create rings cast in copper, brass, bronze, white bronze and silver - beginners welcome! All material costs included in course fee.

Description
In this fresh 6-week jewellery-making course, you get a hands-on opportunity to develop new techniques creating rings with a sculptural and organic flair.

The lost wax process offers a wide range of creative outcomes such as 3D forms and textures, which are not achievable with fabrication techniques.

You will design and create a pair of rings in jeweller’s wax. These wax masters will be cast professionally for you, outside class, making them in metals of your choice - copper, brass, yellow bronze or white bronze.

Later in the course you will refine your new wax shaping skills and develop a ring to be cast in sterling silver!

In the second part of the course, you will sand and refine your casts into finished jewellery.

The class offers beginners a fun introduction to jewellery making, and for those with some jewellery experience it offers a great way to advance and expand your making techniques to new levels.

All materials included in course fee. Please bring pen and paper and your reading glasses (if you use these) and wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

- Evolve your jewellery-making abilities with new and exciting lost wax methods
- Develop and create unique sculptural ring designs
- Carve hard jeweller’s wax ring master designs to fit a chosen finger size for casting
- Sculpt and model soft jeweller’s wax master design to fit a chosen finger size for casting
- Combine hard and soft jeweller’s wax to create unique designs ready for casting
- File, sand and polish metal casts into finished jewellery

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

6 weeks, Thu 6:00 PM - 8:30 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Thorn Richards.
$299.00 incl. GST

description:
Jewellery Making - Precious Stones in Cast Rings, Create sculptural rings studded with dazzling precious gemstones! Combine wax working and stone setting methods to produce a set of rings cast in your choice of copper, brass, bronze, white bronze and silver - beginners welcome!
All materials included in the course fee.

Description

Expanding on the Lost Wax Cast Rings class, students in this course get to add precious gemstones to their cast jewellery process!
Experiment and create sculptural cast metal rings set with beautiful stones in a variety of colours.
This beginner friendly jewellery class is also fun and engaging for returning students to diversify their skills and set stones in new ways.
Students will learn to work with a range of jeweller waxes, including hard wax, modelling wax, sheet wax, melting wax and more to create wax 'masters', setting stones in wax, as well as turning raw metal casts into shining ready-to-wear jewellery.
Students choose their favourite wax masters to be cast professionally outside of class time, transforming the designs into their choice of metals, and are returned to students to polish and finish their casts in class.

The course fee includes a range of small precious gemstones, casting 2 rings in either copper, brass, yellow bronze, white bronze, and 2 rings cast in Sterling Silver.

The bold, organic forms and textures of the lost wax processes offer a wide range of creative possibilities beyond the scope of fabrication methods alone (soldering metal sheet and wire). Setting faceted stones in wax offers a simpler and more experimental way of adding stones to jewellery compared to fabrication settings.

All materials are included in the course fee. Please bring pen and paper and your reading glasses (if you use these) and wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment.

By the end of the course, students will be able to:

Design and create unique sculptural ring designs

Carve hard jeweller’s wax ring master designs to fit a chosen finger size for casting

Sculpt soft jeweller’s wax master design to fit a chosen finger size for casting

Combine hard and soft jeweller’s wax to create unique designs ready for casting

Set faceted gemstones in wax for ‘cast-in-place’ setting methods

File, sand and polish metal casts into finished jewellery

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Duration 6 weeks, Tue 6:00 PM – 8:30 PM
Thorn Richards

description:
Jewellery Making-Soldered Fidget Rings, Classic textured rings, with a unique and exciting twist! Learn to make your own fine jewellery fidget rings from copper, brass and silver - beginners welcome! All materials included in course fee.

Description
In this one-day workshop you are offered a hands-on opportunity to create custom rings with fun mobile components and unique textures. We'll also practice and build experience in the essential jeweller’s fabrication skills of sawing, filing, soldering, sanding and polishing.

What are fidget rings? Also known as spinner rings or stim rings, fidget rings have loose bands attached that can move and swivel around - it's interactive sculpture you can wear!

In this course you’ll be lead through the design and creation of custom copper and silver rings, with copper, brass and silver wire spinner bands adding novelty and movement to a classic ring design.

This course offers beginners a fun introduction to jewellery making, and for those with some jewellery experience, it offers a great way to advance and expand your making techniques to new levels.

All materials included in course fee.

Please wear closed-in footwear suitable for a workshop environment. bring a work apron if you have one or wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little grubby. Remember to bring your reading glasses if a have them.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
Jewellery-making in 4 Weeks, Mixed levels, Sunday Mornings - Ōtaki, This Sunday morning block is a short course on jewellery-making.

It starts on Sunday 23 November and runs for 4 weeks till Sunday 14 December, 10am-1pm.

Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items. Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.

These blocks are also a nice way for existing students or more advanced makers to work on more challenging projects and join friendly classes in our well-equipped studio!

All materials you need can be purchased in class - beginners should expect to use around $30 - $40 of metals in this block.

This block is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. NOTE: Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

Our booking system asks for full payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this ;)

description:
Jewellery-making in 4 weeks - Saturday Mornings, Level 2+, This class is for level 2+ and advanced students. It is not open to beginners. This more advanced class is ideal for those who are already competent at soldering simple joins, annealing, and basic tool use on their own.

Students must have completed two 4-week blocks or a 6-week block at a minimum. If you are unsure of your level because you may have done a few different shorter classes, please contact us and we can advise you.

A more advanced set of students means that your tutor can support you and the group to take on more exciting and complex challenges. They will work with the group to find appropriate projects for you and for the class as a whole. Each 4-week block may focus on a particular skill topic, rather than doing loads of different topics with each student over the block.

Level 2 students learn to solder more competently on their own using chainmaking as a way to develop their fine soldering skills. They may create a simple stone setting or ring alongside this challenge project so they have something to hone their skills that they are familiar with, as well as taking on a new skill. Their silver project could be a pendant on a handmade chain, a charm bracelet, or a more complex bezel setting.

Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques. They should prepare to have one or two simple projects they can work on self-directed in class.

This class fee does NOT include materials for any student. All metals and stones, as well as quality findings and chains, are available for purchase each week in the studio. Students are encouraged to keep their silver scrap and find ways to use it thriftily in future projects.

description:
Jewellery-making in 8 weeks - Tuesday Eve Mixed Level, This class is mixed level, allowing beginners to work alongside advanced students. It starts on Tuesday, 14 October and runs for 8 weeks till Tuesday, 2 December, 5.30pm - 8pm.
Our popular weeknight classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment.

Beginners start with basic ring-making and stone-setting in copper or brass. Students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering. Then we move on to making a practice-ring set with a Cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top) in a Bezel Setting. The stone-setting process teaches you many fundamental techniques in one project! As you work through your practice-ring and setting, you can move onto working in silver and produce another ring with a cabachon stone that you really love. This way you will learn the basics as you go on your practice-ring, before taking the next step in costly silver.

Level 2 students learn to solder more competently on their own using chainmaking as a way to develop their fine soldering skills. They may create a simple stone setting or ring alongside this challenge project so they have something to hone their skills that they are familiar with, as well as taking on a new skill. Their silver project could be a pendant on a handmade chain, a charm bracelet or a more complex bezel setting - for example a teardrop or soft square stone to take on bezels with corners!

Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques. They should prepare to have one or two simple projects they can work on self-directed in class: more chains or simple bezel settings are ideal - to help them strengthen their soldering skills - alongside a challenge project that might be a shelf setting (an adaptation of a bezel setting that can take faceted stones), a tube setting or a larger bezel setting for a box or brooch. Our tutors will work with you to discover your passions in the world of making, and to support your skills so you grow your understanding with each block you take. We recommend that students from level 3 and up take the occasional Technique class (for example - claw setting, enamelling, flush setting) and then bring those techniques into their projects in their block class to be supported in their practice and skill by their regular tutor.

This class fee does NOT include materials for any student.
Beginners should expect to spend at least $60 on materials for their ring making project.
All metals and stones as well as quality findings and chains are available for purchase each week in the studio. Students are encouraged to keep their silver scrap and find ways to use it thriftily in future projects!

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this ;)

description:
Karanga taonga, karanga tangata, karanga whenua |Reversing Cultural Amnesia: Activating Māori Practice in Museums, In 1947, Māori leader, politician, and scholar Apirana Ngata spoke to his scholarly peers at the Polynesian Society, announcing his greatest desire to revive Māori culture as a living force within communities, not be relegated to dead exhibits in museums (Ramsden 1948, 85).
This lecture acknowledges the concerns of visionary leaders and champions of cultural practice and their activation within museums. Through her work as a Māori curator, writer, cultural practitioner and post-doctoral researcher, Awhina Tamarapa advocates for cultural restoration as a form of liberation in a museum context. In her research, Tamarapa is exploring strategies for the recovery and reclamation of taonga puoro (singing treasures) and karetao (animated storytellers) for new generations.
There are challenges regarding taonga held by overseas museums. Concepts such as keeping taonga warm, and mana taonga, recognises the connection and authority of descendants to their taonga, that underpin this work.
The focus on the reclamation of Indigenous practice has been bolstered by working with First Nations, Canada BC. Led by Professor Bryony Onciul, University of Exeter, UK, Tamarapa was privileged to be part of a research project “The Future of Indigenous Rights and Responsibilities: Ancestral governance, environmental stewardship, language revival, and cultural vibrancy” funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council, UK.
_________
The Michael Volkerling Lecture series is a partnership event with the Museum and Heritage Studies programme at Te Herenga Waka | Victoria University of Wellington, National Services Te Paerangi and Te Papa Tongarewa. This annual public lecture series recognises the legacy of the late Dr Michael Volkerling who was one of the principal architects of New Zealand's cultural and creative sectors.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // Toi Poneke Art, Kintsugi Workshop in Wellington // Toi Poneke Art
After several SOLD OUT workshops in Wellington here is the next one... Oct 2025

Learn the magical art of Kintsugi with Artist Ema Frost in this new Workshop. You can bring along a piece of your own pottery to restore in this beautiful style. (I'll also have a few as back up if you don't have your own piece) (All Levels)

Sunday 12th October - 10:30am - 12:30pm or 2:00 - 4:00pm

Ema has been teaching Kintsugi for 5+ years and regularly travels to Japan to study and learn new techniques. Ema's illustrations and ceramic works sit in many of our countries best galleries, and whose products and merchandise sell in the most stylish design stores and gallery shops. Her style is enchanting - quirky, feminine and colourful, and clearly influenced by her travels throughout the world, usually off the beaten track.

Have you ever wanted to try Kintsugi.... It's an ancient Japanese art form where you fix broken pottery with gold - making its imperfections its beauty. - A truly wonderful philosophy to live by. Nothing is ever really broken but new life and meaning is brought back making your piece a work of art and truly something special. You can also apply this technique on various materials like glass, wood, greenstone and shells.

Kintsugi
It's called kintsugi (金継ぎ), or kintsukuroi (金繕い), literally golden (“kin”) and repair (“tsugi”). This traditional Japanese art uses a precious metal – liquid gold, liquid silver or lacquer dusted with powdered gold – to bring together the pieces of a broken pottery item and at the same time enhance the breaks.

You will take away your wonderful finished work, plus your new skills which will enable you to further your own Kintsugi in your own time.

What you will take away:
A finished artwork piece
A understanding of Kintsugi
Knowledge and History of this beautiful art form.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Knitting for Beginners, Always wanted to learn how to knit but never been sure where to begin? Join craft tutor Stella Carruthers as she teaches the basic principles of knitting in this fun, informative and supportive class. Come along and learn the essential building blocks of knitting, using only knitting needles, yarn and your hands!
Come and reap the benefits of a mindful and meditative craft-form. Meet other people interested in making things with their hands, chat over crafting and find out what the craft craze is all about.

Join crafter Stella as she shares her ten years plus knitting experience in this beginner’s knitting class that supports each student as an individual learner.

Master basic knitting techniques, learn how to cast stitches on and off the needles, explore the knit and purl stitches and practice how to hold the needles in a way that is comfortable for you - then learn how to knit in the English style.

Knitting needles and yarn are included in the course fee, but you're welcome to bring along your own 4-ply yarn if you wish.

By the end of the course you will have created two squares of knitting, one in basic garter stitch and the other utilising both knit and purl stitches to create the knitted fabric called stocking stitch.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. description:
Lino-printing Koanga (Spring) Workshop - Pop-up Parlour 2025, Lino-printing Koanga (Spring) Workshop - Pop-up Parlour 2025
Join us for a fun-filled morning of creativity at Pukerua Bay Hub's Pop-up Parlour as we explore Māori design motifs using Lino-cut prints developed with artist Trixie Andrew.
Afternoon Tea provided. No experience needed.

The lino-cut prints will be provided with different design motifs and we will guide you through the process of printing your own items (clothing, bags, cards etc.) and creating your own small lino-cut to keep as well. Different kinds of paper stock will be available.

Māori design motifs are rich in symbolism and storytelling. These visually rich motifs are used in carving, weaving, and tattooing to convey cultural knowledge, history, and spiritual beliefs. These motifs are not just decorative; they are a vital part of Māori culture and identity. We will be exploring Koanga (Spring) for this session.

Event details
- What - 2hr lino print workshop
- When - 10-12pm Saturday 6th September 2025
- Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay
- Cost - $30 to cover lino-cuts, ink, paper, tools and artist koha

LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE - Book now:
https://www.pkbhub.org.nz/shop/p/lino-print-workshop-w483s

What to bring? Bring something to print onto, for example a t-shirt or reusable fabric bag. We encourage sustainable fashion using cotton and upcycling from 2nd hand shop. Or you may choose to print on fabric, high quality paper, card or even a pēpē onesie!

About your hosts:
Trixie Andrew (Ngāti Toa) has spent the past three years in Pōneke pursuing a Bachelor of Fine Arts with Honours at Massey University. She has paused this year to study the Heke Reo course at Te Wānanga o Raukawa, aiming to return to finish her degree after completing the Te Reo Māori Diploma. She is a highly-skilled visual artist and works across different mediums, including print-making.

This workshop is part of Pukerua Bay Hub's 2025 Pop-up Parlour - thanks for your support.

____________________________________
WHAT IS THE POP-UP PARLOUR?
A chance to create and connect in our pop-up community space. From 1-30 September we've got a jam-packed schedule with 65+ events for kids, families, rangatahi and adults to learn, hang out and have fun.

Check out all the free/koha events too -
https://www.pkbhub.org.nz/whatson

Waiho i te toipoto, kaua i te toi roa –
Let us keep close together, not far apart.

description:
Lost Wax Casting - 6 Weeks Course, A fantastic course that's full of fun and inspiration!

It starts on Wed 4 February and runs for 6 weeks till Wed 11 March, 5.30pm - 8pm.

Create interesting designs in wax, then send them off to be professionally cast in metal. Once your pieces are back, you will be taught how to cut, file and shape them into wearable pieces.

Level 1 students: Learn to work in both soft and hard jewellers' wax and send your waxes away to be cast. When they return, you will learn how to clean them up into finished jewellery and/or incorporate them into jewellery in multiple ways. We start with rings, but encourage students to think outside the box!

Level 2 students: Advance your carving skills and learn to set stones in your waxes. This can be done either by creating claws and other settings or trying the cast-in-place technique - an organic, exciting process.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs, which vary from student to student depending on what they want to make. Small castings can cost around $7 - $10, and metals are between $0.35 per gram for bronze - $4 per gram for silver. Please see details on our Regular Classes page.

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, PayPal or Afterpay on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time, please email us to arrange this ;)

description:
Make Your Own Roman Blinds, Come along and learn how to make your very own Roman blind, to give your rooms an elegant and streamlined look.

Description
Roman blinds are a perennial favourite because they use a lot less fabric than the usual pencil pleated or gathered curtains - as well as making your rooms look streamlined and uncluttered.

During the four weeks you will learn how to accurately measure your window to enable you to create very own customized roman blind.

Some hardware included in course fee but a list of all other materials (fabric, etc) will be sent out to you when the course is confirmed.

Please choose a narrow window for your first project - max 150cms wide.

By the end of the course you'll be able to

Accurately measure your window
Calculate how much fabric to purchase
Measure and cut out your curtain
Use appropriate machine skills to sew your curtain fabric
Use finishing skills to apply rings and cords to your curtain
Identify appropriate method to hang Roman Blind

This course is not for beginner sewers, you must to able to use a sewing machine in a competent manner.

Haka for Life Workshop
🔥 Haka for life – A Transformational Māori Experience with Matiu 🔥
Step into a sacred, immersive journey led by Matiu—a master of Māori language, performance, and storytelling, with over 30 years of experience empowering individuals across the globe.
This dynamic, interactive workshop weaves together ancient Māori wisdom with modern empowerment, unlocking deep connection, strength, and presence like never before.
🌿 What You’ll Experience:
✔ The Warrior’s Energy – Harness the raw power of haka, the traditional Māori dance that awakens your inner fire and unshakable presence. ✔ The Art of Connection – Learn the profound practice of hongi, the sacred sharing of breath, and cultivate deeper relationships. ✔ The Power of Storytelling & Song – Discover the soul-stirring magic of Māori narrative and music. ✔ Sacred Masculine & Feminine Balance – Explore potent, healing practices that honor, empower, and connect on a deep, transformative level. ✔ Embracing Light & Shadow – Find balance between your strength and vulnerability, your power and grace.
⚡ Why This Workshop?
This is for those who are ready to step into their power. Those who want to speak with confidence, move with purpose, and lead with authenticity.
By the end of this experience, you will: ✅ Feel grounded, present, and connected—to yourself, to spirit, to your ancestors. ✅ Command a room with presence and mana (power) when you speak. ✅ Own your voice—so that people truly listen and feel your words. ✅ Stand in your warrior energy—unshakable, confident, and fully embodied. ✅ Walk away with practical, ancient tools to help you move through life with more strength, clarity, and purpose.
🔥 Are You Ready? 🔥
If you’re up for real growth, if you’re ready to step into your power, be seen, be heard, and be fully present—then this workshop is for YOU.
Matiu’s approach is welcoming, inspiring, fun, safe and deeply empowering.
🌿 Join us. Awaken your warrior. Change your life.

description:
Māori, Christianity & the Spirit World — Public lecture by Bradford Haami, Māori, Christianity & the Spirit World — Public lecture by Bradford Haami
In lecture theatre 2 (GBLT2) in the Law School at Victoria University / Te Herenga Waka.

Ramsey Library presents a public lecture by Bradford Haami.

What happens when vastly different ways of being meet? Dame Anne Salmond writes of ‘competing cosmologies’ and ‘ontological collisions’ — European missionaries arriving in Aotearoa in the early 19th century brought a Biblical cosmology that began such a collision. In this public lecture Bradford Haami will explore the interactions between Biblical and Māori cultural and spiritual worldviews that continue to evolve up to the present.

* How do Biblical and Māori cultural and spiritual beliefs and thought relate?
* How 19th century rangatira negotiate between traditional beliefs and the Biblical narratives?
* Where do Christian and Māori ways of knowing and seeing clash, compete or enrich each other?
* What does being Māori and Christian look like today?


Bradford Haami (Ngāti Awa) is a Māori historian, researcher and author with research interests in Māori worldviews, spirituality, Christianity and cultural preservation. He is Pou Amorangi (Māori Director) at Laidlaw College in Auckland, New Zealand, where he lectures in biculturalism and sits on the governing board of the college. Haami has written several books on Māori history, culture and spirituality, with recent works including Urban Māori: The Second Great Migration (Oratia Media 2018) and Bringing Culture into Care (Huia 2019). He was the Māori curator/expert on the acclaimed Te Taiao / Nature exhibition at Te Papa Tongarewa Museum.

--
To browse the Ramsey Library catalogue, and sign up to borrow books (free), go to https://library.chaplaincyvuw.org.nz

description:
Narrative Refresh w. Austin Harrison | A PopRox Workshop, Sharpen your narrative tools in this one-off workshop with PopRox improv.
Refresh and restock your narrative toolkit to create a satisfying arc for your improv- be it within a scene or across a whole show. We'll unpack what a narrative arc is, and the simple tools and choices you use to help keep a scene/show on track.
This is a refresh intensive, so folks should have some experience with improvised scene work and have taken a workshop in narrative before- to get the most out of this workshop.

ABOUT THE TEACHER
Austin Harrison is one of Aotearoa's most prolific improv performers, producers and teachers. He's a founding member of PopRox, a 6-time winner of Late Night Knife Fight and a Wellington theatre Award winner. Past shows include Ungartered Territory, Pudgy Mediocre White Men Solve Your Problems, and Magnus Steele. He's taught with Improv Connection, WIT, Voice Arts and was recently appointed Artisitc Director of the New Zealand Improv Festival. Austin specialises in interactive and narrative work and loves the full spectrum of joy improv has to offer!

THE STAND-BY LIST
PopRox firmly believes that improv is for everyone, especially when it comes to sharing skills and knowledge. So we're offering "the stand-by list" for all our workshops in 2025. We'll giveaway any spots remaining a few days before the first workshop of the course, on a first-come-first-serve basis. No need to provide a reason, no questions asked. If the entry fee is a barrier for you to come along, then simply email poproximprov@gmail.com and we'll pop you on the SBL. Everyone on the list will be notified whether there was a place available for them 3 days before the workshop.

description:
Neurodiversity Workshop, Neurodiversity seems to be a hot topic of discussion lately. Famous singers such as Lewis Capaldi and Sia and actors such as Ryan Gosling and Channing Tatum have discussed their neurodiverse conditions. Lockdowns and social media have driven many adults to have startling realisations about their own neurodiverse conditions. It seems suddenly – all at once – the world has become aware that 15-20% of people have different types of brains. (Free for NZ citizens/residents, all others pay $99).

Description
This one-day workshop introduces you to the topic of neurodiversity and considers some of the key conditions that people live with. We look at:

-ADHD – Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
-Autism
-The “Dys family” – dyslexia, dysgraphia, dyscalculia, dyspraxia (Developmental Coordination Disorder)
-OCD – Obsessive Compulsive Disorder
-Tourette’s Syndrome

TikTok creator and public speaker on neurodiversity, Nigel Sutton, will introduce the subject and help you discover the definitions and impacts of each of the key kinds of neurodiversity. Working together with other participants, you will consider many key commonalities that those living with various neurodivergent conditions experience. We will expose the realities of being neurodivergent in a “neurotypical world”, and this will allow you to develop empathy and practical strategies to support neurodivergent people to be their best.

New Zealand’s leading dyslexia expert, Mike Styles, will provide an interactive and participatory session to assist you in understanding and supporting a family member or friend who has dyslexia or a similar learning difference.

You will be able to ask anything you want with our neurodivergent hot seat session.

Find out from those offering “lived experience” what it is really like to have a different kind of brain. This one-day workshop is: ”Neurodiversity in a Nutshell” – whether you know a little or a lot, whether you are a relative, employer, partner, friend, or just interested to know more about neurodiversity – this workshop is for you!

[You must be a NZ citizen or resident to register in this course for free, and you must provide photo ID when you attend. If you are unable to attend the course, we cannot guarantee that you will be able to enrol again for free for a funded course in the future.

description:
PADI Advanced Open Water Course, PADI Advanced Open Water Course
“Your Next Step in Underwater Adventure”
Exploration excitement and experiences are what the PADI Advanced Open Water
course is all about. And no you don't have to be "advanced" to take it - it's designed
so both new and experienced Open Water Divers can sign up and develop better
diving skills and techniques straight away!

The Advanced Open Water Diver course helps you increase your confidence and
build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water. It’s also a great
way to get more diving experience under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.
This course builds on what you've learnt and develops new capabilities by
introducing new dive activities and ways to have fun scuba diving. You will complete
5 different types of dives to build your confidence and develop your dive skills. The
dives include the basics of Deep Diving Underwater Navigation - and your choice of
Peak Performance Buoyancy Naturalist Fish Identification Wreck (weather dependant)
Enriched Air * Photography or Night during winter.

Complete the theory online then join us for a weekends diving. After the 5 dives
over the weekend you will qualify as a PADI Advanced Open Water Diver. This is the
minimum requirement for many of our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the
PADI Rescue Diver course.

If you have any questions please call so we can help you.

description:
PADI Open Water Diver Course, PADI Open Water Diver Course
“Ever Since I Was A Kid I’ve Wanted To Learn To SCUBA Dive…”

PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun safe relevant and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in your PADI qualification will be recognised.

To learn to dive first complete the medical questionnaire to make sure you are medically fit to dive. Next pay your deposit and select your course dates. You will receive your PADI eLearning theory which must be completed before you attend the first practical session. This simple and fun eLearning program will give you the knowledge you need to understand the reason for the skills you will learn.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive so we can go at your pace no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed you will be ready for the sea dives.

During the second weekend you complete four sea dives two per day. This is where we confirm and practice the skills you learnt in our pool – all under direct supervision. You will also complete a simple 300m swim (no time limit and wearing wetsuit mask snorkel and fins).

Once you are a certified diver you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification online. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course and our regular Dive Days.
Our aim is to prepare you for the fascinating adventure of diving. We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call email or stop by our Dive Store.
 

PPADI Open Water Diver course at a glance
Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
Practical: One weekend pool training one weekend with four sea dives
Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
Start Time: Be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am each day.

Location
We are located at 9 Marina View Mana Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Our Location

Prerequisites
Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
Be able to swim 300m (mask snorkel and fins no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts a visit to your doctor is required.
eLearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
Complete the Optional RDP Tables Quiz and Exam after the final exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring
Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
A pen swimming costume towel and a snack for the breaks.
Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost
Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
Includes: PADI eLearning Course Dive Gear Rental Pool Sessions and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased.
10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.

Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course
Course bookings can be made in-store via email online or over the phone
The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
eLearning courses once redeemed cannot be transferred.
Before we can send you the eLearning link we require your full name date of birth a valid personal email address and phone number.
Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

Activities For Certified PADI Open Water Divers
Local Diving; It’s a good idea to keep diving regularly especially in the weeks following your course. We’re here to help with advice on dive sites and gear rental. Want a guide? Join us for Dive Days!
Advanced Open Water course; Further your dive skills and continue your underwater adventures with the PADI Advanced Open Water course you can start straight after your Open Water Diver course.
As a certified PADI Open Water Diver you can take the following Specialty Diver courses alongside those available to non-divers; Altitude Diver – AWARE Fish ID diver – Boat Diver – Digital Underwater Photographer – Diver Propulsion Vehicle Diver – Drift Diver – Drysuit Diver – Enriched Air/Nitrox Diver – Equipment Specialist – Night Diver – Peak Performance Buoyancy – Sidemount Diver – Underwater Naturalist – Underwater Navigation

In attending my classes, i trust that you are in a good health condition and that you know of no medical or other reason why you cannot or should not engage in active or passive exercise. I am not medically trained or qualified to assess if you are in good physical condition and can exercise without risking your health, safety or comfort. If you have any doubts, I strongly urge you to seek expert advice before starting classes with me .
Waiver: You understand there are specific risks of physical or property damages, losses, or injury that may result from your participation with BootyWerks with Molly and you voluntarily assume the risks associated with such participation. attendance at any of my classes confirms you have read and agreed to these terms and conditions.
Refunds can be issued with up to 24 hours notice in advance. if you cancel a class within 24 hours of the class starting, refunds will be issued on a case by case basis. if you are a no show and i haven’t heard from you prior to class you will not receive a refund.
I film and/or photograph classes. Please tell me prior to class that you do not want to be filmed as it is possible that you will appear in these materials. If you do not let me know you do not wish to be filmed, by accepting this agreement, you allow me the unrestricted right and permission to use your image in printed or digital promotional materials including, but not limited to: websites, social media, flyers, banners and videos. Please note that I use videographers of all genders and my partner will sometimes be present to film content. I will only ever use people I trust to film my classes.
Although my main target audience is female please note my classes are for all genders.
Please reach out if you have any questions.
Much love,
Molly xx

description:
Padi Advanced Open Water Course, Exploration, excitement and experiences are what the PADI Advanced Open Water (AOW) Diver course is all about.

The AOW course is designed for both new and more experienced Open Water Divers and is best attended as soon after your Open Water Diver course as possible. That way you will increase your confidence and build scuba skills to become safer and more comfortable in the water; all under the supervision of a PADI Instructor.

The AOW course consists of five dives that includes a: Deep and an Underwater Navigation dive. Popular local options for the remaining three dives are: Peak Performance Buoyancy, Naturalist, Wreck, Fish Identification, Imaging, Night, *Enriched Air or *Dive Against Debris (* conditions apply).

You may choose to add the 'Enriched Air' and/or the 'Dive Against Debris' specialty qualifications to your weekend experience. Simply ask to: include these dives as part of your five dives, complete the on-line study and a short practical, pay a small fee – and go diving. These Specialties count towards the prestigious PADI Master Scuba Diver rating.

Pay your deposit and you can begin the AOW theory. Make sure your dive medical is current, then join us for a weekend's fun diving. After everything is completed, you will qualify as a PADI AOW Diver. This is the minimum requirement for our dive adventures and a prerequisite for the PADI Rescue Diver course.
If you have any questions, please call so we can help you.

description:
Paediatrics: Daytime Mobility & Function + Practical Workshop (Wellington), Paediatric Academy Wellington - Venue to be announced
_____________________________________________________________________________________________
Overview:
Join us for an engaging and interactive session focused on paediatric Assistive Technology (AT) and safe car seat solutions! We’ll explore prescribing AT for sitting, standing, stepping, and mobility—blending clinical theory with real-world insights on equipment choices.
Engage in a hands-on practical session to test techniques, plus learn how to collaborate with parents, caregivers, and kids for practical, daily-use solutions, including safe transportation. Don’t miss this chance to boost your skills and confidence!
Learning Objectives
Identify and describe different types of paediatric Assistive Technology (AT) equipment
Explain the clinical rationale behind equipment prescription
Enhance collaboration with families and caregivers
Assess the functional needs of children and recommend suitable AT solutions
About our Presentor:
Jamie's Bio:
BSc Physiotheraop, Paediatric Product Education - Medifab
Jamie Cockle is a trained physiotherapist and Medifab's Paediatric Clinical Educator and Seating and Positioning Specialist. With a passion for empowering therapists, product specialists, and families, Jamie provides expert training on Medifab’s paediatric equipment, ensuring practical knowledge that can be applied every day to optimise children’s health and happiness.
Jamie’s career began as a Paediatric Physiotherapist at Noah’s Ark Children’s Hospital in Cardiff, followed by a role at Bristol Royal Hospital for Children. It was in these settings that he developed his expertise in paediatric equipment, particularly for children with neurological conditions. He is driven by the belief that every child should have access to the right support, regardless of their abilities or diagnosis..

description:
Panel Talk: Interconnected [Breathe | Mauri Ora], Discover how art, science, nature, and Indigenous knowledge converge as Marshmallow Laser Feast and experts share insights inspired by Breathe | Mauri Ora: An Immersive Journey into Nature by Marshmallow Laser Feast.

Hosted by Miriama Kamo, Interconnected brings the relationships of art, science, nature, and mātaurangagloss to life in a panel discussion where London-based art collective Marshmallow Laser Feast joins leading researchers and curators for an evening of sharing how we understand the world and ourselves, inspired by Breathe | Mauri Ora.

This thought-provoking kōrero explores how technology makes the invisible visible, and how creativity, science, and Indigenous knowledge together can transform how we see our planet and our place within it.

Featuring
* Representative from Marshmallow Laser Feast – artist/director
* Dr Dan Hikuroa – Earth systems scientist and expert in integrating mātauranga Māori
* Dr Huhana Smith – artist, curator, and researcher exploring climate adaptation and Māori knowledge
* Dr Rebecca Rice – Senior Curator Art at Te Papa
* Dr Thom Linley – Curator Fishes at Te Papa

The panel will explore
* How technology and art reveal nature’s hidden systems
* The meeting of mātauranga Māori and the scientific method
* Ethics and responsibility in an age of ecological change
* Reimagining humanity’s relationship with the living world
* Future visions for the next generation’s environmental consciousness.

Programme
* 6pm to 7pm – Exhibition Viewing
Experience Breathe | Mauri Ora after hours – an internationally acclaimed digital art exhibition that reveals the unseen forces connecting all living things.

* 7.30pm to 9pm – Panel Talk
Audience Q&A and closing reflections.

Spaces are limited – book your ticket today.

description:
Paraparaumu Makeup Masterclass - 21.09 @9.15 am, About this event
Join Nikki, a Professional Makeup Artist & Colour Expert with over 14 years of experience, for an engaging and practical Makeup Masterclass. Nikki and her team focus on enhancing natural beauty and making makeup easy for everyone.
As we journey through life, our skin and style evolve. The best way to update your look and learn techniques that suit your unique face shape, style, and colouring is to attend one of our masterclasses. Whether you're a performer on stage, a busy professional, or a multitasking mum, this class will teach you how to apply your makeup quickly, flawlessly, and with confidence.
During the class, Nikki will demonstrate step-by-step techniques on a model while you get to apply your own makeup. You'll have access to professional products and tools to follow along and create your flawless everyday look. It’s fun, interactive, and designed for all skill levels.
"I can’t wait to share my knowledge with you and help you create a makeup routine that leaves you feeling fabulous and confident every day!" – Nikki
What You Need to Know:
No equipment required! We’ll provide all makeup products, brushes, and mirrors.
Bring a willingness to learn and a positive attitude.
Classes are capped at 12-15 participants to ensure personalised guidance.
Arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled.
Please come with a clean, makeup-free face so you can get the best results.

description:
Photography - Unlocking the Secrets to Captivating Images, Why do some photographs linger in our memories while others seem forgettable and repetitive? Why do we scroll through Instagram and barely recall what we saw five minutes later?

This course will help you find the answers to these questions and show you how to transform your photographs into extraordinary, captivating, and memorable images

Elevate your photography from ordinary to extraordinary and ensure your work stands out in the digital age. Creating captivating photographs and understanding what makes a photograph engaging is something every photographer should master.

Camera settings are essential, but once you know them, you need to learn how to take photographs that stir emotions, impact your audience, and leave a lasting impression.
After all, isn’t that the true purpose of photography? People don’t want to see the same landscapes or flowers they’ve seen thousands of times. But how do you turn what you love into something that makes people go, "Wow"?

Captivation in photography means stopping a viewer in their tracks, making them look, feel, and connect. It’s about delivering a photograph that enthrals, evokes profound emotions, and shifts perspectives.

In a world brimming with images, only a few have the power to truly captivate and linger in our memories.

This pioneering course is your gateway to mastering the art of creating captivating photographs at a time when AI-generated images are saturating our visual landscape. Create something genuine and memorable—images that spark curiosity, evoke emotions, and inspire changes in perception. It's time to define your unique style, refine your vision, and make your mark.

Course Outcomes

By the end of the five-week course, you’ll be able to:

-Identify the foundational elements that transform an ordinary image into a captivating one.
-Create photographs that make people say "Wow" by applying techniques that add a spark of wonder to your shots.
-Infuse your photographs with curiosity, making each frame a source of intrigue and interest.
-Understand why some images linger in memory and how to make your photographs unforgettable.
-Develop a unique style and vision that sets your work apart in the crowded digital landscape.

Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Prerequisites
This course is perfect for you if you:

Aim to elevate your photography from good to mind-blowing.
Are eager to discover the secret ingredients that make photographs unforgettable (all backed by research and science).
Feel passionate about photography but need fresh ideas on what to photograph and how to truly stand out.
Wish to explore and evolve your genre and style.

5 sessions, 4 x Thu 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM plus a Saturday field trip
Wellington High School
Presented by Ana Lyubich
$159 incl. GST

description:
STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 1 2026, STEAMS is an integrated approach to learning topics of Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Maths, and Society that fosters critical thinking, problem solving, communication and collaboration. Its aim is to teach real world skills through engaging methods whilst allowing individuals to be creative. This involves immersing tamariki into projects and activities that develop innovation and champion curiosity. STEAMS is not ‘play based learning’ but focused learning through an integrated hands-on approach allowing children to take risks and explore their own curiosity in a subject without time barriers.
At the Ministry of Inspiration we offer STEAMS learning each term for Year 1-8 students. Once a week students will attend a class at Waterlea Racecourse, Blenheim on TUESDAY or THURSDAY. STEAMS Jr (ages 7-9) start at 9am and finish at 2:45pm on TUESDAY. Little STEAMerS operates from 9-12 on THURSDAY. STEAMS Sr (ages 10-13) operates on THURSDAY from 9am to 245 pm. 
Inquiry, collaboration, and an emphasis on process-based learning are at the heart of the STEAM approach. Each term the classes will have a focus which drives the learning and our amazing teachers create opportunities to help each student develop their understanding, improve their skills and gain knowledge in a range of topics.
Students who participate in STEAM learning:
· think outside the box
· feel safe to express innovative and creative ideas
· feel comfortable doing hands-on learning
· take ownership over their learning
· work collaboratively with others
· understand the ways that science, maths, the arts, and technology work together
· become increasingly curious about the world around them and feel empowered to change it for the better.
When does it meet, and where?
The school is held during school terms.
STEAMS Jr (ages 7-9) TUESDAY, 9-245.
STEAMS Sr (ages 10-13) THURSDAY, 9-245
Little STEAMerS (ages 5-6) THURSDAY 12-3.
Location:  Waterlea Racecourse, enter off of Linton St.
How much does it cost?
The students come for a paid three-week trial-as a new student you pay for that through Humanitix.
If both family and teacher feel there is a good fit for the child in the class, they continue for the rest of the term. You are then invoiced for the full term less the amount paid for the Trial.
Payment is by term, with a cost of $73 incl. GST We have a limited number of scholarships available that are awarded on a term by term basis for those with financial need for 25% off. 
Little STEAMerS is $30 incl. GST.
Will my child’s school mind that they miss a day per week?
You will need to inform the child’s school that he or she will be at STEAMS School one day per week. To date we have not encountered any issues around accommodating a child’s participation in STEAMS School, and many of the region’s schools are very supportive of the programme. Once enrolled, you are encouraged to inform the teacher and office staff that your child should be marked present for the day they attend STEAMS School, as they will be attending an academic school as opposed to being absent due to illness or other reasons.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Screenprinting taster workshop Nov 15th - print a tote bag, Design and screenprint your own tote bag, no experience needed!
Join artist and designer Greta Menzies for a fun, hands-on introduction to screenprinting using paper stencils.
In this 2-hour session you’ll design and cut your own stencil, then print your artwork onto a tote bag (included in your ticket).
Want to make extras? See the 'what's included' section below.
What you’ll learn
How to create and screenprint your own design using paper stencils
Tips and tricks from Greta’s years of experience as an artist and textile designer
(Greta is happy to answer any questions about printing methods and help you find resources)

What’s included
All materials provided, including one tote bag
Extra tote bags will be available on the day for $6 each. They make great gifts!
You’re also welcome to bring your own light-coloured fabric or fabric item to print on, just make sure it’s at least 50% natural fibre (cotton or linen is ideal).
The max print size is A3.
Can I print more than one bag? Or multiple colours?
Once your design is on the screen you can print a few multiples if you'd like.
The workshop is set up for participants to make one bag with a single colour print, but depending on how fast you work, (if there is time) you are welcome to add another colour.

Who it’s for
This workshop is for anyone curious about screenprinting, no experience required.
All ages welcome! (Under 13s will need an adult to join them.)
Accessibility
The space is wheelchair accessible.
The process is adaptable for all abilities. If you can use scissors, that's excellent, tearing paper also works. Greta is happy to help with cutting if needed.
Details
Date: Saturday November 15th, 2025
Time: 10.30am - 12.30pm
Location: Mt Cook School, 160 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
Cost: $85 per person
Class size: Max of 10 participants
What to bring
Yourself and your ideas!
Wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little paint on (or bring an apron)
Optional: light-coloured fabric item to print on (at least 50% natural fibre, cotton or linen is ideal)
Water bottle and snacks if you like
Extra tote bags available on the day for $6 each
(random colours and limited selection, unless you want to email me ahead of time and order something specific: greta.menzies@gmail.com)
About Greta
Greta Menzies is an artist and designer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has taught art and design workshops since 2015, in galleries, schools, community studios, and at Massey University. Greta first started screenprinting with stencils in her garage at 17, making hoodies and t-shirts for her mates. Over the last few years, she’s refined her accessible, low-impact printing method while teaching school groups - and now it’s time for all ages to have a go!

description:
Scriptwriting, There are no rules in scriptwriting, only principles. Learn how your favourite movies are built from these principles and begin to create your own.

You will develop and build on your writing skills so you can confidently produce a scripted narrative. You will learn how the basics of scriptwriting work - covering everything from Aristotle to Tarantino.

Topics discussed and practised include the hero’s journey, script format, the differences between writing for film, theatre and television, creating dialogue, world-building and more.

In each session, we will share our writing that has been completed over the week. We’ll take part in exercises, watch clips and have group discussions. There will always be a focus on detailed feedback on your work - all of this working towards having the template and building blocks created for your first screenplay so you are ready to finish writing it.

Bring a pen and paper.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- See film, television, and theatre with a new lens for the way scripted stories work.
- Develop character arcs and dynamics and work with subtext
- Create and build worlds as well as write effective dialogue
- Form and create your own creative principles that you will continue to stand by and develop as you continue to create
- Have the confidence to receive and give feedback
- Have the confidence to put your work out into the world


6 weeks, Thu 5:30 PM – 7:30 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Helen Vivienne Fletcher
$159 incl. GST

description:
Sculpt Clay with Paintvine - Christmas Keepsakes, Sculpt the night away with Paintvine! In this fun tactile workshop, our expert artists will guide you step-by-step to create a quirky hand-made clay sculpture, with your own personalised touch. Our expert clay-makers will introduce you to basic clay hand-building techniques and decorating methods.

No experience needed (all are welcome!) as our professional artist instructors will guide you every step of the way until you have created a clay masterpiece you will be proud of!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?

It’s a social creative class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality air-dry clay and sculpting tools). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night you will leave with your very own hand-made sculpture!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

description:
Sculpture - Intro to Creature Sculpting, Join us in an exciting new introduction to creative sculpting - a hands on class to produce unique creature figurines and miniatures to bring your imagination to life! - Beginners welcome! All material costs included in course fee.

Description
Whether you want to make creatures cute, creepy, in the style of pop-toys, figurines, or a one-of-a-kind character in your own style, this is the class for you!

Working with air dry clays, oven bake polymer clays and wire, armatures this workshop offers a variety of modelling methods and approaches - a great opportunity to turn ideas into tangible 3D forms. With modern clays we can create translucent, flexible, and even glow-in-the-dark elements to add more realism or a touch of the surreal into each creation!

We’ll kick off working with traditional air-dry clay to get a feel for modelling a few simple forms.

Once familiar with the materials, we’ll go through some basic design elements, guided by animal anatomy and morphology. From here the tutor will show and chat with the group about ways we can transform the creatures from our imagination into unique sculptures full of character.

Students will be coached through designing and creating a series of small-scale creature sculptures, beginning simple, and building to a more complex final form as we gather practice.

The class offers beginner students a fun introduction to sculpting organic forms from scratch, and for those with some hands-on creative experience, it offers a great opportunity to experiment, hone and advance your making skills to new levels.

Please wear closed-in footwear suitable for a workshop environment. bring a work apron if you have one or wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little grubby. Remember to bring your reading glasses if a have them.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
Secure Development Training - September 2025, Have you been to a Kawaiicon and found yourself realising that you want to know more? Are you a curious developer who wants to know what happens if you prod a web application? Are you a QA looking to take the worst path possible through an app?
Maybe the PrivSec Secure Development Training is for you!
Agenda
The training is a one day course consisting of the following:
A detailed overview of the OWASP Top Ten Web Application vulnerabilities.
Multiple real world examples and case studies of exploited vulnerabilities.
Hands on experience exploiting these vulnerabilities on a custom web application
Techniques and tooling to identify and exploit these bug classes, using both source code analysis and dynamic testing techniques.
Remediation steps and techniques to mitigate and avoid these issues.
Outcomes
By the end of the day, you will have an understanding of tools and techniques used to compromise web applications and hands on experience in exploiting multiple vulnerabilities in the OWASP top ten.
About the Trainer
Training will be led by one of our Senior consultants, Jack Moran and supported by Sriram Jayaraman
Jack is a Senior Consultant at PrivSec Consulting. He has worked in the offensive security space for the better part of a decade, focusing on web and mobile application testing, along with code reviews and security configuration reviews. He has a number of CVEs credited to himself, and his enthusiasm towards security security is infectious.
Sriram is an ex-developer, turned security consultant. He has a strong background in web application penetration testing, along with code review. He has familiarity with several programming and scripting languages and frameworks such as Python, Javascript, PHP, Node.js, Angular and React.
Notes for the Day
Lunch and snacks will be provided. We will teach you how to hack.
