Gindulgence, New Zealand’s most celebrated boutique gin festival. Waitangi Park hosts Gindulgence in January. A group of 18 distillers will showcase a fabulous selection of more than 90 gins and other spirits from New Zealand and around the world. The ticket price includes samples from distillers, so you’ll be able to explore an exceptional range. Delight the senses with botanical flavour combinations. 
This year, it’s not just gin that features in the outdoor fair. You’ll find rum, whisky, vodka, liqueurs and other specialist spirits. Shop for a summer tipple or listen to presentations from some passionate distillers. Alternatively, just sit back on the grass and soak up the atmosphere, accompanied by live acoustic music and great local food.

description:
Great Sounds Great Festival 2025, Eyegum Music Collective presents GREAT SOUNDS GREAT, a multi-venue music and arts festival taking over Pōneke's Cuba Street precinct for one night only on Saturday 6 September 2025. Showcasing 40 of Aotearoa's best artists across 10 neighbouring venues, this is one big party you shouldn't miss.

Eyegum has worked hard to curate a programme that is sure to offer something for everyone, from first time gig-goers to seasoned live music obsessives. The eclectic lineup includes perennial indie maestros The Bats, capital hometown heroes The Phoenix Foundation, hip hop superstar JessB, troubadour-turned-party starter Anthonie Tonnon, captivating genre-bender Reb Fountain, the incredible local-by-way-of-Naarm Jen Cloher, plus a selection of up-and-coming artists handpicked from Eyegum's Free Wednesday weekly showcase series, and everything in between. There will also be plenty more to be announced soon.

Excitingly for 2025, we will be adding three new venues: St Peter's on Willis, Flying Nun Records and 13 Garrett Street (sponsored by Radio Active), as well as a travelling electronic stage curated by Tonic Collective. This means more artists and music to experience in a variety of special and unique spaces throughout the night.

Ticket holders will receive a wristband that will give them access to each of the participating venues throughout the event. Information on how to pick up wristbands will be provided to ticket holders closer to the time.

Tickets are on sale now at eyegum.co.nz/great-sounds-great

When: from 4pm Saturday 6 September 2025
Where: San Fran, Meow, Valhalla, Rogue & Vagabond, Bedlam & Squalor, Hotel Bristol (2 stages), St Peter's on Willis, Flying Nun Records, 13 Garrett St

Who: The lineup will include Anthonie Tonnon, Baby Zionov, Bad Taste, BADTAB, Baeoli, Bathysphere, The Bats, By A Damn Sight, Cindy, Eveline Breaker, Goya, Half/Angel, Hans Pucket, Iris Little, Jazmine Mary, Jen Cloher, JessB, JHL, Jim Nothing, Jordan Hamel, Leah Dodd, LEAO, Louisa Nicklin, The Phoenix Foundation, Reb Fountain, Rebecca Hawkes, Shayne P Carter (solo), Sig Wilder & Friends, Sofia Machray, Space Bats, Attack!, The Spectre Collective: live-scored cinema, Star Time, plus more artists to be announced soon.

Greytown Art Town - Art Festival, Greytown Art Town - Art Festival
Greytown Art Town: 26th - 28th September 2025 - put it in the diary folks!

Greytown and its surrounding areas are home to an extraordinary concentration of diverse creative talent, producing a unique and vibrant range of artistic expressions. What better way to showcase this than with a local celebration of the arts?

Introducing Greytown Art Town—a dynamic festival dedicated to visual arts, music, poetry, and performing arts. This three-day celebration will offer a rich program of events for all ages and tastes. Included is the Wairarapa Art Trail, where visitors can explore over 30 open artist studios, experiencing artistic expression first hand.

For full program of events see our website:
www.greytownarttown.com

Join us as we Celebrate Creativity!

description:
Greytown Through the Ages, Greytown Through the Ages
DATE: All Weekend
LOCATION: various retail shops & eateries in Greytown Main St.
AGES: All
COST: Free
Step back in time with Greytown Through the Ages, a unique, immersive event where visitors can explore the town’s rich history simply by strolling along its charming Main Street and local shops. Participating businesses throughout Greytown will display historical photographs — some dating back as far as the 1850s.

Wander into cafés, boutiques and eateries to discover black-and-white snapshots of rarely seen archival images showing what Greytown once looked like. From dusty horse-drawn streets to early main street storefronts of eras gone by, each location offers a different window into the past.

Many photographs will be matched with the current buildings so visitors can compare then and now, sparking conversations and nostalgia and soak in the legacy of one of New Zealand’s most historic towns.

www.greytownarttown.com

description:
Heritage Festival Open Days, Heritage Festival Open Days
Join us for an open day in the bell tower of Wellington Cathedral of St Paul, where you can uncover its unique history and see the bellringers come out to play.

Take a tour through our ringing chamber and belfry, and see our 140-year-old bells up close. You will have a chance to watch the ringers in action, and maybe even have a go at chiming our 1500kg tenor bell, the largest swinging bell in New Zealand! Discover the secret world of bells and bellringing, something the public doesn't normally get to see. You may have never known that people are pulling on the ropes to make the bells ring! *One of the few towers in the world accessible by lift!

**Entry by donation**

Health & Safety
Please be aware that touching the bell ropes and access to the bells outside of the designated viewing areas is strictly prohibited. You will only be permitted to handle a bell rope under the guidance and supervision of a bellringer. Hearing protection is not required in the ringing chamber, but earmuffs will be provided whilst in the belfry viewing gallery if the bells are going to be rung.

Location
James Thomas Bell Tower, Wellington Cathedral of St Paul, 2 Hill Street, Thorndon 6011

description:
Hutt Valley Annual Diwali 2025, Hutt Valley Annual Diwali 2025
The Annual Hutt Valley Diwali, organised by the Wellington Punjabi Sports and Cultural Club Inc. (WPSCC Inc.), is a vibrant, family-friendly celebration of light, culture, and community. Held each year in the heart of the Hutt Valley, this non-profit event brings together people of all ages and backgrounds to enjoy the rich traditions of Diwali.

The festival features a colourful mix of cultural performances, traditional and modern music and dance, delicious food, local art and craft stalls, and engaging activities for children and families. It offers a unique opportunity to experience the diverse cultures that make up our region while celebrating the universal values of light over darkness, hope, and togetherness.

WPSCC Inc. proudly hosts this event to promote unity, cultural understanding, and community spirit in the Hutt Valley and beyond.

The Hutt Valley Irish Society invites you to a lively Community Cultural Festival filled with the heart and soul of Irish tradition—and plenty of fun for everyone.

Whether you've got Irish roots or just a love for good craic, there's something for all ages at this community celebration. Entry is free—bring your friends, family, and your dancing shoes!

Don't miss out—let's make it a day to remember!

Join us at Puriri Lawn for interactive readings celebrating Shakespeare and spring at 11:30am and 2:30pm, with roaming performers delighting visitors in between.
Come dressed to impress for our bird costume competition, with judging at 12pm and 3pm following the readings. Feathers, colours, and creativity encouraged!

The Sweetest Festival on the Kapiti Coast.

During November and December thousands of delicious strawberry sundaes will be sold around the region to raise funds for Mary Potter Hospice to help keep the hospice service free.

The Hospice provides some of the best quality specialist care in the world for people facing terminal illness and their families.

Come along to Kapiti Primary School in Paraparaumu on Saturday 15 November from 9.30am and celebrate spring and help us to keep hospice services free.

description:
Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026, Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026
Get ready, Kapiti – something bold, creative, and totally unforgettable is coming your way. On Saturday, 7th March 2026, the Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival makes its explosive return at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, bringing together the ultimate fusion of ink, art, and live entertainment for one epic day of creativity and connection. Whether you're a tattoo enthusiast, an art lover, or someone who thrives in high-energy, artistic environments, this festival is your ticket to something truly extraordinary.

This isn’t just another tattoo expo — it’s a full-blown creative takeover. Expect to see over 40 talented artists under one roof, from the regions leading tattooists to visionary painters, sculptors, illustrators, and local craftspeople. You’ll witness live tattooing, explore interactive art installations, shop handcrafted works, and dive into workshops designed to spark your imagination. Plus, with non-stop local entertainment on the main stage — from musicians to performers and DJs — the atmosphere will be electric from start to finish.

What makes this event truly special? It’s powered by the team at Kapiti Castles — the creative minds behind the popular Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo. Known for producing vibrant, community-driven experiences, Kapiti Castles has crafted this festival as a platform for creative expression, community connection, and artistic inspiration. Whether you're an artist looking to grow your brand or a visitor eager to explore the region’s creative heartbeat, this is your moment.

The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival is more than an event — it’s a movement. It’s a chance to meet incredible artists, get inspired, celebrate culture, and maybe even walk away with some fresh ink. With something for everyone — from art collectors to curious newcomers — this is a must-attend event for 2026.

So mark your calendars for 7th March, gather your crew, and get your tickets now. The Kapiti Tattoo & Arts Festival 2026 is where creativity comes alive, and you won’t want to miss being part of it. Tickets are on sale now — don’t miss your chance to be part of Kapiti’s boldest new festival.

Twisted Frequency is teaming up with Keep Hush to bring a slice of Aotearoa’s outdoor festival culture into the city and broadcast to the world.

For the uninitiated, Keep Hush started as an intimate underground club night in London and has grown into a global platform celebrating underground dance music through live streams, pop-ups, and parties in unexpected places.

These folks have such a fantastic kaupapa that resonates deeply with what we are doing down here in Aotearoa and we couldn't be more stoked to work with them and share a bit of the Twisted community's creative passion with the world.

Featuring a carefully selected lineup of talent who are dedicated to creating original homegrown tunes, all representing a unique aspect of the country’s bass music melting pot. This will be a journey of sound from dub-infused taonga pūoro to home mulled jungle breaks and all stops between.

The Wellington Xiamen Association works to strengthen ties between our two cities through cultural exchange, education, and collaboration.

description:
Martinborough Music Festival 2025, Bringing the world to Martinborough for chamber music in the heart of South Wairarapa.

Join us for four exciting concerts over three days, featuring stunning New Zealand and international artists including Natalia Lomeiko (violin), Yuri Zhislin (violin/viola), Matthias Balzat and Ashley Brown (cello), Jian Liu (piano), Wilma Smith and Donald Armstrong (violin), Simon Brew (saxophone) and Caroline Henbest (viola).

These artists will bring to life extraordinary works including Zoltán Kodály's Duo for Violin and Cello, Op. 7; JS Bach's Goldberg Variations for string trio; Shostakovich's Piano Quintet in G minor, Op. 57 and Mozart's String Quintet No. 5 in D major, K.593.

The Sunday afternoon concert will also include the world premiere of Shifting Worlds, a piano quintet by renowned New Zealand composer Louise Webster, who has special ties with South Wairarapa.

Visit martinboroughmusicfestival.co.nz for more information about artists, programmes and links to ticket sales.

description:
NZ Brewers Fest - Monster Mash, NZ Brewers Fest - Monster Mash
🦇A Day of Decadence, Darkness and Delights 🕷️

Join us from midday until the shadows stretch long, as Brewtown transforms into a haunted haven of unholy delights for NZ Brewers Fest 2025 – Monster Mash!

🍻Fiendishly good Beer!
It wouldn’t be NZBF without great beer, and this year 20 of Aotearoa’s best breweries will descend on Brewtown to pour every style you could possibly desire, from crisp Lagers, cold IPAs and hoppy Pale Ales, to funky Sours, smoky Porters, rich Pastry Stouts – and everything in between!

Visit Brewtown’s own custom Unimog Bar for 13 beers handpicked by our craft beer experts, but get in quick – we only have 1 keg of each, and they won’t last long!

🍸Haunting Spirits & Wine!
New for this year! Step into our haunted cocktail bar for some seriously spooky spirits! Our mixologists have been hard at work creating some devilishly delicious drops just for you.

We’re bringing in some of the best wines the Wairarapa has to offer, so whether you prefer a crisp Sauv, a fruity Pinot or a refreshing Frosé there will be something to enjoy.

Still not enough for you? Then head down to the Everything Else Bar, for NZ crafted ciders, as well as bourbon, rum, gin and vodka alongside a range of low and no alcohol beers, cocktails and soft drinks.

🌮Monstrously Good Kai!
The NZBF food court hosts the region’s top foodies, bringing you big, bold, flavour-packed festival eats that’ll satisfy both the living and the undead.
Watch this space as we announce our festive foodie lineup!

⚔️Enthralling Entertainment!
Lose yourself in a cabaret of the bizarre, where the performances are as dark as they are dazzling. Expect sultry burlesque, twisted characters and moments that will thrill, chill, and have you begging for more.

Witness the brutal thrill of buhurt armoured combat, as warriors face off in full medieval kit in a raw display of might and mayhem.

Dance the day away at the main stage, as Welly’s top talent smash out tune after tune, all building up to a headline show from Brewtown favourites, The Blueprint – as they bring a special set just for Monster Mash! Trust us, you haven’t seen them like this before…

Grab your mates and get stuck in at the Games Zone, where a bit of friendly rivalry meets festive fun, and the loser buys the next round.

Enjoy dressing up? Go all out in your most terrifying, theatrical or jaw-dropping costume — and you might just take out the crown in our epic Best Dressed Competition, with spooky-good prizes up for grabs.

With affordable return coaches from Welly and Petone and great discounts for group tickets it's scarily easy to get involved!
🎃 R18

description:
NZ Drum & Dance Camp, NZ Drum & Dance Camp
Join us this 24th to 27th October for a West African musical immersion at our annual NZ Drum Dance Camp.

Set amidst 38 acres of native bushland just a short drive from Wellington, this weekend is a celebration of unity, rhythm, and the soul-stirring power of African drum and dance, curated for the NZ African drumming community.

We are excited to announce that Epizo Bangoura will be back to join us again in 2025!

Epizo Bangoura is a celebrated master musician from Guinea, West Africa, known for his extraordinary versatility on the Kora (African harp), Balafon (African tuned percussion), and Djembe/Duns.

Epizo will be joined by Ghanaian Master Drummer Yaw Asumadu and special guest Jimi Dale.

Camp Highlights:

♪ Djembe and Dunun Workshops: Suitable for all skill levels, from enthusiastic beginners to advanced drummers, guided by our awesome team of teachers.
♪ Traditional Dance: with the effervescent Epizo Bangoura.
♪ Group Jams and Musical Sessions: Strengthen communal bonds through captivating group jams and impromptu musical sessions.
♪ Tranquil Setting: Enjoy the native bushland environ - build mind, body and spirit whilst enhancing our weekend of music and togetherness.
♪ Catering – Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included on Saturday and Sunday, as well as breakfast Monday. Please bring a shared (pre-prepared) plate for Friday evening kai.

Featured Instructors:

Epizo Bangoura: A master of the djembe and traditional dance, Epizo brings profound knowledge and vibrant energy, embodying the essence of West African music and dance.

Yaw Asumadu: A Master Drummer from Ghana, Yaw has performed globally and taught African drumming for 25 years, collaborating with legendary artists.

Jimi Dale: A pioneer of African music in NZ, Jimi has been teaching African Drum and Dance classes since 1995 and formed the world music and dance group, Tamani. We are excited to have Jimi back again teaching us a dun dance piece.

Pricing Details:
♪ Early Bird: $450 (Reserve by Sunday 31st August 2025)
♪ Adult rate: $495
♪ Kids 9 – 14 years old: $250
♪ Kids 8 and under: $175
♪ Family Packages available on request
♪ Single Day & night $220 (includes 3 meals and full day tuition)
♪ Drum Hire: $15

Event Schedule Snapshot:
♪ Friday, 24th October: Arrive from 4pm - A warm welcome sets the stage for a weekend filled with rhythm and learning.
Bring a share plate for dinner.
♪ Saturday, 25th October: Engage in enriching drum and dance workshops. Participants will be grouped into their appropriate levels.
♪ Sunday, 26th October: Continue your musical journey with drum and dance sessions, leading to a group performance that encapsulates the weekend’s shared experiences.
♪ Monday, 27th October: Morning All in Drum & Dance ceremony, then it's time to hit the road.

FAQs
♪ Getting Ready: Bring your drum (if available), snacks for the weekend, dance-appropriate shoes, sleeping gear (pillowcase & sheet, sleeping bag/ doona), warm clothes, and an eager spirit.
♪ Beginners are warmly welcomed – our camp is a nurturing space for newcomers to discover the joy of African drumming and dance, bolstered by a supportive community.

For more information and tickets -
https://africandrumming.co.nz/tours-and-retreats/nz-drum-dance-camp/

More questions?
Contact - Tulletha at or call: 028 474 1123

Audience Care

Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

We are planning a fully immersive production again with an amazing range of artists.


Main stage:

430-6pm NotMySister
6-730pm Everybody
730-9pm Donna-Marie
9-1030pm Greg Churchill

2nd Stage to be announced soon!


Our friends from Cosa Nostra food truck will be back serving fresh pizzas and also have a range of soft drinks available.


Kids under 16yo are free as well as the mini golf for all attendees!


Please note no alcohol will be allowed, you are however welcome to bring your own food and beverage refreshments, NO glass is allowed please. There will also be multiple water stations free for use.


The #29 Metlink Bus route will be running on the hour with the last bus leaving Happy Valley around 10pm. We will also contact the taxi companies to get them to provision taxis for the event closure.


We will not be offering ticket refunds or swaps for this event, if you can no longer make the event, you can on-sell your own ticket - buyers please be sure about who you are buying from as there are lots of scammers around!


Consent is always required at any event to ensure that everyone is kept safe and boundaries are not crossed. Please ask before any hugging, touching of any sort, taking photos, etc. We operate a zero-tolerance policy to bad behaviour. If you see something that doesn’t seem right, you have a responsibility to do something. And remember, if it’s not an enthusiastic YES then it’s a NO.


Open Air reserve all rights and have a zero-tolerance approach.

description:
POP Go the Festival Singers: Island Bay Presbyterian Church, The Festival Singers invite you to a enjoy unforgettable music in POP go the Festival Singers – a dazzling celebration of popular songs from the 1920s right through to today. Expect energy, variety, and entertainment as we journey through swing, rock ’n’ roll, Motown, disco, soft rock, and contemporary pop.
The programme sparkles with classics and favourites: a Beach Boys Medley full of surfside sunshine, Ruru Karaitiana’s iconic Blue Smoke, Elvis Presley’s Hound Dog, and Bobby Darin’s Beyond the Sea. We’ll groove with Pharrell Williams’ Happy, cheer to Survivor’s Eye of the Tiger, and celebrate Kiwi pride in Crowded House’s Weather with You. Heartfelt beauty shines through Simon and Garfunkel’s Bridge Over Troubled Water and Billy Joel’s And So It Goes, while fun abounds with The Lion Sleeps Tonight and Gershwin’s sultry Summertime.
Swing makes its mark with Glenn Miller’s Chattanooga Choo Choo and In the Mood, while a rousing Queen Medley and an exuberant ABBA Medley bring the concert to a thrilling close. Along the way, enjoy contemporary sparkle with Dua Lipa’s Levitating and the timeless artistry of these unforgettable hits.
With the incomparable Jonathan Berkahn at the piano, every piece shines with character and style. This concert promises nostalgia, joy, and toe-tapping fun – a true trip down memory lane with something for everyone.
Join us and be part of a celebration of music that entertains, connects, and uplifts.

Paekākāriki Pride Party, Paekākāriki Pride is back for the 8th year... this year's dance theme is 80s Dance Party!

Get decked out with your biggest hair, widest shoulder pads, and get your strut on in a power suit as we dance the night away.

This year's proceeds from Paekākāriki Pride Festival 2024 will be donated to Wellington Pride as they navigate their court case against LAVA. For more information follow this link: https://www.wellingtonpridefestival.com/news-1/an-update-on-the-hrrt-case

Our kaupapa:
Paekākāriki Pride exists to support Takatāpui and Rainbow communities in the Kāpiti Region and beyond.
We firmly hold the position that trans women are women and trans men are men, and that non-binary identities are valid. We recognise the harm caused by colonisation to Takatāpui communities. As an organisation we work to become better Treaty Partners

description:
Pasifika Festival's Shooting Star Programme presents: Taula, Show title: "Taula (Anchor)"
Wellington City Council's Shooting Star Programme proudly presents an original theatre production, which debuts at the Hannah Playhouse on Saturday 7 Febrary 2026! This production centres themes of identity, belonging, the passing down of cultural traditions and the importance of family, both present and past. The story follows young people navigating their identity whilst figuring out their place in Educational spaces. Taula is performed by Māori, Pasifika and Asian rangatahi who are emerging and aspiring actors. Join us for a 50-minute show followed by a short talanoa/chat afterwards.
Bookings required due to venue seating capacity - all tickets are free.
More about The Shooting Star Programme:
Following on from a successful pilot programme in 2025 Étū rere pā‘ata - The Shooting Star Programme is back. Part of the Wellington Pasifika Festival, this programme sees a group of young Pasifika actors create a show which tells Pasifika stories. This performance is their theatre debut. The Shooting Star programme brings new artforms and performers to the Pasifika Festival, upskills a new cohort of Pasifika and Māori performers and celebrates Pasifika art. Created by Karl Kite Rangi with support from WCC City Events and with assistant directors Meilani Payne and Maddy Vai-Little.

description:
Puku Rangi Tea – Rapa Nui Music & Dance Tour in Marlborough, Experience the vibrant culture of Easter Island as Puku Rangi Tea tours for the first time in Marlborough to closing the Welcoming Week Celebration!
Since 2012, they have been dedicated to preserving and showcasing traditional Rapa Nui music and dance. Their vibrant performances include the Hoko warrior dance, resonating with the spirit of the Māori Haka, storytelling through Takona body painting and ancestral narratives, Kai Kai string games and the rhythmic sounds of Tahitian ukulele and drums.
Puku Rangi Tea currently performs three shows a week at the Tahatai Hotel in Hanga Roa, Rapa Nui, and has participated in various festivals throughout its history, including:
Indigenous festival 2023–2024, San Juan de la Costa, Chile.
World Gathering of Folkloric Associations 2020, Lima, Peru.
International Festival 2018–2019, Málaga, Spain.
Chapultepec Forest Festival 2018, Mexico City, Mexico.
Second Workshop on Rapa Nui Music and Dance 2018, Mexico City, Mexico.
Rapa Nui Dance and Music Show 2018, Mexico City and Morelia, Michoacán, Mexico.
First Workshop on Rapa Nui Music and Dance 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
Rapa Nui Dance and Music Show 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
Indigenous festival 2016–2020, San Juan de la Costa, Chile.
Cultural Market 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
12th Pacific Arts Festival 2016, Hagåtña, Guam.
Carnaval 2016, Arica, Chile.
Summer Festival 2016, Valdivia, Chile.
Oktoberfest Chile 2015–2017, Malloco, Chile.
Gala Puro Chile 2015, Miami, United States.
The tour holds significant cultural importance due to Rapa Nui deep ancestral connections with Aotearoa, offering a unique opportunity for cultural engagement and community connection.
Their itinerary includes high-profile engagements, such as:
Music Workshop on Friday 12 at 4pm - Koha Entry - RSVP Required
Dance Workshop on Friday 12 at 6pm - Koha Entry - RSVP Required
Concert: Live music and dances on Sunday 14 Spetember. Doors open at 3:30pm, Event start at 4pm
Koha - Entry - RSVP Required (Limited Capacity)
We are also excited to feature the local guest band "Matices", who will open the concert with a vibrant performance of live Andean and Latin American music.

description:
Rathkeale Christmas Fete 2025, Welcome to the Rathkeale Christmas Fête 2025! Walk through the gates of Rathkeale College on 1st November and be welcomed by a diverse range of colourful stalls, the aroma of freshy cooked food and plenty of festive inspiration.

Now in its 22nd year, the Christmas Fête has become a must-do event on the Wairarapa spring calendar. Stallholders travel from around the North Island to sell their wares and offer Christmas shoppers loads of inspiration. From festive decorations, clothing, arts and crafts, to flowers, toys and plants – there is something for everyone.

Gourmet food is always a highlight at the Fête - think freshly made gourmet burgers, lamb & mint sausages, wraps, curry, salads, and the ever-popular berries & ice-cream - there is always a huge variety of flavours to tempt the taste buds. Devonshire Teas and home baking served in the Rathkeale Homestead rose garden is a time-honoured tradition while refreshing cold drinks can be sipped on as visitors listen to live music performed by students at various times throughout the day. The popular Christmas cake stall features again this year - but visitors are encouraged to get in early as the cakes often sell out by midday.

The beauty of this Fête is that it’s a day out for the whole family. In addition to the 120 plus stalls, there is plenty to entertain the children including facepainting and magic shows throughout the day.

Visitors can also explore the beautiful, expansive grounds of Rathkeale College including the school gardens designed by Alfred Buxton, the Greek Amphitheatre and the 3km eco-trail which weaves through large stands of native trees, including ancient kahikatea.

Eftpos is available, but we strongly recommend that visitors bring cash.

Koha/gold coin entry.
Rathkeale College is a five-minute drive north of Masterton in the Wairarapa.
label: Festivals

description:
Rathkeale College Christmas Fête 2025, Rathkeale College Christmas Fête 2025
Welcome to the Rathkeale Christmas Fête 2025!
Now in its 22nd year, the Fête offers shoppers loads of inspiration. Stallholders will be selling festive decorations, clothing, arts and crafts, as well as flowers, toys and plants – there is something for everyone.
Gourmet food is also a highlight – with freshly made gourmet burgers, lamb & mint sausages, wraps, curry, salads, and the ever-popular berries and icecream available for purchase. Devonshire Tea served in the Rathkeale Homestead rose garden is a time-honoured tradition while refreshing cold drinks can be sipped on as visitors listen to live music performed by students at various times throughout the day. The popular home baking stall features again this year, and visitors are encouraged to get in early as the Christmas cakes, in particular, often sell out by midday.
The beauty of this Fête is it is a day out for the whole family. In addition to the 120 plus indoor and outdoor stalls, there is plenty to entertain the children with face painting and three magic shows during the day to round out the fun.
Visitors can meander around the beautiful campus and enjoy the unique surroundings including the school gardens designed by Alfred Buxton, the Greek Amphitheatre and the 3km eco-trail which weaves through large stands of native trees, including ancient kahikatea.
The Christmas Fête is the school’s biggest fundraiser of the year and comes about thanks to an amazing collaboration between the Friends of Rathkeale College, staff and students.

description:
Resonant Rave, ✨ A Night for the High Vibe Dancers ✨
Love the energy of a club night — the music, the lights, the freedom — but not the hangover?
Craving that connected dance floor feeling… completely sober?
Welcome to our Resonant Rave — where we get high on music, movement, and community. 🪩💫
No booze required — just pure vibes, connection, and the freedom to be fully you.
Whether you’re sober, sober-curious, or simply want to experience dance in a new, elevated way — this night is for you.
Come dance. Come connect. Come as you are.
Expect bass-laden melodic grooves, warm smiles, and the kind of connection that happens when everyone’s really there.
Move sober. Dance deeper.
Let the resonance move through you.
🎧 With special guest DJ:
SORCHALULA
Mysterious, mercurial and multi-faceted. SorchaLula has as many shades to her music as she does to her personality. A dynamic producer/DJ, she flows from slinky sensuality, to fierce filth, to the uncompromising underground. Every set features her original tracks, many melting with honeyed vocals by singer Samuel (Cecilia’s Crop). In tune with what the body needs, she entwines beauty with bravery, sinuous melodies with hefty bass, lush peaks with decadent darkness.
She has played many top festivals around Aotearoa: Northern Bass, Shipwrecked Festival, Twisted Frequency, Aum Festival NYE, CubaDupa, Taniwha’s Den and more. She is highly rated by some of the biggest names in the scene for her taste, depth, and intuitive understanding of dancefloors. As founder of The Sensonauts she created events exploring the senses, music, dance, and music education with a focus on inclusivity.
Link to music
https://soundcloud.com/sorchalula
🪩
🎧 As well as:
KIMBA JADE
Kimba Jade has been lighting up dancefloors for over 20 years with her signature blend of deep, funky, and globally inspired grooves. A master of musical journeying, Kimba weaves bass-driven beats with tribal, melodic, and soulful sounds that move both body and spirit.
With a deep passion for Ecstatic Dance and the power of music to connect and uplift, Kimba brings that same vibrant, heart-opening energy into clubs and bars. Her favourite styles to play are Tech House infused with Indie Dance and Techno, blending rhythms with emotive melodies to create a sound that’s both driving and deeply immersive.
After years of spinning in Sydney and Auckland’s underground scene — from conscious dance floors to late-night sessions — Kimba is now based in Wellington, bringing her signature fusion of rhythm, soul, and bass to local venues. Whether behind the decks at a festival, Ecstatic Dance, or a packed club night, Kimba’s passion is the same: to create an unforgettable atmosphere where freedom, rhythm, and connection collide.
Link to music
https://soundcloud.com/kimba
@djkimbajade
🪩

description:
Summer Camp Closing Party! | Dillon Jo, Miles Calder & Keira Batten Coogan, San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!

Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Here it is… our final night! Featuring not one, not two, but THREE of Pōneke’s premier acts to close our 2026 series out.

Dillon Jo is the genre defying project of Wellington Based artists Betty Smith and Georgie Levien. Dillon Jo built paths between the elements of dream pop, shoegaze, folk, alt rock, and indie pop to create their genre defying sound. Having recently recruited Kahu Sanson-Burnett and Ruadh Munro, Dillon Jo has transformed their live sets into an unbridled big-sound shoegaze experience.
Miles Calder released his solo debut album Autopilot Life in 2021, a self-reflective delve into waking up from an unexamined life, dressed in a psychedelic folk-rock palette that evoked late-era Beatles as much as contemporaries like Kevin Morby and Father John Misty. The album won over new fans and critics alike & led to a nomination for a prestigious Aotearoa Music Award (Te Kaipuoro Taketake Toa | Best Folk Artist 2022). 

Keira Batten Coogan writes raw and messy music for alien listeners. Joined onstage by some familiar Pōneke talent, his earnest earworms pack more punch than ever. Themes of queerness, growing pains, love, and nostalgia shine through his lyricism and captivates audiences. 


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Start your new year off right with two of this city's premier alternative acts! 

Half/Angel toe the line of alt-rock, post punk & ambient psychedelia. They unpredictably juxtapose intimate, soft, vocals and delicate instrumental passages with raucous, high-energy outbursts. They’re exciting to listen to, and their singles ‘Debt Collector’ & ‘Boat Ramp + Jitterbug’ will have you struggling to put them in a box and itching to hear what’s next.
New noise in the scene, King Hit, is a Te Whanganui A Tara based four piece that blends together the jarring-ness of shoe-gaze, the punch of hardcore, with the sombreness of midwest emo. After a successful release of their debut single ‘asterisk’, King Hit are poised to release their follow up single ‘Sap’, an grungy-yet-ethereal longing love song.

San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance

description:
Summer Camp | BADTAB and Bri Louise, San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!

Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson. 

Come along for our third night of festivities featuring psychedelic sensations BADTAB and the unbeatable Bri Louise.

BADTAB are carving out their own kaleidoscopic corner of the music world. Weaving together synthesisers and swirling guitar strums with rock and jazz inspired drum beats, BADTAB creates a unique and refreshing sound. The band made their mark in 2024 with a prolific run of releases. September saw the drop of The Pōneke Sessions, collaborative EP with Cellz. Then came December’s Echo Chambers Of…, their full-length debut album that introduced the world to BADTAB’s expansive soundscape. Since the release of their debut album, they have been deep in the works on their sophomore album which is anticipated for a 2026 summer release.

Bri Louise blends sultry queer with smooth love and undeniable groove. Their sound has roots in Gospel and Neo-Soul, evolving into a rich fusion of Jazz, Hip-Hop, and R&B. Bri’s music features a talented live band that supports their poetic lyrics with colourful keys, phatty bass, flashy beats, vibrant guitar and fruity woodwinds.


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

description:
Summer Camp | Daisy Grae and Yawner, Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Our second instalment is one for the books! Featuring local legends Daisy Grae and rising stars Yawner.

Daisy Grae is a Wellington-born band that has been grooving in the local scene since their early high school days. Taking influence from genres across the board, Daisy Grae has crafted their very own brand of alternative funk rock. They consistently bring a refined, heavy, and psychedelic energy to the Pōneke music scene. Feeding off a fresh sound, this ever-evolving 4-piece of passionate personalities continue to be recognised as one of Pōneke’s most exciting live homegrown experiences.

Yawner are a Poneke-based R&B group formed in late 2024, bringing together a tight, groove-driven sound alongside the unmatched vocal talents and timbre of Eden Brown. Since their formation, the band have spent the better half of 2025 meticulously refining their identity as a unit, and are now more ready than ever to share it. Focusing on a heavy-hitting but soothing craft, they’ve put together an enormous live set which is not to be missed.
label: Festivals

description:
Summer Camp | Sam Fowles and Elly Mae , San Fran Summer Camp is back for 2026!

Join us and some of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s finest artists over five nights across January and February with tickets from $10 or a season pass for $40, featuring drink specials and cocktails thanks to our sponsor Jameson.

Our penultimate night features two of Pōneke’s finest songwriters from two separate sonic worlds… their combination is sure to be a treat!

Sam Fowles makes music that moves the body, speaks to the heart, and touches the soul. Driven by groove and the desire to find meaning in the moments on this journey we call life, the musician, songwriter and producer has a signature sound that stands out and stuns. Fowles would describe his music as psychedelic soul laced with blues and funk. It resonates with deep grooves and driving rhythms created by vintage drum sounds, digital sonics, and electric guitars that build and blaze into billowing soundscapes. At its core is his unique, soulful voice and the punchy, heartfelt lyrics he wears on his sleeve.

Elly Mae crafts songs that encapsulate the bittersweet ache of growth, the quiet unraveling of time, and the soft glow of nostalgia embedded within. Her music is an amalgamation of folk, dreampop, indie, shoegaze, and anything in between. From lullabies that make you feel weightless to being wrapped in a blanket of sound, Elly Mae's folk/country melodic guitar style is accompanied by experimental, spatial bass from Arran Cargill-Brown and textured pocket drumming from Sasha Francis-Murray. 


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

description:
THREE JOYFUL HOUSES - AOTEAROA FESTIVAL OF ARCHITECTURE - SUNDAY 28TH SEPTEMBER, THREE JOYFUL HOUSES by IAN ATHFIELD
SUNDAY 28TH SEPTEMBER @ FUTUNA CHAPEL - KARORI
Three joyful houses, three families and three client stories about the commissioning, designing, building and living in homes designed by Ian Athfield.
SPENCER and DIANE LOGAN
1974 - 1978
WINDY POINT – EASTBOURNE
Photographer unknown
Spencer Logan and his wife Diane will talk about the commissioning of their first new home, its design, construction, the cleaning of thousands of bricks, and living in this unique collection of a pair of recycled brick towers with timber clad ‘saddlebags’. 
ROSS, CUSHLA and TESS JAMIESON
1974 - 1978
MAHINA BAY
Ross and Cushla have lived in their home on the Eastern hills above Mahina Bay for 48 years. They will, along with their youngest daughter, recount their experiences of working with Ian Athfield in the commissioning of the design of their home, the construction process and then living in this hillside hugging collection of building, and how this home may have influenced their living and the raising of a family of four children.
JONATHAN CUSTANCE   - THE CUSTANCE HOUSE 1981 – 1982
HAVELOCK NORTH
“The Custance House replaced an early modern home that burnt to the ground in 1981 leaving only the swimming pool unscathed.  Ray and Ann Custance, who were friends of the Athfields, sought a bold replacement.  With their son, industrial and interior designer Jonathan Custance, they prepared a four page brief for a new building….. “
Text taken from Athfield Architects by Julia Gatley 2012 AUP.
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all funds raised from the Futuna Lecture Series go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust. 
BOOKINGS ARE ESSENTIAL TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
There will be 15 Design CPD points available for NZ registered architects attending the event. Please include your NZRAB registration number when registering for Architect tickets

description:
Tartan Up The Green, Tartan Up The Green
Gather up the clan and join us here at Brewtown Upper Hutt – Tartan Up The Green is back for 2025!

Are you ready to be blown away by the power of the Pipes and Drums as Tartan Up The Green returns this October 4th for another rousing rendition of Bagpiping, Highland Drumming and Dancing!

Our mates from RNZPBA Wellington Hawkes Bay are back to curate their all-new take on traditional pipe and drum comps with some of the finest musicians in the country.

Join us on The Greenspace for our very own family friendly, FREE to attend salute to those earth-shaking instruments of war (literally) and all things Highlands and Islands!

It won’t just be Pipers and Drummers competing for glory. Brewtown is delighted to welcome some bonnie boogying in the form of Scottish Highland Dancing, as dancers from up and down the country wow the crowd with traditional dance.

A true showcase of strength and stamina, Highland Dancing is highly technical and recognised as a sport by the Sport Council of Scotland…waltzing this aint!

So, get behind these incredible young athletes and show your support at this years Tartan Up The Green!

description:
Taste Kāpiti, Taste Kāpiti
Celebrate your year with Taste!
A boutique beverage mini fest created to celebrate the unique flavours and producers of Aotearoa’s regions.

With successful events in Whanganui, Kāpiti, and now Tauranga, each Taste Festival is thoughtfully curated to bring together local producers, food trucks and live music in a beautiful outdoor setting.
Founded and run by event professionals with a passion for local culture and connection, Taste K`apiti is a high-quality food and drink experience in a vibrant and relaxed setting that doubles as a perfect end-of-year celebration for friends & families, teams & businesses.
Want to elevate your Taste experience? Check out our VIP/Corporate tickets/tables.
Includes:
A festive lunch, two signature cocktails, and access to our exclusive VIP area – complete with premium seating, shade, and great vibes.
Join us on the beautiful waterfront to eat well, drink local, and celebrate the best of the season!

Te Awahou Minifest 2025, Te Awahou Minifest 2025
Making A Statement Entertainment Presents:
Te Awahou Minifest 2025

Hosted by Dilz, the Te Awahou Minifest promises to deliver a day that will be remembered. This is an all ages event for locals and travelers, aimed to bring our people together through the connectivity of music and community.

Foxton Main Street outside Foxton Barber & Beauty
Sunday November 30th 2025
9:00am - 1:00pm

Free Food
Free Haircuts for Kids
Live DJ & Entertainment
Games & Activities
Prizes & Giveaways
Food Carts
Coffee
Ice Cream
Health Services
AND MORE!

Stay tuned to our Facebook event page for the announcements of our SPECIAL GUESTS, PERFORMERS AND GIVEAWAYS

The Making A Statement Podcast will be hosting a live and direct korero session welcoming involvement from our audience. This will be your opportunity to ask our hosts any questions you may have. For us this presents an opportunity to break the stigma around 'talking to strangers', showing the power of connectivity and communication.


A music video and the moments of the day will be captured by Beyond the Frame, filming the highlights and monumentalising the energy created at the latest addition to the annual events hosted here in the heart of Foxton.


Making A Statement Apparel will be sold at the event. To ensure your size/style is available you are welcome to preorder in advance and collect on the day!

We are still reaching out to our wider community for any support or participation enquiries. If you would like involvement in the event, please DM me or email .
Let's do something special Foxton - It takes a collective to make a statement.

description:
Te Papa Foundation Gala, Te Papa Foundation Gala
Wellington’s premier fundraising event, the Te Papa Foundation Gala brings together Aotearoa New Zealand’s leading supporters of arts and culture for one spectacular night in the museum.

🖼️ Enjoy handcrafted cocktails, discover new favourites in the Toi Art galleries, savour an exquisite three-course dinner paired with premium local wines, bid in our live charity auction, and then dance to live performances from acclaimed local musicians.

👋🏼Thanks to Webb’s, the Gala features a special live auction of once-in-a-lifetime experiences, including Sake & sushi with Dick Frizzell, a stunning carving by Tim Steel (Ngāi Tahu), and luxury escapes.

🎟️Tickets cost $3,000 for a table of ten, or $300 per person.

🌱All proceeds from the Gala supports Te Papa’s work across art, culture, history, science, and nature, ensuring that our much-loved national museum continues to thrive for generations to come.

💸Can’t make it? Our digital auction will be hosted by Webb’s from 28 August until 10 September. More information at tepapa.nz/gala.

description:
Te Wiki Whakanui, Celebration Week, We’re celebrating an amazing 11 years at 4 Queens Wharf before our big move to Te Matapihi ki te Ao Nui, Central Library.
Join us in our play space for special activities each day during our last week (Monday 8 December - Friday 12 December):
The Great Kiwi Scavenger Hunt | Every day
Collect an activity sheet from the front desk and begin your adventure through the forest. Hand in your completed sheet for a reward.
Memories box | Every day
At the craft table, draw or write your special memories of our play space that you’d like to share with our PlayHQ whānau.
Parachute | Every day
Our parachute will be out in PlayHQ all day every day for rainbow fun, let one of our kaitiaki know if you want to play.
Tamariki yoga | Monday 8 December
Join Aria for tamariki yoga, stretching and movement at 11.00am-11.30am
Storytime | Tuesday 9 December
Gather around for storytime at 11.00am-11.30am, where we'll read some favourite stories together.
Waiata Māori and poi | Wednesday 10 December
Bring your singing voice to PlayHQ for waiata Māori at 11.00am-11.30am. Pick up a poi and try out simple movements as we all sing along.
Crafts | Thursday 11 December
Join us at the craft table 11.00am-11.30am and make a PlayHQ souvenir to take home.
Hākari, kōrero and photos | Friday 12 December
For our last ever day at Queens Wharf, bring in your favourite soft toy for a PlayHQ friends hākari. Bring your own lunch and help yourself to free fresh fruit (please remember PlayHQ is a nut free zone – please do not bring in items with peanuts or tree nuts).
Free photos! Our photobooth will be free all day on Friday so you can take a last photo at Ngā Tūrua Kiwi.
As a last day treat, we’ll have goodie bags for the first 50 tamariki to visit on our final day (Friday).

It’s time to shake off the winter blues and celebrate kōanga/spring at Wellington Gardens!

description:
The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026, The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026
Details to follow closer to time, but already got a few new ideas for the 2026 edition.

***

Description from Inaugural 2025 Edition FYI:

I would like to acknowledge the support of The Island Bay Festival, which will be celebrating its 40th year of bringing the community together this year, and thank them for giving me a space in The Park this Sunday at The Day in The Bay to showcase and celebrate The Italians of Island Bay, their history and their contributiion to the community, business and culture.

#supportlocal
#celebratelocal
#celebratecommunity
#islandbayfestival

The majority of Island Bay Italians are Neapolitan from the hill top town of Massa Lubrense and surrounds on the Sorrentine Peninsula, followed by Sicilians from the small volcanic island of Stromboli in the Aeolean sea.

When you think of The Italians of Island Bay you might think of their involvement and contribution to the Fishing and Food (and related) Industries, but it goes much wider than that..

In alphabetic order as to not to offend. NB: list a work in progress.

- academics
- accountants
- artists
- authors
- builders
- cinema
- electricians
- exporters
- film makers
- financial advisors
- fishermen
- footballers
- hairdressers
- hoteliers
- importers
- journalists
- lawyers
- lecturers
- lawn bowlers
- management consultants
- martial arts instructors
- mozzarella makers
- musicians
- olympic medalist
- opera singers
- photographers
- plumbers
- poets
- property developers
- public servants
- publishers
- quantity surveyors
- realaters
- restauranteurs
- scholars
- seamstresses
- secretaries
- retailers
- tailors
- teachers
- tomatoe growers
- volunteers
- wine makers
- wholesalers

Books that will on display:

- Alle Fine del Mondo by Paul Elenio
- Le Famiglie Strombolani by
- Food & Family by
- Family Business by Vincent Moleta
- Angelina by Gerard Hindmarsh
- Unsheltered by Clare Moleta
- Umberto Saba : poetry & prose selected & translated, with notes by Vincent Moleta

Just a few days to go till the big Day in the Bay on Sunday. I'm unexpectedly in Perth for family reasons, so have had to piece this together organically long distance, with the help and contribution of my mum's childhood girlfriends from The Bay, for which I'm extremely greatfull.

My Back-Story:

On my mother's side I'm double 4th generation Strombolana-Kiwi and 2nd generation Dutch-Kiwi on my father's side (RIP).. thus my long and unusual name..

Rosina Maria Giuseppina van der Aa.

All 4 of my biz-nonni (great grandparents) bravely sailed to the ends of the earth (alle fine del mondo) in search of a better future.

My maternal great grandfather (Bartolo Barnao) and his elder brother(Giuseppe) initially fished and slept under their fishing boat in Makara, before returning with their Strombolane wives who were also siblings (Giuseppina and Maria Concetta Pirera) to set up shop literally (a fish shop) in Palmerston North before then moving to No 64 The Parade Island Bay when my Nonna Rosina was 17 circa 1934.

My paternal great grandparents (Angelina Criscillo and Vincenzo Moleta) along with Vincenzo's brother (Antonino) and Angelina's cousin (Rosa) settled and tamed D'urville. My Nonno (Leslie George Moleta) spotted my Nonna (Rosina Elvira Barnao) at the Zino-Toscano wedding where she was a bridesmaid. They had two children, both named after their grandparents as was the tradition. My uncle Vincent Bartolo and my mother Maria Josephine The rest as they say is Family Business..

description:
The New Zealand Stationery Festival, Join us in beautiful Greytown for the first New Zealand Stationery Festival, a boutique celebration of the love of pen and paper!

Opening in our historic Town Hall, this is your chance to explore an inspiring collection of premium international stationery brands, along with handpicked local makers, all under one roof. Featured brands include ArtGecko, A. T. Cross, Esterbrook, Ferris Wheel Press, Lamy, Letts of London, MD Paper, Milan, Moleskine, The Superior Labor, Traveler’s Company, and many more.

From 10 am to 2 pm: Exclusive access for ticket holders to the show, with first-in-line chance to purchase products and take advantage of show special offers. Plus ticket holders also receive a collectable NZ Stationery Festival AS Colour tote bag; this one is going to be very sought-after!

From 11 am to 2 pm: Access for door sales, as capacity allows.

Between 2pm and 4pm: Festival opens for free public access (no entry fee, no totes).

Throughout the day, join creative workshops designed to spark ideas, improve your skills and deepen your love of stationery and creative journaling. See below for a summary of our creative workshops.

The New Zealand Stationery Festival will be intentionally intimate to fit within our wee town; a small but perfectly formed gathering focused on beautiful paper goods, pens, inks, journaling and creative tools, and the wonderful people who enjoy them.

Just an hour from Wellington, Greytown’s charm makes it the perfect setting for a day with your fellow ink lovers, journalers and stationery enthusiasts. Join us for New Zealand’s inaugural biggest little stationery festival!

The New Zealand Stationery Festival 2026
Saturday 10 January 2026, 10 am - 4 pm
Greytown Town Hall, 89 Main Street, Greytown
Creative Workshops:
11am - 11:30am: What the Washi? Introduction to the Creative Uses for Washi Tape
11:45am - 12:45pm The Write Way: A Smooth Introduction to Fountain Pens
1pm - 2pm How to Build a Daily Journaling Habit
2pm - 3pm Plan Your Page - Journaling Creatively
3pm - 4pm Writing to Reveal
Buy workshop tickets here: https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/tours-festivals/2025/new-zealand-stationery-festival
Please note: Event tickets do not give you access to Stationery Festival. Please buy a seperate Stationery Festival ticket, or you can enter for free between 2pm - 4pm (as long as capacity allows).

description:
The Runholder Presents A Boutique Festival of Wine, Gin, Food & Music, The Runholder Presents A Boutique Festival of Wine, Gin, Food & Music
Join us under a canopy of trees for an unforgettable afternoon that blends flavour, sound & celebration. Set against the stunning backdrop of Martinborough’s rolling hills and vines, this curated gathering brings together our favourite makers, movers, and shakers - ready to pour, plate, and play their hearts out.

Sip iconic artisan wines, swirl small-batch gin and savour signature gourmet bites by culinary legends.

On stage we welcome the soulful stylings and powerhouse vocals of Hollie Smith, the retro glam and infectious energy of The Beat Girls, and the genre-spinning magic of Sweet Mix Kids, interspersed with sets from DJ Takas. The only thing smoother than the wine is the soundtrack.

Our Saturday session promises an elevated, intimate atmosphere - where the wine flows, the beats drop, and the good vibes carry you through an afternoon of dancing, right into sunset.

With invited friends: Martinborough Vineyard, Te Kairanga, Escarpment, Ata Rangi, Schubert, Palliser Estate, Halite Wines, Lighthouse Gin, Mt Difficulty, Vavasour, Martinborough Brewery, Antipodes Water, The Crab Shack, Wharekauhau Estate, Shed 5, SOUL Bar & Bistro and Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon.

Elevate your festival experience with VIP hosting at The Runholder Cottage. Indulge in premium and library wines poured by the winemakers themselves, impeccably paired with gourmet food offerings from Auckland Viaduct’s iconic SOUL Bar & Bistro. As a VIP guest, you’ll enjoy all-inclusive food and beverage with menu service for any onsite vendor, exclusive access to the dedicated VIP area with priority stage sightlines and premium hosting amenities for your comfort and convenience.

Take advantage of easy transportation options with return bus add-ons from Wellington, Masterton, Carterton, Greytown & Featherston ($30-$60), and free shuttles to and from Martinborough Square, so you can sip responsibly.

On stage we welcome the soulful stylings and powerhouse vocals of Hollie Smith, the retro glam and infectious energy of The Beat Girls, and the genre-spinning magic of Sweet Mix Kids, interspersed with sets from DJ Takas. The only thing smoother than the wine is the soundtrack.

Our Saturday session promises an elevated, intimate atmosphere - where the wine flows, the beats drop, and the good vibes carry you through an afternoon of dancing, right into sunset.

With invited friends: Martinborough Vineyard, Te Kairanga, Escarpment, Ata Rangi, Schubert, Palliser Estate, Halite Wines, Lighthouse Gin, Mt Difficulty, Vavasour, Martinborough Brewery, Antipodes Water, The Crab Shack, Wharekauhau Estate, Shed 5, SOUL Bar & Bistro & Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon.

Elevate your festival experience with VIP hosting at The Runholder Cottage. Indulge in premium and library wines poured by the winemakers themselves, impeccably paired with gourmet food offerings from Auckland Viaduct’s iconic SOUL Bar & Bistro. As a VIP guest, you’ll enjoy all-inclusive food and beverage with menu service for any onsite vendor, exclusive access to the dedicated VIP area with priority stage sightlines, and premium hosting amenities for your comfort and convenience.

Take advantage of easy transportation options with return bus add-ons from Wellington, Masterton, Carterton, Greytown & Featherston, and free shuttles to and from Martinborough Square, so you can sip responsibly.

description:
Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show, Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show
Featuring Tributes to: Pantera, Ozzy Osbourne, Megadeth, Faith No More and more bands TBA.

About this Event



Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: A Memorial for Metal Legends

Rail Records, Wildkiwi Distillery, Women's Refuge, and Riockstock present a monumental night of heavy metal in honor of two of the genre's most important and beloved figures: the legendary guitarist "Dimebag" Darrell Abbott of Pantera, and the recently departed Godfather of Metal, Ozzy Osbourne.
Join us on Saturday, December 6th, 2025, at Wildkiwi in Upper Hutt for a memorial show that will shake the foundations. This date holds a special importance to us metal heads, falling just three days after what would have been Ozzy's 77th birthday (December 3rd) and just two days before the anniversary of Dimebag's tragic passing (December 8th, 2004), giving us all a chance to raise a glass and celebrate both legends in the loudest way possible.
This is a night to pay tribute to the artists who defined a generation of heavy music. From Dimebag's revolutionary groove and unmistakable harmonic squeals to Ozzy's haunting vocals and iconic stage presence, their impact is eternal. We invite the metal community to come together for an unforgettable evening of remembrance, unity, and blistering riffs.


The Lineup
Prepare for a full-throttle sonic assault from four of New Zealand's premier tribute acts, performing the anthems that have become the soundtrack to our lives:
•Hell's Wrath delivering the ferocious power of Pantera
•Zombie Stomp (ft. Danny Rascal) channeling the madness of Ozzy Osbourne
•Angel Dust performing the eclectic genius of Faith No More
•Demon Foetal Harvest unleashing the thrash mastery of Megadeth
(More acts to be announced!)


Event Details
•Date: Saturday, December 6, 2025
•Venue: Wildkiwi, Unit 13/27 Blenheim Street, Maidstone, Upper Hutt
•Time: Doors open at 6:00 PM
•Age Restriction: This is a strictly R18 event. ID will be required.
•Charity: We will be accepting donations at the event and at point of sale on behalf of Women's Refuge. Your support is greatly appreciated.


Ticket Information
Secure your spot to witness this massive tribute event. Tickets are on sale now!
•$20 Early Bird (+GST/BF) - Limited quantity available! Grab them before they're gone.
•$30 General Admission (+GST/BF)
•$40 Door Sales/Lates (If not sold out prior)


VIP Table Experience - Only 6 Available!
For the ultimate night out, gather your crew and secure a VIP table.
Price: $240 per table (includes 6 tickets - works out to $40 per person)
Perks:
•Guaranteed reserved seating for your group of 6.
•Early venue access from 4:00 PM to settle in and have a meal.
•10% discount on delicious bar food from the Wildkiwi kitchen.
•First dibs on the merch table.
•Check out soundcheck and meet the bands (where possible).


Limited Edition Merchandise
•Exclusive Event T-Shirt: $30
•Commemorate this special night with a limited edition T-shirt. There are only 20 of these shirts being made, so this is a true collector's item. Available as a ticket add-on. Don't miss out!
This show is a tribute, a memorial, and a celebration. Get your tickets now and be part of a historic night for New Zealand's metal scene.
Full ticketing TnCs: https://www.railrecords.net/ticketing-tncs

description:
Ultra New Zealand, It’s entertained fans across six continents. Now, for the first time, Ultra Music Festival is coming to New Zealand. Arguably one of the most recognisable brands in electronic dance music, Ultra is coming to Wellington for an exclusive stop-off. Known for delivering an epic combination of electronic music talent and impressive stage productions, the festival will take place along the capital’s picturesque waterfront on Friday, 10 April 2026. 
The one-day festival will span three world-class stages, with a fourth dedicated to local drum and bass artists. Along with Wellington’s calm autumn weather, Ultra is expected to attract up to 20,000 people from across the country, as well as Australia and beyond. Previous headline performers at Ultra events include David Guetta, Calvin Harris, Skrillex, Tiësto, Armin van Buuren, Martin Garrix, Deadmau5, and Charlotte de Witte. 
The 2026 lineup will be announced on 10 December, with tickets being available on 17 December.

description:
Valentine's Night at Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo, Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo is the place to be this Valentine’s Day! Get your date, your mate, your pals or your gals ready for a wild night out.

We’re staying open until 8.30pm for an adults-only night of cheeky fun – live music, an outdoor bar, delicious food, and love-themed animal talks that spill all the secrets of the animal kingdom.

Grab your favourite human(s), and treat yourselves to a wild, romantic night out!

Adults only. R18. Wild vibes only.

Buy tickets now >>> https://www.wellingtonzoo.com/visit/plan-your-day/things-to-do/valentines-night-2

*Event information*

- Adults only: Strictly R18
- Date: Saturday 14 February
- Time: 5pm–8.30pm (last entry 7.45pm)
- Location: Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington
- Note: The Zoo is not BYO licensed. ID and bag checks on arrival

*Prices*

- $24 online entry (save by booking ahead!)
- $26 standard entry on the night
- $109 package for two: 2x Zoo Entry + pre-booked picnic basket with food (no alcohol)
- For Zoo Crew members: $69 for just the pre-booked picnic basket (entry is included as part of your Zoo Crew membership)

*Add-ons*

- $10 for Wild Explorer ($8 for Zoo Crew)
- $29 per person for Giraffe Feed
- $79 per couple for Creatures of Attraction Tour
- Close Encounters – details coming soon!

*Music & Entertainment*

Enjoy the evening with live music from one of Wellington’s most colourful and fun bands Crash Bandihoot!
- Two 45-minute sets of New Orleans-style brass tunes
- Times: 6pm & 7pm
- Location: He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals

Plus, Wild Explorer VR will be open throughout the evening! Choose from The Great Migration, Dolphins of the Reef, or everyone’s favourite: Dinosaur Evolution! Tickets are $10 ($8 for Zoo Crew) and can be purchased on the night. There are limited slots, so make sure you get in quick!

Love-themed animal talks will be scheduled throughout the evening too!

*Food & Drinks*

Pre-book to enjoy a delicious picnic basket for two from REX Tremendous Events Catering.
- The picnic basket includes cold sliced meats, and sausage rolls for carnivores OR roast vegetables for herbivores; roasted nuts, cheeses, homemade corn chips with a selection of dips and salsa, home-made focaccia, pasta salad and a duo of sweet tartlets
- Dietary options available (no swap-outs): Gluten Free or Vegetarian
- Picnic basket bookings close Wednesday 11th February at 5pm
- Pick up your basket at the Zoo Entrance between 5pm-7pm
- Return your basket to the Zoo Entrance or to He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals Barn, baskets are not to be taken off the Zoo premises

Treat yourselves to tasty food and drinks all evening long – pay as you go! On the night we will have:
- BBQ and hot food available at He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals Barn (vegan options included)
- Outdoor bar open at He Tuku Aroha Meet the Locals Barn (cash & EFTPOS)
- Banana Bar open for cold drinks, hot chips & ice creams
- Note: The Zoo is not BYO licensed. ID and bag checks on arrival

description:
Wairarapa Wines Harvest Festival, presented by James Henry Ltd, James Henry Ltd presents Wairarapa Wines Harvest Festival, a celebration of wine, food, and entertainment. This event brings together Wairarapa's finest wineries, high-profile eateries, and food producers for a day of indulgence set amidst the stunning backdrop of ancient native trees and a picturesque riverside setting.

Indulge your taste buds as you sample the region's finest wines, savour delicious culinary creations, and discover the incredible flavours of Wairarapa. From award-winning wineries to renowned eateries, the festival showcases the very best the region has to offer.

Conveniently located just 10 minutes from both Masterton and Carterton, the festival site is easily accessible to both locals and visitors to the district. For those who prefer to drive, free parking will be available. However, we encourage you to make life easier by taking advantage of our regional shuttle service. The shuttle will run to and from the festival site at the beginning and end of the day, ensuring a hassle-free experience for all.

Don't miss out on this extraordinary event that combines the rich flavours of Wairarapa wines, delicious kai, and a vibrant atmosphere filled with live entertainment. Join us at Wairarapa Wines Harvest Festival presented by James Henry Ltd and immerse yourself in a day of pure indulgence and enjoyment.

Celebrate the opening of Walter Mildenhall Park with a day of community fun and entertainment. This event marks the final stage of Whakatupu Ngāengae – our programme designed to revitalise Naenae’s town centre.

description:
Warehouse Rave ft. Coki (UK), Warehouse Rave ft. Coki (UK)
SYLC & Ghost Media Presents: WAREHOUSE RAVE FT. COKI
Friday 5th September
Secret Central Wellington Location (TO BE REVEALED ON EVENT DAY)
Powered by Banshee Soundsystem
8pm-2am
R18
Strictly limited capacity

Get ready Welly, because this one is about to be serious. We have secured the one and only COKI for an intimate warehouse rave at an inner city location.

This legend of bass needs no introduction, but we’ll give him one anyway. As one half of DIGITAL MYSTIKZ, Coki has made sine waves move like no other, architecting much of the sonic blueprint that modern dubstep has become known for. Alongside Mala, he helped forge the DMZ sound and is now making his way to Wellington for a rare showcase of pure low-frequency warfare. Expect heavyweight pressure, bone-rattling subs, and that unmistakable Coki wobble - this is dubstep in its rawest form.

On support we have drawn for the best of the best. Opening up proceedings we have BABETECH, champion selector and vibe master. Since murking opening slots for Loefah, Filth and Kahn & Neek as well as spreading the gospel of bass for countless evenings on RadioActive, we can’t think of a better opener for this night.

Following that, we have dubstep extraordinaire DUSTY warming things up with his signature and gruelling take on the classic dubstep sound. With releases on Infernal Sounds and Leather Kennel, Dusty has proven himself to be a force to be reckoned with, and is surely one of the most exciting young producers in the game today.

On closing duties we have the Support Your Local crew going b2b with Young Gho$t to round out the night with a bit of silliness.

We’ve managed to secure an all-new inner city warehouse location for this one, and its Further Sound on soundsystem duties this time, heating things up with their BANSHEE SOUNDSYSTEM, preparing for only its second full rollout after Cuba Dupa this year.

We’re unbelievably excited to share this space with you all for a dance and are expecting this to be one for the books.Secure your tickets now and don’t miss out on this momentous and legendary dance music event!

Tickets: https://events.humanitix.com/coki-uk-warehouse-rave

Wellington Folk Festival - 60th Anniversary Edition, Enjoy a holiday weekend of music, dance, craft and folky fun at the beautiful Brooklields Outdoor Education Centre in Moore’s valley, Waimuiomata.

The site opens at noon on Friday and the action runs until late late late on Sunday evening. There will be:
Concerts by our headline guests on the Main stage;
Artist workshops,
Ceili and dance sessions,
Craft stalls on the Village Green, and
A youth programme; plus
opportunities to participate in open mics, invitation concerts, jams, sing arounds and the Festival Choir.

Our headline guest performers will be:
We Mavericks
Adam and Marika
Fiona Ross
Klezmer Rebs
Rhys Crimmin
Two if by Sea
The Trenwiths
For information about them see - https://wellingtonfolkfestival.org.nz/2025-festival-guests/

You can go “full immersion” by camping or sharing a bunkhouse for the whole weekend or treat it as a day or evening (or both) family outing. description:
Wellington Folk Festival 2025 - our 60th!, Welcome to Wellyfest!
The Wellington Folk Festival is held every Labour Weekend, celebrated on the fourth weekend of October, at Brookfield Outdoor Education Centre – a beautiful site owned by the Scouts at 562 Moores Valley Road, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt, New Zealand.
The Festival gate is open from 3pm on the Friday, with events running over Friday evening, all day Saturday through to Sunday evening. You can come for the weekend, for a day, half day or an evening. Children (0 - 12) can attend free.
Weekend passes entitle the holders to camp onsite and there are a limited number of bunks available for sale as well.
PLEASE NOTE - ALL EARLYBIRD PRICING CLOSES AT 11.55PM ON SUNDAY 28TH SEPTEMBER. Full-price tickets can be purchased on-line until Sunday 19th October.
After ticket sales close on Humanitix, you can purchase at the gate, from 3pm on Friday 25th of October.  Weekend tickets, day tickets and evening tickets are all available at the gate. To read our latest news click here, click the Latest News tab in the menu above, or check out our facebook page here www.facebook.com/Wellyfest/.

description:
Wellington Heritage Festival - Building by the Water, Take a closer look at the history of Porirua’s harbourside, from early Māori settlements to cutting edge contemporary engineering developments.

As part of the 2025 Wellington Heritage Festival, Kai Tahi presents a visual exhibition in celebration of Porirua’s unique harbourside heritage.

Building by the Water brings together archival images courtesy of the Alexander Turnbull Library Collection and recent photographic works by Jason Mann. Seen collectively, this visual record aims to place the Kai Tahi development into the wider history of construction along Te Awarua-o-Porirua Harbour.

The exhibition traces a history of harbourside settlement from Māori pa sites, to whaling stations, early settler communities, harbour reclamation, big box retail and now, in 2025, the next community-focused iteration of harbourside settlement, as exemplified by Kai Tahi and the reuse of existing industrial forms.

Kai Tahi has a simple but powerful mission: to transform the traditional idea of a food-court into a cultural and creative harbourside hub for the Porirua Community.

Historic images on display include aerial photographs from Whites Aviation, 19th century engravings and 20th century paintings.

description:
Wellington Heritage Festival in the Wairarapa 2025, Experience the People, Places, & Stories of Te Upoko-o-Te-Ika-a-Māui, the Greater Wellington Region, and discover over a dozen events in the Wairarapa alone.

Wellington Heritage Festival 2025 will run from Saturday the 18th October until Sunday 9th November, spanning from the Kāpiti Coast to the Wairarapa.

On the 8th and 9th of November, the focus will be on the Wairarapa, with a variety of events taking place all across the valley. Come to discover local history, visit historic marae, or delve into some of the delicious food that this magical area has to offer.

Visit our website to discover over 140 culture and heritage themed events across the wider region, from walking tours to wagon wheel making courses. There's something for everyone!

Some events require booking. Please visit our website to learn more about booked events. www.wellingtonheritagefestival.nz/events

Organised by the Wellington Heritage Festival Trust and the Rotary Clubs of Greater Wellington. Sponsored by the Wellington City Council, Hutt City Council, Trust House Foundation, Historic Places Wellington, Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, and Hiamo Ltd.

description:
Wellington Home & Garden Show 2025, The entry ticket is non-refundable, but it is transferable so you if you can't attend for whatever reason, you can give the ticket to a friend.It’s all about ideas at the Wellington Home & Garden Show 2025. A wonderful range of exhibitors, 'Ask an Expert' sessions, latest trends, innovations and exclusive show specials it’s the place to be for inspiration for indoors and out.
For more information visit homeandgardenshow.co.nz or 'Like us' on Facebook.
We are working very hard to keep our events safe and we ask that you please stay home if you are unwell.
Show opening hours: Friday & Saturday 10-5pm, Sunday 10-4pm
FAQs
1. What are my transport/parking options for getting to and from the event?
Parking is available at the venue, at a cost of $10. Please note parking is card payment only (entry to the Show is card or cash).
2. What is the best time to attend?
Peak visitor times are normally between 11am - 2pm so the crowds are less outside of these times.
3. What days is the ticket valid for?
General Admission entry tickets is for one entry only and is valid for any one of the 3 event days.
Gold Card Special 1/2 price tickets valid for Friday only.
4. Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
A printed ticket or showing the barcode on your phone to the entry staff is required.

description:
Wellington Jazz Festival, Soul, funk, jazz, fusion, rhythm and blues — it’s a celebration of sound across the city this spring. The annual Wellington Jazz Festival is back. The event packs over 100 gigs into five days in venues around the city. 
The festival features two major international acts making exclusive New Zealand debuts. Wellington will see two-time Grammy Award-winning jazz vocalist and bandleader, Gregory Porter and five-time Grammy Award-winning jazz singer, Samara Joy. Gregory Porter’s unique and timeless sound blends jazz, soul, and gospel. His influences include Bakersfield Southern Gospel and jazz legend Nat King Cole. At just 25 years old, Samara Joy has become a breakout jazz sensation. She’s redefining 21st-century jazz with a rich, mature tone and refined phrasing. 
The treats in the programme continue with Australian First Nations soul singer Bumpy, and a commissioned work by New Zealand/Congolese drummer, composer, and rhythm master  Myele Manzanza. He’ll be performing with international supergroup, lvdf. The Rodger Fox Big Band returns with a tribute to Ray Charles, and the Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra has its inaugural performance with a Duke Ellington arrangement of Tchaikovsky’s The Nutcracker Suite. Many of the hospitality venues in Courtenay Place and its surrounding streets are planning intimate jazz gigs across the festival. Follow the sound of saxophones to find a spot to park up for the night.
label: Festivals

Wellington MTB Festival, Join us the for the weekend at Wellington’s first MTB Festival from Feb 27th - March 1st 2026.

A free event celebrating our city’s trails and community with three action-packed days of rides, events, and fun for all riders and non-riders!

Day 1: Makara peak, 27th Feb, 2026, 3pm - 9pm
Location: Festival Hub outside Mud Cycles, 424 Karori Road, Karori

what's on offer
- Free Shuttles looping from 3:00-7:00pm
- Bike shop and product showcase, including demo bikes
- On Top of the World - run by WORD this is a fun kids ride to the top of Makara Peak with snacks and party vibes at the top
- Food trucks, craft beer and beverages
- DJ playing laid back festival vibes

For who?
- All abilities and ages – No matter your riding level there’s an activity for you
- Riders and non-riders – don’t ride, no problem. Music, food and off the bike activities are plenty
