description:
Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me, "Faster and faster. And for a long time you wouldn't feel anything. And then you'd burst into fire" - Laura Palmer
TWIN PEAKS: FIRE WALK WITH ME.
DAVID LYNCH | USA & FRANCE | 1992 | 135mins | R18+| 4K DCP PROVIDED BY JANUS FILMS DISTRIBUTION
Join us for this very special community fundraiser screening of the prequel to the critically acclaimed series, "Twin Peaks".
ABC cancelled the original series after season 2 but a month later, Lynch announced he was "not yet finished with the material" and principal photography for the full length prequel film, began on September 5th 1991 at a caravan site in Snoqualmie Washington. Which became the "Fat Trout Trailer Park" where the story of the last 7 days of Laura Palmer begins.
Since its showing at the 1992 Festival De Cannes, no other Lynch film had polarized audiences to such an extent. Fans that wanted more "Cherry Pie" and "Donuts" from the TV show were served a much darker, unflinching and unforgiving work - in Lynch's own words, a movie about "the loneliness, shame, guilt, confusion and devastation of the victim". Derided by critics and many fans at the time it was a commercial box office flop.
Yet in the years since the initial reaction, a gradual wave of reappraisal and appreciation began. With time it's brilliance came into focus with growing acknowledgment, that the film is a more accurate, complex and powerful account of trauma. Combining the dramatic ferocity of Sherly Lee's tour de force and the beauty of Angelo Badalamenti's score, Lynch reclaimed full ownership of the material creating a harrowing, compassionate and enigmatic hymn to Laura Palmer.
As we approach the films 34 year anniversary and since Lynch's passing in 2025, it is now regarded by critics and fans worldwide, as a revered epilogue, essential predecessor to "The Return", and Lynch's most chilling, terrifying, and yet empathetic and humane cinematic masterpiece.
WHERE: The Roxy Cinema. 5 Park Road. Miramar. Wellington.
Cinema 1 - The big cinema upstairs with the massive screen, red italian leather sofas, and of course those red curtains!
WHEN: Wed 25th Feb 2026. Seating is unreserved so arrive early to check-in at the table upstairs, enter the raffle and get seated.
8:15pm - Doors close and the film starts. (no trailers)

COST: Tickets are $20 per person. (plus booking fee). This is a not for profit community screening put on for the pure love of Twin Peaks and the fans. All proceeds go to help pay for the cinema hire and licensing the film with any extras donated to charity. So spread the word and come celebrate "Twin Peaks Day 2026"!
TWIN PEAKS RAFFLE: Check-in at the desk upstairs and get a complimentary raffle ticket, to enter into the draw for 1 of these companion books.
The Secret Diary of Laura Palmer - By Jennifer Lynch with foreword by Mark Frost & David Lynch (paperback, 2012 edition)
Fire Walk With Me: Your Laura Disappeared - By Scott Ryan with foreword by Jeff Jensen (paperback, 2022 edition)
Laura's Ghost: Women Speak about Twin Peaks - By Courtney Stallings with foreword by Sheryl Lee (paperback, 2020 edition)
Cutoff to enter is 8:10pm and prizes drawn just before the start of the film.
RULES:
1. Tickets are per person. There will be NO door sales at the Roxy, so DO purchase it beforehand please. 
2. The film is classified R18+. All attendees MUST be 18yo + and have ID
4. The Roxy have strict no BYO food/drinks. Only Food/drinks purchased at the Roxy can be taken into the screening.
3. This is a safe, friendly, INCLUSIVE place. There is ZERO tolerance for discrimination, disrespect or creepy gross behavior of any kind. By attending you agree to the Code of Conduct.
4. Arrive early to enter the raffle before the cutoff if you want to be in it to win it. Good Luck!
Thank you and Happy Twin Peaks Day!
Join us for more Twin Peaks community screenings at:
www.facebook.com/fishinthepercolator
www.instagram.com/fishinthe.percolator
label: Film & Media

description:
WPF presents: The Hunger (1983), WPF presents: The Hunger (1983)
Three of the most beautiful actors to ever live - Catherine Deneuve, David Bowie and Susan Sarandon- star in this ‘80s cult classic about a vampire couple posing as wealthy classical music teachers.

The Hunger is full camp; queer tension and complexity. And beware: the encounters in this movie do not stick to heterosexual norms.

Underworld Tavern in Mt Victoria is hosting this screening in their suitably dark, macabre and industrial surrounds. Prizes will be awarded to the darkest and most vampiric ensemble. A full bar service will be available throughout.

Continuing our run of film fundraisers, The Hunger allows us queers and our allies to engage with a pillar of queer culture. These screenings are organised and hosted by the community for the community. More than just a screening, this will be a queer horror experience.

The event begins at 3pm but come early to get comfortable. The film will start at 3.30. A short comfort break will be provided. Stay for a drink to discuss and dissect.

The Hunger is rated R18. No one under the age of 18 is permitted. Its running length is 97 minutes.

Tickets are $20 waged, $13 unwaged.

ACCESSIBILITY

- Underworld Tavern is fully wheelchair accessible
- The movie will include closed captions
label: Film & Media

description:
Waifilmfest Presents Never Forgotten: the Marines of Masterton, Never Forgotten: The Marines of Masterton – Special Screening

After sold-out shows in May 2025, we’re bringing back Never Forgotten: The Marines of Masterton for one more special screening in Martinborough!

This feature-length local documentary tells the story of the United States Marine Corps’ 3rd Defense Battalion, who were stationed at Solway Showgrounds in Masterton in 1943 during World War II. Director Mark Pacey explores the Marines’ visit, the deep connections they formed with the local community, and their lasting legacy—including the journey to constructing a memorial in their honour.

Presented by Waifilmfest in partnership with Circus Cinema, Restaurant & Bar and the Wellington Historical Festival 2025, this is a unique opportunity to experience a powerful story of history, community, and remembrance.

Come and be part of this special event — one last chance to see it on the big screen!
label: Film & Media

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presenTs Rochelle (2024) + Bellbird (2019), Film lovers in the Wairarapa have a new home for cinema. The Wairarapa Cinematheque launches in 2025 with a curated programme of classics, contemporary gems, and cult favourites — films you rarely get to see on the big screen.

ROCHELLE (2024) & BELLBIRD (2019) – Double Bill | Wairarapa Cinematheque

Two powerful New Zealand films, one unforgettable evening on the big screen.

ROCHELLE (2024) SHORT FILM
A brazen young man takes it upon himself to send his friend’s busted-up car, Rochelle, out in style by entering it in a local demolition derby. But to get there, he needs help from an unexpected source. A bold and surprising new story of friendship, loyalty, and going out with a bang.

BELLBIRD (2019) FEATURE FILM
Set in the heart of rural New Zealand, Bellbird is a tender, funny, and deeply human story of a father and son finding their way after loss. Warm, beautifully observed, and filled with aroha, it’s a heartfelt portrait of resilience, family, and community.

Tickets are $15 each, available via Humanitix or at the door.
If you purchased a Three Movie Membership on Opening Night (28 September 2025), you’re covered — just show your card at the door.

Join us for an unforgettable evening of extraordinary local storytelling, celebrating the richness of Aotearoa cinema on the big screen.
label: Film & Media

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents Rear Window (1954), Step into the world of Alfred Hitchcock’s timeless classic REAR WINDOW (1954) and help us celebrate the launch of the brand-new Wairarapa Cinematheque 2025 Season.

Cinematheques exist all over the world and are dedicated to presenting films as both cultural heritage and artistic expression. The Wairarapa Cinematheque brings this tradition to our region with monthly screenings on the last Sunday of each month, showcasing classics, contemporary gems, world cinema, and cult favourites.

We begin with REAR WINDOW (1954) starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly, a masterpiece of suspense and one of Hitchcock’s most enduring works. When a photographer confined to his apartment begins to suspect that one of his neighbours has committed a murder, he sets off a chain of events that keeps audiences on the edge of their seats 70 years later.

description:
Wairarapa Cinémathèque 2026 presents SOME LIKE IT HOT (1959), SOME LIKE IT HOT (1959)
Dir. Billy Wilder | USA | 2h | Comedy, Romance, Crime

After witnessing a Mafia hit, two Chicago musicians (Tony Curtis and Jack Lemmon) flee the city disguised as women in an all-female jazz band bound for Florida. Chaos, romance, and mistaken identity follow; including Marilyn Monroe at her most luminous.

Hilarious, subversive, and endlessly quotable, Some Like It Hot is widely regarded as one of the greatest comedies ever made. Billy Wilder’s razor-sharp wit, dazzling performances, and audacious gender play still feel astonishingly fresh more than 65 years on.

This screening opens the 2026 Wairarapa Cinémathèque season.

WAIRARAPA CINÉMATHÈQUE 2026
Celebrating 100 Years of Film

Wairarapa Cinémathèque is a membership-based film programme dedicated to cinema as art, heritage, and shared experience. We believe films are meant to be seen together on the big screen and talked about afterwards.

In 2026, as cinema marks its centenary, our programme brings together restored classics, silent cinema, epic dramas, and contemporary masterpieces that continue to resonate today.

Screenings take place on the first Sunday of each month at 7:30pm
Regent Theatre, Masterton (now Regent 3 Cinemas)

This year’s 11-film programme was chosen by the community, with a touch of curatorial magic to ensure a rich, balanced season. Featured films include: Some Like It Hot, Metropolis, Ran, The Godfather, Dr. Strangelove, All About My Mother, Psycho, La Notte di Cabiria, Put Your Soul on Your Hand and Walk, The Third Man, and The General (100th Anniversary).

The Cinémathèque operates independently under non-commercial screening rights, fostering a welcoming community of local cinephiles.

MEMBERSHIP OPTIONS
Full Membership – $100
• All 10 regular films
• Bonus screening: The General (Buster Keaton, 1926) — 100th Anniversary screening in December
• Discounts on partner events (Wairarapa Film Festival, Film Talks)

Full Student Membership – $85
• All films + bonus screening
• Partner event discounts

Three-Film Sampler – $38
• Choose any three films
• Option to upgrade to Full Membership
• Try us — we think you’ll like us.

Gift Memberships Available

Share the magic of cinema with someone special. Gift memberships can also be allocated to a local secondary school in 2026, giving students the chance to experience great films on the big screen.

Memberships available online and in person
Tickets and memberships can be purchased online via Humanitix or at the door on the night.
label: Film & Media

description:
Wairarapa Word - Lifeswap, Come and hear the makers of NZ's favourite cross-cultural animated comedy series Lifeswap speak and watch all episodes on the big screen.
Created by Wairarapa-based writer William Connor and animator Steffen Kreft.
The Wairarapa debut of all 15 episodes.
Presented by Wairarapa Word.
Tickets $10

Steffen Kreft is an animation film director, illustrator, marionette maker and puppeteer. William Connor is a writer, translator, editor, teacher, and puppeteer. Steffen was born in Germany, and William in Aotearoa. They currently live in Greytown.

William and Steffen will also lead a stop-motion animation workshop on Sunday 7 September, 1-6pm. For ages 12+. Free of charge. Places are limited. Participants will need to download an app on their smartphone and bring along a desk lamp. Supported by Wairarapa Library Service. To register your interest, please email .
label: Film & Media

description:
War on Drugs Film Screening, In remembrance of the victims of human rights violations and extrajudicial killings during the War on Drugs in the Philippines, please join us for a free/koha screening of "On the President's Orders" documentary in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.

NOTE: For a list of trigger warnings, please see this document. Since we will be viewing and discussing potentially sensitive topics, the event will have an Open Door Policy, which means that you may leave the venue any time, for any reason, and will not be judged for doing so.
WHAT IS THE WAR ON DRUGS?
Spearheaded by the former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte, the War on Drugs is a violent anti-drug campaign which killed nearly 30,000 Filipinos, most of which were urban poor (Karapatan, Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch).
WHAT ARE EXTRAJUDICIAL KILLINGS?
"Extrajudicial killings, or extrajudicial executions, happen when someone in an official position deliberately kills a person without any legal process" (World Organisation Against Torture).
WHY IS IT IMPORTANT TO TALK ABOUT TODAY?
Human rights violations and extrajudicial killings are still on-going in the Philippines under President Bongbong Marcos, the son of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos Sr. who proclaimed Martial Law in 1972, and Vice President Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte (Karapatan).
WHY WOULD I WANT TO JOIN THE FILM SCREENING?
The film screening is for anyone who is keen to learn about the War on Drugs, wants to share their experience during the War on Drugs (or something similar) through group discussion, wants to meet new people, wants to watch a Philippine film/documentary, or just wants to have snacks.
I WANT TO JOIN BUT I'M FROM TĀMAKI MAKAURAU / CHRISTCHURCH / THE PHILIPPINES.
We will stream the film through Zoom for viewers outside Te Whanganui-a-Tara, however, there may be internet and other technical difficulties during the event itself. Also please make sure to select the "Online" ticket option when RSVPing.
HOW MUCH IS THE TICKET?
The film screening is free but we appreciate koha for the venue/snacks/donations to Philippine non-governmental organisations (NGOs).
NOTE: This is an LGBTQ+ friendly event.
label: Film & Media

description:
Wellington Chinese Association Screening of Farewell Guangdong, The Wellington Chinese Association is hosting a free screening of all seven episodes of Farewell Guangdong.
Based on Lily Lee's publication Farewell Guangdong, the episodes use dramatic re-enactments, interviews, and historical archive material to bring to life first-hand accounts from the wives and children who fled Guangdong, China, during the second Sino-Japanese War from 1937 to 1945.
 Date: 16 November 2025
Time: screening will start at 4pm, doors will open at 3.15pm. Please be seated by 3.45pm.
Cost: free
Location: Soundings Theatre, Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
 This Wellington Chinese Association event was made possible with support from the Embassy of the People’s Republic of China in New Zealand.
 FAQs
 How long is the show?
All seven episodes will be shown. Each episode is approximately 20-25 minutes long, with total running time approximately 156 minutes. There will be a short intermission approximately halfway.
 Are the seats allocated?
No, all seats are general admission.
 Is there disabled/wheelchair access?
Yes, the venue has wheelchair access and staff will be able to assist. Please note down in the form if you require a wheelchair space in the theatre.
label: Film & Media

description:
Wellington Timebank fundraiser screening of Tinā, Wellington Timebank fundraiser screening of Tinā
Get your tickets here - https://events.humanitix.com/wtb-fundraiser-screening-of-tina

Join us for this special screening of this award winning Aotearoa-made film - Tinā (2024). If you missed it in the cinemas the first time round, you can now watch it from the comfort of the Newtown Community Centre!

Doors open at 5pm
Film starts at 6pm (running time is 2 hours 4 minutes)

Tickets are just $25 waged / $20 unwaged (all tickets include snacks) and proceeds go toward keeping your Timebank in operation.

About the film:
Award-winning writer/director Miki Magasiva (The Panthers, We Are Still Here) makes his feature debut with Tinā (Samoan for "mother"). Samoan music teacher Mareta (Anapela Polataivao) is plunged into grief after losing her daughter in the Christchurch quakes. Mareta takes a relieving role at an elite private school, where she inspires her students to perform at a big choral competition. In the trailer Mareta faces a condescending interview at Saint Francis, and her growing relationship with "spoiled, rich kids" annoys a family member. Tinā was chosen to open the 2024 Hawai’i International Film Festival.

The Guardian says "It’s a big-hearted tear-jerker about the power of art – and it’s already breaking records in its home country, where it’s received the widest-ever release for a local film and become the sixth-highest grossing New Zealand film of all time."

This film is rated M (contains violence, offensive language and suicide references).
label: Film & Media

description:
Wellington: Friendlyjordies Presents - Alien Hunter, WELLINGTON!! COME SEE MY NEW SHOW!
Voted best new show of the 2025 Melbourne Comedy Festival period (about aliens) by The Comic's Lounge.
ALIEN HUNTER
Get ready for a comedy show that’s truly out of this world. Friendlyjordies is diving deep into the UFO phenomenon. Not with the tired "anything unidentified that flies is a UFO" bit, but with actual ALIENS. Yes, he genuinely believes the U.S. government is hiding alien spacecraft, and he’s risking over a decade of hard-earned credibility to convince you. Why? Because if it’s true, it’s the coolest thing ever—and not, at least you’ll have a laugh watching him unravel.
Following the success of his Rome and Byzantine Empire shows, this is his latest hyperfixation, so buckle up for 90 minutes of meticulously researched alien theories delivered with the same obsessive energy he puts into painting every tiny detail on his Warhammer miniatures. Whether you're a sceptic, a believer, or just here for the ride, this show promises to beam you up to comedy gold.
Age: 18+. 
Content warning: swearing, adult themes, mature themes. This show is not for a sensitive audience.
Accessibility: a high portion of this event relies on a PowerPoint presentation.
Companion cards: please email Sandie at friendlyjordiestours@gmail.com
label: Film & Media

description:
Women's Adventure Film Tour 2025 presented by Mountain Designs - Wellington, Presented by Mountain Designs, the Women’s Adventure Film Tour® (WAFT) returns for its 9th year, celebrating extraordinary women and their thrilling adventures. This year’s line-up features an inspiring collection of short films that highlight stories of courage, connection, and pushing beyond personal limits. From mountain peaks to ocean waves, and from the everyday to the extreme, these films showcase women from all walks of life pursuing their definition of adventure.
Each film has been carefully chosen to show women achieving their personally adventurous goals. Adventure doesn’t always mean being the fastest, going the highest, or doing the most extreme things. For most of us, adventure is about stepping outside our comfort zone and climbing our own Everest. The Women’s Adventure Film Tour shines a light on real stories of women from a variety of cultures and sports around the world, creating an empowering and uplifting experience for audiences.
The Women’s Adventure Film Tour® is an official part of Jean Hailes for Women’s Health – Women’s Health Week, proudly presented by Mountain Designs and supported by Nalgene, Sea to Summit, Capital Brewing, PETZL, Osprey and Big White.

description:
🎬 Movie Fundraiser: Kneecap 🎬, This time last year, Kneecap premiered at the Wellington Film Festival - but not enough people got to see it. Some films deserve the big screen experience, so I’m bringing it back!
Come along for a movie night with a twist - supporting a great cause while enjoying this epic film. Set in Belfast, this wild, witty, and politically charged story follows the rise of the real-life rap trio Kneecap, blending music, humour, and rebellion in a way only the Irish can.
Your ticket includes the screening plus a raffle with a twist 😉 - and every dollar goes towards my campaign, helping cover those last few expenses. Imagine the good we can do for our communities when I’m elected!
📅 Date: Monday 8 September
🕖 Time: 5.45pm
Location: Lighthouse Cinema Cuba Street
It’s a perfect chance to laugh and cry - imagine Derry Girls, Trainspotting and Spinal Tap combined - it will change you for the better and help make a difference - so gather your mates and join us for some great craic!

description:
9 September Whisky Tasting, Whisky Tasting: 9 September 2025
Hosted by Matt Mueller
In September, we'll get back on track, away from the International Whiskies of our August tasting, and on to the Eastern Highlands of Scotland: Glendronach.
Named for the valley of the brambles surrounding the distillery, Glendronach was the second distillery to gain a legal whisky license, and is currently under the stewardship of Dr. Rachel Barrie, a legend in the whisky industry. Dr Barrie has recently revamped the Glendronach lineup, and we're going to see how she's doing: we'll try the previous 12 and 15 year--old bottlings against her new releases. She's worked her magic at Ben Riach, and we'll see how she's doing at Glendronach (I suspect quite well!). Additionally, we'll try the highland peated Glendronach, a departure from the familiar smokey peat of Islay. We'll expect a sweeter, softer style, bolstered by some sherry maturation.
Please join me for this wonderful tasting of Glendronachs:
Tuesday, September 9
7:30pm Start time (arrive early to get a beer and a seat)
$60 per person
Seatoun Clubhouse (16 Dundas Street, Seatoun)
See you then,
Matt
Matt & the Clubhouse Team

description:
96 Originals, Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.

description:
A Night on the Orient Express, All aboard as The Botanist turns into The Orient Express. Your tasty train journey will begin in Paris, heading to Istanbul via Germany, Austria, Serbia, Hungary and Bulgaria. The 7-course menu features modern plant-based takes on traditional dishes from each country’s cuisine, such as French crepes with vegan duck a l'orange, coconut-crusted parsnip Austrian schnitzel and Bulgarian kashkaval house-made cultured cashew cheese and spinach pastry; paired with creative cocktails, live music and some iconic Orient Express touches.
 
7-course tasting menu. Matched cocktails (alcoholic or non-alchoholic) can be added to your ticket.

description:
A Taste of Newtown- Kai celebration, Come and join us for our 7th annual Newtown Community Meal, hosted at Newtown School, a celebration of the incredible diversity, creativity, and collaboration that makes our suburb so special.
This is a shared meal that truly reflects Newtown, featuring food that has been grown, sourced, foraged, and prepared right here in our community. Together we’ll enjoy an abundance of amazing kai, including homemade dumplings, locally foraged preserves, and bountiful salads made from locally grown produce.
This event is about celebrating the very best of our suburb, our people, our cultures, and the food that brings us together. Everyone is welcome, so please bring your whānau, friends, and neighbours.
Doors will open at 3pm with music, snacks and time to connect with your neighbours. The main meal will be served at 4.30pm
As always, this is a koha-based event. You’re invited to contribute what you can, but most importantly, we’d love to see you there and share a meal together.
We can’t wait to celebrate Newtown with you.
label: Food & Drink

description:
A hāngi to remember, A hāngi to remember
Enjoy a delicious hāngi by P&S Kai, relax to live music and learn about the 1975 Land March coming to Porirua.

𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝟬𝟰 𝟮𝟯𝟳 𝟭𝟱𝟭𝟭 𝘁𝗼 𝗽𝗮𝘆 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗮 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗱𝗶𝘁 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝗼𝗿 𝘃𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘁 𝗣𝗮̄𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗮 𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗲𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝗽𝗿𝗲-𝗽𝘂𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗵𝗮̄𝗻𝗴𝗶 𝗯𝘆 𝟯 𝗢𝗰𝘁𝗼𝗯𝗲𝗿. Be in quick! (Hāngi will not be available to purchase on the day)

$16 for a hāngi. Two options available:
Original: Chicken drumstick and pork belly, heaps of vegetables and stuffing.

50 years ago, Porirua welcomed thousands of marchers from the 1975 Land March. The marchers along with Dame Whine Cooper were welcomed with steaming delicious hangi and the legendary manaakitanga of Ngāti Toa and the Porirua Community before they delivered their message to Parliament.
To honour this significant time of unity and manaakitanga join us for ‘A hāngi to remember’.
Pick up your hangi, enjoy live music and visit the exhibition Not One More Acre: Remembering the 1975 Land March

https://pataka.org.nz/whats-on/events/a-hangi-to-remember/

description:
Alexia Pizza Nights with Roving Pizza, On occasional Friday evenings Alexia is doing a little pizza pop-up with Roving Pizza!

Roving Pizza make beautiful wood-fired Napoletana style pizzas. Fresh spins on authentic Italian flavours with delightfully soft and crunchy bases achieved through a 24-hour dough fermentation process. All handmade, using the best ingredients, cooked in front of you. Delicious!

How it works:

• Alexia is open from 4pm – 8pm. Pizzas are available to order 4.15pm – 7.00pm or until sold out. Bar snacks and a little sweet finish are also available.
• No bookings taken – just turn up and find a spot. If the weather is nice we’ll be on the terrace and lawn. If the weather is not so nice we’ll be on the terrace and in the winery (all covered).
• Takeaway pizza is also available, walk-in only - no email/phone orders. You need to turn up to order your pizza. Enjoy a glass of Alexia while you wait, and grab a bottle of something delicious to take home.
• Apologies but Roving Pizza does not currently offer gluten free pizza bases. GF and want to join in the fun? We have some GF food options available.
• No BYO food/drinks.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Always a Bridesmaid, Step into the world of <i>Bridesmaids<i> for a three-course feast that brings the film to life, literally. Zephyr is serving up a cinematic dining experience where every bite is perfectly timed with the on-screen action.
Expect to start with Annie’s mum’s famous artichoke dip, and an entree inspired by Lillian and Doug’s engagement party then get ready for the main event: the Brazilian feast (but guaranteed to be without the unfortunate side effects). And for dessert, it’s that cookie. The giant one. Gorgeous to share or go full meltdown mode — it’s your call. All paired with cocktails and drinks that complement the evening perfectly. After all, as Megan says, "I'm gonna climb that like a tree." And yes, by "that," we mean the drinks list. Mocktails available.
Like an exclusive invite to Lillian’s Parisian bridal shower, these tickets will disappear fast. So grab your besties, your worsties, or your slightly terrifying but well-meaning Megan, and join us for a night of food, film, and absolute chaos. Because sometimes, life calls for laughing until you cry, eating until you're full, and toasting to the love of your friendships that survive it all.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Arizona Flashback, Dust off the denim, dig out the flip phones and get ready to rewind time. Two Grey is bringing back Arizona Bar & Grill for a limited-time pop-up.

Welcome to The Arizona Flashback, a throwback to the late '90s and early 2000s that revives the flavours, energy and atmosphere of the iconic Arizona Bar & Grill. Known as a go-to spot for after-work drinks, late-night bites, birthday celebrations and casual catch-ups, Arizona was a place where people came together over great food and good times.

Now, its beloved Southwestern-style dishes and all-day menu return — not just as a delicious nod to the past, but as a celebration of shared moments, laughter and connection.

Immerse yourself in the full Y2K dining experience, complete with retro beats, neon lights and the return of Arizona’s famous Spin the Wheel game for a dash of playful nostalgia.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Art Flow: Dine & Discover, Join us for another exclusive evening celebrating art and cuisine at DoubleTree by Hilton Wellington. Experience the perfect blend of creative expression and culinary excellence as we bring together the artists behind our successful 'Art Flow' exhibition for an intimate dining experience.

Your evening begins at Grazie Italian restaurant with a welcome drink, followed by a carefully curated three course dinner. Our featured artist, Min Kim, will share insights into her beautiful art and offer a unique perspective on her creative process and inspiration with a live art demonstration between the main course and dessert. The journey continues when you’ll indulge in a dessert presented by Le Cordon Bleu, followed by the demonstrated artwork being auctioned towards the end of the evening. This intimate setting provides the perfect opportunity to engage with Min Kim while enjoying exceptional cuisine followed by a guided tour through our hotel’s art-adorned interior.

Event Details:
- Welcome drink on arrival
- Mix & Mingle – meet Min Kim
- A live art demonstration by Min Kim with the completed artwork being auctioned the same night
- Three-course dinner at Grazie Italian Restaurant with the dessert prepared by Le Cordon Bleu
- Guided art tour with our featured artists

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience art beyond the canvas and celebrate the intersection of visual and culinary artistry.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Ata Rangi Summer Sessions - Auckland Anniversary Saturday, Head to Martinborough wine village for another epic Summer Session at Ata Rangi.

DJ OG Masala brings the sunny, summer grooves while renowned NZ seafood legend Martin Bosley will be serving a menu built for hot days and cold wine, including: Ika Mata (coconut-marinated fish with totopos), Whitebait fritters, Sashimi, Pāua fritters tucked between slices of soft white bread!

Entry is free - pay to play - with all food and beverages purchased on consumption. Boz has designed dishes to pair beautifully with Ata Rangi wines. This is a Saturday Session that you won’t want to miss.

What to expect: A welcoming afternoon of:
- Bubbles, rosé, and summer-favourite Ata Rangi wines
- Shade, sunshine, and space to relax
- Exceptional local seafood
- Music that keeps the day humming

No ticket required - but please RSVP so we can cater accordingly. visit@atarangi.co.nz

This is part of a series of four Ata Rangi Summer Sessions, taking place on 17 Jan, 24 Jan, 7 Feb and 21 Feb. See the full series at www.atarangi.com/ata-rangi-events
label: Food & Drink

description:
Ata Rangi Summer Sessions - The Wellington Anniversary Saturday, Spend your Wellington Anniversary Saturday under the trees at Ata Rangi. Enjoy sunshine-soaked, feel-good music by The Relatives while savouring the middle eastern flavours prepared by our laidback locals, Nara. This is a long weekend vibes under the trees. Come dance, sip and settle into summer at our place.

What to expect: A welcoming afternoon for locals, Wellingtonians and travellers alike:
- Ata Rangi wines poured throughout the day
- Plenty of space to relax under the trees
- Good food, great music and a chance to dance
- A celebration of our place and the season

Ticket includes entry, live music and a glass of Ata Rangi bubbles on arrival. Pay on consumption for all other food and beverages.

This is part of a series of four Ata Rangi Summer Sessions, taking place on 17 Jan, 24 Jan, 7 Feb and 21 Feb. See the full series at www.atarangi.com/ata-rangi-events
label: Food & Drink

description:
Ata Rangi Summer Sessions - Waitangi Weekend, Celebrate Waitangi weekend with a little soul-jazz, boogaloo with old-school charm, in the stunning grounds of Ata Rangi Vineyard in Martinborough.

Beloved in the Wairarapa, Rose & Smith return with a menu built for hungry summer afternoons. Offerings of Paella — Chicken, Chorizo & Prawn or Smashed Burgers — Smashed Cheese Burger & Fries or the Double Trouble Burger & Fries, whatever palate pleaser you choose, it will be a perfect pairing for a glass of Ata Rangi rosé, Pinot Gris, or your favourite summer pour.

What to expect: A relaxed and welcoming afternoon of:
• Ata Rangi wines served across the day
• Shade, sunshine, and plenty of space to unwind
• Soulful live music with room to dance
• Comfort food with local flavour
• An atmosphere that feels looked after and unhurried

Ticket includes entry, live music and a glass of Ata Rangi bubbles on arrival. Pay on consumption for all other food and beverages. It is perfectly timed for the long weekend, held on the same day as the renowned Martinborough Fair. Make a weekend of it.

This is part of a series of four Ata Rangi Summer Sessions, taking place on 17 Jan, 24 Jan, 7 Feb and 21 Feb. See the full series at www.atarangi.com/ata-rangi-events
label: Food & Drink

description:
Aurora Distillery Gin Experience, Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.
label: Food & Drink

Terms and Conditions & Cancellation Policy

No-shows will be charged a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.

label: Food & Drink

description:
Bakery & Brewery, Step into the world of baking and brewing with this unforgettable experience. Join owner Tim Tracey at the Dough Bakery HQ for an interactive hands-on class where you'll master the art of sourdough. Learn the techniques behind creating the perfect loaf, from mixing to baking, in this immersive workshop.

After you’ve perfected your sourdough skills, it’s time to head over to Upper Hutt’s Brewtown via the Tradesman Entrance, where you’ll get an exclusive tour of Boneface Brewery. Discover the secrets behind their craft beers, and enjoy an inside look at the brewing process, from hops to pint.

The adventure culminates with a delicious BBQ smoked-meat dinner, where you can unwind, savouring expertly smoked meats in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Whether you’re a culinary enthusiast, a craft beer lover, or simply in search of a great night out, this event offers a perfect blend of hands-on cooking, beer appreciation, and mouthwatering food.

This is your chance to learn from the best and indulge in an evening of flavour and fun!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Bar Blanc de Blancs with Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon, Alexia's special annual Blanc de Blancs celebration returns for a 4th edition with the release of the 2021 vintage of our world famous (in Greytown) Méthode Traditionnelle!

After four years of patient making and aging, the corks on the most sparkly of all our wines are ready to be popped and the liquid gold consumed on the Alexia terrace!

The man, the myth, the mollusc maestro Martin Bosley is back with his Oyster Saloon between 12pm - 3pm shucking fresh oysters for the occasion so get in early for these or miss out!

Oysters not your thing? Fear not, the Alexia kitchen will also be turning out some delicious delights to match to your Blanc de Blancs – everyone will be happy!

It’s always a great day when the new vintage of Blanc de Blancs starts flowing and we’re quietly delighted with how the 2021 vintage is looking!

Essential Details:
- Alexia Urban Winery, 197 West Street, Greytown.
- Leashed dogs ok!
- No bookings required, just turn up. Want oysters? Get there before 3pm.
- Parking onsite, on the street, and lots of parking for bikes. 15 minute walk from Greytown centre.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Battle of the Wine Regions, The best winemakers from across New Zealand will battle it out for bragging rights, and raise money for a charity dear to Rosella's heart at the same time. 
For a second year, three winemakers will put their best grape-crushing foot forward to match a wine from their home region with each course in a five-course degustation menu. Guests will vote for the best-matched wine for each course, scores will be tallied up, and winners will be crowned! 
All profits will go to Heart Kids Foundation, a charity that Rosella's owners received a lot of support from when their son was born with a congenital heart disease. This is their chance to give back to this great charity and provide the support needed for other families going through the same situation.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Beervana, New Zealand’s boldest, hoppiest, and most delightfully weird beer festival. This is no ordinary tasting event, it’s a full-blown sensory adventure where brewers go wild, food gets fancy, and the unexpected is always on tap. 

Expect more than 60 breweries pouring over 300 unique brews—from hazy IPAs and fruited sours to beer cocktails and non-alcoholic surprises. 

But Beervana isn’t just about the beer. It’s a feast for all senses: think whitebait fritters from Boulcott St Bistro, Korean fried chicken, Mahurangi oysters. Add in live music, quirky brewery stands (yes, there’s a Best Stand vote), and unexpected entertainment and you’ve got a festival that you'll come away from with a greater knowledge of great beer, a belly full and plenty of fun memories with your mates.
label: Food & Drink

description: Breakfast Club, For one morning only – Loosie’s Superette is opening for breakfast, serving a comfort-filled menu with banging tunes and endless caffeine. Think trayfuls of fluffy pancakes, bacon and egg muffins, crispy hash browns drowned in maple syrup, and bottomless drip coffee to keep things rolling. Add a cheeky mimosa or two, and you’ve got the perfect start to your weekend. Whether you’re with your brunch crew, shaking off a hangover, or chasing the crispy bits, this is a morning made for indulgence. It’s all about good food, loud laughs, and that first sip of something strong with your best mates by your side. No rules, no rush - just tunes pumping, trays piling up, and that warm, familiar feeling of a proper brunch done right.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Burns Night - A Taste of Scotland, Raise a glass to Scotland!
Burns Night - A Taste of Scotland is a modern, tasting-style celebration of Scottish flavours. Enjoy a cocktail-style menu featuring haggis with neeps & tatties, Cullen Skink, and Cranachan, paired with curated whisky flights and themed cocktails.
With Scottish music and a playful Ode to the Haggis, this festive evening is all about great food, whisky, and fun - no formal sit-down required.
Tickets are limited:
$45 Standard - includes tasting menu
$55 - includes welcome drink (house drink or select theme cocktail)
$70 - includes whisky flight (4 whiskies)
Secure your spot for a true taste of Scotland!
label: Food & Drink

description:

Introducing Cake canvas & coffee - a new hands-on cake decorating experience paired with your favourite handcrafted a Le Ciel drink!

A perfect creative escape before the week starts, a weekend treatr with a creative twist, or simply time to slow down and make something beautiful together.

$62 per person and we can cater to gluten-free, vegan and dairy-free options.

Timing: 2:00 PM – 5:00 PM

Whether you-re celebrating a moment or simply craving reset, Cake canvas and Coffee is a perfect blend of beauty, indulgence, and artistry.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Chance Luck & Magic 2024 Release, Be the first to taste Chance, Luck & Magic 2024, the latest iteration of one of our proudest achievements.

On Saturday 18 October, you can come and taste the beer in our Wild Workshop, the place where it was made. Brewers Pete and Dave will be on hand from 2pm to raise the first toast and tell you all a little about how this year’s blend came to be. We’ll also pull a couple of other goodies from the cellar to keep you and CLM company.

And, to top it off, our friends at Nomames Tacos will be here for the edible pairings.

This beer is the ultimate expression of Wild Workshop’s inner-city terroir, and the 2024 bottle is no different; a blend of five years of 100% spontaneously fermented brews, aged in French oak. The result is a complex and truly unique drop that harnesses the natural character of Pōneke.

We love this beer, and we’re so chuffed that other people do too - we’re very honoured that Chance, Luck & Magic, in its various vintages, has garnered global recognition and become one of our most prestigious creations:
Silver medals at both the 2023 and 2024 World Beer Cup (huge!)
Four consecutive gold medals at the New Zealand Beer Awards, as well as two trophies for Champion European Ale, and the Champion Beer title in 2022
Champion International Beer at the 2024 Australian International Beer Awards

The release of each new edition has become a landmark annual event for us, a chance to take a moment and appreciate the beautiful things that come from the wild workings of the environment.

Come and celebrate with us!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Cheesy Lovers by Le Marché Français, Calling all cheese lovers!
Looking for a fun and original night out for two? Whether it’s a romantic date, a chill evening with a friend, or a cozy family moment, our Cheesy Lovers workshop is the perfect plan
What’s on the menu:
Roll up your sleeves and make two fresh cheeses from scratch, step by step, with our expert cheesemongers
Discover the magic of artisan cheesemaking — milk, love, and a little bit of alchemy

Then, get creative and build your very own cheese platter for two — beautiful and delicious
A full spread of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be waiting for you, along with expert tips on pairing and presentation. And of course… tasting is highly encouraged
It’s an intimate, tasty, hands-on experience for anyone who loves good food, good vibes, and of course... cheese
Hosted in our cozy shop
Upcoming dates:
• Fri 1 Aug, 6pm – 7:30pm
• Fri 15 Aug, 6pm – 7:30pm
• Fri 22 Aug, 6pm – 7:30pm
• Fri 29 Aug, 6pm – 7:30pm
Limited spots available — don’t wait to book!
https://www.iticket.co.nz/.../2025/aug/vwoap-cheesy-lovers
Come for the cheese, stay for the memories!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Cheesy Lovers, Calling all cheese lovers! Whether you're planning a romantic date, a fun night with a friend, or a family treat, Cheesy Lovers is the perfect hands-on experience for two — your chance to craft, taste, and share the magic of artisan cheese together.

Begin the evening by exploring the art of fresh cheese-making — a simple yet rewarding process that will have you creating your own delicate cheese from scratch. Our experts will guide you through each step, from curdling the milk to shaping and seasoning your fresh creation.

Start your journey by making two fresh cheeses from scratch, guided by our expert cheesemongers. You and your partner will work as a team to curdle, shape, and season your own cheeses, learning the art of fresh cheese-making step by step.

Then, put your creativity to the test by building a cheese platter for two. Using a curated selection of artisan cheeses, you’ll design a board that balances textures, flavours, and perfect pairings. An array of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be provided, along with expert tips on plating and pairing to ensure your board is as stunning as it is delicious.

This intimate, hands-on experience is designed for anyone who loves good food, great company, and, of course, cheese!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Christmas Buffet at Oak & Vine Wellington, Christmas Buffet at Oak & Vine Wellington
Christmas plans? We’ve got you covered. Join us for a festive buffet on Christmas Eve or Christmas Day at Oak & Vine Wellington.

About this Event


🎄 Christmas Eve Lunch & Christmas Day Dinner at Oak & Vine Wellington
Oysters, sizzling grills, glazed ham and festive desserts. Christmas tastes better when someone else does the cooking.
Join us for a relaxed celebration at Oak & Vine Wellington with a generous buffet and a two-hour drinks package including house wines, beer and soft drinks. Start with a glass of bubbly and a freshly shucked oyster, then explore live grill stations, a curated charcuterie spread, seasonal salads and indulgent mains. Save room for dessert — we’re serving pavlovas, chocolate fondue and Christmas pudding with brandy sauce.
Whether you're joining us for lunch on Christmas Eve or dinner on Christmas Day, expect good food, good company and zero washing up.

description:
Christmas Feast for Two – A Magical Dinner Experience, Christmas Feast for Two – A Magical Dinner Experience

Each table for two will be adorned with candlelight, evergreen touches, and a hint of gold. Our specially curated five-course Christmas menu brings together the nostalgia of traditional holiday dishes and the elegance of modern cuisine. Expect luxurious flavours, handcrafted details, and a little surprise treat to take home.

Whether it’s a romantic evening, a celebration with a dear friend, or a thoughtful gift experience, this dinner promises to be one to remember.

description:
Club Tropicana, This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Coffee Like Tasting, Coffee Like Tasting
Come sip, smile, and connect over a brew that’s bold, caffeine-free, and full of feel-good vibes. Whether you're a Chi-Coffy regular or just chicory-curious, this event is your chance to explore our blends, meet the founder (hi, it’s me!), and dive into the story behind the brew.

✨ What’s brewing:

Free tastings of Chi-Coffy’s signature blend and exciting new variations

Wellness chats & community connections

A peek into the Chi-Coffy journey and what’s next

Let’s raise a cup to flavor, wellness, and caffeine-free joy. Bring a friend—or two—and come say hi!

description: Cognac vs Armagnac, Noble Rot sommelier Maciej Zimny has a undeniable passion for brandy, and he is yearning to share that with you. Maciej will guide you on an educational journey through this fascinating world focusing on the most prestigious French regions for brandy production: Cognac and Armagnac. He’ll provide detailed insight into the appellations, distillation and ageing processes, differences in oak maturation and why one region focuses on vintage expressions while the other ages blends for several years in barrel. But don’t worry, this isn’t a classroom affair—they'll be pouring 8 different spirits paired to a unique three-course menu to showcase Maciej’s knowledge, and he’ll even teach you the sommelier’s techniques for how to taste spirits correctly. Fall in love with brandy, find your favourite and next time you’re ordering a nightcap you can show off your new-found knowledge to your friends.
label: Food & Drink

description:
DILLI-24, A North Indian feast crafted by long-time Loretta head chef Chandrika Khullar.
Named after her hometown of Delhi and her home postcode, this special menu is a deeply personal tribute to her upbringing and a childhood immersed in the rich culinary traditions of North India. Chandrika brings the heart and soul of Delhi to Wellington with a generous, share-style multi-course menu featuring bountiful vegetarian plates and an exceptional lamb raan.

Expect an explosion of flavour, with exotic spice blends, saffron, citrus and native berries woven into every dish. In North India, condiment is king, and this feast will be served with a vibrant array of chutneys, pickles and relishes. To complete the experience, Chandrika has also designed a beautifully curated drinks menu to complement the bold and fragrant dishes.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Discover Te Muna - Explore the Wines, Te Muna means secret place in Maori. We want to let you into the secret of the Te Muna Valley wines.

Te Muna valley, just east of Martinborough, is not the easiest place to grow grapes. The winds and the temperatures test us.  But the micro climate and the unique soil structure help us produce exceptional wines with a distinctive style.

Join us for a small group, interactive tasting led by wine writer and educator Joelle Thomson, as we explore a curated selection of Te Muna wines from a variety of producers. Craggy Range, Escarpment, Big Sky, Blue Earth Estate and more.

You will be picked up from the Square in Martinborough and driven to the stunning Craggy Range Te Muna Estate vineyard where Joelle will guide you through a tasting of twelve of Te Muna wines. The experience concludes with a relaxed opportunity to revisit some of your favourites from the tasting while meeting several of the producers, before being transported back to the Square.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Discover Te Muna - Go Behind the Scenes, Join us for a full-day immersive experience in the viticulture, winemaking and wines of Te Muna Valley. Walk the vineyards, meet the producers, go behind the scenes and taste exceptional wines right where they are made.

Tickets are limited to twenty people to ensure that this is an intimate experience, taking you to places that are not normally open to the public.

Your tour begins with pickup from Martinborough Square, leading to a special start at Big Sky Wines. Kath and Jeremy will take you through a hands-on experience of their vineyard and winery. From there, visit the stunning Blue Earth Estate vineyard and olive grove. Margaret and Mike will entertain you with stories of their journey and explain how they grow their olives and grapes. You will then indulge in a long, relaxed lunch accompanied with a glass of wine. Some of the region's winemakers will join us to share their stories and answer your questions. The adventure continues with an insiders' look at the state of the art winery at Escarpment. Rowan will walk you through the process of how grapes are transformed into their wines. This will be followed by an exploration of the beautiful Craggy Range vineyard with Anton. The day will conclude with the opportunity to revisit your favourite wines of the day overlooking Te Muna from Craggy Range's gorgeous private venue.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Discover Te Muna - Go behind the scenes, Join us for a unique full day experience immersing yourself in the viticulture, wine making and wines of Te Muna valley. This spectacular valley lies nine kilometres east of Martinborough. Visit the vineyards, meet the producers, go behind the scenes and taste the wines where they are made.

We will pick you up from the Martinborough Square at 9.30 am to start your day at Big Sky Wines. Founders, viticulturists, and winemakers Katherine Jacobs and Jeremy Corban will give you a first look at their 2025 ferments, which have been produced from their organic vineyard. We will then take you to tour Blue Earth Estate vineyard and olive grove and enjoy a long lunch, accompanied by a glass of wine of course. From there we will take you to the stunning winery at Escarpment, and then to explore the beautiful terraced Craggy Range vineyard and taste their wines among the vines, both of which are not normally open to the public. We will finish the day with some of the other Te Muna producers joining us to share their wines and their stories. It will be a day of discovery - the place, the people and the wines of the beautiful Te Muna Valley.

Tickets are strictly limited to 18 people.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Discover the World of Chinese Milk Tea! Sip, Savor, and Explore a Cultural Icon!, Join us for a delicious journey into the world of Chinese milk tea — a beloved drink that blends flavor, tradition, and creativity. From classic black milk tea to trendy cheese foam toppings, discover what makes Chinese milk tea so irresistible!
Taste the Variety: Try popular milk tea styles from across China — including bubble tea, fruit teas, and unique toppings.
Learn the Culture: Uncover the story behind the rise of milk tea and its role in modern Chinese youth culture.
DIY Station: Mix your own milk tea creation with fun ingredients and take home your personalized blend!
Come sip with us at Mandarin Corner – where culture meets flavor!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Doughnuts & HOT FOOD at The Animal Medical Centre, Each Wednesday afternoon, Family Kitchen with Mark and The Animal Medical Centre team up to offer you sourdough doughnuts & hot, delicious, affordable meals.
Set up outside the clinic in a black gazebo, from 2:30pm, we sell sourdough doughnuts in six flavours, mini-celebratory doughnuts, plus a hot dish.
We thought it's time again for a curry, so it's a chicken saag with rice and garlic sourdough bread as our hot dish.
Our sourdough doughnuts are priced at $22 for a box of 4 or $6 each. We also offer mini-celebratory doughnuts, a box of all six flavours for $25. The main hot dish is priced at a very reasonable $18 per portion.
EFTPOS is available.
If you want to pre-order, go to our website https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/weekly-menu/
We really appreciate The Animal Medical Centre allowing us to sell outside their new business.
Should you require an excellent veterinary service, contact the team at NEW Animal Medical Centre
https://www.animalmedicalcentre.co.nz/
Family Kitchen with Mark also offers catering. You can visit our website to see our packages if you have a function or require in-house dining. Our doughnuts are also available for purchase Monday to Saturday. Call or message us by 8pm to pick up orders throughout the week.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/grazing-tables-theme.../
My website has a list of flavours and ingredients for each doughnut. Search weekly menus.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Dragons Is My Uso, Chef Jessica Tang and legendary home chefs Litia Lefaoseu and Iutita Mallon are drawing on the century long fusion of Chinese and Samoan cuisine and the way food expresses love, ai, and alofa. In the late 1800s, small numbers of Chinese settled in Samoa and became part of a growing multicultural community. There they influenced local customs, made an enduring contribution to Samoan cuisine introducing contemporary favourites such as sapasui (chop suey), keke pua‘a (pork buns) and of course laisa (rice). 

Dragons celebrate this cultural and culinary fusion by showcasing these favourites and presenting new dishes highlighting the shared love of culinary staples such as taro and noodles, rice, fish, and pork, the magnificent spectrum of Chinese herbs, spices and flavours. Through cooking and sharing food together the chefs honour their culinary heritage, strengthen our connections to one another and celebrate the big and little moments in life. This is a shared-style meal, served banquet style on lazy Susan turntables. 
Dragons is My Uso was one of the sell-out hits of the 2024 festival - don't miss out!

Discounted tables for 10 available for $1000, so get the whole aiga together!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Due Isole, Join Chef Giulio Ricatti for an extraordinary evening celebrating the bond between two islands — Sardinia and New Zealand. Through a carefully curated nine-course dinner, this event offers a personal and heartfelt exploration of identity, place, and the connection between land and sea.

Raised in Sardinia and now at home in New Zealand, Chef Ricatti shares his story through a menu that bridges the wild, untouched landscapes of both countries. Each course is crafted exclusively with New Zealand ingredients, reflecting the rich bounty of our land and sea, yet inspired by the timeless traditions and bold flavours of Sardinian cuisine.

Accompanying the meal is an expertly selected pairing of wines from Sardinia and New Zealand, highlighting the unique characteristics of each region while celebrating their shared essence. The thoughtful combination of food and drink creates a dialogue between the two islands, offering diners a chance to taste the harmony of contrasts.

More than just a meal, this is an evening of storytelling. Chef Ricatti invites you to journey with him as he reflects on the places that have shaped his life and the meaning of finding a home across oceans. His philosophy of embracing the present moment is woven into every dish, making this event a sensory and emotional experience.

Whether you’re a lover of fine dining, an admirer of Sardinian culture, or simply curious about the connections between food and identity, this dinner promises a night of discovery. Step into the heart of two islands and savour their soul in one unforgettable evening.
label: Food & Drink

description:
ELIXIR CLOSING Blindfolded Daiquiri Competition VII x WCC x Diplomatico Rum, 𝐈𝐭’𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐭 𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐥, 𝐥𝐞𝐠𝐞𝐧𝐝𝐬 — 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐰𝐞’𝐫𝐞 𝐠𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐚 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐠.
For the SEVENTH consecutive year, we're bringing back our legendary Blindfolded Daiquiri Competition and YOU are all invited!
Calling all movers, shakers, and daiquiri dream-makers: your mission is simple…
Make the best daiquiri. While blindfolded. In 60 seconds. In front of a crowd. No pressure.
After almost four years of shaking, stirring, caffeinating, feeding, and occasionally corrupting Wellington, Elixir Cocktail Apotheke is throwing a glorious, FINAL 𝐁𝐋𝐈𝐍𝐃𝐅𝐎𝐋𝐃𝐄𝐃 𝐃𝐀𝐈𝐐𝐔𝐈𝐑𝐈 𝐂𝐎𝐌𝐏𝐄𝐓𝐈𝐓𝐈𝐎𝐍 before we ride off into the cocktail sunset.
This year, we are pairing up with 𝐃𝐢𝐩𝐥𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐨 𝐑𝐮𝐦, courtesy of 𝐇𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐬 AND the 𝐖𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐂𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐂𝐥𝐮𝐛
https://www.facebook.com/groups/246872129390986
Competitors will be given four mystery spirits, juices, and sugars in unmarked bottles, pick their fight song, then step up and shake like the future of cocktails depends on it.
Expect some Elixir closing-party nonsense: specials galore, questionable games, family pricing, and memories to last.
There’ll be laughter, probably some tears, and definitely some questionable dance moves. This is our last hurrah — one more night to raise a glass, hail Satan, and make some chaos together.
𝐒𝐢𝐠𝐧 𝐮𝐩𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐬𝐨𝐨𝐧, 𝐤𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐚𝐧 𝐞𝐲𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐥𝐬
𝐖𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐩𝐞𝐚𝐭, 𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧 𝐮𝐩𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐬𝐨𝐨𝐧, 𝐬𝐨 𝐤𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐚 𝐠𝐨𝐝𝐝𝐚𝐦𝐧 𝐜𝐥𝐨𝐬𝐞 𝐞𝐲𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐠𝐞.
𝑭𝒆𝒓𝒏𝒆𝒕 𝒊𝒔 𝒃𝒊𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓,
𝑪𝒖𝒓𝒂𝒄𝒂𝒐 𝒎𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒕 𝒃𝒆 𝒃𝒍𝒖𝒆,
𝑾𝒆'𝒓𝒆 𝒉𝒚𝒑𝒆𝒅 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒏𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒕

description:
Eat Your Art Out: High Tea, Eat Your Art Out brings a creative twist to high tea, inspired by the bold and brilliant works of Toi Art.

Enjoy a menu of classic treats with an artistic edge: from the Sweet William’s Dish, Golden Ratio Scone, Madeleine Moment, and the Mint to Be mousse. Each dish is a playful nod to the world of art, clever, colourful, and made to be shared.

Your high tea includes your choice of tea or coffee. Alcoholic beverages are available for purchase, and dietary options are available on request.

Every purchase helps to support Aotearoa New Zealand’s national museum.

------

Set Menu
(Includes one of each item per person)

Cheery Cherry Curator
A silky milk chocolate crémeux layered with vibrant cherry glaze and topped with a dark chocolate disc creates a perfectly balanced blend of tart and sweet

Mint to Be
Cool mint and sweet strawberry mousse gently resting on a white chocolate base, combining vibrant flavours that are meant to be together

Madeleine Moment
A citrus-infused madeleine paired with silky sambuca namelaka, vibrant green apple gel, and an elegant chocolate garnish delivers golden flavours with a playful twist

Sweet William’s Dish
Mānuka honey ganache nestled in a crisp vanilla tart shell, topped with a chocolate ‘The Dish’ by William De Morgan. A refined take on New Zealand’s liquid gold

The Golden Ratio
A perfectly proportioned cheese scone layered with sundried tomatoes, olives, and fresh basil brings Mediterranean flavours in perfect balance

The Pecking Order
Tender horopito-spiced chicken layered with creamy Tatua mayo and peppery watercress on fresh focaccia fingers, with native pepper leaf adding a bold, warming kick

Still Life with Eggplant
Tangy eggplant and native kawakawa caponata with buffalo bocconcini and fragrant basil pesto on artisanal brioche. A bold sandwich blending native botanicals and classic flavours.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Everybody Eats x Cliftons: Dinner in the Sky, Dinner in the Sky: Celebrating Five Years of Impact
Join us for a spectacular one-night-only celebration as Everybody Eats marks five years of community impact in Wellington — hosted high above the city at Cliftons Wellington.
This special fundraising event brings together the partners, supporters, and champions who have helped transform rescued food into thousands of delicious meals served with dignity. With every plate, you’ve made Aotearoa a more connected, more nourished place — and now it’s time to celebrate the journey we’ve shared and the future we’re building together.
Suspended above Wellington’s breathtaking skyline, guests will indulge in a three-course menu while taking in sweeping views across our beautiful city. We can’t wait to raise a glass with you to five years of impact, the people who made it possible, and the exciting heights still to come.
What’s Included
• A three-course elevated dining experience with breathtaking views above the city
• A selection of wine is included with your meal, optional additional beverages available to purchase from the bar
• Entry to our Wonderful Weekend Experience raffle, with tickets from $20
• Special guests yet to be announced
label: Food & Drink

description:
FILIPINO RESTAURANT WEEK, From October 20 to 26, 2025, Filipino cuisine will take center stage in Auckland, Wellington, Christchurch, and Dunedin for the first Filipino Restaurant Week (FRW). This week-long event introduces foodies to the rich and diverse flavors of the Philippines, with Filipino restaurants showcasing traditional and modern dishes that tell stories of heritage and community.
Participating restaurants will offer fixed-price menus featuring Filipino dishes like adobo, kare-kare, and halo-halo, giving diners a chance to experience the rich culinary traditions shaped by centuries of history. These menus highlight the unique fusion of indigenous ingredients and global influences in Filipino cooking.
Filipino Restaurant Week is a celebration of heritage, an invitation to unity, and a singular opportunity to savor Filipino cuisine. It celebrates New Zealand’s diverse cultural tapestry, deepens cross-cultural understanding, and strengthens community through the universal connection of food.
label: Food & Drink

Treat the father figure in your life to a memorable afternoon with a luxurious lunch at our renowned restaurant, where rustic charm meets world-class cuisine.

Our specially crafted Father’s Day menu highlights the finest seasonal produce, expertly prepared by our talented chefs. Enjoy a variety of mouthwatering dishes, from tender cuts of locally sourced meats to fresh, flavorful sides that will make every bite a celebration. Paired with a selection of New Zealand’s best wines, it's the perfect way to honor ‘Dad’ while taking in the stunning landscapes of rolling hills and expansive coastlines.

Relax in the elegant yet cozy atmosphere of our dining room, where impeccable service and a warm, welcoming environment make this a day to remember. Whether it's your first time or you're a returning guest, Wharekauhau offers an experience that combines exceptional food, unparalleled views, and a relaxed, family-friendly ambiance—everything needed to make this Father’s Day extra special.

Reserve your place today and give Dad the gift of a memorable experience he’ll treasure long after the day is over. Available on both Saturday and Sunday

description:
Feed Your Senses, Step into an immersive experience where nature’s core elements — stone, clay, wood, water, fire, and air — are brought to life through a dynamic fusion of artistic mediums. Explore interactive installations and captivating performances that engage all of your senses with visual art, sculpture, sound, and more. Throughout the evening, enjoy six unique canapés and six meticulously crafted drinks, each inspired by the work of a different artist. Each exhibit reflects the raw power and beauty of the natural world, as local artists push boundaries to bring these elements to life in real-time.

As you journey through Foxglove’s Secret Wardrobe, you'll be surrounded by live artistry unfolding around you, creating an environment filled with raw creativity and vibrant energy. Aphrodisiac-inspired canapés and expertly paired beverages complement the visual experience, bringing each artist’s medium to life while celebrating Wellington’s rich and diverse creative community.

This culinary and sensory pairing will transport you deeper into the world of artistry, blending food and creativity in unexpected and delightful ways.

This event goes beyond simple exhibition — it’s a celebration of Wellington's local talent where the boundaries between food, art, and sensory experience are beautifully blurred. Whether you’re an art aficionado or a culinary enthusiast, this immersive experience promises to engage your senses in an unforgettable way.

description:
Five Candles - A Birthday Retrospective Wine Tasting, It’s Alexia Urban Winery’s 5th birthday! Five years since we opened our doors to the public for the first time!

In that time we’ve released dozens of new wines, held scores of pop-ups, become a wine bar, and spent many hundreds of hours working towards becoming one of NZ’s few in-house Méthode Traditionnelle producers.

To celebrate we’re delving into our cellar and hosting a fun, informal tasting of some of the wines that have defined our urban winery (and us!). There’s a story behind each one.

Take a seat, hear the stories, and taste the love put into each wine as Alexia co-owners Jane (also winemaker) and Lesley spend an hour traversing five whirlwind years of a little urban winery on a Greytown back street.

Ticket includes all tasting pours.

Tasting:

Méthode Traditionnelle (an advance look at a yet to be released vintage)

2019 Chenin Blanc – that wine that showed us Wairarapa’s Chenin Blanc potential

2017 Chardonnay – 6 barrels that lit the urban winery fire

2020 Pinot Noir – the heartbreak grape from the loneliest vintage

2025 Lagrein (from the barrel) - the wine that’s been on Jane’s mind since the 1990s

description:
Foraged Flavours : From Wild Greens to Plate, Foraged Flavours : From Wild Greens to Plate
~ Foraged Flavours: From Wild Greens to Plate ~

Step into a full-day, hands-on workshop at Mangaroa Farms, just 40 minutes from Wellington with Expert Forager Felicity Joy from Wild Botanica.

You’ll explore seasonal edible wild greens, learning to identify them, discover their properties, and turn your foraged finds into simple, delicious creations. In the farm’s fully equipped kitchen, you’ll make a range of hands-on preparations: fresh wild green spreads, infused butters, vibrant salads, and pickled or preserved treats, all designed to showcase the flavours of the season.

During the day, we’ll enjoy a shared wild feast together, tasting the seasonal dishes you’ve prepared in a relaxed, beautiful farm setting. This workshop is interactive, practical, and sensory, a chance to deepen your foraging skills, connect with nature, and celebrate the flavours of the wild. All ingredients, tools, and guidance are provided, so you can fully immerse yourself in the experience.

Perfect for those who’ve already attended Wild Botanica’s Foraging Workshops, this is the next step: taking your wild plant knowledge into the kitchen. Also suitable for total beginners, no experience needed.

When: Saturday 18th October
Time: 10 am – 3 pm (5-hour immersive experience)
Location: Mangaroa Farms, 40 minutes from Wellington

What’s included:
~ Full-day, hands-on experience: foraging, plant ID, cooking, and tasting
~ Access to a fully equipped kitchen and all tools
~ Guidance from an expert forager and cook
~ A shared wild feast using seasonal foraged ingredients prepared during the workshop
~ Educational insights into the nutritional, medicinal, and culinary properties of wild greens
~ Beautiful farm setting for a relaxed, sensory experience

Don't delay, call your friends and book your tickets now to avoid missing out:

https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/collections/foraging-workshops/products/foragedflavours

p.s. book your tickets by 20 September to receive $20 off each ticket. Just use the code EARLYBIRD at checkout.

description:
High Tea at Le Cordon Bleu | 29 NOVEMBER 2025, High Tea at Le Cordon Bleu | 29 NOVEMBER 2025
Experience an exquisite selection of the finest French Pâtisserie prepared by our highly creative & talented Diplôme de Pâtisserie students.

About this Event

Experience an exquisite selection of the finest French Pâtisserie prepared by our highly creative and talented Le Cordon Bleu New Zealand Diplôme de Pâtisserie students. Tickets are allocated for specific days and seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time-slot you have booked for.
Kiwiana Edition: This High Tea is a speciality menu inspired by classic kiwi treats, enjoy a collection of old favourites with a Le Cordon Bleu spin.

Ticket Information:
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Friday 29th November. (other sessions are also available, to purchase tickets for these events please click here and select your chosen date. Tickets are non-transferable, please ensure you purchase tickets for the correct date.)
Price: $45 per person includes High Tea and complimentary Tea and Coffee.
Booking Times: 11.30am | 12:00pm | 2:30pm | 3:00pm
Tickets are allocated for specific days and seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time you have booked for.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu High Tea experience is one hour. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' collection of French Pâtisserie.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations, or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.



What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Pâtisserie programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.
Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy

• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.

Our Winter Woodlands Pizza Evening is a special fundraiser supporting Hōkai Tahi.
Based in the Wairarapa, Hōkai Tahi walks alongside women and whānau through pregnancy, baby loss, and the early years of parenting - offering time, space, and resources when they are needed most.
Indulge in a delicious 3-course meal (wood-fired pizza included, of course!) with non-alcoholic drinks provided.
A limited bar menu will be available, or feel free to BYO.
Alongside your meal, enjoy live music, a live auction of locally donated treasures, and for those feeling adventurous, a short glow worm walk through the native bush (don’t forget your torch, sturdy shoes, and warm layers - hot water bottles welcome!).

Watermill Bakery, 33 Blakes Road, Mt Holdsworth
Saturday 1st November 2025
5:30–8:30pm
$75 per adult - $20 per child (under 14)

Every ticket sold helps Hōkai Tahi continue supporting local whānau through life’s most tender moments.

description:
I-Sarn Thai KanTok, Join Daeng from Tuk Tuk Thai for a deeply personal culinary journey to the heart of E-Sarn, the north-eastern region of Thailand she once called home. This one-night-only event celebrates the traditional Kan-Tok style of dining – a communal meal served on handwoven bamboo trays and shared amongst family and friends. This event is made to be shared, the ticket price is for a shared menu for two. 

Growing up in the small town of Tha Bo near the Mekong Delta, Daeng’s childhood was filled with stories of rice farming, village generosity, and dishes cooked from what the garden offered. In E-Sarn, meals were acts of love, shared daily around the Kan-Tok with laughter, music, and warmth.

Now, Daeng invites you to gather at her table and experience the flavours of her upbringing. You’ll be served nine traditional dishes on a beautifully crafted bamboo tray, designed for sharing, just as they are in her village.

On the Kan-Tok:
Hor Mok Salmon – Steamed salmon in banana leaves, marinated with herbs, spices, and coconut milk
Mok Nor Mai with Pork Belly – Pork belly steamed with bamboo shoots
Larb Gai – A celebratory chicken mince salad with fresh herbs and toasted rice
E-Sarn Sausages – House-made, spiced and fermented in true north-eastern style
Nam Prik Tomato – Roasted tomato dipping sauce with chillies, garlic, and shallots
Som Tum – Green papaya salad with a sweet, sour, spicy kick
Sticky Rice – Soaked overnight and steamed in traditional bamboo baskets
Fresh and Steamed Seasonal Vegetables – To enjoy with sauces and mains

Dessert:
Kanom Chan – Thai layered jelly cake
Kanom Mun – Tapioca and coconut pudding

Pull up a seat at Daeng’s table and discover the stories, flavours, and traditions that shaped her childhood.
Single tickets or odd numbers unable to be catered to.
label: Food & Drink

description:
IWD Breakfast 2026, General tickets will go on sale on 31 January 2026.
The Zonta Club of Wellington invite you to join us for the annual breakfast event to celebrate International Women’s Day 2026.
The event is kindly hosted by Hon. Nicola Grigg, Minister for Women.
The theme for 2025 is #Recognise the Remarkable.
This years is about remembering that "remarkable" isn't always synonymous with "famous." It’s about the women whose absence would cause the system to collapse, but whose presence is often treated as a given. We want to recognise the quiet giants, the women who sustain other women, communities, industries, and families without a spotlight. It is time to Advocate for these Invisible Pillars and recognise the Unseen, Unsung, and Unstoppable.
Our keynote speakers are: 
Hon. Nicola Grigg, Minister of State for Trade and Investment, Minister for Women, Associate Minister of Agriculture and Associate Minister for ACC
Emma Lewisham, Co-Founder of Emma Lewisham Skincare Company
Diana Minnee, Founder and CEO of Ask Astro - AI that Amplifies the Advisor/Business leader relationship
Theresa Setefano, Black Fern and Rugby Sevens Representative, Rugby Union Player
All tickets include a hot vegan breakfast.
We look forward to you joining us on Thursday 5th March as we look at how we can recognise the remarkable and advocate for the unseen, unsung, and unstoppable.
Please contact us at iwd@zontawellington.org.nz

Melted Kapiti brie cheese with caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket and truffle aioli. Topped with crispy Harrington’s bacon and pickled jalepenos for those who like a little heat. description:
Le Petit Chef, InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.

Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients. Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story. Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert. Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.
