description:
Love Language, Calling budding poets and hopeless romantics - this is your opportunity to share your love of language, with a food and poetry degustation. 
This four-course dinner is a physical manifestation of love and an ode to food. Join Simon Sweetman, Wellington writer, critic, musician and poet, as he reads some of his own poetry, and yours too if you're feeling game. Chefs Tim and Aaron Banks will lovingly create a four-course dinner with ingredients locally sourced and lovingly produced by small scale sustainable farmers... and perhaps they will read their own poems too. 
If you're feeling poetic bring along your own poem specially crafted around this year's festival theme 'Food is Love'. It can be as long or short as you like, as happy or sad, comical or tragic, Keats or Bukowski. Spot prizes for various categories including 'Most Related to the Theme' and 'Most Obviously Foodie' poems. Includes four courses, and a welcome glass of bubbles on arrival.

description:
Love in Scent, Join fragrance aficionado Benny Castles for an immersive journey into the WORLD of love, told through the art of scent. In this exclusive olfactive experience, indulge in small bites and sip on a glass (or three!) of something delightful, setting the perfect mood for exploring the emotional power of fragrance.

Over the course of the evening, you’ll sample up to twelve unique fragrances, each one tied to a captivating love story that inspired its creation. Learn the intimate tales behind these scents and discover how they evoke the passions and emotions that shape our experiences of love. Whether you're a fragrance enthusiast or a newcomer, this sensory journey is sure to arouse your olfactory senses and deepen your appreciation for the art of perfume.

description:
Lunch Speaker Series, Noble Rot invites you to enjoy a relaxed lunch in style. While away your afternoon with a leisurely three-course menu as they keep the wine flowing amongst you and your friends. They've lined up two incredible guest speakers at the forefront of the wine industry to entertain you with their stories, knowledge and insights into current trends in a relaxed but intimate atmosphere. You'll wish all learning was done this way. It’s the perfect excuse to treat your friends, your mum or your date.
 
Guest Speakers & Dates:

Saturday 9th — ‘Small Region, Big Sky’
Katherine Jacobs and her husband Jeremy embarked on a dream to produce some of Martinborough’s finest wines from their special vineyard in Te Muna, and they’ve achieved great success! Katherine will speak about upcoming trends, big dreams and hidden secrets in our favourite region’s wine scene.
 
Saturday 23rd — ‘A Rosie Afternoon’ 
Enjoy the company of Rosie Finn of Neudorf Vineyards, second generation of one of New Zealand's most prestigious wineries in Nelson. You’ll have the opportunity to ask Rosie all about current trends as she combines the story of her family winery’s historic roots and its impact on the landscape of New Zealand fine wines.

description:
Macaron Masterclass, MACARON MASTERCLASS
Presented by Le Ciel Bakery
Whisk, pipe, and finesse your way to perfect Parisian macarons

Join us for a hands-on masterclass where you’ll learn the secrets to mastering this delicate French treat — from glossy meringue to flawless feet. Led by Chef Shuchi Bhardwaj, this is your golden ticket to boujee baking greatness.

- Create & take home your own box of beautifully filled macarons
- Learn foolproof techniques, flavour infusions, and piping styles
- Start your evening with a complimentary glass of bubbles and a decadent Black Forest cake for two—because love (and baking) should always begin on a sweet note.

What you’ll learn:
- Mastering macaronage & piping flawless heart shapes
- Avoiding common meringue mishaps
- Chef’s expert tips for achieving that perfect crisp-yet-chewy texture

Only 12 people per class—an intimate setting where you’ll have Chef Shuchi’s full attention and guidance. Whether you're baking with your sweetheart, bestie, or favorite foodie, this experience is sure to be equal parts fun, romantic, and delicious.

description:
Maille Sunday Kai, Escape the winter chill and head along to Cuba St Tavern for some Sunday Kai with Maille Mustard, running every Sunday of August. Each week features a different delectable roast, served with either a Maille Dijon Bloody Mary or warming mulled wine, and finished with a house-made dessert. Sunday has never tasted so good! Bookings available from 1pm.

$50 for 2 courses
$65 for 2 courses inc a Maille Bloody Mary or House made Mulled wine

Menu
Every Maille Sunday Kai event will offer a vegetarian option of eggplant parmigiana with buffalo mozzarella, Maille Dijon mustard, tomato ragù, garlic potato and broccolini.

3 August
Free-range roast porchetta served with garlic potato, creamed spinach, broccolini, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and apple sauce.
Dessert: Sticky toffee pudding with custard.

10 August
Roast duck breast served with duck fat roast potatoes, Chinese broccoli, mushrooms, Yorkshire pudding, and Maille Dijon mustard and onion cream.
Dessert: Dark chocolate torte with orange mascarpone.

17 August
Conscious Valley roast lamb shoulder with garlic roast potatoes, honey-glazed carrots, minted peas, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and mint sauce.
Dessert: Bread and butter pudding with ginger gelato and crème anglaise.

24 August
Half a roast chicken with duck fat roast potatoes, garlic green beans, cavolo nero, Yorkshire pudding, chicken schmaltz and Maille mustard gravy.
Dessert: Steamed honey pudding with custard and honey gelato.

31 August
First Light roast sirloin served with honey-glazed carrots, duck fat roast potatoes, cabbage and bacon, Yorkshire pudding, horseradish, Maille Dijon mustard and jus.
Dessert: Chocolate fondant with vanilla bean gelato.

description:
Makers and Shakers, Makers and Shakers is back for 2025. Indulge in three one-of-a-kind love potions, each masterfully crafted by the talented team at Cuckoo Emporium and served in a unique ceramic vessel. These beautiful, handmade pieces come from the skilled local potters of the Wellington Potters Association. description:
Michelin Star to Martinborough, Join celebrated Chef and Union Square owner Adam Newell for a once-in-a-lifetime culinary experience. Take a journey through four decades of his exceptional career, including his Michelin-starred tenure at the renowned Fulham Road Restaurant in London. This exclusive event will offer an intimate exploration of Chef Newell's evolution as a chef and restaurateur, showcasing iconic dishes from four pivotal periods in his career.

Set in the elegant Napoleon dining room inside the historic Martinborough Hotel, each course represents a defining moment in Chef Newell’s career. Paired with fine wines selected by in-house Sommelier Carl Fraser, this evening is designed to be a feast for both the palate and the mind.

Course 1: 1980s – Claridge’s Hotel, London
A taste of the refined sophistication from one of London’s most prestigious hotels.
Course 2: 1990s – Le Gavroche, London
A nod to the classic French techniques that helped shape Chef Newell's early career.
Course 3: 2000s – Zibibbo, Wellington
A celebration of New Zealand’s finest ingredients and a significant step in his culinary journey.
Course 4: 2010s – Union Square Bistro, Martinborough
Reflecting his achievements at Union Square, the course that represents his current culinary vision.

This evening offers guests a unique chance to experience the evolution of one chef's journey through extraordinary dishes paired with wines that elevate each moment.

description:
Mischief Night Murder Mystery Feast with Chef Max Gordy, 30 October, 🎃 Step inside, if you dare... on the eve of Halloween. It's a Mischief Night* full of tricks and frights!
👻 A chilling murder mystery unfolds over a hauntingly good three-course Halloween dinner by Chef Max Gordy.
Gather your cleverest friends... who will crack the case first: the detectives or the villains?
Expect twists, laughter, and a touch of fright, with spot prizes through the night — plus a reward for the best-dressed.
🍽️ Award-winning chef Max Gordy (Graze Wine Bar) will conjure up a frightfully delicious Halloween-themed feast.
🥂 Your ticket includes one complimentary alcoholic beverage (with more available to purchase on the night).
TICKET TYPES
Round up your squad of six to solve the mystery and devour a fiendishly good feast for $666.
Have a frightening four-some? Book a table for $444.
Spooky single seats available for $111... we will seat you at a mystery table for some mischief!
VENUE
60 Dixon Street is up a flight of steep steps – with only one way in.
FUNDRAISING
Every ticket sold helps Kaibosh ensure that no good food is left to die.  
By joining us for this night of spooky fun, you’ll be directly helping us rescue quality surplus kai and get it to those who need it most.
*What is Mischief Night? In parts of Pennsylvania and New Jersey in the eastern USA, 30 October is called “Mischief Night.” The tradition refers to the eve of Halloween in which children and teenagers celebrate the holiday one night early with pranks, tricks and more. While in New England, some call it Cabbage Night...
Join us to experience Chef Max Gordy's culinary take on Mischief Night in Pōneke!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Mystery Feast on Mischief Night! Halloween dinner with Chef Max Gordy

A chilling murder mystery unfolds over a hauntingly good three-course Halloween dinner by Chef Max Gordy!
On 30 October, gather your cleverest friends and find your darkest ghoulish attire
Who will crack the case first: the Detectives or the Villains?

Expect twists, laughter, and a touch of fright
with spot prizes through the night — plus a reward for the best-dressed.
Award-winning chef Max Gordy ( @grazewinebar ) will conjure up a frightfully delicious Halloween-themed feast.
Your ticket includes one complimentary alcoholic beverage (with more available to purchase on the night).
Every ticket sold helps Kaibosh ensure that no good food is left to die.

Bring a team of six to solve the mystery and devour a fiendishly good feast for $666.
Have a frightening four-some? Book a table for $444.
Spooky single seats available for $111... we will seat you at a mystery table...
VENUE
60 Dixon Street is up a flight of steep steps – with only one way in.
What is Mischief Night?
In parts of Pennsylvania and New Jersey in the eastern USA, 30 October is called “Mischief Night.” The tradition refers to the eve of Halloween in which children and teenagers celebrate the holiday one night early with pranks, tricks and more. While in New England, some call it Cabbage Night...

description:
Netherfield Ball, Step into the enchanting world of Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice at Homewood, where the timeless elegance of a Regency-era ball comes to life. This evening of romance, music, and culinary delight invites you to relive the iconic moments of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr Darcy’s fateful meeting.

Guests will be greeted with crafted cocktails inspired by love potions, showcasing ingredients from some of the finest distilleries in New Zealand and the United Kingdom. As the evening unfolds, indulge in a carefully curated selection of canapés, created with fresh ingredients sourced from Homewood’s own garden, evoking the flavours and charm of the Regency period.

The grand setting of Homewood, the esteemed residence of the British High Commissioner, will transport you to a bygone era. With the glow of garden lighting, live music filling the air, and an atmosphere brimming with romance, you’ll feel as if you’ve stepped into Austen’s world. Dancing will play a central role in the evening, allowing guests to immerse themselves in the grace and grandeur of the Regency social scene.

Whether you’re an Austen devotee, a fan of Bridgerton, or simply drawn to the allure of historical elegance, this event promises to captivate your imagination and senses. Don’t miss this rare opportunity to be part of a night filled with charm, sophistication, and timeless romance.
label: Food & Drink

description:
New Year's Eve Set Menu at Hippo, Hippo’s turning the New Year’s Eve celebration up a notch. We’re ready to toast the year that was (and is) the only way we know how — with a little harbour sparkle, a lot of flavour, and a healthy dose of Hippo charm.

Join us for a three-course set menu by Chef Antoine featuring your choice of one of three dishes per course. Each plate blends classic French technique with the best of New Zealand’s produce.

Kick things off with Champagne on arrival, dance to the beat of live music, and the kind of flavour that keeps the night flowing.

It’s time to celebrate new beginnings, old friends, new friends and the magic of being back together — the Hippo way.

Tickets are $119 per adult for a 1.5-hour session from 5:30pm – 9:30pm (last sitting), open until late.

Seats are limited. Book your spot and bring in the New Year with a little extra flair.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Next Gen Cook Off, The Next Gen Cook Off returns for its fifth year, and things are heating up at Everybody Eats.
Every Monday in August, four of Wellington’s freshest young chefs will go head-to-head in a high-energy kitchen takeover, serving up epic three-course dinners using rescued food.

Each chef will be given the same protein, generously provided by Meat Direct, but everything else is a surprise—ingredients are revealed that morning, based on what’s come in. Menus are created on the spot, and dishes are served to a buzzing, hungry crowd. It’s fast-paced, creative chaos with serious culinary skills on display. Guests get a front-row seat to the action, while supporting a truly game-changing enterprise.

4 August — Jessie Gibberd, Loretta
Originally from rural Waikato, Jessie Gibberd made the move to Wellington to study, but it was the buzz of hospitality that captured her heart. Swapping textbooks for tongs, she left her degree behind to dive headfirst into the kitchen. Now a chef de partie at Loretta, Jessie brings a grounded, fresh perspective to one of the city’s most beloved eateries.

11 August — Felipe Molina, El Matador
Hailing from Chile, Felipe Molina is a professional chef with over 15 years of experience in kitchens around the world. Having worked in several countries and world-class restaurants, Felipe brings a global sensibility to his craft. With a passion for seafood, meats, and bold, expressive flavours, his cooking is shaped by travel and tradition, blending international influence with creativity on every plate.

18 August — Zane Gupwell, Graze
Zane Gupwell began his hospitality journey at just 15, washing dishes at a local café in Mount Eden. From there, he headed to Queenstown, learning from a wide range of chefs and kitchen styles before challenging himself with a move to Wellington. Since then, he’s worked at some of the city’s top restaurants and now brings his thoughtful, evolving style to Graze Wine Bar.

25 August — Lulu Temmuyin, Mr Go’s
Lulu Temmuyin is a chef who loves pushing boundaries, even when they’re unexpected. Lactose intolerant but obsessed with cheese, and not a fan of lamb but winner of a lamb cooking competition, Lulu is all about surprises. At Mr Go’s, she brings bold, sustainable flavour to the forefront, blending personality with punch in every dish.

Everybody Eats runs on a pay-what-you-can model, transforming food waste into gourmet meals and bringing the community together over good kai. The Next Gen Cook Off celebrates and champions this mission, proving that rescued food can be next-level delicious.

The Next Gen Cook Off is proudly supported by The Gas Hub.
label: Food & Drink

description:
North City Crack Chicken x Heinz Fried Chicken Sauce Pop-Up, Heinz’s fan-favourite Fried Chicken Sauce has finally landed in Aotearoa, and it’s making its NZ debut in style – with a limited-time pop-up collab at Crack Chicken. Already a hit with fried chicken fans overseas for its creamy, sweet and spicy kick, the sauce is now hitting Crack Chicken menus nationwide for one week only.

On the special menu:
- The Supreme Chicken Burger (crispy fried chicken, slaw, pickles and a generous layer of sauce)

- Crack Chicken’s golden Blooming Onion made for dipping,

- Plus the option to add the new Heinz Fried Chicken Sauce to anything and everything on the menu.

When: Friday 3 – Sunday 12 October 2025

Where:
- Crack Chicken Ponsonby – 168 Ponsonby Road, Auckland
- Crack Chicken Hamilton - Made Mess Hall - 401 Grey Street, Hamilton East
- Crack Chicken Willis Lane – 1 Willis Street, Wellington Central
- Crack Chicken North City - North City Mall – Porirua

Hot tip: Sauce lovers and fried chicken fans won’t want to miss this limited-time pop-up – once it’s gone, it’s gone.

description:
Nutcracker High Tea, QTea twirls into a sun-drenched daydream with a high tea inspired by The Nutcracker. In partnership with the Royal New Zealand Ballet, we’re serving a festive fairytale where Christmas meets choreography – with a Kiwiana twist.

Perched above the harbour, QTea High Tea reimagines its plated treats into a sugar plum dreamland. Think raspberry-layered delights, golden pistachio choux, smoked salmon cups and piroshki that dance on the palate.

Sip in style and cheers to the season with The Mouse King’s Toast, Prosecco and Guignolet fizzing with festive sparkle. Craving something a little nuttier? Try The Storm Master’s Tipple. For pure summer magic in a glass, reach for the Sugar Plum Fairy Fizz.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Nyumbani: A Taste of Tanzania, Journey through the heart of Tanzania with dishes that feel like home - comforting, bold, and full of love. This special five-course degustation is created by Chef Shuchi Bhardwaj, a baker who grew up in Tanzania and carries its flavours, traditions, and warmth in her heart. 
Whether it’s the warm embrace of coconut-infused stews, smoky grilled meats, or fragrant spiced rice, each course is a reminder of how food connects us. This menu brings authentic East African flavours to the table, reimagined in a modern way that feels like home. Each course is matched with a carefully selected wine to enhance the flavours of the dish. Expect generous hospitality and a setting that feels like stepping into a Tanzanian family gathering.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Paritua, The Botanist & Sea Shepherd!, We've teamed up with Paritua Vineyard and Sea Shepherd NZ to bring you a fantastic evening of dining and drinking excellent wine! We'll be serving a four course plant based dinner, matched with Paritua wines, in support of Sea Shepherd New Zealand.
⁠
Each dish draws its inspiration from the sea with a kiwi twist, designed by our head chef Stephanie Hinton. Stephanie has recently moved back to New Zealand after 16 years cheffing in London, and running acclaimed vegan businesses there. Each course is paired with organic and vegan wines presented by Ollie Kettle and Josh Pointon of Paritua Wines. Proceeds from tickets sold will be donated directly to Sea Shepherd to help protect our oceans.
Numbers are limited, so gather your friends and book early for an unforgettable night of food, wine and ocean conservation.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Pizza Night at Longbush Cottage, Authentic wood-fired Napoletana pizzas by Roving Pizza, a garden bar, and golden-hour vibes — join us for Pizza Night at Longbush Cottage!

Roving Pizza with their mobile wood-fired oven will be serving up authentic Napoletana pizzas — soft, crunchy, and unforgettable. Pair your pizza with a glass from our licensed garden bar, offering local wines, beers, and low/no alcohol options.

Relax in the gardens, grab a seat at a picnic table, or throw down a rug and enjoy golden-hour views. Kids are welcome (with supervision).

- Our Emporium may be open for a spot of gift shopping

- Card facilities available

Tickets: Free entry — just pay for food & drinks.

description:
Pre order Thai foods, NEXT WEEK'S THAI COMFORT SPECIAL IS HERE!

Get ready for our Kin Favorite: Beef Mince Pad Kaprao with Fried Egg
!
This is the ultimate Thai street food classic, and here's why you need to pre-order:
Tender, savory beef mince is wok-tossed with a fiery, fragrant blend of fresh chilies, garlic, and aromatic fresh basil. The high heat of the wok creates a spicy-sweet, intensely savory glaze that is totally addictive.
Served hot over jasmine rice and crowned with a crispy-edged, runny-yolked fried egg. Break that yolk and mix it all together for a bite of pure happiness!
PLUS! Our signature Chicken or Tofu Satay is still on the menu for the perfect side.
Delivery Dates:
Dinner: Wednesday, October 8th
Lunch: Friday, October 10th
Order Cut-Off: Monday, October 6th, 9 PM
Pre-order now to secure your Thai feast!
#ThaiFood #BeefLover #thaicomfortfood #supportlocal #toobusytocook #busyparents #wellingtonfood #thaifoodwellington #kineatwellington

description:
Robbie Burns Day, Join us at the Thistle Inn, Wellington’s only Scottish pub, for a lively celebration of Robbie Burns!

Immerse yourself in a Scottish experience with a specially crafted Scottish-themed set menu that promises to delight your palate. As the Dunwofflin Ceilidh Band fills the air with traditional melodies, you can also find yourself enjoying captivating poetry readings, including the iconic Ode to the Haggis.

To top off the afternoon, raise a glass and savour a selection of fine Scottish whiskys, perfectly complementing the festivities.

Don’t miss this chance to celebrate the legacy of Robbie Burns! Book now for an unforgettable afternoon of culture, music, and community.

Limited seats.

description:
Rotten Luck Fermentation Club Special CHEESE-MAKING – Pop-up Parlour 2025, Rotten Luck Fermentation Club Special CHEESE-MAKING – Pop-up Parlour 2025
The Rotten Luck Club is at the Pop-up Parlour!

Come along for a 2 hour cheese-making demonstration and tasting session! Local enthusiast Erin will guide us through the process and share her love for all things cheese.

• What - 2 hr workshop where you'll be shown how to making a fresh batch of cheese (probably halloumi and maybe also paneer), and everyone can take some home.
• When - 2pm-4pm, 28 September 2025
• Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay (opposite school)
• Cost - $10 per person BOOK NOW ( https://tinyurl.com/5n7twce7)
• What to bring? Anything yummy for the tasting session. Bonus points if it is home made.
• Who - Kids welcome to join but they will need their own ticket and must be supervised by a caregiver at all times.

We will also have a tasting session of different types of cheeses for everyone to sample.

Bring any questions you have and you'll be able to look at the range of equipment used too. Will have tips and tricks for setting up at home, including sourcing the right type of milk and getting your hands on some rennet.


Other Rotten Luck Fermentation Club events at the Pop-up:

- Sauerkraut & Kimchi (Rangatahi & Adults) $10. https://tinyurl.com/7myhk5v9
- Bread-making $20 https://tinyurl.com/yfkderv7
- Recipe Discovery @ PKB Library, free https://tinyurl.com/byswfp93
- Sauerkraut & Kimchi (Kids) $10 https://tinyurl.com/4hdapf3b
- Whiskey-making @RSA $20 https://tinyurl.com/2a26z3yt

All paid events are helping to fundraise for the Pop-up Parlour.

The bar at the RSA will be open for further alcohol purchases. Please do not bring your own alcohol to the venue.

Note, no paywave facilities. Cash and card only. Do not drink and drive - arrange a lift if you are drinking alcohol. Pukerua Bay Hub will not be liable for any unruly behaviour.


____________________________________
WHAT IS THE POP-UP PARLOUR?
A chance to create and connect in our pop-up community space. From 1-30 September we've got a jam-packed schedule with 65+ events for kids, families, rangatahi and adults to learn, hang out and have fun.

Check out all the free/koha events too -
https://www.pkbhub.org.nz/whatson

Waiho i te toipoto, kaua i te toi roa –
Let us keep close together, not far apart.

description:
Santa Cipolla, “Holy Onion”. For the entire month, Cicio Cacio Osteria is getting brave and bold, celebrating the magic of vegetables in all their glory, especially the santa cipolla (aka the holy onion). 
Vegetables bring colour, life and joy. In Italy, they mark the rhythm of the seasons, stir up cherished memories and signal the excitement of fresh beginnings. Come along and experience vibrant flavours with playful snacks, fun street food, freshly baked breads, handmade pasta and a brand new range of dishes that celebrate the beauty, bounty and simplicity of Italian cuisine.
label: Food & Drink

description: Santiago to Buenos Aires, Noble Rot sommeliers Maciej Zimny and Jessica Wood invite you to embark on their recent road trip through Chile and Argentina. They will indulge you with stories and share their experiences through these two fantastic wine countries alongside a South American themed five-course degustation menu including dishes they enjoyed on their journey. Relax and enjoy their tales and insight into why the wines taste the way they do, the key stylistic differences between the two countries, and learn from them first-hand the secrets of why Chilean and Argentine wines are ones to watch in the future.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Saturday 'BAKES' By Onslow College, Each Saturday, we offer a variety of sourdough products next to Onslow College. We always have doughnuts, but on Saturdays we offer bread, savoury baked items (this Saturday, we have brioche), and mini-celebratory sourdough doughnuts.
All products can be pre-ordered and picked up on Saturday morning through our website.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/weekly-menu/
EFTPOS is always available.
Our boxed mini-celebratory doughnuts, 70% of the original size, are available for a sale price of $25 for a box of all six flavours.
Our regular doughnuts cost $6 each or $22 for a box of 4 doughnuts.
We also offer catering at Family Kitchen with Mark, so if you have a function or need for in-house dining, check out all our packages on our website. Our doughnuts are also available for purchase all week. Contact Mark on 021 0223 0824 for next-day pickup.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/grazing-tables-theme.../
All our doughnuts contain a lively sourdough & biga starter, for a fuller flavour profile and a springy texture.
Have you tried our sourdough doughnuts yet?
Our doughnuts can be pre-ordered and picked up on the day to avoid disappointment (should we run out).
We launch a new flavour every two weeks and have created over 180 combinations since selling three years ago.
Support has been phenomenal, and we thank everyone so very much indeed for the weekly sales.
If you are not following us on our social media channels, please consider doing so, as it helps the company grow and increases the exposure of our products. Thank you.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Sconnoisseur, Get ready to master the art of making Wellington's iconic cheese scones at Pravda Café. Widely regarded as the home of the city's best cheese scones, Pravda's creations are so beloved, they often sell out before you can blink. Now, you can learn the secrets behind their mouthwatering scones firsthand.

In this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through mixing and preparing your own batch of Pravda’s famous cheese scones. Once your dough is ready, you'll hand them off to be baked to crispy flaky perfection. While they cook, relax with a cup of tea or coffee, and once your scones are ready, you’ll enjoy the fruits of your labour fresh from the oven.

The best part? You’ll get to take home the coveted recipe, allowing you to recreate these legendary scones in your own kitchen whenever you want. This is a perfect opportunity to learn a piece of Wellington’s culinary history and enjoy a deliciously rewarding experience.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Shift into Spring, Shift into Spring
Come and join us this vernal equinox - where the days and nights begin to balance, marking the start of spring! we will be raiding the pantry, using the last of the larder, and the new spring growth to celebrate the end of the winter season. we will be serving a four course meal featuring preserves, pulses and pastries (and a few other tricks up our sleeve) with matching drinks - Two nights only, Wednesday and Thursday the 17th and 18th of September. $120pp
Book through our website:

https://lustrekitchenanddining.co.nz/booking.html

Look forward to seeing you there!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Sip the Sky: Paint, Sip and Stargaze, Paint:
Begin the evening with a night sky-inspired painting session at Ventana Art Space - 7 Kitchener Street. Whether you're a seasoned artist or picking up a brush for the first time, this relaxed, hands-on experience invites you to create under the spell of twilight tones and celestial charm.

Sip:
Then head next door for a guided wine tasting from the passionate team at The Good Way (located beside the Martinborough Brewery on Ohio Street), showcasing a selection of their elegant, small-batch wines. Find your favourite and grab a bottle to take home—perfect for gifting or continuing the magic later.

Taste:
Indulge your senses with a chocolate tasting hosted by Elly from be happy chocolate. Sample her handcrafted, ethically made bars and select your favourite block to take home. Please advise any dietary requirements when booking. Warm your hands around a velvety be happy hot chocolate and...

Stargaze:
Head outside for a gentle stroll to Considine Park with Charlotte from Wairarapa Dark Sky. Walk in the Dark while sipping hot chocolate. A chance to understand the benefits of the dark sky and finish with some star gazing.

Timing is flexible to allow for moving between locations, if you'd like to order food from The Social Kitchen food truck at the Brewery, etc. The latest finish time would be 8.45pm.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Snacks Amore, When the host brings you bread, instead of a red flag...Snacks Amore!
Amuse Snack Bar invites food lovers to ditch the dating apps for one delicious night of light-hearted speed dating and snack-based bonding at their Euro-inspired aperitivo haven. Whether you are after a snack (human) or a snack (sustenance), you're guaranteed to leave with a full heart and a satisfied appetite.
Each attendee will enjoy 12 mini dates and 6 courses of Italian-inspired snacklets – cacio e pepe, agrodolce, pasta alla norma, porchetta, and zabaione, all served in perfect bite-sized form. A glass of Lambrusco kicks off the evening, with a cheeky mini tiramisu maritozzo to take home. Throughout the event, wines curated by the charming Richard Klein of Artigiano Imports will be on offer, alongside Amuse’s house spritz, Negroni, and Parrotdog Lager.
The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming – more aperitivo hour than high-pressure matchmaking. The Amuse team, also musicians, will guide the evening with playful icebreakers, musical moments, and a light-touch structure that makes meeting new people easy and enjoyable.
Two themed evenings allow guests to choose their best fit:

Evening 1: General Assembly
Grouped on the night by chosen generation:
• 5:30pm – Millennials (28–45)
• 7:30pm – Gen X (40–60)

Evening 2: Rainbow Night
Grouped by dating preference.
• 6:30pm – she for her upstairs, he for him downstairs.

The event warmly welcomes all gender identities and sexual orientations. Attendees will be asked to indicate who they’re interested in dating at checkout, but gender identity remains private unless individuals wish to share it. Symbols and nametags on the night will help create a fun and inclusive vibe. Amuse Snack Bar is proud to be an LGBTQIA+ friendly space.
label: Food & Drink

description:

Our sourdough doughnuts are priced at $22 for a box of 4 or $6 each. We also offer mini-celebratory doughnuts, a box of all six flavours for $25. The main hot dish is priced at a very reasonable $18 per portion.
EFTPOS is available.
If you want to pre-order, go to our website https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/weekly-menu/
We really appreciate The Animal Medical Centre allowing us to sell outside their new business.
Should you require an excellent veterinary service, contact the team at NEW Animal Medical Centre
https://www.animalmedicalcentre.co.nz/
Family Kitchen with Mark also offers catering. You can visit our website to see our packages if you have a function or require in-house dining. Our doughnuts are also available for purchase Monday to Saturday. Could you contact us to organise?

Limited space available so get in quick.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Spy in the Wild, Step into a world of mystery, flavour, and espionage at The Green Man Pub on Wednesday, 23rd October.
Doors open at 6:00pm, with the main event kicking off at 6:30pm. You’ll be welcomed with a sealed mission envelope containing your assignment for the evening. In teams, you’ll work to crack codes, decipher tasting notes, and unravel clues inspired by Spy Valley’s wines and the stories behind them.
Along the way, enjoy five chef-crafted canapés, each perfectly matched with a hand-picked Spy Valley wine. Expect a captivating atmosphere enhanced by lasers and special effects, transforming the pub into a true espionage experience.
🎟️ Tickets from $50 – includes six canapés with wine pairings and your mission dossier. Places are limited, so secure your spot before this top-secret evening sells out.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Summer Saturdays with Lighthouse Gin, Settle in at our cottage for a leisurely summer afternoon under the trees. Join us every Saturday in January from 2-7pm for refreshing Lighthouse Gin & Tonics, wood-fired pizzas and chilled summer tunes.

Kicking off the Saturday series on 3rd January, we have DJ Takas spinning some laid-back beats to set the scene. DJ Takas will also play on Saturday, 17th January 2026.

Stretch out on a bean bag in the shade or claim a sunny spot on the cottage veranda, G&T in hand.

No bookings required, just turn up and unwind.

The Runholder Restaurant & Tasting Room will be open as normal from 11am.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Summer Sessions I Under the Stars I An Evening at Ata Rangi, Join us at Ata Rangi for a long-table dinner amongst the vines - an evening brimming with beautiful food, exceptional wine, and lively company.

Savour seasonal, locally inspired cuisine by Ant North, celebrated for dishes that bring the best of the Wairarapa to the table. Served family-style, each course is paired with a hand-picked selection of Ata Rangi wines, while Sam Auger’s warm, intimate evening sets create the perfect soundtrack for the night.

Your ticket includes a generous, joy-filled evening:

- Welcome drinks at sunset
- Long-table dining amongst the vines
- Seasonal food shared family-style
- A curated selection of Ata Rangi wines
- Time to connect, relax, and celebrate
- Live music to match the evening

Set beneath the stars of Wairarapa’s Dark Sky Reserve, this promises to be an unforgettable night. Gather your friends and join the extended Ata Rangi family for an intimate celebration full of laughter, wine, and magic from dusk until dark.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Sushi Unfolded: A Vegan Demonstration & Tasting, Back by popular demand! An evening of flavour, creativity, and connection as Balarama once again shares the craft of vegan sushi-making. From delicate hand-pressed pieces to beautifully rolled varieties, you’ll watch each step come to life in an engaging demonstration that’s both practical and inspiring.

Balarama’s grounded and approachable style makes the process easy to follow—even if it’s your first time exploring sushi-making. There’ll be space for questions throughout, and plenty of tastings along the way—so come hungry!

On the menu for the demo:

* Hand-pressed sushi (Nigiri)

* Sushi rolls (Maki-zushi)

* Tofu pocket sushi (Inari-zushi)

Afterwards, stay on for a full vegan dinner and dessert, freshly served and enjoyed in good company—a deliciously relaxed way to spend your evening.

Meet Balarama, your chef & host
Say hello to Balarama, our amazing chef who’s always meditating on his next culinary creation. At Bhakti Lounge, he’s known for mastering a range of cuisines—from comforting classics to vibrant international dishes. Lately, he’s been exploring the delicate and artful world of Japanese cooking, crafting plant-based sushi that’s as beautiful as it is flavorful. Balarama’s goal is to make food that feels nourishing, thoughtful, and easy to enjoy—like a home-cooked meal made with heart. With his calm, down-to-earth style, he makes even the most intricate dishes feel approachable.
label: Food & Drink

description: Sweet Sensations, Noble Rot wants to sing the praises of sweet wines and help you to learn that they aren't just one note. They'll showcase a range of wines from around the world that lean towards the sweeter side without leaving a cloying sensation on your palate, enhanced by a specially-curated five-course degustation menu from entree to dessert. If you would like to explore your favourite level of sweetness in wine, this event is for you. The knowledgeable Noble Rot team are here to show you that sweetness is one of wine’s most versatile assets, as well-balanced sweetness in wine can be delicate, elegant and complementary to both sweet and savoury dishes. Discover how some grape varieties are more suited to producing sweeter wines and how their level of sweetness is achieved. If you're into the sweeter things in life, this one is for you.
label: Food & Drink

description:
THE SOUL TABLE 5 Course Dinner | 5 DECEMBER 2025, THE SOUL TABLE 5 Course Dinner | 5 DECEMBER 2025
This 5-Course dinner is a special pop-up menu designed by one of our bachelor students.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables arranged per order

About this Event

This 5-Course dinner is a special one-off pop-up event and is not one of our typical LCBNZ Brasserie dinners. It features a bespoke menu created by Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business student Sagar Rajan, inspired by his culinary journey and his current workplace, Koji Restaurant.
Due to popular demand we have opened an additional 20 seats for the 5th of December.

Ticket Information
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Friday 5th December
Price: $99 per person
Booking Times: 6:30pm
Matched Wine Option: If you would like to add matched wines to your dining experience you can do so on the day by paying an additional charge. Alternatively, we have a selection of wines to purchase by the glass or bottle as well as beers and soft drinks. We are a fully licensed restaurant and do not offer BYO.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.
The Menu: will not be released before the event. Please be aware that the menu will include fish, meat and shellfish components.
Tickets are allocated for specific seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu 5 course dining experience is 2 hours. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' creations.




What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Cuisine programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.

Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy
• No refunds are provided unless the event is cancelled by Le Cordon Bleu NZ.
• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Taste & Create - A Painting with Sugar Valentine Affair, Taste and Create a palette of passion at the historic Inverlochy house. Join us in indulging in hand-crafted pastries by the renowned Maxine Schecter of Sugar Flour while working with Inverlochy's skilled tutors to create a piece of art in your choice of medium (drawing, printmaking, pastel painting, ceramics). Pastries are paired with refined tea and non-alcoholic bubbles.

The exact pastries are going to be a surprise (we'll drop hints along the way in the lead up to the event)! So pastries pictured are not what you'll get. The pastries will be incredibly seasonal and fruit focused (if anyone has any fruit allergies they’re unsure of you can can contact Maxine directly before booking). Maxine can also offer gluten free and gelatine free options for the dietaries too.

About the team:

Maxine Schecter is a French trained pastry chef who has worked in restaurants and patisseries in Wellington (Logan Brown), Paris (Gâteaux Thoumieux), London (The Fat Duck and Sketch) and is the author of Patisserie Made Simple: The Art of Petits Gateau.

Inverlochy Art School offers a broad range of high quality art classes and workshops, taught by a community of enthusiastic and talented practicing artists all year round. We believe in art for art's sake and allow students to find freedom in creative exploration.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Casual Dram: 19, It’s time for another Casual Dram, and this time we’ll be taking a look at distillation rates - with double, partial-triple and triple distilled whiskies all making an appearance.
If you’ve ever looked at the flow chart for partial triple distillation, you’ll know that this sort of thing can be pretty complex!
But fear not, I promise we won’t be getting too scientific - and we’ll taste an interesting mix of official and independently bottled crackers, across a multitude of ages from some all-time fave distilleries; Mortlach, Benrinnes, Bunnahabhain and Amrut.
Here’s the lineup…
Bunnahabhain 12 years old 2023 Cask Strength Edition 60.1% (Sherry casks) WB 87.27
Mortlach 'Signatory Symington's Choice' 2007 / 17 years old #205 56.6% (1st Fill Oloroso Sherry Butt Finish) WB 88.23
Benrinnes Adelphi 13 years old 55.5% (1st Fill Oloroso Sherry Hogshead) WB 88.19
Amrut Triparva Triple Distilled 50% (casks as yet unknown) WB 87.19
Mystery whisky WB 88.11
I hope you can join me for another tilt at five tip top drams!
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Enchanted Ale Quarter, Enter the magical realm of The Enchanted Ale Quarter, a fairytale-inspired pop-up tavern where whimsy, wonder and craft beer collide.

Step into a storybook setting, with twinkling lights, woodland decor, and forest-fantasy touches around every corner. Feast on gnome and fairy-themed comfort food like the solstice salad, loaded forest fries, sirens & ships fish & chips, and a decadent dark forest brownie, all paired with enchanted brews and mythical tipples.

Cosy, curious, and otherworldly, The Enchanted Ale Quarter brings a little magic to Wellington’s winter nights. Dust off your wings and join us for a pint, some sustenance or a potion, no quest required.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Love Ferry, Interislander is docking onshore to bring burger lovers something truly special — The Love Ferry a spicy beef and pork patty with melted Kāpiti brie, caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket, truffle aioli, crispy Harringtons bacon and pickled jalapeños in a Poneke Bakery red brioche bun, with smoked paprika and sea salt sprinkled fries.
This gourmet tribute to the love of food is served straight from the iconic Interislander ship box. Back by popular demand, the Interislander pop-up burger truck is making waves once again, offering a taste of the Interislander experience without even setting sail.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Lunch Society: New Year, New Connections, The Lunch Society – New Year, New Connections: A 2026 Kick-Off Lunch with Diana Marsh, CEO Experience Wellington

Start your year with purpose, connection and a seriously inspiring conversation.

Join us for the first Lunch Society event of 2026, featuring Diana Marsh, CEO of Experience Wellington, as our keynote speaker. Diana will share her vision for Wellington’s future — from arts, culture and events to the city’s evolving identity and what lies ahead for our capital in the coming year.

This intimate lunch is designed for women who value meaningful connections, great conversation and a beautifully curated dining experience. Expect a warm, welcoming atmosphere, a delicious multi-course lunch, thoughtful spot prizes and plenty of opportunities to connect with like-minded women from across Wellington.

Why you’ll love it:

- Insightful keynote from one of Wellington’s most influential leaders

- Curated lunch in a stunning venue

- Meet inspiring women across business, creative and community sectors

- Spot prizes throughout the afternoon

- Feel-good vibes to kick off 2026 on a high

About Diana Marsh:
Diana Marsh is the CEO of Experience Wellington, the organisation behind many of the city’s most loved cultural institutions, venues and experiences. Passionate about place-making, creativity and community, Diana is a powerful voice shaping Wellington’s cultural heartbeat.

Spaces are limited and our events always sell out — we’d love you at the table.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Lunch Society: Spring Edition, Join us for 'The Lunch Society: Spring Edition' , an afternoon of delicious food, meaningful connections, and inspiring conversations to warm the soul.

The Lunch Society is a quarterly ladies’ lunch event designed to bring together women in Wellington for networking, entertainment, and philanthropy.

This event is all about bringing together like-minded individuals to connect, learn, and share in a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. Expect an engaging guest speaker, valuable networking opportunities, and plenty of moments to inspire you.

Settle in for a beautifully curated experience featuring:

• A powerful keynote by Kristy Grant on New Voices, Fresh Stories: Women Leading Creative Change
• A delicious three-course set menu and a refreshing welcome drink on arrival
• An exclusive goodie bag for every guest + spot prizes
• A chance to give back, with a portion of all ticket sales donated to a charity : KidsCan + Cancer Society

Whether you're a returning guest or joining us for the first time, you’ll be welcomed into a warm, inclusive space that celebrates women, ambition, and community. Come to be inspired, stay to be part of something bigger.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Wellington Food Show, Are you ready to reignite your passion for cooking and get inspired with new flavours? Then look no further than The Food Show, Wellington's ultimate foodie extravaganza! This isn’t just another trip to the market — it’s an immersive culinary adventure that will excite all your senses.

Prepare to witness culinary rockstars in action as they whip up their signature dishes live! Renowned chefs and culinary stars, including MasterChef winners Nadia Lim, Sam Low, and the hilarious Annabelle White, will be sharing their tips, tricks, and insider knowledge in the Chance Voight Cooking Theatre. Whether you’re looking to master a new dish or get ideas to elevate your meals, this is your chance to get inspired and bring restaurant-worthy meals into your own kitchen.

Beyond the live cooking demonstrations, The Food Show is packed with exclusive show specials you won’t want to miss. Stock up on pantry essentials at unbeatable prices, discover hidden gems from local producers, or indulge in luxurious gourmet treats — all while saving big on products you can’t find anywhere else.

Whether you're a seasoned chef or just getting started, The Food Show is your ticket to discovering the best in food, flavour, and fun.
label: Food & Drink

description: Tire-toi une bûche, Executive Chef Jonny Taggart shares his love for the classic – and not-so-classic – flavours of Quebec. Fresh from a culinary adventure in Montreal, Jonny returns with an open heart, an inspired palate, and plenty to share. This special menu will feature everything from Tourtière (French Canadian meat pie) and smoked meat sandwiches to the beloved pairing of poutine with a steamie (Montreal-style hot dog), along with the sweet and comforting tarte farlouche. No need to book. Just come along with your friends and family and enjoy these French Canadian delights!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Traditional Kölsch Service!, Kölsch Service is BACK!! Enjoy our fresh batch of Dösen Kölsch the traditional way - just like in Köln.
What's Kölsch service?
It's kinda like beer yum cha but there's only one thing on the menu - 200ml glasses of Kölsch bier!

We keep track of your tab by marking the edge of your coaster and when your glass is empty - voilà, another glass appears!
If you're done, just pop your coaster on top of your glass to indicate no more.
You can order food and non-alcoholics the same way, just take a seat and everything will come to you.
To make sure you get a table, book here: https://www.meandoses.co.nz/bookings
PLUS DEUTSCHES ESSEN!

We're serving up Apache's take on Currywurst - the classic German streetfood that is a dream with a crisp Kölsch. Yes we'll sort some vegan ones too!
We're also slinging more amazing fresh Brezels
from Brezelmania, served with cheese sauce

We'll be running Kölsch service from 12pm - 5pm on Saturday October 4th, come along and get the Köln experience!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Tītahi Bay Spring Community BBQ, Tītahi Bay Spring Community BBQ
It's (nearly) summer so it's time for a BBQ! Come and join us at 43 Kapiti Crescent (St Matthew's Hall) for a BBQ on the lawn. If it's bad weather, we will move into the hall.

All welcome! Dinner will be served from 5pm; we will make dinner, so just bring yourselves!



FAQ

Who is this for? Can I come along?

Yes absolutely, please come, we would love to have you. This dinner is for all the people who live in the beautiful community of Tītahi Bay!

What if I can't make it until a bit later?

That's all good, we will be serving a rolling dinner from 5 to 6.30pm so come whenever suits you. If you can only come a little later than 6.30pm, we will likely have more than enough so come anyway!

Can I bring my kids along?

Yes! In fact, please bring your kids along. We will have some games in the room and some options for crafts on the tables along with the food.

Do I need to bring anything?

Nope! Just yourselves, all are welcome just as you are.

But I really want to bring something to contribute?

If you would like to bring a salad to contribute to the BBQ, feel free to email us at and we can chat! We really just don't want this to be a barrier to anyone coming along.

Can I help?

Yes absolutely, this is a community event so help is always appreciated. It is also a great time to meet some other people. We will have some tasks for set up and also some for packing down and cleaning up. If you are interested in helping, flick us an email at

Will my dietaries be met?

We will make sure there will be options for these dietaries: vegan, gluten free, dairy free, and nut free.

If you have a dietary that isn't on there, feel free to check and flick us an email.

Can I bring my friend(s) along?

Yes, please bring your friends along, especially if they live in Tītahi Bay!

Who is this hosted by?

This idea is hosted by us, the crew who run Tītahi Bay Anglicans, but it is run with the help of our friends around Tītahi Bay. The hope is that this can become a recurring community event where others can join in on hosting this.

This is at a church, will I be preached to?

No, we promise that this isn't a Tupperware party bait and switch. While we definitely are a church, this event is for the Tītahi Bay community as a whole to be able to come eat together and connect.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Urban Cocktail Trail I Pōneke Wellington (NZ), Urban Cocktail Trail I Pōneke Wellington (NZ)
Get ready Pōneke! The Urban Cocktail Trail is heading your way this Spring for an incredible afternoon of bar-hopping and cocktail sipping!

On Sale Times
Presale Access - Thursday 31 July, 10am NZST
General Access - Thursday 31 July, 12pm NZST

----

Grab your mates and discover the best bars in Pōneke Wellington on the self-guided Urban Cocktail Trail! Whether you're a cocktail lover, or just up for a fun afternoon out, this trail is all about good drinks and great vibes!

Kick things off with a bite at your starting venue, then make your way around using your cocktail vouchers. Where you go and what you sip is totally up to you 🍸

Tickets will fly, so lock yours in and get ready for an afternoon of flavour and fun!


VENUES + SIGNATURE COCKTAILS
🍹Dirty Little Secret Ft. Peachy Pear
Absolut Pear Vodka + Vanilla Galliano + Peach Syrup + Lemon Juice + Egg White

🍹Ernesto's Ft. Pimm'd to the Brim
Pimms + Cucumber Gin + Strawberry Liqueur + Juices

🍹Otto Champagneria & Beer Hall Ft. Saigon Sunset
Papaiti Orchard Gin + Lemongrass Liqueur Syrup + Ginger Syrup + Lime Juice + Soda + Mint

🍹Rosie's Red-Hot Cantina Ft. Coconut Margarita
Cazcabel Coconut Tequila + Triple Sec + Lime Juice + Agave Syrup

🍹St John's Bar Ft. Tiki Trail
Sailor Jerry Spiced Rum + De Kuyper Banana Liqueur + De Kuyper Mango Liqueur + Kwai Feh + Lychee Liqueur + Lemon Juice + Pineapple Juice + Grenad in e

🍹The Old Bailey Ft. Pash & Dash
Rum + Passionfruit Liqueur + Passionfruit Syrup + Lime + Lemonade + Mint & Lime Garnish


TICKETS (Limited Availability)
Option #1 – The Connoisseur | $99
- $10 Food Voucher for your chosen starting venue ( valid until 2 PM )
- 6x Cocktail Vouchers to enjoy at any participating venue ( valid until 5 PM )

Option #2 – The Trailblazer | $75
- $10 Food Voucher for your chosen starting venue ( valid until 2 PM )
- 4x Cocktail Vouchers to use at any participating venue ( valid until 5 PM )
Note: Food options may vary from the venue’s regular menu due to the event format.


EVENT REGISTRATION & VOUCHER COLLECTION
Pick up your event vouchers and guide at the designated registration point before starting your trail.

Event Day Registration
Location: Ernesto's (1 Grey St, Te Aro)
Date: Saturday 6th September
Time: 12 PM – 1:30 PM


REFUND POLICY
No refunds unless the event is canceled or postponed by the organiser.


GETTING AROUND
The Urban Cocktail Trail is a fully self-guided experience. After checking in at your starting venue, explore at your own pace and choose where to stop along the way.


----------

description:
Urban Wine Walk - Pōneke Wellington, The streets and laneways of Pōneke Wellington are set to come alive this Spring as a line-up of eight venues each play host to an incredible winemaker, who'll be there ready to pour and chat you through an unforgettable afternoon.


HOW IT WORKS
Kick things off at your chosen starting spot with something to eat, and then let the adventure unfold. Wander at your own pace, glass in hand, discovering incredible wines and venues along the way.

With a stellar line-up of winemakers, good vibes at every stop, and a guaranteed sell-out crowd, the Urban Wine Walk is the ultimate self-guided tasting experience you and your crew won’t want to miss!


PARTICIPATING VENUES & WINEMAKERS
1 - Choice Bros Ft. Coney Wines (NZ)
2 - Glou Glou Ft. Halite (NZ)
3 - Little Beer Quarter Ft. Hopes Grove & Aard (NZ)
4 - Lulu Bar Ft. Margrain Vineyard (NZ)
5 - Noble Rot Ft. VALLI (NZ)
6 - Panhead Tory St Ft. The Good Way (NZ)
7 - The Arborist Rooftop Bar Ft. Matawhero (NZ)
8 - The Tasting Room Ft. Tettonica Wines (NZ)

*Please note that traditional venue menus may vary due to the nature of the event.


TICKETS
Vino Lover Pass – $79 + Booking Fee (Limited Availability)

WHAT’S INCLUDED
Wine Tastings – Up to 3 wines per winemaker along the trail
$10 Food Voucher – Redeem at your nominated starting venue (before 1pm)
$25 Wine Voucher – Put towards event-day wine orders (six-pack minimum, participating producers only)
Event Essentials – Your official wristband & keepsake tasting glass


EVENT REGISTRATION & COLLECTION
Before heading to your nominated starting venue, swing by the official registration point to collect your wristband, tasting glass & vouchers.

Where: Panhead Tory St (1 Tory St)
When: Saturday 18th October | 11am – 1pm

Please note: The Urban Wine Walk officially runs from 12-4pm. Arrive early to grab your event pack and avoid the rush!


REFUND POLICY
Tickets are non-refundable (we’re all in for good times rain, hail or shine!). The only exception is if the event is cancelled or postponed by the organisers – then we’ve got you covered.


GETTING AROUND
One of the best parts about the Urban Wine Walk...? It’s totally self-guided! After checking in at your nominated starting venue, the day is yours! Wander at your own pace, discover new spots and sip your way through the trail however you like.


Sorry kids, Urban Wine Walk is strictly 18 Years and Over!


----------

Tickets are non-refundable (we’re all in for good times rain, hail or shine!). The only exception is if the event is cancelled or postponed by the organisers – then we’ve got you covered.
GETTING AROUND

**Sorry kids, Urban Wine Walk is strictly 18 Years and Over!

In this relaxed, hands-on session, you’ll learn how this golden, flaky pastry is made, explore its key flavours, and hear the cultural stories behind a snack many Vietnamese families grew up with. The workshop is beginner-friendly and designed as a welcoming space to cook, taste, and connect through food.
What makes this workshop special is not just the recipe, but the sharing of culture, memory, and community. Whether you’re new to Vietnamese cuisine or reconnecting with familiar flavours, you’ll leave with new knowledge, warm food, and a deeper appreciation of Vietnamese food culture.
Free to attend | All ingredients provided | Limited spaces – registration required
Come cook with us, meet new people, and enjoy a meaningful cultural experience through food.
This workshop is proudly delivered by Viet Hub NZ, in collaboration with Te Tai Ohinga | Central City Youth Hub, supporting accessible, inclusive spaces for cultural learning and connection ❤️.

Two of Wellington’s legendary food rescue and community dining champions, Everybody Eats and Kaibosh, are joining forces to serve piping hot mac 'n' cheese, raising funds to help feed the community. As official charity partners of the festival, they are turning comfort food into real impact.

For just $10, each bowl will help fund a three-course meal for someone in need through Everybody Eats or provide a day’s worth of food for a family via Kaibosh.

description:
2025 Taiwan Update Lectures, Taiwan’s Multidimensional Energy Security Challenges
Professor Chyungly Lee
A stable and reliable energy supply is essential for a nation’s economic growth and development. In selecting fuel sources, nowadays almost all countries have taken climate change into account, adopted sensible clean energy transition plans, and designed a schedule to meet the goal of Net Zero. While pursuing a 3-E (energy-economic-environmental) balanced energy supply strategy, Taiwan, lacking indigenous resources, faces unique challenges of supply disruptions from over dependence on energy imports and possible blockade, quarantine, or invasion from Beijing. Any disruption of power supply or surge of energy costs could not only threaten Taiwan’s competitive edge in the global high-tech market but also undermine Taiwan’s internal stability and the nation’s survival. In this talk, Dr. Chyungly Lee will first present fact sheets on Taiwan’s energy status, summarize Taiwan’s current energy strategy, and then discuss dilemmas and vulnerabilities that Taiwan might face in the next few years.
What does Taiwan’s two-level politics tell us?
Professor Alex Tan
This presentation examines Taiwan as a critical case study for understanding the evolving challenges to democracy in the 21st century. Arguing that Taiwan serves as a “canary in the coalmine,” the analysis highlights how the island’s early and persistent political polarization—rooted in identity politics and the legacies of authoritarian rule—prefigures trends now visible in established democracies worldwide. The research explores how deep divisions between the Kuomintang (KMT) and Democratic Progressive Party (DPP), reinforced by institutional and social factors, have led to legislative gridlock, declining trust in political institutions, and a “democratic ceiling” that constrains further democratic development. Taiwan’s precarious geopolitical position, facing constant pressure from the People’s Republic of China, intensifies the dilemma of balancing national security with the protection of civil liberties. The presentation analyzes Taiwan’s innovative responses to disinformation, foreign interference, and public health crises, illustrating both the resilience and fragility of democratic systems under external and internal stress.
Gaming Taiwan: Indigenous Epistemologies in Play
Associate Professor Chia-rong Wu
This research explores how Indigenous knowledge systems in Taiwan are being revitalized through video games. Far from mere entertainment, these games draw on tribal traditions, ancestral stories, and deep connections to the land to create meaningful digital experiences. By blending oral storytelling with interactive gameplay, Taiwanese Indigenous game developers are preserving cultural memory while challenging colonial legacies. Titles like Princess Baleng, Tayal, VuVu, and Gadvia show how games can empower communities and pass down wisdom to younger generations in innovative and engaging ways. Gamers not only play a game but also immerse themselves in digital environments shaped by Indigenous perspectives and values. This study encourages all engaged audiences, including educators and students, to consider video games as powerful tools for cultural resurgence and learning. Focusing on Indigenous Taiwan, it highlights how digital games integrate historical consciousness and interactivity to reimagine the past and future of the island.

description:
50yrs Misuse of Drugs Act: What impact & what next?, The 1975 Misuse of Drugs Act (MoDA) has failed to deliver. Data from the United Nations Office for Drugs and Crime indicates the demand for drugs is greater than ever, while the supply of drugs knows no bounds. The failure and harm caused by the so called 'War on Drugs' is acknowledged globally and witnessed first hand here in Aotearoa New Zealand.

Back in 2011 a comprehensive review of the MoDA conducted by New Zealand Law Commission recommended the MoDA “should be repealed and replaced by a new Act …administered by the Ministry of Health”. HRCA wants to see that recommendation enacted.

New Zealand has a history for bold world leading policy reform: Woman’s Right to Vote; Decriminalisation of Sex Work; National Needle Exchange, Same Sex Marriage and most recently Drug Checking.

This half day Symposium will provide clear evidence why major law reform is necessary and detail the foundations upon which Aotearoa NZ can once again be innovative and lead the way with new drug laws based on evidence, research and experience -providing a safer environment for future generation.

Harm Reduction Coalition Aotearoa are delighted to have assembled a group of respected independent thinkers with vast experience of drug policy in Aotearoa and beyond, to reflect on the impact of the MoDA and to identify the principles and values needed to underpin new drug laws.

Warren Young: Prof. of Law & Former Deputy President New Zealand Law Commission.
Kirsten Gibson: Chair of Harm Reduction Coalition Aotearoa and Qualitative Researcher.
Fiona Hutton: Associate Prof. Institute of Criminology, Victoria University of Wellington.
Adam Dorsett: 40 yrs Living/Lived Experience of Prohibited Drug Use, 25yrs in Prison.
Julian Buchanan: Former UNODC Advisor and Criminology Professor.

NOTE:
This event is free and open to the public on a 'first come first served' basis.
However, eventfinda ticket holders will be guaranteed a seat.
label: Government & Politics

description:
A Place of Firsts, Globally, citizens assemblies are widely used as an effective way to involve local people in deciding how to address complex issues such as climate change. Despite the repeated failure of standard policy processes, citizens assemblies have only recently made it to New Zealand. Register for this event to find out more about the Porirua Assembly on Climate and its innovations. 
Porirua is known for community-led innovations in governance and delivery, and the Porirua Assembly on Climate continued this tradition by being:
the first climate assembly in New Zealand,  
the first assembly co-designed and organised by an iwi authority and a community group, 
the first assembly process designed to honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi by using a tricameral design,  
the first New Zealand assembly to include children and young people, and 
by creating a new local governance body - the Porirua Community Leaders Forum - that sponsored the Assembly, holds its recommendations and can instigate ongoing community dialogue on local issues. 
Panellists will share learning on the Porirua Assembly’s innovations, talk about why the standard citizens assembly model was modified, dig into what enabled so many firsts and how these worked out in practice. They will reflect on this legacy and possible future impacts. Might these democratic innovations strengthen local democracy elsewhere in Aotearoa New Zealand? 
About the Host and Speakers
Jodi Watene is a Systems Change Lead at Te Rūnanga o Toa Rangatira Incorporated, was the project manager for the Porirua Assembly and is helping to establish a New Zealand Community of Practice on Indigenous Citizens’ Assemblies.
Makerita Makapelu is a Team Leader for Wesley Community Action in Porirua with a background in performing arts and youth work. She specialises in community-led development and grassroots systems change, and was one of the Porirua Assembly facilitators.  
Cally O'Neill was a participatory designer of community spaces until 2019 when she shifted her focus towards advocating for Te Tiriti-based deliberative democracy to address the climate and other contemporary crises. She is a founding member of Te Reo O Ngā Tāngata/The People Speak and was one of the Porirua Assembly facilitators. 
Future Unity, a youth climate group formed during the Assembly process will be represented by Orini Rokx-Taratu and Santino Morehu, who were participants in the Assembly’s youth and community streams.  
Emily Beausoleil is an Associate Professor at Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington. Her research as a political theorist centres on the dynamics, conditions and challenges of democratic engagement in diverse societies. She is conducting an independent evaluation of the Porirua Assembly process.

description:
Asia After 5: Exploring Bhutan - Fireside chat with Ambassador Sonam Tobgay, Join us for this Asia After Five event, featuring Ambassador Sonam Tobgay, Bhutan’s first-ever Ambassador to Australia in conversation with Professor David Capie, Director of the Centre for Strategic Studies, as they discuss insights into life in Bhutan, its culture and politics and the country’s evolving position in the world.

The event will follow our popular Asia After Five format, blending Asia-focused discussions with an evening of networking to deepen your understanding of the region.
This is an open event, so feel free to bring a friend! Please RSVP for catering purposes.
About Ambassador Sonam Tobgay
Sonam Tobgay has been serving in Bhutan’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs for almost three decades and is currently the Ambassador of the Kingdom of Bhutan to Australia. He has also had diplomatic postings in Geneva, Kuwait, New York and New Delhi and has acquired extensive diplomatic skills in human rights, development, trade, health and aid mobilization.
About Professor David Capie
Professor David Capie is Director of the Centre for Strategic Studies and Professor of International Relations. He is also a Trustee of the Asia New Zealand Foundation.
David's research interests focus on conflict and security issues, particularly in the Asia–Pacific, and New Zealand's foreign and defence policy. He has authored or co-authored three books and numerous articles and book chapters.
His research has been supported by the Rockefeller Foundation, the East-West Center and the Royal Society of New Zealand’s Marsden Fund. David has held visiting positions at the Weatherhead Center for International Affairs at Harvard University and at LUIS Guido Carli in Rome.
He was regional co-chair of the Council for Security Cooperation in the Asia-Pacific (CSCAP) from 2020 until 2022 and was a member of the ASEAN Regional Forum Experts and Eminent Persons Group from 2012 to 2019.
label: Government & Politics

description:
Australia, New Zealand, and a post-American Asia, Foreign and defence policy in Australia and New Zealand needs to grapple with the likelihood that the US won't compete with China for regional leadership. Canberra and Wellington thus need to develop strategies that emphasise self-reliance, yet Australia in particular is pursuing ever-closer integration with the United States.
Sam Roggeveen is Program Director of the Lowy Institute’s International Security Program. He is the author of The Echidna Strategy: Australia’s Search for Power and Peace and Our Very Own Brexit: Australia’s Hollow Politics and Where it Could Lead Us. Before joining the Lowy Institute, Sam was a senior strategic analyst in Australia’s peak intelligence agency, the Office of National Assessments, where his work dealt mainly with North Asian strategic affairs, including nuclear strategy and Asian military forces. Sam also worked on arms control policy in Australia’s Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade, and as an analyst in the Defence Intelligence Organisation. Sam writes for newspapers and magazines in Australia and around the world, and is a regular commentator on the Lowy Institute’s international magazine, The Interpreter, of which he was the founding editor from 2007 to 2014. Sam also serves as lead editor at the Lowy Institute, and editor of the Lowy Institute Papers.
All welcome but please register to attend.
label: Government & Politics

description:
Book Launch - Isaac Featherston 'Petatone': A Colonial Life, Join us next month to launch Isaac Featherston 'Petatone': A Colonial Life by John E Martin. The book will be launched by Charlotte MacDonald.

Tuesday 7 October, 6pm
Unity Books Wellington
All welcome!

'Existing views of Featherston are fragmentary, negative and not very satisfactory. He was the “little Doctor”, a single-minded despot wielding tyrannical power and casting an oppressive shadow. As I began to understand more of his life, I realised that there was little appreciation of a man who had contributed so much.’ —John E.Martin

Isaac Featherston was at the heart of some of the most significant developments in New Zealand from the 1840s colonisation by the New Zealand Company to the abolition of the provinces in 1876. A doctor, newspaper editor and politician, he advocated for the provinces against the domination of central government, while also being primarily responsible for the relocation of the capital from Auckland to Wellington in 1865.

Known amongst Māori as ‘Petatone’ and with a reputation for directness and honesty, he was at the very centre of Pākehā–Māori relations, and in his 1857 official portrait is depicted alongside leading rangatira Te Puni and Wi Tako.

About the author: Dr. John E. Martin has researched and written about New Zealand history since the 1980s, teaching in universities and employed as a historian in the public sector. He was parliamentary historian in the 2000s and 2010s. His publications include rural and labour history, the history of science and engineering, and social and political history. His books include The Forgotten Worker (1990), People, Politics and Power Stations (1991 and 1998), Holding the Balance (1996), The House: New Zealand’s House of Representatives, 1854–2004 (2004), Parliament’s Library (2008), Honouring the Contract (2010), Illuminating Our World (2017), A Colonist’s Gaze (2018) and most recently Empire City: Wellington Becomes the Capital of New Zealand (2022).

description:
Café des Idées in Wellington - Sealife stories from the subantarctic, Café des Idées in Wellington - Sealife stories from the subantarctic
Join us for the next Café des Idées - Sealife stories from the subantarctic: links between France and New Zealand

About this Event

The next Café des Idées, organised by and , is honoured to host Wendy Nelson and Kevin Hackwell for a captivating discussion on the shared scientific and environmental connections between France and New Zealand in the subantarctic marine world.

Wendy will be talking about important marine collections made on French expeditions of discovery to the NZ subantarctic in the early 1800s that are housed in the Herbarium of the Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle in Paris.
Wendy has been collaborating with Professor Line Le Gall (Departement Origines et Evolution) and for two weeks in October they worked to locate and document these important specimens - uncovering answers to some long held questions about the identity of species described over 180 years ago and not found subsequently.
In this talk she will take you into the Herbarium of the Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle, Paris - and highlight some of the remarkable treasures housed there.
(This work was supported by funding from the French Embassy in Wellington and the Royal Society of New Zealand Te Apārangi.)
Kevin will talk about the importance of the marine protected areas in the subantarctic and initiatives that have been taken to protect critical habitat for southern seabirds and connections between French and NZ in this critical work.

Wendy Nelson is a botanist and marine biologist, currently Senior Research Fellow Auckland Museum Tāmaki Paenga Hira
Kevin Hackwell is an ecologist, formerly Chief Conservation Advisor for Forest & Bird, a sister organisation to LPO (Ligue pour la Protection des Oiseaux)

📅 Friday, 05 December 2025 - 5.30pm
📍 Alliance Française Wellington, 78 Victoria Street, Wellington
🎟️ Free entry, koha donation

description:
China and the Media Landscape in the Pacific, Over the last decade, the People’s Republic of China has sought to deepen its ties with Pacific Island countries. Beijing’s efforts to cultivate influence in the region have included expanding economic, diplomatic, and security ties with Pacific Island nations, as well as expanding China’s footprint in the region’s media landscape. This talk will present the findings of recent research on China’s efforts to shape reporting, media coverage and narratives in the Pacific Islands and put Beijing’s efforts within the context of the region’s rapidly evolving information landscape.
 About the speakers:
Heidi Holz is a Senior Research Scientist at CNA. For close to two decades, her work has focused on PRC strategic communications, propaganda, and influence efforts. She is a graduate of Georgetown University’s School of Foreign Service, where she received a master’s degree in security studies and a bachelor’s degree in Chinese and East Asian history.
Genevieve Collins is a research specialist in the China Studies program at CNA, where her research focuses on the behaviour of China’s state-run media and its reactions to US military operations and activities.
 Barbara Dreaver (Discussant) has been the Pacific Reporter for TVNZ 1 News since 2002, breaking stories uncovering social and economic issues affecting Pacific people living in New Zealand and the Pacific Islands. In 2020, she created a two-year training programme through Pacific Cooperation Broadcasting Ltd to support new Pacific journalists across the Pacific region. In the 2024 New Years Honours she was awarded an ONZM for services to investigative journalism and Pacific communities.
 About CNA: CNA is a non-profit, non-governmental research and analysis organization dedicated to providing independent and objective analyses to the U.S. government and the public. This talk will build on previous CNA research on China and the Pacific Islands media landscape which you can find at www.cna.org.
