description:
Advice for Modern Life - meditation course, Advice for Modern Life - meditation course
Advice for Modern Life - meditation course
with Kadam Birgit

By keeping Atisha’s Advice in our heart, we can maintain a peaceful happy mind, our human nature and good qualities will improve, we will be able to show a good example for the people of our troubled world and we will quickly attain full enlightenment.

As Venerable Geshe-la says, ‘Simply putting this Advice into practice we will naturally become a Bodhisattva, a holy compassionate being who is the object of everybody’s love and respect’.

On this half day course Kadam Birgit will share teachings given at the International Summer Festival 2025 on Advice from Atisha’s Heart.

Although it was composed many centuries ago, this much-loved Buddhist scripture is full of practical advice to help us deal with the challenges of modern living, and transform our life into an authentic path of inner development.

Everyone welcome.

WHAT TO EXPECT
These classes are based on Buddha’s teachings on the mind, but you do not need to be a Buddhist to attend, or to benefit from them. There is no physical exercise involved and you can choose to sit either in a chair or on a cushion. These classes are suitable for all levels of experience.

Registration starts at 9:30am. This course includes a vegan, wheat-free morning tea (we cannot guarantee gluten-free).

description:
Beyond Sight: The Power of Dyad Meditation, Beyond Sight: The Power of Dyad Meditation
What happens when we strip away the surface layers of small talk, social roles, and even sight itself?
In this unique evening, you’ll step into the practice of Dyad Meditation — a powerful form of authentic relating where two people take turns speaking and listening in complete presence. One person shares, the other simply listens. No interruptions. No fixing. No judgment. Just the rare experience of being fully seen and fully heard.
The twist? You’ll be blindfolded.
By closing our eyes to the outer world, we drop our guards and tune into something deeper. This creates space for vulnerability, openness, and raw connection that we don’t often experience in daily life.
Expect an evening that’s real, grounding, and surprisingly freeing — a chance to connect with yourself and with others in ways that go beyond sight.
You don’t need to bring a partner or a friend — in fact, coming on your own is part of the experience. Everyone will be paired up on the night, so it’s all about connecting beyond familiar circles.
Afterwards, we’ll share reflections over a nourishing plant-based dinner, keeping the conversation alive in a relaxed space.
Meet Andre, your host
Andre has been exploring the art of authentic connection since his teens, when a rite of passage in Golden Bay first sparked his passion for circle work. Since then, he has been creating spaces that invite honesty, vulnerability, and depth — guiding people into experiences of being truly seen and heard. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and breathwork facilitator, Andre brings creativity and presence to all his offerings, inspired by the question of what it really means to be human.

Join Tara Goddard for this Breathwork Medicine Journey connecting through breath and alchemising its medicine through waves of the body.

Breathwork is an ancient technique used for healing & expansion to bridge the gap between your human self & higher self.

Alternate states of awareness are created, where waves of emotion, thought or somatic sensation are able to roll through and release with the breath.

BreathWav not only works with somatic intelligence, but nervous system attunement, working with the denser and more subtle layers of the body to raise & uplift.

Breathwork may cause the release of
DMT (Spirit Molecule) it is an alchemy with brainwaves and cerebrospinal fluid. Gamma brainwaves are associated with states of deep meditation, heightened awareness, and higher brain functions.

Breathwork and other deeply meditative practices activate gamma waves and there is a correlation between gamma waves and DMT release, with one seeming to stimulate the other.

Breathwork experiences and benefits so often parallel those of DMT and other psychedelic plant-medicines, DMT is produced naturally in the brain, and is released during Breathwork.

𝘾𝙤𝙣𝙩𝙧𝙖𝙞𝙣𝙙𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙨:

Breathwork results in certain specific physiological changes in the body and also can result in intense physical and emotional release.

As a precaution, the following conditions are contraindicated in certain breathwork practices.

It is crucial that you inform your breathwork practitioner if any of the following conditions are relevant to you:

• Pregnancy (at any stage)

• Severe PTSD or trauma

• Currently using recreational drugs

• Recent surgery

• Taking any medication that alters brain chemistry like anti-anxiety,anti-depressant, ADD, OCD medications, etc.

•Detached Retina

•Glaucoma

•Kidney disease

•High Blood Pressure

•Cardiovascular disease, including angina, previous heart attack or stroke
•Diagnosis of aneurysm in the brain or abdomen

•Uncontrolled thyroid conditions

•Diabetes

•Severe Asthma— for mild to moderate asthma, we can discuss but you must bring your inhaler to the session.

• Epilepsy

• History of Seizures

• Prior diagnosis of bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or previous psychiatric condition.

•Any other medical, psychiatric or physical conditions which would impair or affect the ability to engage in any activities that involve deep physical and/or emotional release.

𝙁𝘼𝙌’𝙨:

What can I expect?

There will be a short guided meditation, explanation of conscious connected breathwork (how to do it, tetany, things that may happen etc), a full 60 min breathwork journey and space afterwards for a few to share about their experience and any questions asked and support given if needed.

I have one or more of the listed contraindications - what should I do?

Email or message Tara to let her know what these are and she’ll let you know if she can offer adjustments so you can attend.

description:
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset, Breathwork: A Gentle Reset
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset

Take a pause from the noise of daily life.

This breathwork journey begins with gentle movement to awaken the body and open the breath. Through slow, mindful stretches, we begin softening tension and grounding into the present.

You’ll then be guided through two styles of breathwork — each offering a unique pathway inward. There’s no pressure or expectation, just the freedom to explore what feels right for you:

A dynamic, connected breath for those who wish to build energy, move emotion, or break through internal blockages

A slow, rhythmic breath for those seeking stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches invite a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and inner clarity.

To gently close the session, we’ll move into a quiet, nurturing meditation to support integration and leave you feeling steady, clear, and connected.

Afterwards, stay and enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, lovingly prepared to complement the experience — because healing is also about how we feed and care for ourselves.

Why Breathwork?

Breathwork has helped so many shift from a state of tension and overwhelm into a place of ease, clarity, and resilience — often after just one session. It’s a simple, powerful practice that reconnects you to your body, your breath, and your inner stillness.

You’ll leave feeling more grounded, more present, and more like yourself again.

Meet Karla, your host
Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

description:
Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System, Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System
If you’re running on fumes, stuck in overdrive, or feeling wired and tired, this session is for you. Even if you’ve tried resting, you might still feel tense, foggy, or emotionally flat. This session is designed for high-achieving women ready to reconnect to their body, regulate their nervous system, and rediscover their energy.
You might notice these signs:
Waking up tired, even after a full night’s sleep
Overthinking decisions and feeling emotionally reactive
Craving peace but feeling disconnected from your body
Often feeling “on” and unable to fully relax
Workshop Details:
Through guided somatic breathwork, gentle movement, and nervous system education, you’ll be supported to safely release stored tension, calm your system, and access clarity from within.
What to bring/prepare:
Comfortable clothing for movement
Water bottle and journal
Yoga mat provided
Optional: blanket, eye pillow, essential oils
Arrive: 5–10 minutes early to settle in
Unwind further with a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, a nurturing way to ground yourself and enjoy a sense of calm and connection after the session.
Contraindications for Breathwork:
Breathwork can be a powerful tool but may not be suitable for everyone. Please consult your healthcare provider before participating if you have:
Cardiovascular issues (e.g., high blood pressure, heart disease)
Respiratory conditions (e.g., asthma, COPD)
A history of seizures or epilepsy
Diagnosed mental health conditions (e.g., schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)
Pregnancy (some breath patterns may need modification)
Recent surgery or physical injuries that limit movement
You are always welcome to participate in the somatic and movement elements without engaging in deep breathwork—your safety and well-being are our priority.
About Lynofuro:
Lynofuro is an Integrative Somatic Coach and Breathwork Facilitator who helps intuitive, high-performing women overcome emotional burnout and restore energetic balance. Her work blends somatics, breath, and energy alignment to support lasting transformation.
What past participants say:
“I walked in overwhelmed and walked out feeling like myself again.”
“This was the first time I felt fully present and peaceful in weeks.”

www.lynofuro.co.nz

description:
CBT skills for physical health practitioners in Aotearoa New Zealand, Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT) is a psychological intervention initially developed for emotional disorders. It is now widely used in supporting people to deal with the challenges of physical ill-health. Professionals from various backgrounds can learn to use a simplified CBT skills set, and use of these skills enables them to be more effective in managing aspects of their patients’ distress.
The training is a mix of theory, skills demonstration and skills practice, giving participants a better understanding of the applicability of the skill set in their area of practice and providing some skills to take away. Training sessions are spaced to allow participants to use their new skills in their clinical practice. Each participant reflects on their learning and their work with a specific patient, and the whole group reflects on lessons learned. In this way, learning remains rooted in participants’ clinical practice. These CBT courses are consistently evaluated highly by participants.
The Course
Teaching will be commenced with 2 days of in person sessions. 19th and 20th Feb 2026 at Mary Potter Hospice, Wellington and subsequently 2 sessions on-line via Zoom. These will be either 18th or 19th March an 22nd or 23rd April 2026.
Attendance at all sessions is mandatory to complete the course.
The courses cost is $850 per person (incl GST).
The Trainers
Kathy Burn was a Clinical Nurse Specialist in Palliative Care who went on to train in CBT and to develop the CBT service at St Christopher’s Hospice, London. She now works in CBT in chronic pain, and she teaches and supervises CBT trainees at the institute of Psychiatry, London.
Kathryn Mannix was a Palliative Medicine Consultant and CBT therapist. She developed ‘CBT First Aid’ to enable palliative care clinicians to adapt skills from CBT into their clinical practice. She is an author. There are insights into her use of CBT in her books With the End in Mind and Listen.
Terms and Conditions
Attendance: In order to create a learning community for each course, it is important that each person on a course attends every session and is able to join in the discussions by keeping up with the course. By accepting a place on a particular course, you agree to attend all the sessions, to arrive on time, and to work alongside your group members during the session to support each other's learning. Each session builds on the last, and you'll be asked to put your new learning into practice in- between sessions. Building learning groups in this way means we can't add new trainees after a course has begun.
We are not able to run catch-up sessions for sessions missed. If you miss sessions, you may be asked to withdraw from the course and no refunds will be given.
Refunds/Canellations: Once you sign up and pay, we won't be able to refund your payment unless we can reallocate your place to another person before the course begins. The deadline for cancelling your place is 28 days before the day and time of the first session. If you cancel and we can fill your place with another person, we'll offer you the choice of a refund or a place on a future course, if places are available. We will do our best to fill your place, but we can't promise this. Refunds will incur an administration fee.
Dates and Times of Sessions: all dates and times are given in NZ time, and this varies over the year. It is up to you to check the correct time in your time zone: you may find this website useful to check your own time zone with Auckland NZ time on each specific date: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/
Trainers: we have a team of trainers, all of whom are experienced CBT therapists and trainers, and all are familiar with applying CBT in physical health settings. Different sessions may be taught by different trainers, or by 'guest appearances' by some of our team. The team of trainers will ensure there is continuity of content and of learning as the course progresses.
Special circumstances: Sometimes, life events appear unexpectedly. If something unexpected prevents you from attending, please let us know as early as you can, and we will give consideration to how we might be able to support you to continue your training if that is what you wish to do.

description:
Cacao + Movement + Yin, Cacao + Movement + Yin
Welcome to an hour and a half of uninterrupted YOU time!

Lift your energy with ceremonial cacao, dance into joy with an energizing movement practice, and close with yin inspired stretches and meditation - a journey of connection, movement and renewal.

Hosted by Heidi Firth & Kae-Lynn Sorensen.

What to expect:
Cacao - Ceremonial Cacao drink to foster heart-opening, emotional connection, and creative flow. We'll open with mindfully drinking "Cacao Ambassador" Cacao to bring awareness to our hearts & bodies.

The Movement - Easy to follow choreography with modifications. Where intentional movement meets empowering music.
Think of it as an hour just for YOU – to sweat, move however you need to, laugh, release and feel amazing in mind, body + soul.

A space where you can leave your judgements at the door, reconnect with yourself and have some fun!

Yin Yoga - A slow-paced style of yoga that emphasizes passive stretching and longer-held poses. It targets the deeper connective tissues of the body, such as ligaments and fascia, rather than the muscles, promoting flexibility, joint health, and relaxation. The practice encourages mindfulness and introspection, creating a calming contrast to more vigorous, dynamic forms of yoga.

Sunday 19 October 2025
10:30am - 12pm
Central Rugby Club, 34 Lansdown Street, Mayfair
$45 pp

Bookings Essential
Follow the ticket link to reserve your space
Your booking is confirmed once payment is made.

https://kaelynnsofferings.as.me/schedule/8fa42429


About Heidi
I love holding spaces that feel like a deep exhale, where we can melt into Yin shapes, sip cacao, and let our whole system soften. My love is supporting people to feel good in their bodies and to remember that health can be both deeply healing and beautifully simple.


About Kae-Lynn
Hello I’m Kae-Lynn!

I lead The Movement because, I believe everyone deserves a non judgmental space to catch their breath and, be reminded of their spark.

When Mel first shared The Movement with me I was so I was burnt out, numb, and deeply disconnected. I was busy trying to love and please everyone else that I completely lost myself.

During my first class something shifted. The music — the movements — Reminded me of that spark within me. It felt like my soul finally had permission to shine again. For that one hour, I could breathe. No pressure, no expectations, no noise from the world or my mind. Just movement, music, and freedom to be me.

I believe fitness should be intentional, empowering and fun.

Come give it a go!

description:
Chit Chat with a Kit Kat (Free Event), Chit Chat with a Kit Kat and Coffee!
This is for 'all women' of all ages and from all walks of life who just need to be heard, and to share their worries, burdens, stresses, grief, sadness, loss etc.. and my friend and myself are realising there are alot of us out there experiencing these emotions for a myriad of reasons, be it loss, be it menopause, be it grief, stress, anxiety, depression, financial,family stuff, so my beautiful friend and I thought it would be a great idea to extend our little sessions that we have been having to more women who are in need of just being free to feel what we feel, to be honest, raw and open and not feel judged for our thoughts and emotions in a safe loving caring understanding space where we can support each other to be Brave Bold and Beautiful under pressure
We are human beings doing the best we can with what we have in a world that has sort of gone a bit pear shape hey, so this Beautiful Woman is about allowing you and me to speak our truth amongst like minded women in a safe space who are experiencing similar feelings and emotions with no judgement just love and understanding
The positive of this is when we vocalise and communicate our worries, concerns, hurts, disappointments, sadness, anger, frustrations, annoyances, we actually let go toxic energy from our mind, body, soul which actually improves our health and wellbeing mentally and physically, fact and truth!
Studies and Statistics have proven that 80% of illnesses are caused by STRESS, so let's just do something kind, caring, loving and healing for us and let's get together and get raw real and natural and chit chat about whatever it is you want to chit chat about, no judgement of course within reason lol
What do you think? Sounds fab?

If so then DM me or email stessak@gmail.com to confirm, and i'll book you in on the 3rd of December or if you are just one of those bizzy Lizzy's like me and you forgot to book, then just feel free to rock up or text me which i will give you access to when you email stessak@gmail.com
Where:
1.Johnsonville Public Library
2.Upstairs in a Private space
3.10am -12pm Just ask person at the desk where to go if you are unsure
p.s Great coffee shop next door on the same level
or bring your own coffee or tea in a flask if that's what you prefer as I know some people are particular with their drinks

description:
Confident & Competent Suicide Prevention Training Series - Te Whanganui-a-Tara-Wellington (CC2026/02), CONFIDENT AND COMPETENT SUICIDE PREVENTION TRAINING
To reduce the high rates of suicide in this country a workforce confident and competent in assessing risk and providing ongoing support to suicidal people is essential.
Recent coroners’ findings highlighted the need for workers in the health, social services and counselling/psychotherapy sectors to regularly update their knowledge and competency in suicide risk assessment and intervention. This training should be a core component of practitioners’ ongoing professional development. Advanced practitioners such as counsellors, psychotherapists and clinicians should not only be knowledgeable about suicide risk assessment but also highly competent in undertaking an assessment and assessing the level of risk. The training attended should match the worker's scope of practice. Those working in the non-mental health sectors must be also be competent in making an informed referral to crisis services.They must also be up to date in their competency and capability to engage with the suicidal individual.
This advanced-level workshop address the concerns raised by coroners and are designed for clinicians counsellors and psychotherapists. Rather than a siloed approach to assessment and support strategies, this training emphasises the interconnection of the two and presents them as part of the continuum of suicide intervention and care.
Designed specifically for the New Zealand context, this training is being recommended by counsellors all over the country as a must attend workshop.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Conscious & Connected Breathwork, Conscious & Connected Breathwork
Conscious & Connected Breathwork

Step out of autopilot and into your own rhythm — this session is about tuning in again.

We begin with gentle movement and mindful stretches to awaken the body, open the breath, and release tension. You’ll then be guided through two complementary styles of breathwork, allowing you to explore what feels most nourishing for you:

A dynamic, flowing breath to energise, release emotion, and move through internal blockages

A slow, steady breath to cultivate stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches create a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and clarity of mind. The session closes with a quiet, nurturing meditation, helping you integrate the experience and leave feeling steady, connected, and present.

Stay afterwards to enjoy a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket — a simple way to nourish your body and complement your practice.

Meet Your Host: Karla

Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

What’s on the menu?
Spaghetti with roasted capsicum, sunflower seeds and sun-dried tomatoes

Stuffed focaccia

Salad with pear

Lemon poppy cake

description:
Dine with a Doc - The power of plant-based nutrition and lifestyle interventions, Doctors For Nutrition and MTM Community Project invite you to an evening of inspiration, education, and connection at our next ‘Dine with a Doc’ dinner.
Join us for a presentation on ‘The Power of Plant-Based Nutrition and Lifestyle Interventions for Preventing Chronic Disease’—an event designed to empower everyone from healthcare professionals to health-conscious community members. You will also be the first to hear about the new MTM Community Project, and about their mission. 
When: 6:30pm – 9:30pm, Tuesday, 19th August 2025
Where: Gear Homestead, 1 Okowai Road, Aotea, Wellington
Price: $50 (includes dinner and non-alcoholic beverage)
At this event, Dr Heleen Haitjema will take you on a journey through the clinical benefits of whole food, plant-based (WFPB) nutrition. Through easy-to-understand explanations of key concepts - such as endothelial dysfunction, intramyocellular lipid accumulation, and calorie density - you’ll discover how WFPB eating can dramatically improve health outcomes and transform lives. 
After the presentation, join us for a panel discussion and a Q&A session with Dr Haitjema and Dr Luke Wilson. 
The evening continues with a plant-based dinner curated by the chefs from MTM Community Project, served in the elegant setting of Gear Homestead. Enjoy the opportunity to connect and network with leading dietitians, specialists, GPs, and passionate members of New Zealand’s plant-based community.
Buy your tickets now; spaces are strictly limited!
Sponsored by: Little City Kombucha

description:
Draw It Out - Adult workshop, A gentle yet powerful tool for wellness (adults 18+) to access inner guidance.

Theme: Welcoming new possibilities
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.

This single workshop focuses on the theme of welcoming new possibilities, great if you are going through change, wanting to transition or entering a new phase.

Date
This is a single workshop
6.15pm-7.30pm
Monday 29 September

Cost
$46 total

Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.

This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.

“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”

For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.

Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

description:
Draw It Out - Fertility NZ national online workshop, A bespoke Draw It Out workshop for Fertility NZ, open to all genders.
Tickets: $34.50pp
Theme: Strengthen self-care for the holiday season
Strengthen your inner resources to care for yourself over the holiday season, and meet others going through similar experiences through this online national workshop, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.

FertilityNZ exists to support New Zealanders experiencing fertility problems, whether facing challenges becoming or staying pregnant. This bespoke workshop shares drawing for wellness, to tap into your inner guidance for support, within a safe space where others may be experiencing similar journeys.
Included in your workshop
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
What you will need
As this is an online workshop, you will need a computer in a comfortable, quiet setting. A hard surface to draw on (like a desk or a board), three to five pages of A3 paper (you can also tape two A4 printing papers together), and any colouring tools of your choice. Crayons are great as they are more child-like so you don't worry about how it looks. Coloured pastels or pencils are also good, or any coloured markers. The key is a range of colours.

description:
Dying Matters Week, Dying Matters Week
Coming up at the Community Centre next month. 2 sessions totalling 1 hour in length.

Monday, 1st at 2:00pm Final Farewell: Your Legacy Your Way with Alina Reed
Ever wondered what your send-off might look like? A haka, a playlist, a tree planting? Join us for a 20-minute kōrero on the importance of documenting your funeral wishes — with heart, humour, and a dash of practicality. Let’s talk about how to make your final farewell truly yours.

Monday, 1st at 2:30pm Mary Potter Hospice with Imelda Coleman
You may know hospice through fundraising events like street appeals or strawberry fairs – but hospice is so much more than that. Join us for a short 20 minute session to learn about the holistic care Mary Potter Hospice provides, supporting not only patients but also their whānau. Discover how hospice care uplifts, comforts, and brings dignity at the most important time of life.

There is a link to the website here: https://gowithgrace.nz/dyingmatters/wellington-events/wellington-central/, you can pre-register here or come on the day.

description:
Elebreath® Somatic Breath + Sound Journey, Elebreath® Somatic Breath + Sound Journey
Join Lynn Tiang for a powerful in-person ceremony blending cacao, breathwork, sound, and intuitive movement. Release emotional tension, reset your nervous system, and reconnect with the wisdom of your body.

Through the Elebreath® five-phase arc — grounding, activation, cathartic release, integration, and soulful reflection — you’ll be guided into a state of deep presence where breath, sound, and movement awaken what’s been waiting to be felt.

What to expect:
* Somatic breathwork to clear stored emotions & reset nervous rhythms
* Live soundscapes & intuitive movement for release and integration
*Ceremonial cacao opening to connect with heart energy
*Oracle card pulling + journaling to anchor insights
*Light kai to ground and nourish after the session

Who this is for:
*Anyone navigating emotional fatigue, life transitions, or inner misalignment
*Those seeking nervous system recalibration and emotional release
*People longing for a safe space to soften, release, and reconnect with their body’s wisdom

What’s Included:
*Elebreath® five-phase somatic breathwork journey
*Trauma-informed, nervous system–aware facilitation
*Live sound journey & curated sonic support
*Cacao opening ritual
*Journaling + oracle reflection
*Closing with kai and community space
*Integration Breathwork practices that you can access anytime at your own timing
*Fatigue-free mini-course integration

Details:
Saturday, 27 September, 11:45am - 2:15pm at AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing, Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington Central

Investment:
Early Bird Pricing for first 8 sign-ups. Limited spaces available, so book in fast!

**PLEASE NOTE** This is a private event for which AWHI is providing the space and promotional support only. All bookings and inquiries must be directed to the host, Lynn Tiang at @lynofuro !

description:
Embodied practices for ADHD, Embodied practices for ADHD
Discover how somatic practices and embodied awareness can offer meaningful support for living with ADHD.

Through somatic enquiry, you’ll be guided to develop a deeper understanding of your unique experience, and discover body-based practices that support living with more ease, alignment, and self-awareness.

Together, we’ll explore practices such as somatic enquiry, sensory and movement-based exploration, embodied mindfulness, and cultivating self-compassion. Along the way, we’ll engage with themes including motivation, emotional and nervous system regulation, sensory processing, overwhelm, and balancing rest with activity.

All are welcome — whether you are diagnosed, self-identified, or exploring the possibility.

Please feel free to reach out with any questions.

Amy Richards is a yoga teacher based in Pōneke, with a Certificate in MindBody Therapy. She is drawn to the ways intentional movement and embodied awareness can shape our inner experience and relationships. Grounded in a trauma-informed approach, her work invites exploration of connection with sensation and emotion through the body.

Her practice is influenced by Tantric Shaivism, contact improvisation, Open Floor dance, Hakomi somatic psychotherapy, Somatic Experiencing, Authentic Relating, and Nonviolent Communication.

description:
Embrace the Breath, Embrace the Breath
Join Sarah for an evening of mindfulness, breathing and meditation.

Breathwork is a conscious manipulation of the breath to bring about a change in consciousness.

The doors open at 7.15pm (when you arrive, please wait in the waiting room at the entrance, Sarah will come and get you when the studio is ready), with the journey beginning promptly at 7.30pm, with mindfulness, a 45-60 min journey with the breath, followed by connection and sharing.

Sarah Bradnock is a local multi-modality practitioner of energy, bodywork, plant medicine, now working utilising the the breath with SoulSide Breathwork.

Book your space today! Only 10 available.
$55 per person
bring a friend (2 tickets) $100

Registration closes on Wednesday 23 September, if not sold out before then!

What do you need to bring:
- yoga mat or other mat to lay on
- bolster (optional)
- eye pillow
- socks
- jersey or warm top
- water bottle
- journal and pen

If you've never participated in breathwork before, here are a few contraindications:
Physical Contraindications
-Cardiovascular issues
-Glaucoma
-High blood pressure (Over time, if untreated, it can cause health conditions, such as heart disease and stroke) Deep-breathing lowers blood pressure.
-Epilepsy
-Detached Retina (Retinal detachment separates the retinal cells from the layer of blood vessels that provides oxygen and nourishment).
-History of strokes or seizures
-Aneurysm or family history of aneurysm. (Burst blood vessels in the brain).
-Blood thinning medication. (Unfortunately, the blood thinners used to prevent such blood clots can increase the risk of bleeding in the brain, a cause of hemorrhagic stroke).
-Pregnancy or possible pregnancy
-Asthma
-Mental Contraindications
-Substance dependence & addiction (Deep breathwork journeys are not always appropriate for those who are still addicted to a substance, as it tends to raise suppressed or repressed material for processing. However, if you’re currently in recovery, this can be extremely healing, and help you discover the deeper patterns that gave rise to this addiction. (Grof, 1985: 267 – 268).
-Bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or psychosis
-Hospitalisation for emotional crises in the last 10 years
-Psychological conditions and diagnoses, which preclude safe emotional release.

If you are affected by any of the above, please inform Sarah.

*Tickets are non-refundable, but are transferrable with 24 hours notice required.

description:
Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt, Empathic Boundaries: Saying No Without Guilt

If you hear rejection when someone says "no" to you, or if you struggle to say "no" even when you want to - this workshop is for you.

Plus there is an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket! Stay back to continue the connects over a nourishing meal.

In this workshop based on Nonviolent Communication (NVC) you will discover how to listen to feelings and needs that sit behind the "no" and how to connect to what truly matters to yourself and others. You will get to know some foundational tools of NVC, and practice on examples from real life. This session is interactive, and you will walk away with some understanding of NVC processes and materials to practice in your own time.

You will discover:

What stops you from saying "no" when you really want to

How to connect to what matters (to you and others) and find the needs behind the "no"

How to listen for needs, rather than look for conflict

Meet Helen & Anna, your hosts
Anna Banaś and Helen Williams are passionate, down-to-earth facilitators who bring warmth, depth, and a wealth of experience to their work in Nonviolent Communication (NVC). Anna is undertaking certification as an NVC trainer, a sociolinguist, and skilled group facilitator who has spent nearly 20 years supporting families, organisations, and communities to communicate with more clarity and compassion. Helen brings a rich blend of experience as a mindfulness teacher, mediator, coach, and yoga practitioner. Together, Anna and Helen create a safe, engaging, and supportive space where learning feels both empowering and nourishing. Whether you’re completely new to NVC or looking to deepen your practice, you’ll be in very good hands.

description:
Experience Heidi: A.I Medical Scribe for All Clinicians - Wellington, Experience Heidi: A.I Medical Scribe for All Clinicians - Wellington
For practices,clinics & care teams ready to adopt Heidi—the AI scribe for all clinicians. Join us in Wellington. Hosted by Hendrix Health.

About this Event



Experience the Future of Clinical Documentation with Heidi & Hendrix
This event is perfect for practices and clinics looking to bring —the AI medical scribe for all clinicians—into their organisation. Heidi can be used by doctors, nurses, pharmacists, physios, psychologists, vetenarians and more, supporting everything from patient consults and shift handovers to practice meetings and MDMs.
Built with robust data privacy and compliance in mind, Heidi scales to fit how your clinic operates, so you can spend less time on paperwork and more time on patient care. We’ll also discuss safe AI adoption in healthcare, including how Heidi respects data sovereignty in Aotearoa. This session is designed to be straightforward and practical—no hype, just a real look at how AI can transform your everyday workflow.

About Heidi is an AI-powered medical scribe designed to ease the documentation load on clinicians. Already supporting over a million patient interactions every week, Heidi transcribes and processes clinical conversations in real time—helping generate notes, letters, and assessments so clinicians can spend more time with patients and less on paperwork.
Built by a team of doctors and backed by leading global investors, Heidi has become a trusted partner for practices and clinics around the world. The technology is developed to meet international standards including HIPAA, GDPR, NHS and the Australian Privacy Principles, with enterprise-grade certifications like SOC2 and ISO27001.
Heidi never stores session recordings and does not sell or share clinical data. It's designed with clinician wellbeing, patient care, and data safety at its core. Learn more at heidihealth.com.

About
Hendrix Health, Heidi’s official partner in Aotearoa New Zealand , is dedicated to transforming healthcare through life-long learning and human-centred technology. Since September 2024, the Hendrix team have visited over 120 GP clinics, 10 hauora Māori, and 6 Pasifika providers to understand the real challenges on the ground. By working closely with local communities, Hendrix Health ensures that revolutionary innovations like Heidi are culturally responsive and truly effective—already changing the lives of 1000's of healthcare professionals across the country.


Agenda


🕑: 05:00 PM - 06:00 PM
Networking on Arrival (Whakawhanaungatanga)
Info: Arrive, grab a drink, some kai, and connect with fellow attendees. This is your chance to meet new faces, catch up with colleagues, and set a welcoming tone for the evening.


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:10 PM
Opening Karakia & Whakatauki
Info: We’ll open with a brief karakia (blessing) to acknowledge our gathering, focus our intentions, and bring everyone together under a shared purpose. A short whakatauki will be shared, reminding us why we’re here: to improve healthcare for all in Aotearoa.



🕑: 06:10 PM - 06:15 PM
Current Pressues in your Work
Info: A quick reflection on everyday challenges—like documentation fatigue, paperwork overload, and time inefficiencies—that impact both workflow and patient care.



🕑: 06:15 PM - 06:30 PM
Heidi Demo
Info: We’ll show how Heidi fits into your clinical workflow, covering:


- Who is Heidi? Background and purpose.


- AI Scribing Basics: Four steps (Transcribe, Customise, Output, Review).


- Live Demo: A clinician–patient consultation, including informed consent and template use.


- SOAP Formatting & Note Review: How Heidi helps structure and refine notes.


- Ask Heidi Anything: See how to generate a patient letter or other documents directly from the consultation.


🕑: 06:30 PM - 06:40 PM
Principles of Safe AI Use in Healthcare/Data Handling
Info: Explore data privacy, sovereignty, and compliance in Aotearoa, plus best practices for responsibly adopting AI in clinical settings.


🕑: 06:40 PM - 06:45 PM
Karakia Whakamutunga
Info: We’ll close the formal session with a karakia, acknowledging the time shared and the insights gained.


🕑: 06:45 PM - 08:00 PM
Networking
Info: Continue conversations, ask further questions, and connect with the team. Wrap up the evening with new insights and meaningful connections.

description:
Explore Healing For Self - Monthly Event, Explore Healing For Self - Monthly Event
Tania loves creating & holding sacred space for people & in this monthly event she will be creating a space where you can focus on your own healing journey in a group environment. In each session you will be guided through clearing, releasing, healing & remembering processes to help & assist you. We will explore different tools, processes & modalities each time to experience the highest possible energetic shift that is possible at that time.

Each month will have a different focus & flavour with the intention of working on yourself in a safe held space.
Over the next 4 sessions we will explore:

The 12 Chakra system, tools to use to help clear & heal the chakras and then enjoy a beautiful energy healing with the Archangels that are connected to each of the chakras.

Angelic Reiki - Receive an Angelic Cleansing, releasing old karmic connections with Archangel Michael, followed by a group healing with the angels wanting to connect with you.

Full Sensory Perception tools through Pleiadian Lightwork - an explanation on how the tools may feel & work & being in those energies & frequencies to receive the clearing & healing that is possible.

Access Bars - How ‘running the bars’ can help, some key points to use for stress or healing, running clearing statements to release old beliefs & patterns. What else is possible & how does it get any better than this.

There is a lot to explore & embrace and there may be additional processes brought in as Tania is guided or as time allows.

First Tuesday of the month 10am-12pm $30


Tania is a gifted intuitive and holistic practitioner, known for her grounded presence and loving guidance. She is an Angelic Reiki Master Teacher, Pleiadian Lightwork Practitioner & Teacher, conscious channeler, and Access Bars Practitioner. With a rich background in intuitive and energy work, she brings a nurturing and empowering energy to both group workshops and one-on-one sessions.

description:
Exploring our Shared Humanity, Do you ever feel that you're just going through the motions? That life is a series of tasks, a pursuit of pleasure, or a race for self-improvement that never really satisfies? This isn't just a feeling; it's a fundamental human question about what it means to exist.

Description
Join experienced psychotherapist Rohit Grover for a six-week course that invites you to look beyond the surface of everyday life. In these two-hour sessions, we will explore the core tenets of existential therapy, moving away from the conventional focus on self and hedonism. Instead, we'll grapple with life's big questions:

What does it truly mean to live a value-driven life?
Do our personal values matter, or is the search for meaning just an illusion?
What is the "being" part of "human being" all about?

Through guided discussions, reflective exercises, and insights from classic existential thinkers, Rohit will help you navigate this profound territory. This isn't about finding easy answers. It's about developing the courage to ask the right questions, to confront the realities of freedom, responsibility, and meaning, and to discover a more authentic way of living.

This course is for anyone ready to step off the treadmill and begin a deeper exploration of what it means to be alive. Come and find out what it means to truly exist

Upon completion of this course, participants will be able to:

Differentiate between a life driven by external pressures or fleeting pleasures and one rooted in personal values and authentic meaning.

Identify and critically examine the core existential givens of human existence, such as freedom, responsibility, isolation, and the search for meaning.

Articulate a personal understanding of what it means to "be" a human being, moving beyond a purely functional or biological definition.

Arrive at sensing rather than thinking. Sensing this existence, this dance of life. Widen your view of existence.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
Finding Stability in Turbulent Times, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

Finding stability in turbulent times

Pandemic, war, Inflation. Our only problems? Certainly not.

Crisis after crisis slam us in the face.

In the last century it was climate change and world hunger.

This century we are facing newer problems. With the old ones still unresolved.

How is it possible to find peace and stability in a world such as ours? Is it possible?

Albert Einstein said: ' A problem can never get resolved on the same level it originated.'

To find stability, there's need to rise to a higher platform.


Meet your host, Nava

Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

6.15pm Tuesday 27th January

End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

description:
Finding Stability in Turbulent Times: Through Yoga Psychology, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

In times of uncertainty, the mind can lose its sense of balance. This workshop explores how yoga psychology offers practical ways to remain grounded amid inner and outer turbulence.

Drawing on the wisdom of yoga philosophy, particularly the Bhagavad Gita, we will reflect on how anxiety and inner conflict can become opportunities for clarity and conscious response. Rather than avoiding discomfort, yoga psychology teaches us how to meet it with steadiness, discernment, and purpose.

Through reflection and practical tools, participants will learn how to stabilize the mind and reconnect with what truly matters—even in challenging times.

6.15pm Tuesday 20th January

End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

description:
From Freeze to Flow: Somatic Tools to Move Through Emotional Paralysis, From Freeze to Flow: Somatic Tools to Move Through Emotional Paralysis

This will be a gentle Somatic Breathwork workshop designed to help you regulate your nervous system, decompress emotionally, and find embodied clarity. Using nose-dominant breathing techniques, optional mouth exhales, and gentle somatic movements, this session will support you in releasing tension and building to a potential cathartic experience.

Who this is for
This workshop is perfect for:
•⁠ ⁠Those feeling stressed or overwhelmed
•⁠ ⁠Individuals experiencing wired-and-tired fatigue
•⁠ ⁠Anyone struggling with overthinking or racing thoughts
•⁠ ⁠People facing sleep disruptions or insomnia
•⁠ ⁠Those with a heaviness in the chest
•⁠ ⁠Creatives facing blocks in inspiration
•⁠ ⁠Caring parents in need of self-care
•⁠ ⁠Welcome to beginners!

What to expect
•⁠ ⁠Arrival ritual and consent check
•⁠ ⁠Breath demo to guide your experience
•⁠ ⁠Progressive breath arcs using Elebreath 5-Arc
•⁠ ⁠Conservative tracks available throughout
•⁠ ⁠Micro-shakes and unwinding to release tension
•⁠ ⁠Optional arm swings and body sways
•⁠ ⁠Integration rest to reflect on your journey
•⁠ ⁠Journaling to capture insights
•⁠ ⁠Live sound with bowls and curated music

Benefits you may notice
•⁠ ⁠A deeper sense of calm
•⁠ ⁠Softer jaw and shoulders
•⁠ ⁠A steadier baseline of emotional regulation
•⁠ ⁠A clearer mind
•⁠ ⁠Improved sleep quality
•⁠ ⁠A lifted mood
•⁠ ⁠Greater emotional range without feeling overwhelmed

Yoga mats are provided but you are most welcome to bring:
•⁠ ⁠Additional yoga mat
•⁠ ⁠Warm layers and socks
•⁠ ⁠Water bottle
•⁠ ⁠Small towel
•⁠ ⁠Optional eye mask or light scarf
•⁠ ⁠Journal and pen
•⁠ ⁠If you tend to feel cold, consider bringing a blanket

Pre-class prep
•⁠ ⁠Eat a light meal 2 hours before class.
•⁠ ⁠Hydrate well throughout the day.
•⁠ ⁠Avoid alcohol and recreational substances for 24 hours.
•⁠ ⁠Limit caffeine intake 4 hours prior.
•⁠ ⁠Arrive 10 minutes early for intake.
•⁠ ⁠If you have health conditions, check with your provider.
•⁠ ⁠Feel free to share any concerns with Lynn before the session at {{hi@lynofuro.co.nz}}.

Contraindications and safety
Breathwork can alter your breath rate and surface emotions. It may not be suitable for those who are pregnant, have serious cardiovascular issues, uncontrolled blood pressure, or a history of seizures. This practice is not medical care. We offer a conservative track with nasal-only breathing and smaller ranges of motion, along with breaks as needed.

Aftercare
Post-workshop, we encourage you to drink water, eat nourishing food, engage in simple movements or a short walk, and journal any insights. Emotional waves can continue for 24 to 48 hours, so reach out if you need support.

Facilitator
Lynn Tiang is an Integrative Somatic Coach specializing in breathwork and Reiki, focusing on corporate burnout, chronic pain, and stress. Her approach is nurturing and gentle, ensuring a supportive environment for all participants.

description:
From Sad Blokes to Well Men: Changing the focus in male suicide prevention - Ngāmotu - New Plymouth (FSB2026/06), From anxious boys through to lonely old men: Tracking male suicide across the lifespan.
Are traditional notions of masculinity meeting the needs of men in 2026? How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.
A vision for men’s wellbeing: An holistic approach to conceptualising men’s wellbeing and key mental wellbeing messages for men.
IT'S TIME FOR A SERIOUS RETHINK IN HOW WE PREVENT MALE SUICIDE AND TO TAKE SUICIDE IN MEN OUT OF THE TOO HARD BASKET
Hear a comprehensive critique of why the suicide rate in men continues to remain high despite numerous prevention initiatives, the reasons why we need to focus more on men and what are proven effective strategies for preventing male suicide.
BE PART OF THE SOLUTION
IN THIS MONTH OF MOVEMBER TAKE THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE  IN A WORKSHOP WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MALE SUICIDE PREVENTION SPECIALIST BARRY TAYLOR
It matters that men are able to optimise their wellbeing.  Well men contribute to well whānau, communities, workplaces, economy and society.
Drawing on his lived experience and his extensive experience in engaging, assessing and supporting suicidal men of different cultures, age groups, genders and sexualities, he offers practical and time proven approaches to both preventing male suicide, engaging with a suicidal man and effective initiatives to optimise men's wellbeing.
"Helping men and boys to transition from sad blokes to well men must be our focus"

description:
From Sad Blokes to Well Men: Changing the focus in male suicide prevention - Wellington (FSB2025/01), From anxious boys through to lonely old men: Tracking male suicide across the lifespan.
Are traditional notions of masculinity meeting the needs of men in 2025? How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.
A vision for men’s wellbeing: An holistic approach to conceptualising men’s wellbeing and key mental wellbeing messages for men.

IT'S TIME FOR A SERIOUS RETHINK IN HOW WE PREVENT MALE SUICIDE AND TO TAKE SUICIDE IN MEN OUT OF THE TOO HARD BASKET
Hear a comprehensive critique of why the suicide rate in men continues to rise despite numerous prevention initiatives, the reasons why we need to focus more on men and what are proven effective strategies for preventing male suicide.
BE PART OF THE SOLUTION
DURING THE MONTH OF MOVEMBER TAKE THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE  IN A WORKSHOP WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MALE SUICIDE PREVENTION SPECIALIST BARRY TAYLOR
It matters that men are able to optimise their wellbeing.  Well men contribute to well whānau, communities, workplaces, economy and society
Drawing on his lived experience and his extensive experience in engaging, assessing and supporting suicidal men of different cultures, age groups, genders and sexualities, he offers practical and time proven approaches to both preventing male suicide, engaging with a suicidal man and effective initiatives to optimise men's wellbeing.
"Helping men and boys to transition from sad blokes to well men must be our focus"
Topics covered:
Overview of suicide in men
The Suicidal Moment - Men's thoughts, emotions and behaviour in the "suicidal moment”
Masculinity for the 21st Century - Are traditional notions of masculinity meeting the needs of men in 2024?  How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.
Intergenerational suicide among men and its impact of whānau and hapū
From anxious boys through to lonely old men: Tracking male suicide across the lifespan
A vision for men’s wellbeing: An holistic approach to conceptualising men’s wellbeing and key mental wellbeing messages for men.
Tāne Ora: An Online Masterclass in creating a movement of wellbeing for men by men
Participants would benefit from also registering for this online workshop series which takes a deep dive into the determinants of wellbeing men and what is required to shift very ingrained understandings in men about being a man.  How do we move from a program approach to mens wellbeing to a movement of change that engages men in conversations of the heart and the walrua. Click here for more information and to register
Previous participants’ feedback
"The best and most informative workshop I have attended in 27 years of mental health nursing”  Community Mental Health Nurse
"This workshop should be compulsory for anyone working with men”  Male Family Violence Worker
"It was as if Barry was talking about every young man I see at school”  School Counsellor
"I have much better understanding about depressed and suicidal men. Going away with lots of ideas of how work with the men in my community”  Rural Community Support Worker
"Thanks for being so inclusive of older men. They are so often forgotten”. Aged Care Worker
"The incorporation of Te Ao Māori into the training was excellent and made it relevant to the men I work with” Kaiwhakatere
"Most helpful workshop I have been to in regards to suicide”  Mental Health Recovery Programme Facilitator
"Appreciated how inclusive the presenter was of different cultures and his analysis of how culture influences what it means to be a man”  Refugee Health Worker
An opportunity for a day of learning with award winning suicidologist, Barry Taylor

Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention / postvention for 36 years at the local, national and international levels.
His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to and evaluating  community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programmes.
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in the context of suicide prevention and postvention both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas. In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award. He currently sits one of the Health and Disability Ethics Committees.
As a health sociologist, Barry offers an unique insight into the phenomenon of male suicide in the Aotearoa-New Zealand context, the role of gender construction and the critical social and cultural determinants that have influenced men's distress and impaired wellbeing. Insights that very few others trainers or training programs in this country provide. He has had an interest on the impact of social exclusion, alienation and discrimination on mens's wellbeing and advocates for a human rights based, systems change and person-centred approach to wellbeing.The workshop is enriched by the learnings from Barry's own lived experience of depression and suicidality and his pathway to recovery.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to effectively respond to the unacceptably high rate of male suicide in this country.

Do you suffer from bloating, constipation, stomach cramps, weight gain, stubborn fat, or a low mood? Or do you just want you and your family to be healthier?

About this Event



Habit Mastery Series: Goal Setting for the New Year

The new year is fast approaching! Discover how to unlock your potential with this interactive goal-setting workshop so you can smash those new year’s resolutions. Learn how to clarify aspirations, set goals, and develop a success-driven mindset. Gain practical tools to turn dreams into actionable plans through hands-on exercises and expert insights.
This workshop is ideal for professionals, entrepreneurs, students, and anyone seeking clarity and direction in their personal or professional life.
Key Takeaways:
The psychology of goal setting
Creating goals
Overcoming obstacles and staying motivated
Tracking progress and adjusting strategies
Harnessing visualization and mindset for success
Join us for:

The session will be followed by a delicious plant-based dinner together, all included in your ticket!






Meet Your Host: Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. description:
Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience
Stress and struggle leave their mark on both body and mind, sometimes in ways we can’t easily undo. Just as knots form in the body, impressions and tensions accumulate in the mind. While we can’t change the past, the Bhagavad-gita teaches that we can shape our future—what we choose to cultivate now carries us forward.
In this one-hour workshop, we’ll explore how philosophical and spiritual wisdom can help us rise above the tangles of trauma and anxiety. Through practical insights, open discussion, and guidance from the Gita’s philosophy, we’ll look at how to build resilience—not only by steadying the nervous system, but by exploring the deeper self beyond the changing body and mind.
Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 28th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

description:
Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Wellington, We're pleased to invite you to join us for this workshop on Building resilience and unlocking the power of the mind.
Why this matters:
In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill. It's not just about bouncing back from adversity but confidently navigating change. Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability. This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind. By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
What to expect:
During this interactive workshop, participants will explore the core concepts of resilience and the mind-body connection through engaging discussions, experiential exercises, and practical demonstrations. They will learn evidence-based techniques to enhance their resilience, manage stress effectively, and cultivate a positive mindset amidst adversity. By the end of the session, attendees will emerge with a comprehensive toolkit to fortify their mental resilience and embrace change with confidence.
Who this is for:
This workshop caters to individuals across all organisational levels who are eager to enhance their resilience and cultivate a resilient mindset. Whether you're an owner, manager, chef, senior staff member, or junior employee, this workshop offers invaluable insights and practical strategies to bolster resilience and thrive in today's fast-paced world.
About the presenter, Sarah Robb
Sarah is a certified coach, counselor, and Master Practitioner of NLP (neuro-linguistic programming) holding a Bachelor's degree in Psychology.
With a passion for transformation, she guides individuals through retraining their brains and breaking free from limiting beliefs and patterns. Drawing on her extensive lived experience, Sarah has collaborated with over 200 clients and organisations, empowering them to apply practical tools and strategies for significant improvements in their mental health.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

description:
HineHau Breathwork for Women, Join Shannon Rose for this unique three-hour breathwork workshop for all wāhine.

Through story, breath, and reflection, you’ll learn and experience the power of your breath as a wāhine: to cleanse, to create, and to consciously live in alignment with who you are.

Shannon has been immersed in the practice of breath since 2017 and is recognised as one of the pioneers of breathwork in Aotearoa. She is the founder of HineHau, a breathwork training kaupapa supporting wāhine to step into leadership and facilitation through the breath.

In this workshop, you’ll be safely guided on a journey of remembrance, reconnection, and reclamation. Expect to come away feeling grounded, rejuvenated, and more at home in your body.

What’s Included
*Karakia to open and close our space
*Purākau — Māori creation stories on the whakapapa of the breath
*Kōrero — how intentional breathing helps to align your mauri, wairua and mana
*Working with the nervous system to support manifestation and creativity
*BreathWav™ Journey — a 70-minute circular connected breath practice for release, alignment, and deep connection
*Journaling & Reflection to integrate what arises.

What to Bring
Water bottle, a journal + pen and an eye mask. Mats, blankets & supportive props provided.

Who This is For
This workshop is open to wāhine of all cultures who are ready to experience the healing power of Te Hā — the sacred breath.

HineHau Breathwork for Women: Workshop, Join Shannon Rose for this unique three-hour workshop—breathwork for wāhine.
Through story, breath, and reflection, you’ll learn and experience the power of your breath as a wāhine: to cleanse, to create, and to consciously live in alignment with who you are. Open to wāhine of all cultures who are ready to experience the healing power of Te Hā — the sacred breath.
In this workshop, you’ll be safely guided on a journey of remembrance, reconnection, and reclamation. Expect to come away feeling grounded, rejuvenated, and more at home in your body.
What’s Included:
*Karakia to open and close our space

HineHau Breathwork for Women
With Shannon Rose
Saturday 25th October 2026, 11.45am-2.45pm | Awhi Yoga
Price: $65
Nau mai, haere mai!
About Shannon Rose:
Ngāti Porou ki Harataunga, Ngāti Whakaue, Ngāti Whakahemo, Tūhourangi, Scotland, Croatia, England. Shannon Rose has been immersed in the practice of breath since 2017 and is recognised as one of the pioneers of breathwork in Aotearoa. She is the founder of HineHau, a breathwork training kaupapa supporting wāhine to step into leadership and facilitation through the breath. HineHau teaches breathwork through a Te Ao Māori lens to wahine, offering 200-hour practitioner certifications.
Since beginning her practice in 2017, Shannon has been part of the early wave of facilitators bringing the transformative power of breathwork to Aotearoa. Her approach is both deeply spiritual and deeply human, making the breath accessible as a tool for healing, alignment, and reconnection.
Through HineHau (formerly Elevare), Shannon has trained over 50 practitioners in the BreathWav™ modality, a practice that works with the full spectrum of the breath to release, restore, and reawaken. At the heart of her work is a commitment to weaving whakapapa, story, and ceremony into modern practice, creating spaces where wāhine can return to themselves with clarity and confidence.

description:
Humans: Why & What To Do, Humans: Why & What To Do
An evening of inspiration & indulgence! Talk by Devamrita Swami followed by a plant-powered dinner & dessert.

We’re the most connected generation in history — and somehow the loneliest. We’ve built more technology than any civilisation before us — and still can’t solve our basic problems. We talk endlessly about progress — while the planet burns and mental health plummets.

What if the trouble isn’t just what we’re doing… but that we’ve forgotten why we’re doing it?

In this bold talk, Devamrita Swami — a world-traveling monk, strategist, and social critic — unpacks the mess we’re in and asks the questions most of us avoid: Why are we here? And what should we actually be doing about it?

Afterwards, stick around for a plant-based dinner and dessert — fresh, colourful, and made to share. Grab a plate, grab a seat, and dive into real conversations with people who are curious, open-minded, and up for something different.

Meet Devamrita Swami, your host
Devamrita Swami is an educator, author, and monk who has spent over forty years exploring and sharing the wisdom of bhakti-yoga. He brings ancient Vedic teachings to life, effortlessly navigating the latest research in archaeology, consciousness, ancient history, neuroscience, social science, and psychology. Author of Searching for Vedic India and Hiding in Unnatural Happiness, he combines philosophy with practical insights on happiness, wellbeing, and personal fulfillment. For anyone seeking to channel the human drive for fulfilment in a meaningful and sustainable way, Devamrita Swami offers clear, engaging, and indispensable wisdom.

description:
Inner infrastructure for Outer Resilience, In times of polycrisis and uncertainty, more people are coming around to the need not for more information, but for integration and presence.
This 90-minute session offers a safe, grounded space to slow down, reconnect with ourselves, and explore the inner terrain of change-making, and of our relational space.
As Rumi reminds us: “Yesterday I was clever and tried to change the world; today I am wise and am changing myself.”
Building our inner infrastructure - our relationship with self, with our feelings, with others and with nature - is foundational to how we show up in the world.
We will begin by discussing research into how distraction or numbing our discomfort is an intelligent and common short-term survival strategy, but in fact is one which limits our long-term capacity to connect, lead and evolve. We will then guide participants in somatic practices to offer accessible ways to reconnect with your agency.
During this session, you will gain tools to increase your inner awareness, expand your bandwidth of awareness, and integrate emotion, sensation, and story. Together we’ll explore the role of perception in our orientation to life and the choices we make, how our narratives can connect us with our agency, the power of curiosity, and dive into how our relational presence can often have more impact than our opinions.
This session is an invitation to restore connection, calm, and courage, to become more whole, more fully human, and more ready for what this moment is asking of us.
About your host
Freda is a curator, engagement practitioner, and connector, who works at the intersection of social change, community-building, and inner development. She is the Founder of the Goodlife Collective, which curates spaces that build connection, wellbeing and collective wisdom.
Drawing on yoga teaching, somatic practices and adult development, Freda is interested in how we build our inner infrastructure - the capacity to work through discomfort, reconnect with our agency, and bring greater presence to relationships. Her background is in psychology, environmental-science and design, and she loves nerding out on ideas and conversations about unlocking our collective potential.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Introduction to Acceptance and Commitment Therapy Workshop - November 2025, Introduction to Acceptance and Commitment Therapy Workshop - November 2025
A 2-day introductory, experiential ACT workshop for clinicians.

About this Event

Growing research about ACT demonstrates its efficacy for a wide range of diagnoses and life problems. It helps people accept their internal experiences while moving towards the life they value.
At this experiential workshop you will establish a foundational understanding of Psychological Flexibility, develop skills for using ACT and learn about Relational Frame Theory (RFT).
Over the two days you will learn how to:
help clients hold their painful thoughts and emotions gently; identify and actively move towards their values; and develop awareness of the present moment and their capacity to observe it.
develop a therapeutic relationship in which support can be provided compassionately and flexibly.
formulate life struggles from an ACT perspective.
practice ACT exercises and relate the concepts back to your own life and clinical experiences.
meet clients where they are and foster their willingness to change.
This workshop is fully catered with vegetarian food.
Giselle Bahr and Ben Sedley are clinical psychologists and co-founders of ACT Wellington. They have been using ACT for over 15 years, and have been trained and supervised by many leading ACT therapists and researchers. Giselle and Ben have both worked at Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services, in Private Practice with adults and adolescents, and in the clinical psychology programme at Victoria University. Giselle has developed and facilitated ACT groups for parents and adults, and served on the Board of ANZ ACBS. Ben is the author of Stuff That Sucks: Accepting what you can’t change and committing to what you can, the co-author of Stuff That's Loud: A teen's guide to unspiralling when OCD gets noisy (with Lisa Coyne) and is an ACBS Peer Reviewed ACT Trainer.


QUESTIONS AND MORE INFORMATION
How can I contact the organiser with any questions?
Please get in touch if you have any questions about this training. You can email us at:

JOURNEY TO SERENITY YIN YOGA AND SOUND HEALING 2025, JOURNEY TO SERENITY YIN YOGA AND SOUND HEALING 2025
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are monthly on the second Friday of each month and are held temporarily in the Meeting Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity.
