description:
Terra Soma Yoga, You are welcomed to a gentle, invitational yoga experience.

Terra-soma yoga (translating to earth-body) weaves together hatha yoga, somatic inquiry, and nature connection, inviting you into awareness of your inner terrain. This approach encourages you to meet yourself as you are — to listen to the intelligence of your body's own rhythms and sense how they echo the wider rhythms of the earth. Through this listening, we enter a living, evolving conversation about well-being and what it can look like in today’s world.

How is your heart? We often hear “follow your heart” or “listen to your heart,” but what does that actually mean? In this class, you’ll be invited into heart somatic enquiry - locating this intelligent organ, listening into this space, and perhaps allowing it to lead, inform, or express through movement.

The structure of this hour-long class includes:

A gentle lead-in towards the heart

A mixture of supine, seated, and standing asana

Repeated sequences with encouragement to make them your own — add or subtract asana, move in your own time, with your own breath

Optional free movement explorations

This is an invitational practice — everything is a choice, not a must. Tailor the practice to suit yourself. Come as you are; everyone and all of you is welcome.

Your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, making this an evening of movement, heartful awareness, and wholesome connection.

Meet Abbie, your facilitator,
Abbie is a 200-hour certified yoga teacher who trained with Awakening Arts: School of Yoga and Eco Somatic. She deeply values the insight, liberation, inner and collective resources somatic movement practices can offer. Abbie has also completed a 50-hour training exploring how yoga can support trauma awareness, mental health, and body image. She thrives in and intends to create spaces where each person’s pace is honored and the body’s innate wisdom is encouraged to emerge and lead.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
The Check-in Men's Group Tuesday 23 Sept, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

description:
The Healthy Hospo Stress Reset: Sauna • Ice Bath • Breathwork • Community - Auckland, Healthy Hospo and Hospitality New Zealand are excited to invite you to…
The Hospo Stress Reset: Sauna • Ice Bath • Breathwork • Community
We’re all told that stress is bad. Chronic stress can lead to burnout and serious health issues. But what if stress itself isn’t the enemy? What if learning how to work with stress could actually make it a powerful tool for resilience, energy, and performance?
With hospitality gearing up for peak season, this is your chance to reset, recharge, and equip yourself with the tools to stay calm and in control when things get busy.
Join Healthy Hospo and Hospitality New Zealand for a unique experiential workshop designed just for hospo. Across this 2-hour session, you’ll experience:
·       Interactive Breathwork, led by our resident Breathwork & Physiology expert, Josh Fankhauser, to help you manage stress and shift your state on demand.
·       Hot/Cold Contrast Therapy, a guided community sauna and ice bath experience with Sauna Collective, to boost recovery, improve focus, and leave you feeling re-energised.
·       Practical Tools for Everyday Life. Strategies you can take back to your workplace (and your own wellbeing) to help you thrive through peak season.

 Times: Three sessions to choose from, each capped at 16 people so spaces will go fast!
·       9:00 – 10:45am
·       11:00 – 12:45pm
·       1:15 – 3:00pm
What to Bring
·       Swim suit
·       2 x Towels (one for sauna, one for shower)
·       Change of clothes
·       Notebook & pen
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $50 per person is fully sponsored.
Spaces are limited and as all spaces are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!
label: Health & Wellness

description:
The Kava Experience, Bula Vinaka and Welcome to Kava Culture, New Zealand’s newest destination for authentic Fijian Kava!
We are thrilled to invite you to another relaxing Kava Experience night. Whether you're a curious newcomer or a seasoned kava enthusiast, our dedicated team will warmly guide you through every step of this unique journey.
At Kava Culture, we offer a premium, traditionally brewed kava experience designed for wellness-focused individuals seeking natural relaxation. We pride ourselves on sourcing our kava directly from small Pacific Island farms, ensuring unparalleled quality and authenticity.
Immerse yourself in the rich traditions of the Pacific as you enjoy our exquisite kava in our calm, serene location at Kaitahi, beautifully illuminated by ambient lights. This is more than just a drink; it's an opportunity to connect with others, promote genuine stress relief, and celebrate ancient island culture with modern comfort.
Join us for a night filled with community, connection, and tranquility. Let Kava Culture transport you – no passport required!
Choose your journey:
* Mini Experience: $30 (1.5 hours)
* Full Experience: $50 (3 hours)
We can’t wait to welcome you!

description:
The Mind, Body, & Climate Change-FREE EVENT AT VIC, The Mind, Body, & Climate Change-FREE EVENT AT VIC
The Mind, Body, & Climate Change

Explore how young minds can drive change by understanding the links between climate change, well-being, and action.

Free kai. Big ideas. Good vibes.

Ready to connect the dots between your own well-being and the planet’s future? We’re talking real talk, fresh perspectives, and a whole lot of inspiration — without the boring lecture vibe.

Devamrita Swami — world-travelling monk, renowned strategist, social observer, and all-round thought-provoker — is back at Vic Uni for the third time. He’s spoken at universities all over the globe, and now he’s here to flip the way you see climate action and mental health.

And yes… free plant-based dinner is on us:

🌮 Loaded nachos (salsa, taco ‘meat’, sour ‘cream’ & ‘cheese’)
🥤 Strawberry & peanut butter milkshakes
🍩 Caramel & chocolate doughnut


Come for the food, stay for the conversation. Connect with good humans, share some laughs, and leave with fresh ideas you’ll actually want to act on.

When: Tues 16 Sept, 5:45 pm

Where: Vic Uni, Kelburn Parade — MacLaurin Building MCLT103 (up the steps from the Hub). We’ll have people outside pointing you in the right direction. Lost? Text us: +64 20 4191 5046

Click ‘Get Tickets’ to save your seat (and your doughnut).
👉🏽👉🏽 https://tr.ee/TheMindBodyClimateChange 👈🏿👈🏿

Hosted by yoga lounge club.

description:
The Overthinking Mind - Break Free From Mental Loops, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

The Overthinking Mind - Tap to break free from mental loops

This workshop explores why our thoughts get stuck in loops of worry, doubt, and replay.  Drawing on the insights of Carl Jung, we’ll uncover how the unconscious mind, shadow, and how unresolved inner conflicts fuel over-thinking. You’ll also learn how the body and nervous system become conditioned to repeat these mental patterns, creating the familiar cycle of racing thoughts and restless emotions.

Through a guided exercise, you’ll experience practical tools from FasterEFT and the science of neuroplasticity—methods that help rewire the brain and bring the mind back to calm clarity.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll not only understand the deeper roots of over-thinking, but you’ll also walk away with simple, repeatable techniques to interrupt mental loops, ease the nervous system, and create a lasting sense of inner peace.

“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others and see that many of us face the same challenges beneath the surface—making growth and healing easier when we explore them together :)

“This is an interactive workshop that offers the chance to connect with others on a similar journey. It’s powerful to know, that beneath the surface, we often share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”

Meet your host, Krishnaloka

Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

The Overthinking Mind - Finding Peace in Mental Chaos, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind - Finding Peace in Mental Chaos
In a world full of distractions and constant motion, it’s easy to feel disconnected from ourselves. Yoga philosophy invites us to slow down and turn inward, offering powerful insights into the nature of the mind and how we relate to our inner world. This workshop will focus on cultivating presence and awareness through ancient teachings and grounded practices that help us reconnect with what truly matters—bringing calm, focus, and meaning into everyday life.

description:
The Overthinking Mind – Making Friends with our Mind, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind- Making friends with our mind
What mood is our mind in today? What does it refuse to do that we want it do, and what does it do that we don’t want it to do? Is there any solution to the unruly nature of the mind? Thankfully yoga wisdom deals head on with the mind - how to manage it, and how to satisfy it and make it peaceful.


Meet your host, Khadiravan
Khadiravan is a seasoned bhakti yoga teacher at Bhakti Lounge and you might have heard her angelic singing, which is like therapy for the ears. Kirtan (mantra music meditation) is Khadiravan's love and she enjoys creating a comfortable and meditative space when she hosts our SoundLabs or at soulFeast. Khadiravan also offers her background of a PhD in Yoga Psychology, to whoever wants to lend an ear and an inquisitive mind to exploring life through the lens of yoga wisdom
6.15pm Tuesday 23rd of September
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

description:
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis
If your brain won’t stop running in circles, this workshop is for you.
In 60 minutes, we’ll unpack why your mind loves to overthink, how to break out of thought spirals before they swallow your day, and I’ll guide you through a relaxing hypnosis to quiet the noise on the spot. You’ll leave with simple tools you can use anytime life feels too loud.


Meet your host, Gopi
Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity, overcome negative thought patterns and habits through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, trauma informed coach, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.

description:
Women's Health and Aging Workshop, Movement and function can be challenging for women as we age. Join experienced physiotherapist Sara Dore and explore how you can manage the effects on your health and wellbeing as you age as a woman. (Free for NZ Citizens/Residents, others pay fee of $99)

An interactive workshop presented by experienced physiotherapist Sara Dore, focusing on how movement and function can be challenging for women as they age. Particularly for women, there is more to the core than abdominal muscles and strength and we explore these broader aspects. Most importantly, you will come to understand that movement is medicine and we can make a difference.

You will be able to make a positive difference for yourself! The objective of this workshop is to give you knowledge and understanding about how you can manage the effects on your health and wellbeing as we age as women
Knowledge is power!

In this one-day workshop you will discover:
- The base of the pelvic floor. Anatomy of the pelvic floor, and the common conditions urinary incontinence, and pelvic organ prolapse will be discussed. Education on basic pelvic floor advice and management as well as appropriate exercises will also covered.
- The middle deep abdominal muscles. Trunk stability versus core strength as we age and the impact on our other core muscles and pelvic floor will be discussed. The principles of Clinical Pilates versus traditional Pilates will be presented together with he key principles of movement is medicine.
-The importance of the diaphragm and breathing well will also be discussed to enhance optimal movement and function for women.

Please wear comfortable clothes and socks as this is an interactive workshop.
Tea and coffee provided, please bring your lunch and snacks.

A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend the workshop.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions "What You Need to Know".

description:
Yoga & Cacao Twilight & Morning Edition - Pop-up Parlour 2025, Yoga & Cacao Twilight & Morning Edition - Pop-up Parlour 2025
Come and join Jenny Allan for a cup of ceremonial grade cacao and then enjoy a gentle and relaxing restorative yoga practice - twilight edition.

Event details

• What - 1.5 hr yoga session
• When -
TWILIGHT EDITION 7-8.30pm Tuesday 23rd September 2025
MORNING EDITION 10-11.30am Saturday 27th September 2025

• Where - St Marks, 98 Rāwhiti Road, Pukerua Bay
• Cost - $30 per person

• What to bring? Most props are provided but feel free to bring your own yoga mat for extra comfort as well as a cushion, blanket, socks and an eye pillow if you have one.

This class is suitable for all - no previous experience is required.

LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE.
TWILIGHT SESSION - https://tinyurl.com/5a2pad44
MORNING SESSION - https://tinyurl.com/mw82z38u

Restorative yoga is a practice of deep relaxation in which yoga poses (asanas) are held for several minutes with the use of props such as blocks, bolster and blankets to support the body in gentle stretch.

When your body enters a state of relaxation, your mind will also relax. Once you have been guided to let go of any tension held in your body, all that is required is for you to pay attention to your breath, becoming aware of any thoughts that may arise, and then gently releasing them.

This restful practice calms both mind and body, allowing the nervous system to enter its parasympathetic state – the state of “rest and digest”, in which healing is enabled and enhanced.

About Cacao
Cacao is a superfood. It is plant medicine at its finest. Its scientific name, Theobroma cacao, translates to "food of the Gods." Containing many minerals, vitamins and phytonutrients such as flavonoids and antioxidants, it is also an extremely potent adaptogen that encourages the body to come into balance.

Cacao has a particularly strong influence on the heart – both physiologically and energetically. Cacao anecdotally is reported to enhance connection in community, hence its beauty in being shared in circle.

In Jenny's experience, cacao seems to enhance whatever it is that you are doing – be it running a marathon or meditating – cacao can make you go deeper, further, longer, stronger. However she does seem to have a mind of her own so be open to the experience she offers you – it may not always go quite how you planned!

Cacao is very safe and tolerated well by most people. However it is to be used with caution by people who are taking high doses of SSRIs. Cacao releases serotonin, so it works as a mild antidepressant. When taken with SSRIs that release serotonin chemically it can lead to serotonin syndrome. Individuals taking MAOIs (monoamine oxidase inhibitors) should avoid consuming ceremonial cacao due to potential interactions.

This workshop is part of Pukerua Bay Hub's 2025 Pop-up Parlour - thanks for your support.

description:
Yoga for All at Kai Tahi, Yoga for All at Kai Tahi
Community yoga is coming to Kai Tahi!

Try Sunday morning yoga classes with local yoga teacher, Janie Walker from BeCalmed Studio. Janie specialises in introducing people to yoga and supporting a life-long practice and love of yoga. Come stretch, breathe and feel good; this is yoga for all bodies and experiences.

$10 per class (cash or internet banking), no bookings required.
Please bring a yoga mat.

Every Sunday 9am (starts 19 October)
Kai Tahi atrium

What is yoga?

Yoga is breathing deeply, letting go of anxious thoughts, being kind, stretching the body to reduce tension, being more flexible, focusing and being mindful, and moving into different shapes.

What are the benefits of yoga?

Get stronger, more flexible and re-learn to relax in these Sunday morning community yoga classes. Reduce your blood pressure, improve circulation, reduce anxiety – and find more ease in your body.

How will I feel after my Sunday Kai Tahi yoga class?

Lighter, more relaxed, stronger, more confident, calmer.

What kind of yoga will I be doing?

A mix of vinyasa, hatha, restorative and mindfulness.

Who is the yoga teacher?

Janie Walker is a trained and experienced vinyasa, restorative and yin yoga teacher. She weaves ancient yoga philosophy and breath work with easy poses. Her classes are for beginners and those who want to deepen their own practice. Janie focuses on relaxation, breath and relaxing the mind.

How much does it cost?

$ 10 per class (cash or internet banking)

Do I need to book?

No bookings necessary. Just turn up. Yoga mats provided or bring your own.

Can I do yoga if I am injured or recovering from illness or don’t feel good?

If you have an injury or want to chat about how to look after yourself during your yoga class, please do contact Janie: or phone 0274539099. If you have any other physical or mental conditions that you’d like Janie to be aware of so she can support you, please contact her.

Find out more about BeCalmed Studio and Janie Walker - www.becalmedstudio.com

description:
(Now on Sunday) Planetary Parade - Free event, Due to a heavy cloud forecast on Saturday morning, we have changed the date for this event to the following morning, Sunday 24 August.
A rare cosmic event where six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

description:
5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio, Five years ago we were in the midst of a global pandemic, visiting digital rooms with friends around the corner, making sourdough, and sort of watching the daily news. We were also making experimental attempts into the world of radio, with the birth of Mouthfull’s first international streaming server, playing music 24/7 (also live events a few times a week).
If we travel even further back in time, 2017 was the debut of the “Mouthfull Radio” episodic series (~20eps) - but we consider the ongoingness the real thing to celebrate.
Moving towards present day ~ through a vast richness of hosts, events, music, shows, zines, selectors, connections, pop ups, and story-times. It is a real joy to help community contemporary radio ripple out from this Pacific Island nation to the world wide web.

5 Years goes so fast, and so we shall honour this time with a great celebration in the capital city of Aotearoa! We will bring together all of the elements of Mouthfull you have known to love; make some books, make up some new dance moves with friends, and make our ears glisten in the sounds of live and selected music.
Whiro // New Moon. The last dark night of winter. A time for reflection; an invitation to come together as friends and whānau and plant intentional seeds for future flowers to bloom, as well as rest in deep listening and shared beingness.

Lineup:
*ºJuniper May
*ºStar Time
*ºajhoneysuckle (tāmaki)
*ºMystery Waitress (duo)
*ºDJ B.Lo (whākatu)
*°Benny Salvador


We are also releasing our first ever compilation. This special event will be opened with a premiere listening session of the full CD, playing the album all the way through. You can purchase a physical copy at the show, or on bandcamp (preorders open September 1st).
5PM sharp CD push play. Some divine collaborators with unique new releases on offer.

This is a fundraiser to support the sustainability of Mouthfull. We are only able to pay the bills due to events like this, and are fundraising to support a long awaited update of our digital infrastructure to enable future support. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT - you can support us by purchasing a ticket (extra donation if you are balling), a tshirt, a raffle ticket, or a zine - it all goes to the same goal of enabling & uplifting one another.

How Big Should My Entry Be?
This is Armies on Parade, so go big!

Armies on Parade is your opportunity to show off what inspires you in the Warhammer hobby. Your project could be anything from a K*ll Team squad or a Warcry warband to a massive galaxy-conquering battleforce or a realm-shaking army.

For Warhammer Age of Sigmar, Warhammer 40,000, Legions Imperialis, Middle-earth™ Strategy Battle Game, Warhammer: The Old World, and Warhammer: The Horus Heresy, the minimum number of units per entry is two complete units. This can be any combination of unit types, including, but not limited to, a character model and a squad, two tanks, a tank and squad, and more.

For skirmish-style games including Necromunda, K*ll Team, Warcry, Warhammer Underworlds, and Blood Bowl, the minimum entry is one complete warband, K*ll team, gang, Blood Bowl team, or other equivalent.

Experience the wonders of the Universe as you embark on an extraordinary journey into the vast depths of space and beyond.

This September at Astronomy on Tap, we’re diving into one of the biggest questions in science: Are we alone? Our theme is The Search for Life and Water. Wherever we find water on Earth, we find life. Could the same be true beyond our planet?

From icy moons in our Solar System to distant exoplanets, scientists are searching for the conditions that could support life. Join us as we explore the potential for discovering life in the universe and the technology helping us get closer to the answer.
Upon arrival, receive a drink and your first-class inflight snacks. Then sit back and relax in our digital full-dome planetarium as we explore the night sky. Complete your trip through the galaxy with the cash bar and a look through interactive exhibitions.

Whether you’re accompanied by a special someone, a friend, or embarking on a solo adventure, raise your glass to the stars and enjoy the stellar ride.

description:
Bar Crossing Seminar - Manawatū (Foxton bar), Crossing A Bar? We Can Help
Bar crossings can be one of the trickiest, and riskiest parts of boating in Aotearoa. They change fast, they don’t always play nice, and they’ve caught out even the most experienced skippers. Each year, we see serious incidents and tragedies happening on our bars, so it’s super important to know your stuff before you head out.
That’s where we come in. Join us at Manawatu Marine Boating Club for a free and relaxed seminar. You’ll hear straight from local Coastguard skippers and boating legends who’ll share their real-world tips, local knowledge, and a few stories from the water.

Here’s what we’ll cover (and chat about):

Understanding the local features of your bar
Reading and interpreting the conditions when planning a trip
Getting your boat and your crew bar crossing ready
How to handle your boat while crossing
How to do a bar crossing report (and why it’s worth it)
What to do if things go pear-shaped
It’s interactive – so bring your questions, share your own experiences, and have a yarn with others in the boating community.
Bring your mates too – whether they’re brand new to boating or have been around since the days of paper charts and handheld compasses, there’s something in here that could save a trip… or a life.
 Why it matters:
In 2024, 23% of craft-related drownings happened during bar crossings.
5 lives were lost due to capsizing while crossing a bar.
Older blokes are still the most at-risk – but everyone can make safer choices with the right knowledge (and a lifejacket on).

It’s Halloween and that is true for this month at Bea Adventure! All things spooky and kooky are there for the investigating, rescuing and possibly the running from! Will the witch need saving before the angry mob gets them or is she trying to make you into a casserole? Is that haunted house really ghost infested or is it just a group of pesky kids and their meddling mutt?

Meet with fellow heroes to save the world against foul monsters and evil enemies … all with a beer* in hand. Join our Professional Dungeon Masters and play D&D the World’s Greatest Roleplaying Game.

In cahoots with Baylands Brewery, Bea D&D the premium gaming store based in Wellington, are running Dungeons & Dragons RPG evening events for adults (R18).

Whether you have played D&D before many times or never, all heroes are welcome to come along. Our professional Dungeon Masters are skilled in helping you have a great time as you learn and still providing a challenging encounter for all the adventurers who have fought many battles before. It’s a great place to bring friends who have been meaning to try the game for a while, get some social time in with friends and try out some amazing locally brewed beers.

We will be providing pre-generated character sheets and everything you need to play. All you need to bring is yourself. (For all you dice goblins, do feel free to bring your own shiny math rocks along for us to admire.) We will start off the session getting familiar with your character and how to play, before venturing out into the world. Make sure you get there on time or we may have to start the adventure without you!

Dungeons & Dragons in a real tavern. It’s the event you have been waiting for. So don’t delay, get your tickets today!

PLEASE NOTE: Being that the venue is licensed, and the event runs late, we don’t recommend this one for young adventurers. Check out our kid friendly options in the Bea D&D store instead!

description:
Book Club: Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, Join us in person to discuss Emiko, a contemporary version of Jane Austen's Emma set in Canada.
(Order your copy through us by 20 March 2026 for delivery at the 23 May meeting or couriered in NZ)
About Emiko:
A busybody foodie avoids questions of her own future as she meddles in the love lives of those around her. Has this matcha-maker met her match?

Self-declared matchmaking GENIUS (a la Beyonce) Emiko Kimori has already found success by helping her aunt find true love, so when the new girl in town becomes her new BFF, it's only natural for Emiko to help set her up for social success with a suitable love match.

Emiko lives with her Ojiichan in a small town on BC's West Coast surrounded by friends and neighbors, including her childhood friend Kenzo Sanada, who wishes she'd spend less time playing matchmaker. But Emiko can so clearly see who belongs together, even when her targets don't know it themselves. She simply has to meddle - for the sake of true love!

As for her own romantic life though . . . who has time for that? Emiko is far too busy with her matchmaking schemes, her brunch recipes, volunteering, her bustling social life, keeping up her grades, eating said brunch recipes and making plans for after graduation. Plans she will absolutely decide on soon. Definitely. Maybe? But when Emiko ends up falling for the last person she expects, she finds herself caught in the tangled web of her own love matches. For the first time, instead of arranging from afar, Emiko has to figure out what it means to be in love herself, and that friendship and romance are more complicated than she ever imagined . . .
About the Author:
Chieri Uegaki is a second generation Japanese-Canadian and award-winning children’s author living and writing on Vancouver Island, in the traditional and unceded territory of the lək̓ʷəŋən speaking peoples, today known as the Esquimalt and Songhees Nations.
She graduated with a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of British Columbia’s Creative Writing Department and has written a number of stories for children, including the picture books Suki’s Kimono and Rosie and Buttercup (both illustrated by Stéphane Jorisch); Hana Hashimoto, Sixth Violin (illustrated by Qin Leng); and Ojiichan’s Gift (illustrated by Genevieve Simms).
When not reading or writing, Chieri consumes rom-coms and mysteries in any form, chooses appetizers over dessert most of the time, and tries to stay on top of her collecting problem. She is currently working on a number of projects.
Rachel Pilois (Book Buyer) on this selection:
There have been many retellings of Austen’s novels in the last 200 years. Pride and Prejudice easily wins the prize of Austen’s most adapted novel in both film and literature. In the last 20 years there’s been a noticeable growth in culturally (and gender) diverse takes on Austen’s work, with the most popular retellings being of Indian (i.e Bride and Prejudice) or African-American (i.e. Ibi Zoboi’s Pride) heritage. Sadly, some of her less popular novels (Mansfield Park and Northanger Abbey) have few adaptations in both film and literature, faithful or modern retelling.
With the 2026 theme of the JASNZ being diversity it made sense to choose a slightly less popular novel (only in terms of how many adaptations) and a slightly less common culture used in Austen retellings. Thus I settled on the upcoming YA novel Emiko by Chieri Uegaki, a Japanese-Canadian retelling of Emma.
Emma is a much beloved story and a much beloved character, who’s thoughts, actions and motivations are very recognisable in a modern teenager. Adding in the deep cultural etiquette of Japan as a likeness to the rules of regency society, makes Uegaki’s Emiko a brilliant and well thought out modern retelling of the Emma.
As it publishes on 9 September 2025, we can discover and discuss this new and exciting adaptation for the first time together! 
NB: Ticket numbers are limited to ensure ease of discussion. Afternoon tea is provided
FRIEND: bring a friend, get 10% off! Discount automatically applied

description:
Book Group: Uncle Tom's Cabin by Harriet Beecher Stowe, Do you keep meaning to read more of the great classics of literature? At Wellington Classic Literature Group we read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. The group has been running for more than a decade and we have a great bunch of regulars as well as readers that come along for particular books or simply when it suits. We meet on the first Tuesday of the month.

Our October book is Harriet Beecher Stowe's 1852 abolitionist novel Uncle Tom's Cabin; or, Life Among the Lowly. The work changed American hearts and minds about slavery.

The influence of Uncle Tom's Cabin was so immense that the story arose that when Abraham Lincoln welcomed Stowe to the White House during the American Civil War he reportedly declared, "So this is the little lady who started this great war."

In the US, it was the best-selling novel of the 19th century and the second best-selling book of all after the Bible.

Project Gutenberg link for those e-reading:
https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/203

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.

HALLOWEEN CRAWL TERMS & CONDITIONS
ENTRY REQUIREMENTS
This is a 18+ event only. Government-issued photo ID is mandatory at the door. No ID, no participation.
WRISTBAND POLICY
Your wristband = your access. It must be collected at the official check-in location during posted hours (before 10:30 PM).
If you miss check-in, your wristband will not be available and you will not be permitted into crawl venues. No refunds.
If you can’t make it, you may designate a friend to pick up your wristband on your behalf.
VENUE PARTICIPATION & RULES
Crawl schedules, bar times, and specials are listed on the Digital Bar List.
Your ticket is only valid during the scheduled crawl hours — not outside of them.
Digital Crawl Map: Always check it the morning of the event for final venue confirmations and any last-minute adjustments.
Venues may close early, reach capacity, or have staff unaware of the crawl — if so, simply continue to another participating location listed on the map.
All venues reserve the right to deny entry based on intoxication, dress code, behavior, or safety concerns. Standard security checks still apply.
TICKETS & SALES
All sales are final. Tickets are non-transferable and non-refundable.
If an event is fully canceled without a replacement date, a refund (minus processing fees) will be issued.
Events run rain or shine, and lineup, specials, or bar participation may change without notice.
COSTUMES & CONDUCT
Costumes are encouraged, but anything resembling a weapon or considered offensive may result in denied entry with no refund.
Disorderly conduct, harassment, or damage to property will result in removal without compensation.
LIABILITY RELEASE
By purchasing a ticket and joining the crawl, you confirm that you are participating at your own risk. You accept full responsibility for any injuries, illnesses, property loss, theft, accidents, alcohol-related incidents, or death that may occur before, during, or after the event.
You hereby waive, release, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, staff, contractors, sponsors, volunteers, affiliates, and all participating venues from any and all liability — whether due to negligence, gross negligence, breach of duty, or otherwise.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties from any claims, damages, or legal fees arising from your actions or participation.
By attending, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and accepted this waiver. It is intended to be as broad and enforceable as permitted by law.

description:
Boos & Brews Halloween Pub Crawl Wellington 2025, Boos & Brews Halloween Pub Crawl Wellington 2025
Boos, brews & beats. 4+ pubs, seasonal pours & a citywide Halloween party in Wellington. Oct 31 — your crawl awaits.

About this Event


👻🍻 BOOS & BREWS HALLOWEEN PUB CRAWL – Wellington 2025 🍻👻
Halloween Friday in Wellington deserves a proper toast. On October 31st, 2025, join Drink Link for the Boos & Brews Pub Crawl, a night where costumes meet craft beer. This crawl will take you through 4+ pubs, each serving up themed drinks, lively music, and plenty of Halloween energy.





🍺 Crawl Highlights
🍻 Seasonal Pours & Haunted Cocktails – Pumpkin ales, blood-red brews, and crawl-only drink deals
🎶 Music & DJs – From spooky classics to dancefloor favorites
🍺 Walkable Route – All pubs within easy reach, no rides needed


🍺 How the Night Flows
Check-In (7:30–10:30 PM) – Collect your wristband and your first pint of the night.
Roam (8:30–11:30 PM) – Move between pubs at your own pace, guided by the digital crawl map.
Final Toast (11:30 PM–2 AM) – Everyone gathers at the closing bar for the big party.

🍻 Digital Crawl Map – Full lineup posted on event day ()


🍺 Tickets
🎟 Early Bird pricing starts at $15
🚫 Capacity is limited — don’t wait
🍻 Wristband covers venue entry, drink specials, and map access





⚠️ Important Event Disclaimers
Age Requirement
Entry is strictly 18+. You must show a valid government-issued photo ID to participate. No exceptions will be made.
Wristbands
Your wristband is your pass for entry. Present your ticket or QR code at the check-in location to receive it. Wristbands must be worn throughout the night to access participating venues. If you miss the pickup window listed on the crawl map, you forfeit your access — no wristband means no entry. Lost or unclaimed wristbands cannot be replaced.
Tickets & Refunds
All sales are final. Tickets cannot be refunded, transferred, or exchanged. If the crawl is canceled without being rescheduled, the base ticket price (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Participating venues, event hours, and drink specials may be adjusted at any time without advance notice.
Venue Entry
Each participating location has the right to refuse service or entry for reasons including intoxication, violation of dress code, inappropriate conduct, or venue capacity. If denied entry at one stop, you may visit another participating venue. No refunds will be issued under these circumstances.
Capacity & Access
Venues may reach capacity at peak times. Admission is not guaranteed once a venue is full. Late arrivals may face lines or delays. Refunds will not be issued for wait times or inability to enter specific venues.
Self-Guided Crawl
This is a self-directed event. There is no host leading the group. Use the DIGITAL CRAWL MAP LINK to navigate between stops.
Venue Awareness
Not all bar staff may know about crawl logistics. If confusion arises, contact the event representative listed on the crawl map. If that venue cannot accommodate you, move on to another open crawl location.
Drink Specials
Discounts and drink deals are set independently by each bar. They may change, sell out, or be discontinued without notice.
Event Timing
Tickets are valid only during official crawl hours listed on the digital map. Showing up early, late, or outside of the crawl schedule does not guarantee entry.
Security
All venues will conduct their own security screening. A wristband does not bypass checks.
Costumes
Costumes must be safe and respectful. Props resembling weapons or offensive attire will result in denial of entry without refund.
Notifications
To stay updated, sign up for text alerts. These will notify you of venue changes or movement times during the crawl.
Conduct
Respect staff, other attendees, and venues. Disorderly behavior, property damage, or harassment will result in immediate removal without refund.
Liability Waiver
By purchasing a ticket, you acknowledge and accept that participation carries risks. You voluntarily assume all dangers, including but not limited to: accidents, personal injury, illness, disability, property damage, theft, alcohol-related incidents, interactions with other participants, and even serious injury or death.
You, and anyone acting on your behalf, hereby release and discharge Events Per Se, its affiliates, sponsors, contractors, employees, volunteers, and participating venues from any liability for losses, claims, or damages — whether due to negligence, gross negligence, breach of duty, or any other cause — that may occur before, during, or after the crawl.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties against any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) that arise as a result of your actions during the event.
By attending, you confirm you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this agreement is intended to be as broad as allowed by law.
Event Continuity
The crawl will run rain or shine. Venues may change last minute. Always check your email and the digital crawl map for updates.
Acknowledgment
Purchase of a ticket signifies full acceptance of these disclaimers, terms, and conditions. You accept complete responsibility for your participation.

description:
Coven: Butch, For butches and butch lovers! This night sets to make two things clear:

1. We love butches!
2. Get enough sapphics and queers in a room and anything can become a competition

Join us for axe throwing, games, kai, and as always at our events impeccable vibes. Spot prizes for the best butches, drink on arrival, and a room full of hot babes? Need we say more, so get your fits checked and grab your ticket before they go. This event has limited capacity.

Not a butch? No problem, all butch and butch appreciating Coven members of all flavours welcome.

No dress code! Come as you are, celebrate butch fashion or your queer identity and expect a fun chill night with your community.

More info about Coven:

Coming Solo? You’re Not Alone.
Don’t be nervous if you’re planning to come on your own – Coven is built for connection. Whether it’s your first queer event or your hundredth, you’ll be surrounded by a community that gets it. From the moment you arrive, there’ll be friendly faces, welcoming vibes, and plenty of chances to mingle, and connect. Coven is about belonging – and there’s a place here for you.

Coven Kaupapa
For queer women and gender minorities, spaces like this are rare, vital, and sometimes, life-changing. In a world that constantly centers cishet norms, Coven offers a space where we are the default – where you can fully show up as yourself, be seen, celebrated and surrounded by YOUR community.

For many in our Coven, this is one of the only opportunities we feel comfortable enough to experience nightlife free from the male gaze, tokenism, fear, or the need to shrink ourselves to fit in. It’s a space where sapphic, trans, nonbinary, and gender-diverse people aren’t just welcomed – we are centered. It’s for those who are often pushed to the margins, who rarely feel represented in “inclusive” spaces that still cater to the mainstream.

This night exists because we need it – and because we create it, together.

Accessibility
This event is located on the ground floor. Have specific accessibility needs? Reach out directly to the Whisky & Wood team at hello@whiskyandwood.co.nz

If you made it this far... Good girl / Good they / Good boy / Good YOU!

description:
Dancing & Drinking Society, DADS return to The Undercurrent!

The Dancing & Drinking Society (or DADS for short), is New Zealand’s premier exponent of authentic 1920s dance Jazz with Rags, Rambles, Shuffles, Drags and Blues from the juke joints, speakeasies, woolsheds and Memorial Halls of 1920s New Zealand.

DADS have been bringing their swing blues sounds to dance floors and craft beer bars across the capital since late 1913. When they take to the stage, guitar, horns, vocals, and kick drum blend as The Society present their favourite old rarities with exactly the sort of vigour you want for some stress relieving dance times. They’ve cultivated a decent reputation for generous and open-hearted live performance.

If you feel like a decent drink and a leg shake or two, this would make for a pretty good option.

With Adrian Jensen, Daniel Yeabsley, Blair Latham, and now Michael Costello!

See: ⁦https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rlWe4fbd-O4⁩

Thursday 4th December
Doors 7pm/ Gig 7:30pm
$20
Tickets available online and on the door

Snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

We’ll see you there ☆

description:
F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #10, Sign up here: https://luma.com/ftstwellington10
F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington!

WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?
FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!
Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!

HOW TO JOIN?
Take 2 minutes to fill out our form

https://luma.com/ftstwellington10
Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma

HOW MUCH IS IT?
The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:
3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
Also includes those pesky ticket fees!

WHERE IS IT?
We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.

WHAT THEY SAY
“Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias

“This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya

“F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika

“I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda

"it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara

“Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz

Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7

FAQ
• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.

• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings

• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences.
This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us

• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!

• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.

• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form
--

𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙.
* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit
)

This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket

We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver.

--
Stay in touch
Website: https://www.epicllama.com/fuckthesmalltalk
Instagram: www.instagram.com/epic.llama/
Join the club (newsletter): epicllama.myflodesk.com/wellington

Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma :)


🧧 HOW MUCH IS IT?

The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:

⏰ 3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
🥪 Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
👥 A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
💛 Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
🎫 Also includes those pesky ticket fees!


🌳 WHERE IS IT?

We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.


💛 WHAT THEY SAY

🗣 “Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias


🗣 “This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya


🗣 “F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika


🗣 “I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda


🗣 "it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara


🗣 “Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz


Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7 🫶


🤓 FAQ

• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.


• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings 💛


• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences. ♥️ This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us :)


• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!


• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.


• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form :)

--

* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!

🙅‍♀️📱This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket 🙅‍♀️📱


We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver. 🌍

description:
FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

description:
Feeding Frenzy Halloween Bar Crawl Wellington 2025, Feeding Frenzy Halloween Bar Crawl Wellington 2025
Packed dance floors, killer beats & spooky drinks. The frenzy hits Wellington Nov 1 — and you’re either in it or missing it.

About this Event


🩸🔥 FEEDING FRENZY HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL – Wellington 2025 🔥🩸

When Halloween Saturday hits Wellington, the streets turn into a party jungle — and the Feeding Frenzy Halloween Bar Crawl is at the top of the food chain. Hundreds of costumed crawlers will be out in full force on Saturday, November 1st, 2025, bouncing from one high-energy bar to the next, chasing the best music, the best drinks, and the wildest crowds in the city.
This isn’t a night where you settle into one place — it’s a moving, breathing, full-costume swarm of energy. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks that fit the season, and the kind of Halloween madness that only happens once a year.




WHAT’S IN STORE
🍹 Bars and clubs stocked with exclusive drink specials just for the crawl.
🎶 DJs pushing the energy with Halloween remixes, EDM, hip hop, and throwback anthems.
👻 Crowds dressed in everything from elaborate horror make-up to clever pop culture costumes.
📍 Venues chosen for atmosphere, music, and their ability to keep the party moving.


THE PLAN
The party starts at 7:30 PM at the first venue — grab your wristband and you’re in for the night. The feeding frenzy moves through multiple stops, all within walking distance, with each bar serving its own vibe and drink specials. By 11:30 PM, the entire crowd converges for a final blowout party that carries the night until 2 AM.

PARTICIPATING VENUES We’ll reveal the full lineup soon. Every location will be transformed for Halloween and serving themed drinks you won’t find on the menu any other night of the year.
📍 On event day, click the Crawl Map Link to see every participating bar, drink specials, and live music schedule.


🩸 Whether you’re a vampire, witch, demon, or something completely unexplainable, this is your night to roam the city in full costume and let loose with a crowd just as wild as you are.



🚨 Tickets: Starting at $15 — lock yours in now before they’re gone.

Your Ticket Includes:
🎟️ Entry to all participating bars and clubs in Wellington
🚫 No cover charges
📱 Digital crawl map access
🎵 DJs & entertainment at every venue
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drink specials




⚠️ Important Event Disclaimers
Age Requirement
Entry is strictly 18+. You must show a valid government-issued photo ID to participate. No exceptions will be made.
Wristbands
Your wristband is your pass for entry. Present your ticket or QR code at the check-in location to receive it. Wristbands must be worn throughout the night to access participating venues. If you miss the pickup window listed on the crawl map, you forfeit your access — no wristband means no entry. Lost or unclaimed wristbands cannot be replaced.
Tickets & Refunds
All sales are final. Tickets cannot be refunded, transferred, or exchanged. If the crawl is canceled without being rescheduled, the base ticket price (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Participating venues, event hours, and drink specials may be adjusted at any time without advance notice.
Venue Entry
Each participating location has the right to refuse service or entry for reasons including intoxication, violation of dress code, inappropriate conduct, or venue capacity. If denied entry at one stop, you may visit another participating venue. No refunds will be issued under these circumstances.
Capacity & Access
Venues may reach capacity at peak times. Admission is not guaranteed once a venue is full. Late arrivals may face lines or delays. Refunds will not be issued for wait times or inability to enter specific venues.
Self-Guided Crawl
This is a self-directed event. There is no host leading the group. Use the DIGITAL CRAWL MAP LINK to navigate between stops.
Venue Awareness
Not all bar staff may know about crawl logistics. If confusion arises, contact the event representative listed on the crawl map. If that venue cannot accommodate you, move on to another open crawl location.
Drink Specials
Discounts and drink deals are set independently by each bar. They may change, sell out, or be discontinued without notice.
Event Timing
Tickets are valid only during official crawl hours listed on the digital map. Showing up early, late, or outside of the crawl schedule does not guarantee entry.
Security
All venues will conduct their own security screening. A wristband does not bypass checks.
Costumes
Costumes must be safe and respectful. Props resembling weapons or offensive attire will result in denial of entry without refund.
Notifications
To stay updated, sign up for text alerts. These will notify you of venue changes or movement times during the crawl.
Conduct
Respect staff, other attendees, and venues. Disorderly behavior, property damage, or harassment will result in immediate removal without refund.
Liability Waiver
By purchasing a ticket, you acknowledge and accept that participation carries risks. You voluntarily assume all dangers, including but not limited to: accidents, personal injury, illness, disability, property damage, theft, alcohol-related incidents, interactions with other participants, and even serious injury or death.
You, and anyone acting on your behalf, hereby release and discharge Events Per Se, its affiliates, sponsors, contractors, employees, volunteers, and participating venues from any liability for losses, claims, or damages — whether due to negligence, gross negligence, breach of duty, or any other cause — that may occur before, during, or after the crawl.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties against any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) that arise as a result of your actions during the event.
By attending, you confirm you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this agreement is intended to be as broad as allowed by law.
Event Continuity
The crawl will run rain or shine. Venues may change last minute. Always check your email and the digital crawl map for updates.
Acknowledgment
Purchase of a ticket signifies full acceptance of these disclaimers, terms, and conditions. You accept complete responsibility for your participation.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Field Trip Presents - Paws & Pours (Wellington), We’re turning the park into one giant, dog‑friendly, Field Trip playground.
Paws & Pours is a DJ‑led, social day out where dogs, their humans (and humans that just like dogs) come together for music, beers and sunshine. It's Giant Picnic vibes, but with paws on the grass.
Expect DJs with live sax, styled chill zones, food trucks, dog bakery, cocktails, beers AND games for you and your doggo.
Professional dog trainers and handlers will be on site throughout the day to monitor behaviour and support dog safety. The event is designed to accommodate a range of dog temperaments, with space to move, pause or opt out as needed.
Add in a pet photographer, groomer, pop‑up bars, lawn games and a best‑dressed dog costume competition, and you’ve got a seriously good day out.
This is Field Trip, just a little cuter.
What’s Included
DJs and live music throughout the day
Pop‑up bars with cocktails, wine, beer and non‑alcoholic options
Styled picnic lounges, umbrellas and chill zones
Dog enrichment toys and play areas
Dog treat stations
On‑site dog trainers supporting safety and behaviour
Pet photographer pop‑up
Dog groomer pop‑up
Best‑dressed dog costume competition
Plenty of space to relax, roam and socialise
Dog Safety & Welfare Policy
Dog safety and responsible ownership are taken seriously at this event. Use your common sense. If your dog is not social, comfortable in busy environments, or around other dogs and people, this event will not be suitable.
Dogs must be friendly, social and comfortable around other dogs and people
Owners are responsible for their dog’s behaviour at all times, all dogs must remain under owner control
All dogs must be fully vaccinated
Dogs over 8 months of age must be spayed or neutered
Leads are required on arrival and departure, with designated off‑lead play zones where appropriate
Professional dog trainers and handlers will be present throughout the event to monitor behaviour and step in where required
Dogs showing signs of distress, aggression or overstimulation may be asked to take a break or leave the event
Failure to follow guidance from trainers or event staff may result in removal from the event.
FAQs
Do dogs need to be on a lead?
Yes. All dogs must be on lead at all times, except in clearly designated off-lead areas.
Will there be water and shade for dogs?
But of course. There will be water stations and shaded chill zones available throughout the site.
Are puppies allowed?
Puppies are welcome if fully vaccinated and comfortable in social settings. All dogs over 8 months must be spayed or neutered.
Can children attend?
Children are welcome if accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. They don't need a ticket. Please make sure they know not to pet dogs that aren't theirs without permission

Hosted by the fabulous Kita Mean, winner of RuPaul’s Drag Race Down Under, this hilarious event sees ten friends give 4-minute presentations on why you should date their bestie.

HOW IT WORKS
If you want to Pitch Ya Pal: Submit a short, creative pitch deck. If selected, you’ll present it live on stage to a crowd of (mostly) singles.

Come Watch the Magic: Whether you’re pitching or just along for the ride, expect a night full of laughs and potential right swipes in real life.

See Someone You Fancy? Scan the QR on your table and submit an online dating form. Here’s the twist, it goes to their bestie to decide if you’d be a good match.

After the Pitches: It might only be 8:30, but we’re still calling it an after party. The DJ takes over, the lights shift, and now’s your moment to move, mingle, and see what happens next.

FOR ALL THE DETAILS VISIT

Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Double the nights, double the chaos. Dance, crawl & party across Wellington Halloween weekend. DJs, shots & finales ‘til 2AM!

About this Event


Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025 👻🎧
Halloween weekend is built for the bold — and this pass is your all-access ticket.
The Fright Night + Screams & Shots Weekend Pass gets you into both nights of the city’s most electrifying Halloween parties. Friday kicks off with Fright Night, a citywide takeover where DJs, costumes, and neon lights set the stage. Saturday keeps the momentum alive with Screams & Shots, a high-voltage crawl of bars and clubs serving Halloween-themed shooters and nonstop beats.
This isn’t just a bar crawl — it’s a two-night music-fueled Halloween marathon. Think of it as your festival pass to the city’s nightlife: two different lineups, two massive finales, one unforgettable weekend.




WHY GRAB THE WEEKEND PASS?
⚡ Two Nights, One Wristband – Access to both Friday & Saturday events.
🎶 Festival-Level Energy – Back-to-back parties with DJs mixing EDM, hip hop, and Halloween remixes.
🍹 Exclusive Drink Deals – Spooky cocktails, shot specials, and themed drinks both nights.
🎭 Costumes Required – From glow-in-the-dark ghouls to full-on festival fits, the dance floor is your stage.
📍 Multiple Venues – 4+ stops each night, all within walking distance, ending in a huge late-night finale.


HALLOWEEN CRAWL INSTRUCTIONS
Check-In: Get your weekend wristband at the starting venue (7:30–10:30 PM each night).
Crawl the Clubs: Move between participating venues at your own pace from 8:30–11:30 PM.
Finale Blowout: Meet the full crowd at the closing party from 11:30 PM–2 AM.


YOUR WEEKEND PASS INCLUDES
🎟️ Entry to both crawls (Friday + Saturday)
🚫 No cover charges at any participating venue
📱 Access to the official crawl maps for both nights
🎶 DJs & live entertainment at every stop
🍸 Drink + shot specials exclusive to crawl attendees
🕺 Two grand finale parties — one each night




PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and clubs will be released closer to the event. Expect high-energy DJs, themed rooms, and Halloween drink specials at every stop.

👻 Whether you’re chasing bass drops, showing off your costume on packed dance floors, or rallying your crew for back-to-back nights out, the Weekend Pass is your way to experience Halloween without limits.
🚨 Early bird passes start at just $25. Grab yours now before they sell out.



18 + EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so you don’t miss out.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Bar List. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

description:
Glow in the Dark Paint Party: Aurora Lake Scene, Ultra Violet lights and neon nights. Prepare to experience Paintvine like you’ve never experienced it before - in the dark!

Paintvine After Dark is New Zealand’s first glow in the dark paint party!

Grab a drink in one hand, a brush in the other and get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going with ultra-violet lights, glow in the dark paint and nothing but laughs all night long!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, neon acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night you will leave with your own fluro painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

For any changes or enquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

description:
Grand Opening Lucas Oil Superstock & Super Saloon Series, Grand Opening Lucas Oil Superstock & Super Saloon Series
The days are getting longer and that can only mean one thing - Speedway is about to roar back into life! The 2025/26 season at Robertson Prestige International Speedway thunders back into action on Saturday 25th October at 6:30pm with a HUGE night of entertainment.

The midnight oil is being burned in sheds and workshops all over the country, as competitors and crews race to be ready for the massive summer of speedway action ahead. With new cars and new drivers plus all your favourites, the opening night is going to be huge on the dirt oval at the Robertson Prestige International Speedway.

The familiar roar of Superstocks hitting the dirt is an institution in Palmerston North and a quality field of these fearless drivers are ready to set the tone for the season racing in the Lucas Oil SuperStock Shootout Series! Metal crunching Stockcars never disappoint with plenty of new cars, new paint schemes, and wild designs - these are the backbone of the sport and always are dedicated to putting on a sensational show for the fans!

Spectacular Super Saloons will hit the dirt for the Lucas Oil Super Saloon Shootout Series and put on a thrilling show racing side by side! The return of your favourite Historic Stockcars from yester-year will bring back all the memories of the days gone by. Add in Minisprints and the future of Speedway Youth Ministocks round out what is expected to be a massive, high adrenaline filled opening night of the 2025/26 Speedway Season.

Its double points night, which is an excellent chance for competitors to get some early runs on the board in the Travel Managers Group Season Points Chase. Points are awarded for a top six placing in every non-championship race throughout the season, and overall victory in any of the classes is a major achievement, and a tribute to a driver's consistency throughout the season.

Classes in action are Superstocks, Stockcars, Super Saloons, Minisprints, Historic Stockcars, and Youth Ministocks – PN Registered Cars only.

Drivers, please follow the below link to register your intention to compete at the Opening night of the 2025/26 season. Please note Youth Ministocks are only open to Palmerston North Speedway registered competitors only.

https://www.pnspeedway.co.nz/forms/25-10-2025

Admission prices are $30 for an Adult (16 years and over), $10 for Children aged 8-15, and $70 for a Family pass of 2 adults and up to four children. Kids aged 7 and under are FREE.

Tickets are available to pre-purchase online from www.eventfinda.co.nz, (tickets purchased incur an additional service fee) or on race day from Gate 1 (Waldegrave Street), Gate 2 (Cuba Street - Bridge) and Gate 3 (Cook Street) from 5.30pm.

Racing Starts 6.30pm.

Click here to view a full list of the Arena terms and conditions of entry https://venuespn.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Terms-and-Conditions-of-Entry-2023.pdf
