description:
Haunted Hop & Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Haunted Hop & Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Party all weekend in Wellington! The Haunted Hop & Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass gets you into the best bars on Oct 31 & Nov 1.

About this Event






👻🎃Haunted Hop + Halloween Bar Crawl Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025 👻🎃
Two nights. One ticket. The ultimate Halloween takeover. The Weekend Pass gives you entry to both of Wellington’s biggest Halloween crawls — the Haunted Hop Bar Crawl on Friday, October 31st, and the Halloween Bar Crawl on Saturday, November 1st. Back-to-back nights of costumes, cocktails, and chaos, all across the Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs.
Friday kicks off with the Haunted Hop, a massive crawl where costumed partygoers pack the streets and every venue becomes a Halloween hotspot. Saturday turns up the volume with the Halloween Bar Crawl, bringing out DJs, dance floors, and spooky specials to close out the weekend in style.
Why settle for one night when you can crawl through both?





WEEKEND PASS HIGHLIGHTS
🎟️ Two Crawls, One Wristband – Admission to both Friday + Saturday events.
🎶 Live Music & DJs – Halloween hits, party anthems, and dance-floor energy all weekend.
🍸 Exclusive Drink Specials – Spooky cocktails, eerie shots, and bar-only deals.
👻 Costumes Everywhere – From scary to sexy to over-the-top — your outfit gets two nights to shine.
📍 Multiple Venues Each Night – 4+ bars and clubs, all within walking distance.



HOW IT WORKS
1️⃣ Check-In: Collect your weekend wristband at the designated starting venue (7:30–10:30 PM, both nights).
2️⃣ Crawl the City: Explore participating bars and clubs between 8:30–11:30 PM at your own pace.
3️⃣ Final Party: Join the crowd at the closing venue from 11:30 PM–2 AM for the ultimate send-off.





WHAT’S INCLUDED
🎟️ Admission to both Friday + Saturday crawls
🚫 No cover charges at any participating venues
📱 Digital crawl maps for both nights
🎶 DJs & live music at every stop
🍹 Themed drink and shot specials
🕺 Huge closing parties each night



PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and nightclubs will be revealed closer to the event. Each venue offers its own Halloween theme, entertainment, and drink specials for crawl guests.


🎃 Hundreds of Halloween lovers, back-to-back nights, and the best nightlife Wellington has to offer. Whether you’re creeping through the Haunted Hop on Friday or shutting it down at Saturday’s finale, the Weekend Pass is your ticket to experience it all.
🚨 Early bird passes start at just $25. Lock in your plans now before prices rise.



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so you don’t miss out.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Bar List. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to all disclaimers, terms, and conditions stated above, and accept full responsibility for your participation in the event.

description:
High Seas Boat Parties, High Seas Boat Parties – 2026 Summer

We’re kicking off the 2026 summer season in style with a sunset cruise across Wellington Harbour. Join us for two hours of good vibes, open water, and top-tier selectors as we bring the party back to the harbour.

LINE-UP
Chris Keene
Chris Keene is an Auckland-based DJ & producer with over a decade of experience across pop, rap, and electronic music. His career has taken him from local clubs to major stages including Rhythm & Vines, Snowmachine, SXSW, and Coachella, with support slots for artists such as Meduza, Marshmello, and Denzel Curry. Known for polished, crowd-focused sets that blend groove, energy, and musical depth, Chris Keene is a perfect fit for a summer sunset cruise on Wellington Harbour.

With support from The Painter Guys & Odie

LOCATION
Wellington Harbour

TIME
7:00 PM – 9:00 PM
(2-hour harbour cruise)

DATE
Thursday 30 January

Expect summer energy, stacked music, iconic harbour views, and a proper boat party atmosphere with nibbles provided.

IMPORTANT EVENT INFORMATION / DISCLAIMER

• This is a boat cruise event – boarding times are strict. Late arrivals may miss departure and no refunds will be issued.
• Event is weather dependent. In the case of unsafe sailing conditions, the event may be postponed or cancelled at the organiser’s discretion.
• If the event is cancelled due to weather, mechanical issues, or maritime safety requirements, tickets will be transferred to a rescheduled date or refunded (excluding booking fees where applicable).

description:
Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip, Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip


Hi this is a trip through the Inner Marlborough Sounds, suitable for beginners who have gone to at least one SKISL and be OK with rescues. The focus is on camping, coffee, and having a fun time with relatively short kayaking times on the water.

The schedule for Wellingtonians is: on the Thursday 29th Ferry over to Picton, in at 12:30, launch from Picton beach head over to Kumoto, tents up, Friday - paddle around the Bay of Many Coves, stop for coffee / lunch / chips / shower at Punga Cove, stay at Camp Bay. Maybe a quick trip over to Bumine Island with empty boats. Saturday night at Ratimira for camping / snoozing. Sunday - up early, on water at 8am, paddle back to Picton in by 12, lunch, on 1pm sailing. So 4 days with Blumine as an optional paddle, mostly shortish trips. We might shift the plan around depending on the weather, but that sets out the general plan.

For the ferry you need to book your own tickets and I would urge you to get your ferry tickets now as they go fast. If you are concerned about the weather get the fully refundable tickets. When you buy your ticket select the "kayak" option. Any questions ask them in the comments below.

description:
Magic: Commander Party Edge of Eternities @ Ceberus Games, Join us for Commander Party! Purchase a booster for entry.
Commander Party is a story-inspired Commander event that immerses players in the setting of the latest set release. The vibe is fun and casual, and the events are outstanding opportunities to welcome in broad groups from your community, from new players to lore enthusiasts to Commander fans.
The event features special rules designed specifically for Edge of Eternities and includes play aids and party cards to support play.
Set up and play follows the regular Commander format rules but players all have these additional abilities:
Special Rules:
Alternate win condition: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control all five worlds, you win the game.
At the beginning of your end step, if one or more opponents lost 3 or more life this turn, gain control of an unclaimed world or a world controlled by one of those opponents.
Whenever you cast your commander, you get an orbit counter.
, pay an orbit counter: choose left or right. Each player passes control of a world they control to the next player in the chosen direction. Activate only as a sorcery.
Each world card also grants a triggered ability whenever a player gains control of it and at the beginning of their upkeep while it is in their control in their command zone.

description:
Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day, Mangatainoka Motors Hot Rod Car Day
Attention all petrolheads! Buckle up for a rip-roaring day at our Car Days, where you can flaunt your sweet ride to fellow enthusiasts and the public alike. Plus, you'll have the chance to compete for some epic prizes that are sure to rev your engine!

Get ready to soak up the atmosphere with live music, delicious grub, and a refreshing ale. Swing by the Histui Museum for a bit of nostalgia, or hit up the Tui Shop for some merch to show off your Tui pride. Or, if you’re feeling laid-back, just kick back, relax, and let the crowd admire your ride while you swap stories with mates and family.

PRIZE CATEGORIES:

We’ve got a treasure trove of fantastic prizes up for grabs! From Most Original to the ever-coveted Star of the Show, there’s something for everyone!

- Most Original – For the ride that makes jaws drop!

- Local Star – Must be from Wairarapa or Tararua (home turf pride, baby!)

- Furthest Travelled – For those brave enough to put some serious miles on the clock!

- People’s Choice – Because the crowd knows best!

- Star of the Show – Walk away with a whopping $500 Tui voucher! (You know you want it!)

KEY TIMINGS FOR THE DAY:

- 09:00 AM - Gates open for cars (let the engines roar!)

- 10:00 AM - Gates open for the public (let the ogling commence!)

- 10:45 AM - All competing cars to be parked (no late arrivals, please!)

- 11:00 AM - Registrations close (don’t miss out!)

- 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Judging takes place (bring your A-game!)

- 12:30 PM - Prize giving (who will take home the glory?)

- 4:00 PM - Tui Brewery closes (but we do it all again the following month!)

PRE-REGISTER YOUR VEHICLE:

Why wait? Pre-register your vehicle or bike now for just $10 online. Just jump onto the website and on the day you can just park up, and flash your email confirmation on your dashboard. Easy peasy! Just head to https://www.tuihq.co.nz/mangatainoka-motors/

And if you forget to pre-register? No sweat! You can still sign up on the day.

All proceeds from registrations go towards the Mangatainoka Motors Reserve Restoration Project. It’s a win-win!

So, gather your crew, polish that ride, and join us for a day of laughter, camaraderie, and, of course, some seriously sweet wheels. We can’t wait to see you there!

description:
NZ Tech Rally Feb 2026 meetup, Join our community at our first 2026 event - Feb 2026 in-person meetup in Wellington CBD. Many thanks to our 2026 Platinum sponsor Creative HQ for hosting us.
Date: Thursday, 12 Feb 2026
Venue: Creative HQ, 7 Dixon Street, Wellington, NZ
Time: 4.30 pm - 7.00 pm
Programme
4:30 pm – 5:00 pm
Arrival & networking
5:00 pm – 6:00 pm
Welcome notes – Stuart Whitehead
Talk 1 – Chloe Gunn
Talk 2 – Mrinal Mukherjee
Speaker Q&A and closing notes – Stuart Whitehead
6:00 pm – 7:00 pm
Community mingling & networking
Talks & Speakers
Unlocking Your Brain’s Edge with AI - Chloe Gunn, CX Designer @ Kiwibank
Chloe Gunn explores how AI can amplify your thinking, help you learn faster and make complex ideas easier to handle. She shares practical, neuroscience-backed tools to reduce cognitive load, cut rumination and face tough conversations. A fast, energising talk for anyone using AI day to day.
Engineering management: Not quite what they told you - Mrinal Mukherjee, Engineering Leader @ Bank of New Zealand
Step beyond myths about engineering management. Mrinal's talk shares the messy realities of leading teams, balancing delivery, people, and chaos. Packed with stories, humour, and practical lessons, it helps new managers prepare, gives experienced leaders reassurance, and offers all attendees tips to navigate the tricky parts of leadership.
Event entry
This is a free event for our tech community. Everyone is welcome. Please RSVP to grab your free ticket, as we have limited numbers.
Please make sure you have your QR code in your ticket email handy as we will digitally check-in on arrival at the venue.
If you can't attend, then please email us at info@nztechrally.nz to cancel your ticket, so folks on the waitlist can attend.
For any enquiries, please email info@nztechrally.nz.

description:
Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025, Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025
🐹 New Zealand Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 – Upper Hutt

Get ready for the cutest competition in New Zealand – the Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 happening in Upper Hutt on Saturday 11th October 2025. This one-of-a-kind event brings together pet lovers breeders and guinea pig enthusiasts from across the country for a full day celebrating our much-loved cavies.
Hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs in collaboration with the Capital Cavy Club the show features two major events in one day:
🏆 Pedigree Guinea Pig Show – showcasing the very best cavies bred to national standards.
🐾 Pet Guinea Pig Show – where family pets take the spotlight for their charm personality and cuteness.
Whether you’re a seasoned exhibitor a first-time participant or simply a guinea pig fan this is the perfect opportunity to:
✅ Meet and connect with other guinea pig owners and breeders.
✅ Learn more about cavy care breeds and showing standards.
✅ Enjoy a fun family-friendly day out in the heart of Upper Hutt.
✅ See some of New Zealand’s most beautiful and beloved guinea pigs.

📍 Event Details:
Date: Saturday 11th October 2025
Venue: Upper Hutt Uniting Parish 1 Benzie Avenue Upper Hutt
Time: 9:30am arrival for the main show | Pet Show starts at 2:00pm

Exhibitors from all cavy clubs across New Zealand are welcome with special sections for junior members and pet owners.
With support from Topflite and hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs the Nationwide Cavy Show is one of the biggest guinea pig events in New Zealand – and one you won’t want to miss!

description:
Nightlife & Horde Halloween Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Nightlife & Horde Halloween Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
From rooftop beats to undead streets, the weekend is yours. DJs, shots & finales light up Wellington Oct 31 & Nov 1. One wristband.

About this Event

One weekend. Two worlds. Your Halloween story starts here.
The Nightlife & Horde Weekend Pass unlocks entry to both of Wellington’s wildest Halloween crawls:
Halloween Nightlife Crawl – Friday, October 31st
Zombie Horde Pub Crawl – Saturday, November 1st
Friday night is for the glam. Step into cocktail lounges, rooftop bars, and dance clubs with DJs spinning Halloween remixes and exclusive themed menus. Saturday night is for the horde. Join the undead as the city’s pubs transform into survival zones filled with zombie shots, blood-red cocktails, and a closing party where the living and the undead collide.
Two nights, two vibes — one wristband.





WHY BUY A WEEKEND PASS?
✨ Double the Halloween – Party both Friday & Saturday with one ticket.
🍸 Curated Drink Specials – Classy cocktails Friday, blood-soaked shots Saturday.
🎶 Non-Stop DJs – Hip hop, EDM, party anthems, and spooky remixes across both nights.
🎭 Two Themes, One Crowd – Dress to impress on Friday, then unleash your inner monster on Saturday.
📍 4+ Venues Each Night – From stylish nightlife venues to pub-packed streets, all within walking distance.


HOW THE WEEKEND WORKS
Check-In: Pick up your weekend wristband at the designated start venue (7:30–10:30 PM both nights).
Choose Your Path: Explore any participating bars, pubs, or clubs between 8:30–11:30 PM.
Final Party: Each night ends at a huge closing venue from 11:30 PM–2 AM.


WHAT YOUR PASS INCLUDES
🎟️ Admission to both Halloween Nightlife Crawl (Friday) + Zombie Horde Crawl (Saturday)
🚫 Skip the cover charges at all participating venues
📱 Digital crawl maps for both nights 🎶 DJs + live music at every stop
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drinks and specials each night
🕺 Two grand finale parties to close out the weekend


PARTICIPATING VENUES
Venue lists will be announced closer to Halloween. Expect a curated mix of upscale bars and clubs on Friday, and themed pubs and high-energy party spots on Saturday.
This pass is built for the ones who want it all: Friday for style, Saturday for chaos. Get your crew together, plan your costumes, and claim your spot for back-to-back Halloween madness in Wellington.
🚨 Early bird passes start at $25. Space is limited — secure yours before they’re gone.





EVENT TERMS & CONDITIONS
AGE & ID POLICY
Entry is strictly 18+. You must show a valid government-issued photo ID to join.
No ID = no entry, regardless of ticket purchase.
WRISTBANDS & CHECK-IN
Mandatory Wristbands: A wristband is required for venue access. You’ll receive it at the official check-in by presenting your Eventbrite ticket or QR code.
Check-In Deadline: Wristbands must be collected during the posted hours (before 10:30 PM). If you fail to check in on time, you lose access—no refunds.
Proxy Option: If you can’t arrive in time, you may send someone else to pick up your wristband.
VENUE ACCESS & CONDUCT
Schedule Restrictions: Wristbands and drink deals are valid only during the times listed on the Digital Bar List.
Use the Crawl Map: Always review the Digital Crawl Map Link on event day for updates, venue changes, or closures.
Capacity Limits: Some locations may reach max capacity. You may be required to wait or choose an alternate venue.
Venue Rights: Bars reserve the right to refuse entry based on intoxication, dress code, behavior, or safety concerns. Security screening still applies even with a wristband.
TICKETS & REFUNDS
Final Sale: All tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable. If the event is canceled with no new date, a refund (minus fees) will be issued automatically.
Rain or Shine: The crawl happens regardless of weather. Venue participation and specials are subject to change without notice.
Arrival Issues: Late check-ins or showing up at the wrong venue are not grounds for refunds.
COSTUMES & BEHAVIOR
Costume Guidelines: No items resembling weapons. Offensive or unsafe costumes may lead to denied entry without refund.
Respect the Crawl: Disorderly conduct, damage to venues, or harassment of staff or other guests will result in removal with no refund.
LIABILITY WAIVER
By purchasing a ticket and participating, you voluntarily assume all risks associated with the event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, property loss, theft, accidents, alcohol-related harm, and even death.
You fully and forever release and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, partners, contractors, sponsors, employees, volunteers, and all participating venues from any claims, liabilities, or demands connected to your participation—whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, or any other reason.
You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties from any expenses, damages, or legal costs arising from your actions or involvement.
By attending, you confirm you have read and accepted these terms and conditions. Your participation is voluntary, and this waiver is intended to be as broad and enforceable as the law allows.

description:
OPEN MIC - Vogelmorn Upstairs, OPEN MIC - Vogelmorn Upstairs
Open Mic / Variety show night at Vogelmorn Upstairs

Step into the spotlight and share your talent on the Upstairs stage.
Music, stand-up, poetry, storytelling, movement, experiments. If it's performable, it's welcome.
No genre too strange, no format too small.

A vocal mic and simple PA will be provided, please bring along anything else you need to perform.

Bar open from 3pm, Happy hour from 3pm to 6pm, Open Mic from 5pm.

Sign-up on the night - all voices, styles, levels of experience etc welcome

https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/98053/Open-Mic-Night-At-Vogelmorn.utr

"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”

description:
One Drop Taproom Takeover at the Horseshoe, We're super excited about our first tap takeover and are going all out with deals, competitions and entertainment. Lots to share so read on for the details or TLDR *Like *Tag your mates *Share *Come along!

The main event:
7 beers on from star Sydney brewery One Drop Brewing Co. This brewery has a large cult following and made a great name for itself internationally, only occasionally available in NZ. How did we get them... let's just say we have connections.

Accommodation:
Want to attend from out of town? We have teamed up with Copthorne Solway Park to offer a great bed and breakfast special for $140 (based on two adults), available between Oct 16th and 22nd. Call or book direct with the code 'ONEDROP'. We've even arranged pick up from the hotel on Saturday and we can drop you back. Too easy!

Competitions:
*Like this post
*Tag friends you'd like to attend with
* Share this post
You could win a weekend for two at the Copthorne Solway Park for this event, winner announced Oct 16th. Plus we have four $50 vouchers up for grabs! We'll let you know if you got one of those on the 17th.

Entertainment:
The Featherston Vinyl Club will be spinning the disks for us all, these folks are presently fund raising for a New sound system so Koha is appreciated!

The Beers:
Pints range from only $11 to $17!
We only have 20 Litres of most of these so they WILL run out, luckily we also have these (and more) in cans for drink in or takeaway.
Walk a Talk - 6% Hazy IPA
Home Land and Sea 2 - 8.2% IIPA - Colab with Garage Project
Chill Pils - 4.2% Czech Pils
Do You Know Better - 6.4% Smoothie Sour Ale
Built For This - 6.5% Penta-fruited Sour Ale
Courtside - 6.1% Smoothie Cream Sour Ale
Watermelon Double Take - 10.1% Fruit Sour

See you at The Horseshoe Taproom on the 18th!

description:
One Night, Two Lit Events, ONE NIGHT, TWO LIT EVENTS
Bad Diaries Salon + Starling’s 10th Birthday
Verb is thrilled to host two sparkling events in one night this November with our tremendous friends, Bad Diaries Salon and Starling. A fresh batch of bad diaries will start the evening, followed by a line-up of not one, not ten, but twenty poets in celebration of Starling’s 20th issue and 10th birthday.

You have the option of coming to either event but you know you want to come to both. There will be cake! 
___
Friday 7 November at Meow. 
Tickets: $15 for one event / $25 for both. 
Verb Community members receive a 10% discount (check your ReVerb e-newsletter for the discount code, or email community@verbwellington.nz)
BAD DIARIES SALON – STAR 
6pm – 7pm, Friday 7 November at Meow
Tickets: $15 (or purchase the double-bill ticket for $25 and go to Starling’s birthday party, too)
Four courageous, starry writers – Kate Camp, Jo Randerson, Michelle Duff and Elizabeth Knox – read from their unpublished diaries on the salon theme, STAR. This is Verb's eighth annual edition of Bad Diaries Salon, hosted by Tracy Farr. What happens in salon stays in salon, so come, witness, celebrate.
Bad Diaries Salon is raw, raucous, unedited and candid: the written word, rediscovered and shared.
Starling: RELAY
7.30pm–9pm, Friday 7 November at Meow
Tickets: $15 (or purchase the double-bill ticket for $25 and go to Bad Diaries Salon, too)
Join us to celebrate TEN YEARS of Starling with a relay of readers from Issue 20 through to Issue 1. An evening of infectious energy, this is also the sign-off for editors Francis Cooke and Louise Wallace, handing over to the incomparable Tate Fountain and Maddie Ballard. A new chapter of Starling awaits!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Paint Your Mate with Paintvine!, Paint Your Mate is a fun-filled painting session in the heart of Wellington, where you and your favourite human sit face-to-face and paint a portrait of each other on canvas. No skills required, 100% judgement-free, and abstract, exaggerated masterpieces are very much encouraged!

You’ll be seated opposite your mate while our Paintvine artist guides you with tips, encouragement, and lots of laughs! This event is perfect for couples, dates, best mates, siblings, or anyone who wants a socially acceptable excuse to stare at their mate.

This ticket is a double pass (two people, two canvases) and includes one free Love Potion cocktail (or mocktail) per person, all the painting materials you will need, and a final portrait reveal that will absolutely end in laughter.

What’s included

- Around two hours of painting, laughs, and creative chaos, guided by our Paintvine artist and assistant.
- All painting materials for you and your mate – acrylic paint, brushes, palettes, aprons, the lot.
- Two high-quality stretched canvases (one each!).
- One free Love Potion cocktail (or mocktail) per person to keep the creative juices flowing.
- Photos snapped throughout the session and uploaded to our Facebook page.
- Heaps of laughs while you unleash your chaotic, creative sides.
- Two one-of-a-kind masterpieces to take home.
- and best of all - we clean up!

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night, you will leave with your own painting ready to hang on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info, head to [[https://paintvine.co.nz/]

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pearls & Pints - Adults Social Club (Ages 18+), Meet new people, make new jewellery, and enjoy your first drink on the house! Pearls & Pints is a faction of our Village Beads Social Collective, which aims to connect people of similar interests as you bond over creating some new pearl jewellery and enjoy some pints (or other beverages!). Come solo and meet new people, or bring some friends along for a fun night at Abandoned Brewery! No beading skills required, our team will help out with all the technical skills at the end.

Create either two freshwater pearl bracelets or one freshwater pearl necklace in this session. We’ll bring a huge selection of different freshwater pearl beads with us, and Abandoned have a huge selection of craft beers, wines, and other delicious drinks to choose between! Snacks available for purchase too.

Bookings and payments required in advance for people aged 18+. Valid ID required upon entry.

Workshop is held at Abandoned Taproom Petone - 38 Fitzherbert Street.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pokemon: League Cup @ Cerberus Games, Pokemon: League Cup @ Cerberus Games
Pokémon TCG League Cup tournaments give players an opportunity to earn Championship Points and practice their skills for larger competitions.

Here are the details:

Entry Fee: $25.00
Format: Standard
Tournament Structure: 3-5 Rounds Swiss followed by a Top 4/8 Cut Single Elimination

Decklists will be required. You may fill out a deck registration form on paper or submit one digitally to:


Each participant will receive a booster pack and a Pokemon Prize Packs on entry. A booster pack will be added to the Top Placers Prize Pool per participant.

The champion of each age division will be awarded one (1) League Cup-Branded Champion playmat.

Pokemon Trainer Club and Player ID will be required to participate. Don't have one? You can create an ID at the following link:

https://join.pokemon.com/

Championship points are also awarded. Refer to the website for more information.

https://www.pokemon.com/us/play-pokemon/pokemon-events/pokemon-tournaments/tcg-league-cup/
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy, TICKETS ON SALE NOW!
Tickets for the Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy are officially on sale as of today (1 August) until 1 October, unless they sell out prior. So don't leave it till the last minute!
Priority will be given to financial members of Club Garibaldi and Club Italia Nelson.
Non-members will be wait-listed in order of application date and confirmed after the 1 October cutoff.
The cost of the tickets are as follows:
Financial Club Members (from both Clubs):
- 12 years and over: $25.00pp
- 6–11 years old: $12.50pp
- under 5 years: Fre
Non-Members:
- 12 years and over: $50.00pp
- 6-11 years old: $25.00pp
- under 5 years: Free
Please email, text or call Rosina to secure your tickets now.
rosina.vanderaa@gmail.com
021-621-245
Once your FY25/26 membership status has been confirmed, Rosina will send you the bank account details.
A presto!
Disclaimer: Photo not taken at The Pines, but captures the essence of what we expect to the night to be like.. full of laughter.. and lots of loudness..
***
Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Powell Hut Slow Overnight Stay, This is a mid week tramp to beat any rush.
This event is aimed for people wanting to get up to this hut and stay the night as a group but NOT have the stress or pressure to break any speed limits.
The start time is set early to give the maximum amount of walking time to reach the hut destination. Typically it is a 3-4hr walk but even with a huge amount of breaks we will be arriving just in time to have lunch at the top.
There will be regular posted stopping points along the way at Rocky Mt Lookout and again at Mt House Shelter.
You will be in charge of yourself through the trip but we will be there to answer questions and provide the entertainment like always

This is a fully serviced hut with water, gas cooking and a lovely wood burner to heat the hut during our stay.
The walking distance is 7.3km on a well formed track in most parts and formed stairs.
The elevation gain is approximately 500m which brings you to the hut which sits at 1200m above sea level.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington, Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pōneke Pinballers - Tournament & Free Play, - FREE TO PLAY PINBALL
- TOURNAMENTS
- PRIZES
- ON-SITE BAR
What more you could ask for?
Kicking off at 6pm, Thursday the 3rd of April. We open to you the entire arcade set to “free play”. This is the one time a month when you won’t need any tokens to play pinball, just push the start button and you’re on your way.
You might be wondering how much this incredible night will cost? We present to you a bargain of a life time. $20 at the door gets you night of dirt cheap pinball.
BUT WAIT THERE’S MORE…
For only an extra $5 get your self entered in the NZ's largest monthly tournament, Pōneke Pinballers. Put your skills to the test and play with the best players in the country.
Tournament details:
Qualifying:
- From 6:30 - 8:30pm.
- Group match play 7/5/3/1 scoring.
- 1 game per round
- no new rounds after 8:30pm
Finals:
- Top 12 players.
- Amazing race format

Bring your mates along for a night of ALL YOU CAN PLAY PINBALL!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pōneke Pump n' Dump - Pinball Tournament, PINBALL TOURNAMENT AT YE OLDE PINBALL SHOPPE
Pōneke's Premier Pinball Tournament for your future career as an internationally ranked pinball player!
Make a hearty pilgrimage through the arcade, trying your hand at a selection of our finely curated games, report your scores to the staff, and watch your ranking on the tournament ladder rise as your scores are stacked up against your competitors. Not happy with a score you got? No problem, you can keep trying until you're
happy with it!
Make it into the Top 16 before the end of Saturday, and you'll be invited to play in the finals round the following Sunday, where 1st - 8th will play in A Division, and 9th - 16th will play in B Division.
This finals round is free of charge, and comes with a whopping prize pool worth $200 in value awarded to the top finishers in each division.
So what are you waiting for? Come and show us your skills!
Qualification Round (7th - 13th September):
Each player is granted access to a token deal of 12 tokens for $20!
- Sunday to Saturday
- Submit at least one score on each of the selected 8 games during open hours.
- Your best score on each game is ranked.
- Take a picture of your score and submit it at the counter.
- Unlimited qualifying! Not satisfied with your score? Grab more tokens and keep playing to improve it!
Scoring System:
- Linear Scoring applies. Score 100pts for the top score on each selected game, 99pts for 2nd, 98pts for 3rd, and so on.
Finals (14th September):
Top 16 qualifiers will battle it out on Sunday from 12pm onwards, with 8 in A-Division, and 8 in B-Division! Keep an eye on our socials if you've participated in the competition throughout the week - those who have qualified for the finals will be announced on SATURDAY night (the 12th).
You could win a share of $200 in Shoppe Credit!
How to Participate:
Simply come to Ye Olde Pinball Shoppe during open hours and submit your scores from Monday to Saturday!
Location:
18A Bond Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
This month's games are:
AC/DC
Fish Tales
Godzilla
James Bond 007
King Kong
Lord of the Rings
Medieval Madness
Pulp Fiction
Come, participate, and let’s find out who the true Pinball Wizard is! May the best player win!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39), Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39)

Single? We have got you!



Highlights:

This unique event adds a playful twist to speed dating, allowing singles to connect through fun and games.
Enjoy simple board games like Giant Jenga, perfect for breaking the ice – even if you’re new to games!
Skip the awkward small talk and see how people interact in a relaxed, group setting. Match with someone and get connected for a second date.


You’ll start the night in mixed-gender groups and rotate around to see people of the opposite gender.



Feeling a bit shy? You’ll stay with your same-gendered group through the night, so bring a friend along for the ride!



Drinks are provided, and we have nibbles to keep you fueled. Because, let’s face it, gaming is thirsty work!





After the games wrap up, feel free to hang out with your new acquaintances till 9.15 and play other games.

A match form will be sent out the following day, and we’ll connect you with your matches in the coming days.

Perfect for singles looking to mix fun with the chance to meet someone special.





Recommended age 25-39.

Book now!



Not your vibe? Check out our other upcoming events on our website!
By purchasing a ticket you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms & Conditions.



** If your gender is showing as sold out, join the waitlist! You’ll get a notification if there are cancellations or additional tickets released!
label: Hobbies & Interests

Roll for Hope 2025, A tabletop roleplaying games event, all proceeds will go to Make-A-Wish. Please visit our website for more information on games and times - https://rollforhope.nz
With a range of games including Dungeons & Dragons, Savage Worlds, Pirate Borg, Paranoia, homegrown games, playtests, and more, there's sure to be something for everyone.
The doors will open at 9.30am, with the first session starting at 10am. There will be three sessions of games in a variety of systems and genres; 10am-1pm, 2-5pm, and 6.15-9.15pm, Book for anywhere between 1-3 sessions for $8 per session, with a 20% discount if you book all three.
A survey link will be emailed closer to the event for attendees to rank their game preference so that we can assign people to games, check spam if you don't receive the email.

description:
Social Sewing Saturday - October, Social Sewing Saturday - October
Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts!

About this Event

Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Soirée at the Zoo - A Night for our Whānau and Animals, An evening of connection & purpose 
Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo and Ronald McDonald House Charities® (RMHC®) New Zealand invite you to an exclusive fundraising event — Soirée at the Zoo: A Night for our Whānau and Animals. 
Join us for a refined evening of celebration and generosity, where compassion for people and care for wildlife come together in a truly unique setting. 
Guests will experience the Zoo after hours, enjoy elegant hospitality, and take part in an inspiring night of entertainment and giving — all in support of Wellington families and animals. 
Thursday 19 March 2026 
6.30pm – 11.00pm 
Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 
 What to expect 
A rare opportunity to explore the Zoo after hours! Join an exclusive Zoo tour and discover the Zoo from a whole new perspective. 
A complimentary welcome drink and delicious canapés throughout the evening 
An engaging live auction and raffle with exceptional prizes 
An entertaining MC, live local music and a chance to dance the night away 
Opportunities to connect with friends, colleagues, and familiar Wellington faces 
The moving story of a local RMHC® NZ whānau 
An insight into Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo’s vital conservation mahi in Aotearoa and around the world
Ticket options 
Soirée Admission ($165) 
Secure entry to the Soiree, a welcome drink on arrival, and canapés throughout the evening. Plus, every visitor will enjoy an exclusive after-hours Zoo tour! 
Soirée Giraffe View Bar Leaner ($1,000) 
For an elevated event option, the Giraffe View Bar Leaner option includes entry for four people at a reserved seated bar leaner, a welcome drink on arrival, and canapés throughout the evening – plus the exclusive after-hours Zoo tour!
Soirée Lions Lounge ($3,500) 
For the most premium experience of the night, opt for the Lions Lounge package, featuring tickets for six people in an exclusive seated couch area, an antipasto platter and a bottle of wine at your table when you arrive, and delicious canapés throughout the evening. Plus, skip the queues at the bar and enjoy dedicated table service all night long! And of course, you’ll get the opportunity to explore Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo after hours on a tour. 
Where the proceeds will go  
This fundraising event will make a tangible difference to Wellington families and animals. All proceeds from Soirée at the Zoo will be shared equally between Ronald McDonald House Charities® New Zealand and Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo. 
Every day, RMHC® NZ provides a home-away-from-home for more than 100 families, offering comfort, care, and stability during difficult times. Your attendance — and your generosity on the night — will directly support families with essential accommodation and meals. 
Through our community partnership, Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo welcomes RMHC® NZ families to the Zoo at no cost. Each year, over 400 adults and tamariki visit the Zoo to reconnect with nature and the restorative power of wildlife, joining the 250,000 people annually who experience the Zoo as a place of wellbeing and inspiration. 
Secure your ticket now 
With only 150 seats available, this will be an unforgettable evening of purpose and celebration. 
Secure your place today and be part of a night that supports whānau, wildlife, and the community that connects us all. 
Invoicing options are also available; please email venues@wellingtonzoo.com for more information.
Please note: Event data will be shared with both RMHC® NZ and Te Nukuao Wellington Zoo.

Spring Céilí Dance with The Great Beag Céilí Band, Spring Céilí Dance with The Great Beag Céilí Band
Spring has sprung, the days are getting longer, the rain is falling sideways. Must be about time we had another céilí! Join The Great Beag Céilí Band at St Michael’s Hall in Kelburn for a rousing evening of dancing to foot-stomping celtic tunes. Our Autumn céilí sold out so make sure you get your tickets early!

If you’ve never been to a céilí (or ceilidh) before, fear not - céilí dancing is very easy! No fancy moves or any previous experience required: our caller will explain each dance, and we’ll all walk it through a couple of times before adding the music.

This is social dancing so bring all your friends! No need to bring a specific partner - there’ll be lots of friendly people to dance with.

Discounted online tickets are available on Humanitix until midnight on September 26th: $24 / $16 concession
https://events.humanitix.com/beag-ceili-spring-ceili-2025

Some door sales may be available on the day: $30 / $20 concession (cash only)

—

Doors open 7:30pm

Adults and age 10+ welcome. Under 16s accompanied by an adult.

Light refreshments will be available. We recommend bringing a water bottle to grab a quick drink between dances - hydration is key!
This is an alcohol-free event.

Getting here: St Michael’s Hall is located at 81 Upland Road in Kelburn Village, just behind the church.
There is very limited on-street parking in the village. We recommend public transport: the 4, 18, 21, and 22 buses stop regularly right outside coming up from Te Aro or down from Northland and Karori.

Be safe online: Tickets are only available online from the Humanitix event. Do not buy tickets from other sources such as Facebook comments or resale sites - these are always scams. If you can no longer attend, please contact us via Humanitix, our socials, or email to discuss refunds.

Health notice: Céilí dancing is a great way to meet lots of people. If you are feeling unwell then please stay home and rest this time, we will see you at the next one.

description:
Taumarunui on the Main Trunk Line 2025, Taumarunui on the Main Trunk Line 2025
Travel over seven viaducts, see the Rangitikei cliffs, the central volcanic plateau, National Park and the Raurimu Spiral ‒ all while travelling on the new Capital Connection carriages to “Taumarunui on the Main Trunk Line” (and back).

Our route begins at Palmerston North and will take us over the Mangaweka viaducts, among the tallest in the North Island, with views seldom matched in New Zealand. You can view the picturesque Rangitikei River below as it flows past the high sandstone cliffs.

Leaving National Park we then travel down one of the rail wonders of the world, the Raurimu Spiral. This magnificently engineered piece of railway, steeped in history with stories of how an engineer with courage, foresight and a brilliant ability overcame one of the most challenging railway engineering assignments of the last century.

here are two options once you get to Taumarunui, a bus tour to Omaka Lodge or the Taumarunui Rail Action Centre.

The bus departs the Taumarunui railway station at 12.30 for Omaka Gardens and will be back at the station by 2.30pm. A pop-up café will be available for you to enjoy lunch while out at Omaka and you will have 3 acres of country excellence to explore at your leisure.
Roses will be in bloom and the rhododendrons in flower. There is even a garden for your wedding hour. There are fantastic views and vistas over the forgotten world.

https://www.omakalodge.nz/ https://gardenstovisit.co.nz/private-gardens/omaka-lodge/

Included are transfers and entrance to the garden for your self-guided tour. Additional guided tours cost an additional $5.00 ‒ please pay to the hosts.

When you buy your train ticket you can choose a shuttle bus that will take you Taumarunui Rail Action Centre where you can view their model railway, trucks, jiggers, tractors and carriages. A hidden little gem, operated by the Taumarunui Rail Action Centre.

If you do not want to take a bus you may wish to visit the railway museum (on the platform) where you can wander down memory lane, or visit the town shops just across the road from the station.

At 2.45 pm it’s “All aboard” for our return journey to friendly Palmerston North!

This train will be hauled by a KiwiRail diesel locomotive.

When Sunday 23rd November 2025
Depart Palmerston North 8.30 am
Depart Marton 9.10 am
Arrive Taumarunui 12.10 pm
Depart Taumarunui 2.45 pm
Arrive Marton 5.55 pm
Arrive Palmerston North 6.30 pm

Adult fare to Taumarunui $180
Adult fare with side trip Omaka Lodge Garden $202.50
Adult fare and Taumarunui Rail Action Centre $193

description:
The Coven Ball: Leather & Lace, The Coven Ball is Back – And Naughtier Than Ever!

Get ready to unleash your inner vixen at Coven: Leather & Lace – our most seductive event of the year returns for its second spellbinding edition!

Expect a night full of provocative delights: dazzling burlesque performances, flash tattoos, a spanking booth (yes, really!), and tantalizing treats lurking around every dark corner. And don’t forget – there are spot prizes for the fiercest looks, so bring your best Leather or Lace fantasy.

Who’s it for?
Coven is a celebration crafted exclusively for queer women and gender minorities. Whether you’re sapphic, trans, nonbinary, genderqueer – this is your night to shine.

Evening Highlights:
- 7pm Cocktail Hour: Fabulous arrival photos, sip on our sexy drink specials and soak in the vibes with live sapphic music.
- An evening of entertainment from burlesque, to the kinkier kind, and flash tattoos by an incredible local artist
- Our infamous dessert grazing table

Tickets are strictly limited – and they WILL sell out. Secure yours now and don’t miss the queer event everyone will be talking about.

Coming Solo? You’re Not Alone.
Don’t be nervous if you’re planning to come on your own – Coven is built for connection. Whether it’s your first queer event or your hundredth, you’ll be surrounded by a community that gets it. From the moment you arrive, there’ll be friendly faces, welcoming vibes, and plenty of chances to mingle, and connect. Coven is about belonging – and there’s a place here for you.

Coven Kaupapa
For queer women and gender minorities, spaces like this are rare, vital, and sometimes, life-changing. In a world that constantly centers cishet norms, Coven offers a space where we are the default – where you can fully show up as yourself, be seen, celebrated and surrounded by YOUR community.

For many in our Coven, this is one of the only opportunities we feel comfortable enough to experience nightlife free from the male gaze, tokenism, fear, or the need to shrink ourselves to fit in. It’s a space where sapphic, trans, nonbinary, and gender-diverse people aren’t just welcomed – we are centered. It’s for those who are often pushed to the margins, who rarely feel represented in “inclusive” spaces that still cater to the mainstream.

This night exists because we need it – and because we create it, together.

Accessibility
The event is held upstairs at Whisky & Wood, a stunning venue with gender-neutral bathrooms and lift access (note there is a small bump as you enter). Staff will be ready to help if needed. Have specific accessibility needs? Reach out directly at hello@whiskyandwood.co.nz.

Community Tickets
We want Coven to be for everyone. At checkout, consider donating toward our community ticket fund. Can’t afford a ticket? Email willysmackntush@gmail.com with the subject “Free for Me” and your preferred name. We’ll be gifting free tickets on Friday 18 October.

If you made it this far... Good girl / Good they / Good boy / Good YOU!
Get ready for a night of queer joy, sexy surprises, and community magic.

description:
The Eras Tour | The Final Show: A Swiftie Birthday Screening For a Cause, This email was sent to any current ticket holders, check your spam folder!
Kia ora! 
We have an update on the eras tour movie we need to share with you. In the past East Coast releases have meant a Friday 5pm release for us in New Zealand, which would have been fine for our Saturday screening of the FINAL SHOW (trailer here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S1MO3bRG9qw). 
However it seems Disney has just released that it will stream from 9pm EST, which is 3pm on Saturday here! So we have tossed and turned the last 24 hours as to what to do! The choices boiled down to the old movie on Saturday or the new one the following day (the Penthouse kindly is able to accommodate either). Since many of us are excited about the new one AND it won't be showing on a big theatre screen we have made the call to move to Sunday, 14th December, 1pm. 
Now, we recognise this is a change of plan that might affect you. If you cannot make it and would like a refund, that is absolutely fine, this should be a function on Humantix you can pursue (or else email me at evaneely@live.com). 
We do hope that you can still join us though! We have a giant Taylor birthday cake planned (in the States it will be her birthday when we get together!), goodie bags with Taylor tattoos, stickers and bookmarks, and three awesome spot prizes (Showgirl acoustic CD, an awesome new 1000 piece Taylor puzzle, 2026 Taylor calendar). 
We'd also LOVE if you could share the link with family & friends, we still have some tickets to sell and would love to raise the funds, and have a fantastic dance party vibe with you. (https://events.humanitix.com/the-eras-tour-movie-a-swiftie-birthday-screening-for-a-cause)
Apologies for this hick up and change of plan. Mara broke her foot 3 weeks ago and has had surgery, so we are getting used to pivoting and changing plans this summer. We appreciate your understanding! 
Thanks for supporting Mara, she is excited to still have her birthday weekend, even with a non functioning foot and some time changes! 
Much love, Eva & Mara
EVENT OVERVIEW:
Calling all swifties! Come along to a fun, action packed, dress up, sing-along on Taylor's birthday on December 13th. A one time screening only, of Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour Movie at Penthouse cinema. There are three ticket price options to pay, Budget Swiftie, Generous Swiftie, Big Spender Swiftie. Each ticket gives you the same access, its just about how much you want to donate. Every ticket also comes with a Taylor Swift themed goodie bag. All of the funds will go to supporting families and children in need in Palestine through Aotearoa 4 Gaza. So ...Are you ready for it?
There will be a Taylor birthday cake, goodie bags and a few Swiftie spot prizes!
Information about cause:
The Aotearoa 4 Gaza mutual aid fund was set up last year to directly support families in Gaza. We are a grassroots collective based in Aotearoa standing in unwavering solidarity with Palestinian families in Gaza. Through consistent, direct mutual aid, we send $100 at a time (usually once a week) to families who are living through unimaginable hardship under Israel's occupation and genocide. These contributions go straight to verified recipients, without intermediaries, ensuring urgent support reaches those who need it most. The fund is fully volunteer run and is led by Emily Writes. Nobody takes a cut. Every cent goes to our families. Every donation is a lifeline, and a stand against violence and genocide. We invite you to contribute, to share, and to stand with us in this act of collective care and resistance.

Get ready for the biggest Halloween Crawl in Wellington on Friday, Oct 31st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs!

About this Event
https://vimeo.com/1111730489?share=copy


🎃🕸️ WELLINGTON HAUNTED HOP BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃
Get ready for the craziest Halloween celebration in Wellington. Join The Haunted Hop - Halloween Bar Crawl on Friday, October 31st, 2025, and access to 4+ of Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs!
🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics.

🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 7:30 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM!
🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait!
Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're creepy, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be a part of on Halloween night.🧟‍♀️


⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience!
Gather your ghouls and take over the city with The Haunted Hop Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Wellington’s top bars.
🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Wellington
🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues
🎟️ Exclusive Haunted Hop Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry
📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems
🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue
👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Wellington’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and make Halloween a night to remember!


🚨 Get Your Haunted Hop 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨
🦇Wellington’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots.
It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this Haunted Hop Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.
🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a Halloween to remember!
💀 Let the WELLINGTON HAUNTED HOP BAR CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money straight back to the bank!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
WRISTBAND VENUE:
Lulu Bar & Restaurant
🕒 7:30 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 31 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:30 -10:30 to arrive and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:30PM or explore the other venues.
MIDDLE STOPS:
Cavern Club
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 22 Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
The Rogue & Vagabond
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
FINAL VENUE:
BL3
🕒 11:30 PM – 2:00 AM
📍8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet at this final venue at 11:30PM for a massive final Halloween party!


Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Middle Stops” at your convenience between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM or stay at the wristband venue until 10:30pm. After 11:30 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate at the final party location!
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop (wristband venue), as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Please also note that wristbands are no longer available after 10:30PM at the first venue. No refunds will be given if you show up late and miss the wristband pick-up window!
This club crawl is a walking bar crawl—all venues are within walking distance of each other. Please plan accordingly for transportation and your walking schedule.
Wristbands for entry will be provided by event staff only. To pick up your wristband, please check in with the event staff at the front reception or host stand.


2025 CRAWL MAP:





🎟️ General Admission – $20
Includes access to all official crawl stops. No frills — just the fun.
───────────────────────────────────────

👑 VIP Ticket – $25
Includes everything in GA plus:
🔥 Access to the VIP-only crawl challenge for free tickets
🚀 First dibs on future crawl drops & pre-sales
───────────────────────────────────────

🤯 Ultra VIP – $35
For the dangerously curious. Includes everything in VIP plus:
🏆 Name on our “Crawl Wall of Fame”
📜 Official “Certified Crawl Legend” digital certificate
🚪 Access to a future exclusive pre-sale drop
❓ A mystery bonus item we legally can’t describe 👀




A SPOOKTACULAR HAUNTED HOP PARTY YOU WON'T WANT TO MISS
Skip the overpriced cover charge and long lines at a single bar. With one ticket, you’ll unlock access to multiple Halloween hotspots across Wellington, each with its own theme, music, and party energy. Whether you're rocking a full costume or just out for the night, this is your chance to experience the city’s top nightlife all in one thrilling Halloween themed experience.
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE HALLOWEEN NIGHT OUT
One bar? One vibe? That’s not how Wellington does Halloween. Grab your crew and bounce between the city’s best bars and clubs, each bringing something different to the table. From spooky cocktails to wild dance floors, the night builds up to one massive end-of-night party you won’t want to miss. 🧛‍♀️
THE BIGGEST HALLOWEEN PARTY NIGHT IN WELLINGTON
This crazy Halloween experience crawl will take you through the city’s top bars and clubs with a line-up built for non-stop fun. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks, and a crowd ready to party in full costume.
GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THEY VANISH!
Spots are filling fast, so now’s the time to lock in your plans. Round up your friends, pick your costume, and get ready to sip, dance, and crawl your way through one of the most exciting nights Wellington has to offer. Halloween only comes once a year... so grab your tickets today! 🎟️



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can’t make check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband for you so they don’t miss out.
Day-Of Updates: Review the Digital Crawl Map on the morning of the event for any last-minute changes or venue updates.
Check Venue Schedule: Each venue’s crawl time is listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Wristbands and drink specials are valid only during these scheduled times.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18+ years of age with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. Wristband pickup location and time are listed on the crawl map. If you do not pick up your wristband at the designated location and time, it may not be available, and you will not be able to access crawl venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Admission & Venue Rights: Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication, dress code, inappropriate behaviour, or venue capacity. If refused entry at one venue, you may visit alternative crawl venues available at that time. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Self-Guided Crawl: This is a self-guided event with no host leading the group. You must use the digital crawl map to navigate between venues.
Venue Awareness: If bar staff are unaware of the crawl, you must contact the venue representative listed on the crawl map. If you cannot reach them, consider that venue unavailable and proceed to an alternative crawl venue open at that time. Nightlife venues may reach capacity or close early, and not all staff members may be aware of the crawl.
Drink Specials: Drink specials are offered by participating venues and may be modified or discontinued at any time without notice.
Event Time Restrictions: Your ticket is valid only for crawl venues during the scheduled crawl times listed on the crawl map. It is not valid for entry outside these times. If you arrive late or at the wrong venue, refunds will not be issued.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not entitle you to skip venue security checks. All attendees must comply with security screening before entry.
Costume Policy: Do not wear costumes that include items which could be considered or used as weapons. Highly offensive costumes are not tolerated and may result in denial of entry without refund.
Crawl Notifications: Sign up for crawl notification texts to receive updates about when to move to the next venue. There is no host to notify you in person.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you understand and agree that you are attending entirely at your own risk. You voluntarily assume all risks and dangers incidental to this event, including but not limited to: personal injury, illness, disability, property loss, theft, damage, accidents, death, alcohol-related incidents, and actions of other participants, staff, or third parties. You, on behalf of yourself and your heirs, executors, and assigns, hereby fully release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, officers, directors, employees, contractors, volunteers, affiliates, sponsors, participating venues, and their respective representatives from any and all liability, claims, demands, actions, or causes of action whatsoever arising out of or related to any loss, damage, injury, illness, or death — whether caused by negligence, gross negligence, breach of contract, or otherwise — that may occur before, during, or after the event. You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any claims, costs, or expenses (including legal fees) brought by you or on your behalf, or by any third party as a result of your actions during the event. You acknowledge that you have read and understood this waiver, that you are participating voluntarily, and that this waiver is intended to be as broad and inclusive as permitted by applicable law.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Always check the digital crawl map for the latest venue list and updates. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.

description:
The Napier Escape, Saturday 23rd August 2025 – Learn, Indulge or Explore in Napier
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.
A Deco Deep Dive
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.

Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:
A Deco Deep Dive
The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history. After a devastating earthquake in 1931 levelled much of the city, Napier was rebuilt in the architectural style of the time—Art Deco.
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views
Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.
Crab Farm Winery was established in the early 1980’s with the first vintage under the Crab Farm Winery label released in 1987. The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years. Originally purchased without viewing beforehand – Hamish Jardine’s great grandfather was alarmed to find his new land was actually partially underwater. With tidal pools, rushes and hundreds of Crabs, the family jokingly named it ‘Crab Farm’.
Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace. Wander among world-famous Art Deco buildings, stroll the scenic Marine Parade, or relax at a local café with a Hawke’s Bay treat. Visit MTG Hawke’s Bay for a dose of culture, browse boutique shops, or admire the colourful street art. It’s your chance to soak up Napier’s unique charm your way.
For all timetable, pricing & more information - head to www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/

Our last event event had 15 performers and we want you to contribute to the next!

Tui Express, Tui Express
Mainline Steam’s popular Tui Brewery trip returns with Steam locomotive Jb1236 (Joanne) and the fleet of Ao carriages featuring large panoramic windows, air conditioning and heating.

Travel from Plimmerton through Pukerua Bay overlooking the stunning coast line with views of Kapiti Island as we proceed north through Kapiti into the country side of the Manawatu. We pass through the Manawatu Gorge with spectacular views of the river and the remnants of the old highway now bypassed by the new The Te Ahu a Turanga highway over the Tararua ranges.

Our buffet carriage will have food and drinks available for purchase during the trip.

Upon arrival at Mangatainoka, a bus will transfer you to the Tui Brewery or feel free to take the 10-minute walk to the Brewery.

Our hosts at the Tui Brewery will serve a gourmet BBQ lunch in the original Flagon room with a complimentary drink (beer, cider, Sav) and you will receive the Mangatainoka Passport full of vouchers to redeem at the Brewery. Please purchase the lunch option when booking your train tickets.
