description:
Unity Book Club October 2025 | Cursed Daughters, About the book: 
No man will call your house his home. And if they try, they will not have peace...

So goes the family curse, long handed down from generation to generation, ruining families and breaking hearts. And now it's Eniiyi's turn - who, due to her uncanny resemblance to her dead aunt, Monife, is already used to her family's strange beliefs, as well as their insistence that she is a reincarnation. Still, when she falls in love with the handsome boy she saves from drowning, she can no longer run from her family's history. Is she destined to live out the habitual story of love and heartbreak, or can she escape the family curse and the mysterious fate that befell her aunt?

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In October we will be discussing Cursed Daughters by Oyinkan Braithwaite.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Unity Book Club September 2025 | Flesh, About the book: 
A propulsive, hypnotic novel about a man who is unravelled by a series of events beyond his grasp.
Fifteen-year-old István lives with his mother in a quiet apartment complex in Hungary. New to the town and shy, he is unfamiliar with the social rituals at school and soon becomes isolated, with his neighbour – a married woman close to his mother’s age – as his only companion. These encounters shift into a clandestine relationship that István himself can barely understand, and his life soon spirals out of control.
As the years pass, he is carried gradually upwards on the twenty-first century’s tides of money and power, moving from the army to the company of London’s super-rich, with his own competing impulses for love, intimacy, status and wealth winning him unimaginable riches, until they threaten to undo him completely.
Spare and penetrating, Flesh is the finest novel yet by a master of realism, asking profound questions about what drives a life: what makes it worth living, and what breaks it.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In September we will be discussing Flesh by David Szalay.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.

WAITLIST ONLY - Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy, TICKETS ON SALE NOW!
Tickets for the Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy are officially on sale as of today (1 August) until 1 October, unless they sell out prior. So don't leave it till the last minute!
Priority will be given to financial members of Club Garibaldi and Club Italia Nelson.
Non-members will be wait-listed in order of application date and confirmed after the 1 October cutoff.
The cost of the tickets are as follows:
Financial Club Members (from both Clubs):
- 12 years and over: $25.00pp
- 6–11 years old: $12.50pp
- under 5 years: Fre
Non-Members:
- 12 years and over: $50.00pp
- 6-11 years old: $25.00pp
- under 5 years: Free
Please email, text or call Rosina to secure your tickets now.
rosina.vanderaa@gmail.com
021-621-245
Once your FY25/26 membership status has been confirmed, Rosina will send you the bank account details.
A presto!
Photo courtesy of The Pines.
***
Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.

description:
WCC "Tequila and Salsa night!", Hello again bartenders from all walks of life! Brush up on your Tequila knowledge and your Salsa recipes because the next Wellington Cocktail Competition is just around the corner!
As to the theme for this WCC, it is “Tequila and Salsa food pairing” The hero spirit this time around will be a surprise tequila on the night, but I can tell you it will be a reposado. The catch is, you have to pair it with a salsa that you make yourself. There are no limits on the style of cocktail you want this time around, so get creative!
If you would like to participate, get in touch with me or Dan ASAp as we were running low on time to organize this time around.
Minimum 30ml of Tequila must be used in the drink and as always must be the hero spirit of the night.
You will be making two drinks for the judges to try and 5 minutes to make two servings of your cocktail and serve your salsa.
The judges may also be coerced with bribes and favours during your presentation.
The event will be on 28th of September and the competition will start at 6pm.
If you have any questions about the competition, please ask either me or Dan.
The main aim of this cocktail competition is to help those who may not have entered comps before, gain a bit of confidence and experience, or for people who haven’t entered a comp in a while, to shake off those cobwebs.
It also a chance to meet new people and introduce newcomers to the Wellington bar scene. Most of all the idea is to have fun!
Each competitor will have 5 minutes to make and present two servings of their drink.
All Tequila and corn chips for your salsa will be provided, but you will have to source your own ingredients including citrus and sugar syrup. Glassware and ice will be provided, you are more than welcome to bring specialty equipment and ingredients, however you will be marked on how easy your drink is to replicate.
The competition will be judged by a panel of 3 judges. While knowing your stuff is important, brand knowledge is not the key here. This comp is to engage bartenders in a fun comp environment, so drink and personality are just as important.
Competitors will be first come first serve, so message either me or Dan if you want to be entered, there are 10 spots for the night and there will be prizes for the winner.
There will be drink deals on the night, and make sure you bring your friends, workmates, parents ect ect to cheer you on and heckle the other competitors…
See you all there!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
WCC x Hanging Ditch x Planteray "A very tiki birthday!", Hello again bartenders from all walks of life! Get your best tiki shirts and all your syrups ready because it’s time for another WCC.
This will be a special WCC as we are teaming up with Hanging Ditch for their 10th birthday so please come along and congratulate them for this milestone!
As to the theme this time around, you will be making “Birthday cake Tiki Cocktails” for the judges, and you have complete creative control on how you would like to wish a happy birthday to Hanging Ditch. The only rules are it must be tiki inspired, and it must be birthday cake inspired as well.
For the spirits, you will have the choice of either Planteray 3 Stars, Planteray Original Dark or Planteray Pineapple Stiggins and as it’s going to be a tiki night, I will allow you to use a mixture of the rums available.
If you would like to participate, get in touch with me or Dan sometime in the month and I will announce our competitors closer towards the time.
Minimum 30mls of any of the Planteray Rums must be used in the drink and as always must be the hero spirit of the night.
You will be making two servings of your cocktail for the judges to try and 5 minutes to make both.
The judges may also be coerced with bribes and favours during your presentation, and a gaudy tiki shirt wouldn’t go amiss.
The event will be on 30th of November at Hanging Ditch and the competition will start at 7pm.
If you have any questions about the competition, please ask either me or Dan.
The main aim of this cocktail competition is to help those who may not have entered comps before, gain a bit of confidence and experience, or for people who haven’t entered a comp in a while, to shake off those cobwebs.
It also a chance to meet new people and introduce newcomers to the Wellington bar scene. Most of all the idea is to have fun!
Each competitor will have 5 minutes to make and present two servings of their drink.
All Planteray stock will be provided, but you will have to source your own ingredients including citrus, sugar syrup, etc. Glassware and ice will be provided, you are more than welcome to bring specialty equipment and ingredients, however you will be marked on how easy your drink is to replicate.
The competition will be judged by a panel of 3 judges. While knowing your stuff is important, brand knowledge is not the key here. This comp is to engage bartenders in a fun comp environment, so drink and personality are just as important.
Competitors will be first come first serve, so message either me or Dan if you want to be entered, there are 12 spots for the night and there will be prizes for the top 3.
There will be drink deals on the night, and make sure you bring your friends, workmates, parents ect ect to cheer you on and heckle the other competitors…

description:
WCC x Rittenhouse & Elijah Craig "The Return of the Mellowcorn", Hello again bartenders from all walks of life! Prepare for beer matches and the return of the king because Mellowcorn is coming back to NZ!
As to the theme for this WCC, it is “The Mellowcorn and Rye Happy Meal.” This time around, I would like you to come up with what’s known as a Happy Meal, which is a cocktail, a shot and a beer. You will have the choice of either the Elijah Craig small batch or Elijah Craig Straight Rye Whiskey for the cocktail in question and I will say there are no limits on the cocktail you create.
The catch is you will be pairing it with a shot of either Rittenhouse Rye or Mellowcorn as well as a canned beer of your choosing. We will be supplying the spirits, but you must provide the beer and whatever ingredients you need for the cocktail.
If you would like to participate, get in touch with me or Dan sometime in the next month and I will announce our competitors closer towards the time.
Minimum 30mls of Elijah Craig Small Batch or Elijah Craig Rye must be used in the drink and as always must be the hero spirit of the night.
You will be making two servings of your cocktail for the judges to try and 5 minutes to make both as well as serve your shot and beer.
The judges may also be coerced with bribes and favours during your presentation.
The event will be on 27th of October at Crumpet and the competition will start at 6pm.
If you have any questions about the competition, please ask either me or Dan.
The main aim of this cocktail competition is to help those who may not have entered comps before, gain a bit of confidence and experience, or for people who haven’t entered a comp in a while, to shake off those cobwebs.
It also a chance to meet new people and introduce newcomers to the Wellington bar scene. Most of all the idea is to have fun!
Each competitor will have 5 minutes to make and present two servings of their drink.
All Elijah Craig, Rittenhouse and Mellowcorn stock will be provided, but you will have to source your own ingredients including citrus, sugar syrup and your beer match. Glassware and ice will be provided, you are more than welcome to bring specialty equipment and ingredients, however you will be marked on how easy your drink is to replicate.

Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet here by 10:00 PM and stay for the massive NYE countdown party featuring live DJs, dancing, and a midnight champagne toast.
Please note: A Taxi/Uber/Lyft may be required for some stops. The crawl does not provide transportation or shuttle services between venues.
Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Optional Venue” at your convenience between 8:00 PM and 10:00 PM or stay at the wristband venue. After 10:00 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate and ring in the New Year together (marked as ‘The Final Stop’ below).
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop, as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Also, wristbands are no longer available after 10:00pm at the first venue.


2025 CRAWL MAP AVAILABLE NOW:
TBA





TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL

Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can't make the check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband to ensure you don’t miss out.
Note Club Schedule: Each venues’s scheduled times are listed in the "DIGITAL BAR LIST." Wristbands (for entry) and any applicable drink specials apply only during these times.
Day-Of Check: Review the "DIGITAL CRAWL MAP" on the event morning for any last-minute details or venue changes.

Responsible Drinking: Please drink responsibly. We promote a safe, fun environment, but remember, no one should drink and drive. Use designated drivers or rideshare services. Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication or inappropriate behaviour. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.

The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.

description:
WOW Train VIP Experience ex Christchurch : SOLD OUT, Transcend the ordinary on a journey like no other, to a show like no other. This extraordinary experience brings you the Greatest Stages on Earth.

Departing Friday 26 September, 2025

Beginning in Christchurch or Kaikoura, you'll witness the unique landscapes of the pacific coastline aboard the Coastal Pacific WOW Train and Interislander Ferry. A very special service, full of all things WOW, you'll be treated to a VIP welcome, special WOW garment appearances with an accompanying commentary, a WOW goodie bag and full catering during your journey. In Wellington, you will continue your journey into extraordinary with a Gold ticket to see the 2025 World of WearableArt (WOW) Show. This is a WOW experience like no other!

You'll love this break
If you are looking for the ultimate WOW Show experience, then this is the ticket!

Indulge your senses with a unique WOW Train experience, journeying along the coastline and over the strait past marine habitats aboard the Coastal Pacific and Interislander. In Wellington, you will continue your journey into the extraordinary with the Gold ticket to see the World of WearableArt Show.

This magical 3-day experience is set to be one of the greatest journeys of all time!

Inclusions
A 'Gold' ticket for the WOW Show performance on Saturday 27 September and a WOW Show Programme
Exclusive WOW Train aboard the Coastal Pacific (where everyone on board will be going to WOW in Wellington!) and VIP Ferry journey on the Interislander on 26 September
Onboard WOW entertainment and a goodie bag
Morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea aboard the train
2-nights accommodation including breakfast
Hotel transfer
Return flight with Air New Zealand

description:
Watercolour Paint and Wine Night in Waikanae - Midnight Kitty, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Waikanae! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: NO DRINKS are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Watercolour Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Floral Bunny: CANCELLED, Turn wine into watercolour! Take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a watercolour masterpiece!

Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

description:
Wellington Brick Show 2025, Wellington's largest display of LEGO® builds is back, bigger than ever!
Mark the 13th & 14th of September in your calendar and be sure to come along to see the amazing LEGO® creations from some of NZ’s best builders. This year’s show is our biggest yet, featuring over 150 passionate exhibitors from across the country to showcase their newest, most mind-blowing LEGO® creations. From towering cities to pop culture tributes, from amazing spaceships to fanciful unicorns, we have something to inspire and amaze LEGO® fans of all ages.
Come along to Walter Nash Stadium in Lower Hutt and experience amazing LEGO® displays, interactive activities, brick pits to get creative, raffles, food trucks and much more!
When:
Saturday 13th September, 9am–5pm
Sunday 14th September, 10am–4pm
Where:
Walter Nash Centre, Lower Hutt
How much:
Adults $10
Children $7
Family ticket $28
Door sales will also be available.
Be sure to like and follow the Wellington Brick Show on Facebook and Instagram to find out more about this amazing weekend of LEGO®fun! @WBS.nz
The Wellington Brick Show is proudly brought to you by Well-LUG - Wellington LEGO® User Group. We are a group of LEGO® fans of all ages from across the lower half of the North Island. New members are always welcome. Find out more about us at www.well-lug.nz

description:
Wellington Frocktails 2025, Wellington Frocktails 2025
Frocktails: a night of sewcialising, cocktails, delicious snacks and fantastic me-mades!

About this Event

Wellington Frocktails, with our headline sponsor The Fabric Store, celebrates the making of garments. Whether you sew, knit, crochet or stitch, September 6th is the evening to show off your proudest make! Frocktails is a worldwide movement, celebrating me-mades for over 10 years.
Mingle with new sewing friends and say cheers over a shared passion of this craft. Whether you're an expert or beginner, this event is for you.
Included in the ticket price is a welcome cocktail (or non-alcoholic beverage), second beverage, light refreshments, a goodie bag and the chance to win one of the many sewing related prizes. A photographer will be on hand to capture the event and all of your wonderful me-mades! With exclusive use of the venue, the option to purchase other beverages will be available.
You will need to be 18+ to attend this event.

Please note: A photographer is present at this event. Photos taken may be used for marketing purposes in future event promotions
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Wellington Game Review, It's the 1st ever Wellington Game Review!! Try out games for free and support your local dev with feedback.

You can play these games:
- Dream Team Supreme, a co-op roguelike deckbuilder by Big Adventure
- Echo Zero, a survival, base-building, action roguelike by Wildboy Studio
- Shape Sender Deluxe a physics-based puzzler by Dead Teapot

Tell your friends about it. Stop by after work, or before going out into town. Make an evening of it with your mates. Enjoy all the games and food Respawn has to offer and jump into the free playtests as you please. We're easy and we'll be gaming and chatting from 6pm till late.

This is the first time that Wellington game devs have banded together to organise local playtesting in person. These three games have been in development for over a year, and each has something specific that the devs made for this playtest. Respawn is the ultimate gaming hub in Wellington, offering top tier gaming, food, and weekly events. Let's keep the fun going with some games made down the street!

description:
Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st, Wellington Halloween Bar Crawl 2025 | Saturday, November 1st
Get ready for the biggest Halloween Bar Crawl in Wellington on Saturday, Nov 1st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs!

About this Event


🎃🕸️ WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃
Get ready for the wildest Halloween celebration in Wellington. Join the spookiest Halloween Bar Crawl on Saturday, November 1st, 2025, and get access to 4+ of Wellington’s hottest bars and nightclubs!
🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics.
📍 Crawl Stops: Lulu Bar & Restaurant, El Horno, The Rogue & Vagabond, and BL3—Wellington's hottest bars and nightclubs for an unforgettable Halloween celebration!
🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 7:30 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM!
🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait!
Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're spooky, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be at to celebrate Halloween.🧟‍♀️


⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience!
Gather your friends and take over the city with the Halloween Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Wellington’s top bars.
🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Wellington
🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues
🎟️ Exclusive Halloween Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry
📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems
🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue
👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Wellington’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and unforgettable Halloween experience!


🚨 Get Your 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨
🦇Wellington’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots.
It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this year's Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.
🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a Halloween to remember!
💀 Let the WELLINGTON HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money straight back to the bank!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
WRISTBAND VENUE:
Lulu Bar & Restaurant
🕒 7:30 PM – 10:30 PM
📍 31 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:30 -10:30 to arrive and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:30PM or explore the other venues.
MIDDLE STOPS:
El Horno
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 34 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
The Rogue & Vagabond
🕒 8:30 PM – 11:30 PM
📍 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is a middle slot—you can visit this venue at your leisure anytime between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM.
FINAL VENUE:
BL3
🕒 11:30 PM – 2:00 AM
📍8 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet at this final venue at 11:30PM for a massive final Halloween party!


Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Middle Stops” at your convenience between 8:30 PM and 11:30 PM or stay at the wristband venue until 10:30pm. After 11:30 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate at the final party location!
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop (wristband venue), as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Please also note that wristbands are no longer available after 10:30PM at the first venue. No refunds will be given if you show up late and miss the wristband pick-up window!
This club crawl is a walking bar crawl—all venues are within walking distance of each other. Please plan accordingly for transportation and your walking schedule.
Wristbands for entry will be provided by event staff only. To pick up your wristband, please check in with the event staff at the front reception or host stand.


2025 CRAWL MAP:




🎟️ General Admission – $20
Includes access to all official crawl stops. No frills — just the fun.
───────────────────────────────────────

👑 VIP Ticket – $25
Includes everything in GA plus:
🔥 Access to the VIP-only crawl challenge for free tickets
🚀 First dibs on future crawl drops & pre-sales
───────────────────────────────────────

🤯 Ultra VIP – $35
For the dangerously curious. Includes everything in VIP plus:
🏆 Name on our “Crawl Wall of Fame”
📜 Official “Certified Crawl Legend” digital certificate
🚪 Access to a future exclusive pre-sale drop
❓ A mystery bonus item we legally can’t describe 👀



A SPOOKTACULAR HALLOWEEN PARTY YOU WON'T WANT TO MISS
Skip the overpriced cover charge and long lines at a single bar. With one ticket, you’ll unlock access to multiple Halloween hotspots across Wellington, each with its own theme, music, and party energy. Whether you're rocking a full costume or just out for the night, this is your chance to experience the city’s top nightlife all in one thrilling Halloween themed experience.
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE HALLOWEEN NIGHT OUT
One bar? One vibe? That’s not how Wellington does Halloween. Grab your crew and bounce between the city’s best bars and clubs, each bringing something different to the table. From spooky cocktails to wild dance floors, the night builds up to one massive end-of-night party you won’t want to miss. 🧛‍♀️
THE BIGGEST HALLOWEEN PARTY NIGHT IN WELLINGTON
This crazy Halloween experience crawl will take you through the city’s top bars and clubs with a line-up built for non-stop fun. Expect packed dance floors, themed drinks, and a crowd ready to party in full costume.
GET YOUR TICKETS BEFORE THEY VANISH!
Spots are filling fast, so now’s the time to lock in your plans. Round up your friends, pick your costume, and get ready to sip, dance, and crawl your way through one of the most exciting nights Wellington has to offer. Halloween only comes once a year... so grab your tickets today! 🎟️



18+ EVENT / GOVERNMENT ISSUED ID REQUIRED


TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated check-in time at the scheduled location before 10:30 PM. Late arrivals will not be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.

description:
World Chase Tag Casual Game Night, World Chase Tag Casual Game Night
Come play Chase Tag at the Kilbirnie Recreation Center.

Come along to our casual game sessions. These will be open to anyone wanting to play and will be social, casual based rather than keeping score. We will play various versions of tag games: such as Ultimate Tag (which involves multiple evaders), Flight Club (which involves king of the hill format), and Chase-Off (the team version, as seen in World Chase Tag competition videos).
World Chase Tag was formed by Christian Devaux in 2012 after a game of Tag with his son in their back garden. A year later, he was joined by his brother, Damien, and together they set about turning the oldest game into the newest sport.


Cost:
-$4.50


Contact us:

description:
Wow Train Vip Experience Ex Auckland: SOLD OUT, **SOLD OUT** - but limited tickets are still currently available for the Christchurch to Wellington WOW Train and Ferry Experience

Transcend the ordinary on a journey like no other, to a show like no other. This extraordinary experience brings you the Greatest Stages on Earth.

Departing 2nd October, 2025

Beginning in Auckland or Hamilton, you'll witness the unique landscapes of the North Island aboard the Northern Explorer WOW Train. A very special service, full of all things WOW, you'll be treated to a VIP welcome, special WOW garment appearances with accompanying commentary, a WOW goodie bag and full catering during your journey. In Wellington, your journey ascends yet further with premium 'Gold' seats at the World of WearableArt (WOW) Show. This is a WOW experience like no other!

You'll love this break
If you are looking for the ultimate WOW Show experience, then this is the ticket!

Indulge your senses with a unique WOW Train experience through the volcanic heart of the North Island on your way to our stunning capital, Wellington. There, you will continue your journey into the extraordinary with a Gold ticket to see the 2025 World of WearableArt Show.

This magical 3-day experience is set to be one of the greatest journeys of all time!

Inclusions
A 'Gold' ticket for the WOW Show performance on Friday 3 October and a WOW Show Programme
Exclusive WOW Train journey aboard the Northern Explorer on 2 October (where everyone on board will be going to WOW in Wellington!)
Onboard WOW entertainment and goodie bag
Morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea aboard the train
2-nights accommodation including breakfast
Hotel transfer
Return flight with Air New Zealand

From NZ$1995 per adult

description:
You Should Be Dancing - Wellington, You Should Be Dancing - Wellington
You Should Be Dancing is back!

A disco dancing celebration. A boogie wonderland featuring classic tunes groovy enough to make even a statue move. A club night of super danceable disco hits!

If you love disco, or just want to shake your thing and have a great time, this night is for you.

All kinds of nice people are welcome. Dress up or down. Good times will be had on the grooviest dance floor with the most glamorous tunes and the greatest vibe. What have you got to lose?!

If you’re into...Earth, Wind & Fire, The Bee Gees, ABBA, Diana Ross, Cher, Boney M, Donna Summer, Kool and the Gang, Chic, Gloria Gaynor, KC & The Sunshine Band, The Trammps, Sylvester, Sister Sledge, The Nolans, The Jackson 5, Shalamar, Womack & Womack, Ottawan, The Village People, Chaka Khan, Evelyn Champagne King, Patrice Rushen, Silver Convention, Divine, Pointer Sisters, Bohannon, Patrick Cowley, Patrick Hernandez, Eruption, Rose Royce, Giorgio Moroder, Evelyn Thomas, Gwen Guthrie, Anita Ward, The Weather Girls, The Whispers, The O’ Jays, The Brothers Johnson, Candi Staton, Amanda Lear, and more more more...you will love this night.

You Should Be Dancing has a love of disco and dancing. We take great pleasure in getting together with friends, playing the best tunes, forgetting about work for a while and grooving the night away. We love to party and we pull out all the stops to keep the dance floor moving to the music. These events are always outrageous fun, so why not come down and get into it.

The full tour dates are as follows.

10/10/2025 - Christchurch - Loons
18/10/2025 - Auckland - Galatos
24/10/2025 - Wellington - San Fran

description:
Yu-Gi-Oh!: Saturday Genesys Format (100pt) @ Cerberus Games, WHAT IS GENESYS?
The Genesys rules are simple:
No Link Monsters or Pendulum Monsters are allowed. All other cards are allowed. The original field layout is used, with no Extra Monster Zones nor Pendulum Zones.
The standard Forbidden & Limited Cards list is not used. All those cards can be used, except Link Monsters and Pendulum Monsters. Usual limit of 3 copies max of any card still applies.
Deck construction uses a point system. Some cards are assigned a point value; most cards cost zero points. The total point cost of cards in your Main Deck, Extra Deck, and Side Deck (combined) cannot exceed the point cap for that event.
Here are the details:
Start Time: 12:00pm
Entry Fee: $15
Format: 100pt Genesys (3-4 Rounds)
Format details including points lists can be found here:
https://www.yugioh-card.com/en/genesys/
Prizing:
Each player receives an OTS Tournament Pack on entry. One Core/Deck Builder Booster Pack is added for each player to the top placers prize pool.

description:
Zombie Horde Halloween Pub Crawl Wellington 2025, Zombie Horde Halloween Pub Crawl Wellington 2025
The undead rise in Wellington! Join the Zombie Horde Pub Crawl on Nov. 1 for 4+ pubs, specials, & a monstrous finale!

About this Event


Zombie Horde: Halloween Pub Crawl – Wellington 2025 🧟‍♂️

On Saturday, November 1st, 2025, the undead rise in Wellington. The Zombie Horde Pub Crawl takes you through 4+ pubs and bars, each with their own specials and Halloween themes. Walk with the horde, grab exclusive drinks, and end the night at the ultimate zombie party.




What’s Included
Admission to multiple participating pubs
Crawl wristband for entry & specials
No cover charge at participating venues
Digital crawl map for navigation
DJs and live entertainment at select stops


Event Schedule
🔑 Check-In | 7:30–10:30 PM – Pick up your wristband at the opening pub.
🍺 Crawl Time | 8:30–11:30 PM – Move between bars at your own pace.
🎉 Final Party | 11:30 PM–2 AM – Gather at the last venue for the closing zombie party.



Details
🎟 Tickets start at $15 (Early Bird). Prices increase closer to Halloween.
🧛 Costumes encouraged — whether you’re a fresh zombie, survivor, or something in between, you’ll fit right in.
📍 Venue lineup announced soon. Full details will be available on the Digital Crawl Map on event day.



18+ Event / Valid ID Required


Helpful Tips
Arrive on Time: Wristbands must be collected at the designated check-in venue by 10:30 PM. Late arrivals cannot be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Send a Friend: If you can’t make check-in, you may authorize a friend to pick up your wristband so you don’t miss out.
Know the Schedule: Each venue’s times are listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Drink specials and crawl access are only valid during the hours posted.
Stay Informed: Always review the link on the morning of the event for the latest updates and any last-minute changes.
_______________________________________


Important Terms & Disclaimers
Age Requirement
All participants must be 18+ with a valid government-issued photo ID. Entry will not be granted without ID.
Wristbands
A wristband is required for entry at all participating venues. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive it. Wristbands must remain visible throughout the night. If you fail to pick up your wristband during the scheduled window, no replacement will be provided.
Tickets & Refund Policy
All ticket sales are final — no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled in full, your ticket (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Venues, times, and drink specials may be modified without notice.
Venue Rules
Each venue reserves the right to deny entry or remove guests for intoxication, capacity limits, inappropriate dress, or disruptive conduct. No refunds will be issued if entry is refused for these reasons.
Capacity & Timing
Some stops may reach capacity during the event. Admission is first-come, first-served, and your ticket does not guarantee immediate access to any specific location. Late arrivals may face delays in entry.
Self-Guided Experience
This is a self-led crawl — no host will escort groups between venues. Use the Digital Crawl Map to navigate. If staff at a venue are not aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the map and proceed to another participating venue if needed.
Drink Specials
Promotions are determined by each venue and may change or end without advance notice.
Security & Dress Code
All venues conduct their own security screening. Wristbands do not bypass these checks. Costumes must not include weapons (real or replica) or offensive themes. Violations may result in denied entry without refund.
Behavior Expectations
Respect venue staff, security, and fellow attendees. Aggressive or damaging behavior may result in removal without a refund.
Liability Notice
By purchasing a ticket and attending, you voluntarily accept all risks related to participation, including alcohol consumption, injury, illness, property loss, or incidents caused by other attendees. You waive any claims against the organizers, affiliates, staff, and participating venues. You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless these parties from any expenses or claims resulting from your actions.
Event Continuity
This event will run rain or shine. Venues and schedules may change. Check the Digital Crawl Map and your email on event day for the latest information.
Acknowledgment
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to these terms and accept full responsibility for your participation.

description:
Ōtari Glow Worm Tour, Ōtari Glow Worm Tour
Take a guided night tour through Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush and discover some of the fascinating night-time residents on your way to see the titiwai/glowworms. Enjoy the tranquil beauty of the bush after dark and witness the magical glow of these unique creatures.

This outdoor night-time tour takes just over an hour.
If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 5 years and older.
The tour requires a moderate level of fitness, the route includes numerous steps to and from the glowworms.

Meet at the Ōtari Visitors Centre, 150 Wilton Road. Bring warm clothes, walking shoes, and a torch.

This tour is operated by the Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush Trust. Join the Trust from just $20 a year and the glow worm tour is free, plus you’ll be supporting the amazing work the Trust does. Join today at owbt.nz/membership-donations/

Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.

For any changes or inquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at or call 04 499 1400.

description:
☕🚨Coffee & Cars 🚨🚘, ☕🚨Coffee & Cars 🚨🚘
🚗☕ FREE EVENT - Coffee & Cars is back for Season 8! 🚗☕

We’re rolling into our eighth season of Coffee & Cars at Southward Car Museum!

Bring your pride and joy, check out an incredible mix of classics, customs, hot rods, and modern favourites - or just come along to enjoy the atmosphere.

📅 Upcoming Dates (weather dependent):

- Sunday 16 November 2025
- Sunday 14 December 2025
- Sunday 11 January 2026
- Sunday 8 February 2026
- Sunday 8 March 2026

🍔 Food & Drinks:
The Southward Coffee Stop is open for drinks & snacks (check out the new Milkshakes & Icies!)
We’ll also have the Coffee Cruisers + Food Trucks on-site plus the ever-popular BBQ Fundraiser - each month run by a different local sports club or organisation, so bring some change to support them.

💙 Look out for our Gulf GT40-inspired donation box near the museum entry!
Coffee & Cars is a FREE event and we love keeping it that way so everyone can come along and enjoy it. But, as you can imagine, it does cost a lot to run each season. If you’d like to help us keep the wheels turning, we’d be so grateful for any contribution - big or small. Every bit of support helps us keep Coffee & Cars running strong for the whole community. Thank you for helping us make this event possible 🙌

🚙 All Cars Welcome – classics, performance, JDM, vintage, muscle, daily drivers… if you love it, bring it.
🚗 Spectator Parking is also available on-site.

⚠️ Please note: There will be no October event this year as the last few October events have been rained off, so we’re looking forward to a dry & sunny start in November!

🎄💃🕺 Xmas Salsa Hutt Dance Party 💃🕺🎄, 🎄💃🕺 Xmas Salsa Hutt Dance Party 💃🕺🎄
"May I have this Christmas dance?" 🎄😊💃🕺 It's that time of year already! Come spread the Christmas cheer on the dance floor with us!

Come dance the night away with your like-minded friends, and loads of classic Salsa songs from years ago, as well as a “dash” of Bachata and a “sprinkling” of Kizomba…..

• One fantastic wooden dance floor with a mix of Salsa, Bachata, and Kizomba music

• Easy to find venue off a main street in Petone (72 Cuba St)

• Plenty of parking in surrounding streets

• On main bus routes (#83 from Wellington, or #110 from Upper Hutt), or short 8min walk from Ava Train Station

• Water station provided however bringing your own water drink bottle is recommended. Also, BYO soft drinks, fruit juices, non-alcohol drinks, etc. (NB/ No alcohol allowed on premises!)

• Please wear high heel/stiletto caps to prevent damage to the venue’s wooden floor – For example, from https://www.beclickless.com/pages/faqs

• Only goes until 10:30pm so get there early to have a decent "fix" of dancing and socialising 😊

• Only $10.00 at the door (cash), or bank transfer (preferably at least 24 hours in advance):

description:
2025 Greytown Santa Parade, Celebrate the season with Greytown’s annual Santa Parade - an afternoon of festive fun, community spirit, and creative flair. The parade begins at 2pm on Saturday, 13 December 2025, bringing music, colour, and holiday cheer to the streets of Greytown. This free event is proudly presented by South Wairarapa Rotary.

Local businesses, schools, clubs, and community groups are invited to take part by entering a float. There’s no cost to register, and all entries are welcome. Prizes will be awarded across several categories, including Mayor’s Choice, Best Tractor or Farm Vehicle, Most Creative Concept, Best Business Representation, Best Youth Entry, and Best Overall Floats (1st, 2nd, and 3rd place).

After the parade, the festivities continue with Carols at Cobblestones from 3:30pm (koha entry). It’s a joyful celebration of connection and creativity in the heart of our region.

To register your float, scan the QR code on the event poster or contact the organisers directly.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
2025 New Zealand Book Awards for Children & Young Adults Ceremony, The most joyful children’s literature event of the year is surely the New Zealand Book Awards for Children and Young Adults ceremony, and we’re inviting you to join the celebration at the characterful Pipitea Marae in Wellington on Wednesday 13 August.
You’ll be greeted by a singing group of talented Pōneke rangatahi and there’ll be live music throughout the evening. But most importantly, you’ll get to meet the 47 gifted children’s writers, illustrators and translators who are finalists in this year’s awards, and applaud the winners as they are announced.
Tickets (which include food and refreshments at the post-ceremony function) are on sale now via Humanitix for $52.00 plus booking fees. This is a popular event with a limited number of seats, so secure your place today and enjoy this wonderful showcase of the very best books of the year for young New Zealand readers.

In this advanced four-hour course run by Joe Chang from Kids Game Dev, tamariki learn about the multi-layered process behind game development, including programming, 3D modelling, game art, animation, and heaps more.

This course is great for tamariki who have already completed 3D Game Design or a similar course, and is also open to novices looking to learn game design from scratch.

Tamariki are encouraged to bring a small packed lunch and a water bottle.

Places are limited and bookings are essential for each tamariki that wishes to take part.

Saturday 2 August | 2-4pm
Adventure School Hall - Doors open from 1:30pm
Kids clothes
Afternoon tea refreshments provided and 'new to you' clothes and accessories to take home
Join us on Saturday 2 August at 1:30pm with the event kicking off at 2pm
(Everyone selecting clothing will need their own ticket)

The Clothing Grab runs in rounds:
- Everyone starts at one end of the room.
- You'll make your way through and select 5 items.
- Once you’ve chosen your 5 items, head back to the starting point and wait for the next round.

It’s a great way to refresh your kids’ wardrobes sustainably and affordably. We’d love to see you there!

description:
Art Classes - Term 4 - Creative Kid's Art Lab - 2025, Art classes & after-school care for children who like to make, create and invent. Located in Raumati, Paraparaumu - Kapiti.

For ages 5-13 on Tues, Wed and Thurs. The kid's art classes are from 3.30 - 5.15pm, however children can arrive from 3pm onwards.


- Qualified primary teacher and artist
- 15 years' experience teaching art to primary-aged children
- Progressive teaching methods
- Lessons based on traditional and modern arts/crafts, developing skills & creativity
- Structured, but in a home-studio setting
- Daily or weekly themes
- A child-friendly, relaxed environment for after-school
- Lots of variety / choice
- Excellent resources

The classes provide an opportunity to play and experiment in a structured but caring, home-studio environment.

Activities are designed and supervised by an experienced primary school teacher and artist.

To meet the needs of active and curious children after school we explore a variety of crafts such as sewing, crochet, pottery, felting, weaving, jewellery and woodwork; and the art forms: painting, drawing, sculpting and printmaking.

The activities utilise a child's growing mathematical skills such as estimating, measuring, scaling up & down, changing 2D to 3D, exploring symmetry, and pattern-making. Natural sciences, such as chemistry, biology, geology and physics are included, as well as history and culture.

See the creativekids artlab website. Phone Helen with any questions.
label: Kids & Parents

Baby Rock & Rhyme with Wellington City Libraries & Nōku te Ao Capital E
Ideal for babies and tiny tots, Baby Rock & Rhyme is a weekly drop-in programme for you to spend quality time with your baby through rhymes, fingerplays and stories.
Delivered by an experienced facilitator, you and your baby will have fun exploring their first introduction to literacy and music, set inside the inspiring and ever-changing PlayHQ.
Best suits ages 0-2, Baby Rock & Rhyme is part of our E Tipu E Rea term-time programme.
Free, donations appreciated.
Nōku te Ao Capital E, 4 Queens Wharf. Pram parking and accessible bathrooms available.
Learn more at: https://www.capitale.org.nz/event/baby-rock-n-rhyme/

Balloon School: Creative Mode (1.5 hours)
Get ready to twist, create and build in Balloon School: Creative Mode! 🎈🛠️ Designed for kids aged 5+, this fun and hands-on workshop teaches tamariki how to make epic balloon creations inspired by their favourite pixel world.
In this 1.5-hour session, kids will learn to twist:
A diamond sword
A pickaxe
A creeper (careful, it might explode!)
No experience needed, just bring your imagination! All materials provided, and kids can take their creations home.
Perfect for crafty adventurers who love building, creating and having a laugh along the way! 🎮🎈

description:
Bunnings Halloween Family Night, This Halloween, Bunnings is inviting families across New Zealand to enjoy a safe, inclusive and delightfully spooky evening at their local Bunnings. On Thursday 30 October from 5:00pm to 7:00pm, stores nationwide will come alive with free Halloween festivities, including DIY workshops, face-painting and tasty treats.

Kids DIY areas across New Zealand will come alive with decorations from Bunnings’ Halloween range, creating a festive atmosphere for kids and parents to enjoy. Children can dive into Halloween-inspired crafts like making Jack ‘o’ lanterns or decorating masks and keyrings, face-painting and themed games. Bunnings team members will be dressed to impress in playful Halloween costumes, and plenty of food will keep everyone energised throughout the evening.

With the growing popularity of Halloween in Aotearoa, Bunnings is proud to offer a welcoming space for parents and kids to celebrate together.

“Bunnings has always been about community, and our Halloween Family Night is a great way to bring people together in a fun, safe environment,” says Melissa Haines, Bunnings NZ General Manager.

The Halloween Family Night has seen remarkable year-on-year growth, starting with 1,100 attendees across 8 stores in 2023, surpassing over 4,850 attendees across 41 stores in 2024.

This year, with all stores participating, Bunnings is set to make Halloween bigger and better than ever.


Visit Bunnings Halloween Family Night
Time and date: Thursday 30th October 2025 5:00pm-7:00pm

To book your spot at the Bunnings Family Night Halloween Event visit In-Store D.I.Y. Workshops - Bunnings New Zealand

For more information including store transformations, workshops and Halloween merchandise visit Bunnings Halloween

DATE: Saturday Sept 27
TIME: 2-3pm
LOCATION: Greytown Art Gallery
AGES: 8-12 years
COST: $35 (all materials provided)

Children’s “Matisse” Collage Workshop with Linda Kirkland – 60 minutes of fun and focused creativity for children aged 8 – 12 years. Immerse your child in a world of colour and creativity with the Under the Sea collage workshop, led by experienced educator Linda Kirkland. Drawing inspiration from the bold, large-scale collages of Henri Matisse—who famously described his technique as painting with scissors—Linda will guide the children through an exciting exploration of shape, colour, and composition. Her engaging teaching style will inspire the young artists to create vibrant and unique masterpieces that bring the underwater world to life.

This workshop has limited space.
Please register here: https://greytownarttown.com/childrens-matisse-collage-workshop-with-linda-kirkland/

description:
Family event: Explore Omnibirding with Giselle Clarkson, We are thrilled and delighted to announce we are going to be hosting a fabulous school holiday event with the multi-award winning Giselle Clarkson to celebrate the release of her latest book Omnibird: An Avian Investigator’s Handbook, a guide to the art and science of omnibirding.
Giselle Clarkson, the author of The Observologist, will be in Tawa for this very special event to explore the inner workings of the book and delights and wonders of the avian world.
Some birds are so commonplace it’s easy to forget how extraordinary they are. These creatures have a secret eyelid, hollow bones and a two-part brain. They dress in feathers. Omnibird, explores what’s remarkable about the birds all around us and the clues we can all use to become avian investigators.
Giselle is an author, illustrator and cartoonist based in Greytown, known for her work on conservation and environmental topics. She has illustrated award-winning picture books and nonfiction and is a 2023 Arts Foundation Laureate, receiving the prestigious Mallinson Rendel Illustrators Award.
This promises to be an unmissable event for bird and nature lovers of any age.
Books for sale thanks to the Children's Bookshop.
We wish to extend our thanks to Gecko Press for helping make this event happen.
This is a free event.
We expect this event to be very popular so to secure your seat early arrival is suggested.

description:
Intro to 2D Traditional Animation - Creative Arts Holiday Programme, This is a beginners course in 2D animation where tweens & teens will learn the time-honoured principles of hand-drawn animation and how to apply them to your own animation project. You may work on a project incorporating your own ideas, or if you'd rather, an assigned a project from your tutor.

You can use any device, ipad or laptop you already own (except a mobile – it's really not big enough to do good animation on). The school does not provide any digital equipment.

Your tutor, Ross Payne, is a 30 year veteran of traditional 2D animation, and loves to share his knowledge about it for you to love it as much as he does.

In each lesson there will be examples and demonstrations of the animation principles with follow up exercises to put your new skills into practice. You'll work on your project both during class and at home, applying the animation principles to your individualised project.

You can choose to draw your animation on paper then scan/capture into your device, or choose to draw your animation digitally, directly into an animation programme. which ever you choose, instructions in class will be provided to give you the skills needed for this step.

Bring a water bottle and snack for morning tea.

This workshop is for ages 10 and above. Tuesday - Friday, 30 September - 3 October, 10 am - 1 pm daily.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, pottery and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Jewellery Making - Creative Arts holiday programme for teens, Craft your own rings in this introduction to metal-smithed jewellery making! In this quick paced one session workshop you’ll learn some metalworking fundamentals to turn raw silver, copper and brass into shining wearable rings. Use hammers and stamps to add textures and simple lettering to customise your creation!

Techniques covered:

- Use sizers and jeweller’s callipers to measure ring size
- Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces
- Use hammers and stamps to texture and form metal
- Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal
- Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery

Minimum age is 13 years. This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, pottery, animation and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
Kids Christmas Party – Sunday 7 December, Kids Christmas Party – Sunday 7 December
✨ What’s On

1:00 PM – Meet Olaf & Elsa as they welcome the kids.
1:30 PM – Be amazed by the Elves and their Bubble Magic Show – every child will even get the chance to be inside a bubble!
2:30 PM – Family BBQ with live music by Myah Snow, performing Disney favourites including songs from Frozen.
3:00 PM onwards – Games and activities for the kids.
Around 3:30 PM – Santa arrives to hand out presents! 🎅
✨ Gift Options
This year you can choose how your child’s present is arranged:

Option A – Pay $25 per child and we’ll take care of the gift (just let us know what they’d like when you register).

Option B – Purchase your own gift (maximum value $25), wrap it, clearly label it with your child’s name, and drop it at the Club by Friday 28 November.

⚠️ Please note: If you choose to supply your own gift but don’t drop it off by the deadline, we won’t be able to include your child in the party.

Registrations close on Monday, November 24th

A maximum of 60 children will be allowed
2 adults per 4 kids
You can register online - click the button below. Note: If you would like us to purchase your child's present, payment must be made by November 24th.

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER ON-LINE: :

description:
Kids Market - Pop-up Parlour 2025, Kids Market - Pop-up Parlour 2025
Come along and support our young entrepreneurs!

TAKING REGISTRATIONS NOW!!
https://tinyurl.com/yc6myufk

The Kids Market is part of the Pukerua Bay Hub Pop-up Parlour. It is a great opportunity for children up to 16 years of age to show their entrepreneurial spirit and sell their own handmade crafts, baking, good quality used toys, clothes, books etc.

Customers, bring your cash on the day.

Event details
• What - Trading for 2hr and 2hrs of setup/packdown
• When - 12 – 3pm Sunday 14th September 2025
Set up from 10.30pm. Trading 12-3pm. Pack-up to be complete by 4pm.
• Where - St Marks, 98 Rawhiti Road, Porirua, 5026 (opposite the school)
• Cost - koha per table, collected on the day

• What to bring?
A table will be provided to each stall, we recommend you bring a tablecloth. You must bring your own float as there is no access to ATM, eftpos, or power at the stalls. Please no free items as this may affect other children’s sales.

Stalls are limited to two people each and a supervising parent must be onsite at all times.

LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE.

For more information email
____________________________________
WHAT IS THE POP-UP PARLOUR?
A chance to create and connect in our pop-up community space. From 1-30 September we've got a jam-packed schedule with 65+ events for kids, families, rangatahi and adults to learn, hang out and have fun.

Check out all the free/koha events too -
https://www.pkbhub.org.nz/whatson

Waiho i te toipoto, kaua i te toi roa –
Let us keep close together, not far apart.

description:
MEGA Machines Day 2025, MEGA Machines Day – Free Family Fun!

Date: Saturday, November 22
Time: 11 AM – 2 PM
Location: Mitre 10 MEGA Masterton

MEGA Machines Day is back and it’s bigger and better than ever! This is a completely FREE family event designed for kids and parents to enjoy together. Children can climb into our HIAB truck, forklift, loader, and a concrete mixer courtesy of Higgins, dress up, and take amazing photos.

There will be a free kids’ workshop, mini games, a local photo booth courtesy of The Dance Company, temporary tattoos, and plenty of giveaways including Mitre 10 bouncy balls and bubble wands. Enjoy a sausage sizzle with all proceeds donated to Wellington Free Ambulance, and learn lifesaving skills at the Heartbeat CPR session.

To make the day even more exciting, we’re offering 10% OFF storewide during the event from 11 AM to 2 PM (T&Cs apply). Entry is free for everyone, and donation buckets will be available to support Wellington Free Ambulance.

Join us for a day of fun and community spirit – all for free!

description:
Meet the Characters from Kiwi's Big Hararei show at Zealandia!, These school holidays, Zealandia Te Māra a Tāne will become the playground of a host of incredible critters from Circa Theatre's current children's show Kiwi's Big Hararei!
Brought to you by award-winning company, Horse With No Name, this free "Meet the Characters" event features an amazing array of manu, including kiwi, tūī, kārearea, and tītīpounamu.
The cast of Kiwi's Big Hararei will wow tamariki with a sneak peek of their show, featuring original waiata by Aotearoa singer-songwriter, Benny Tipene. They will also kōrero about the unique adaptations of these manu and how we can all be kaitiaki of them.
Bring your tamariki along to engage with these colourful creatures, with stunning costume design by GRIDLEY by Victoria. Musical performance, native biodiversity, and interactive theatre combine on the Heritage Lawn for an afternoon of spring fun in the sun! The team of talented children’s entertainers from Horse With No Name is so excited to share a snippet of their show Kiwi's Big Hararei with you.
Kiwi's Big Hararei will be playing at Circa Theatre over the school holidays until 4 October: https://www.circa.co.nz/package/kiwis-big-hararei/
General Admission fees to the sanctuary apply, free entry for members. Should the weather turn, this event will be held the foyer of the Visitor Centre on the ground floor. Overflow carparking is available at Birdwood Street during the busy school holiday period.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme, Mindful Kids Summer Holiday Programme
Get your kids ready for a fun, screen-free holiday programme full of mindful, holistic activities. Vegan kai will be provided daily too!

About this Event

At Mindful Kids we will explore nature, get creative cooking and crafting, play music and dance, do mindfulness exercises and more in a peaceful, safe environment. The programme has been crafted with care to give your kids the best experience and will be facilitated by a NZ qualified primary school teacher.
The programme will run for three Fridays over the course of three weeks as per details below.
Times: Drop off time: 8.30am - 9am; Pick up time: 3pm - 3.30pm
Dates: Friday 16th January, Friday 23rd January, Friday 30th January
Location: Bhakti Lounge - 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro Wellington
What to bring: A drink bottle, sun protection, weather-appropriate clothing, regular Medic*tion, and walking shoes.
Age range: 7 - 10 year olds
General daily schedule: Each day will run according to the following structure incorporating the daily theme as per below.
8.30 - 9am - Drop off time
9am - Mindful Moment: Roll, 5 mins of breathwork, 5 mins of yoga, story, circle time
9.30am - Activity
10.30am - Morning tea time
11am - Activity
12.30pm - Lunch time
1.30pm - Mindful Moment: Roll, 5 mins of breathwork, 5 mins of yoga, story
1.45pm - Activity
2.30pm - Afternoon tea and pack up time
3 - 3.30pm - Pick up time

Activities for each day: Check out the cool activities we will do each day!

Cooking and Crafts Day -16th January
Vegan cooking class - Learn to make sushi, sweets and more..
Masterchef Jr contest
Table decorating and restaurant designing
Arts and crafts afternoon
Nature Day - 23rd January
Nature treasure hunt at Central Park
Decorating pots and gardening
Nature hike
Fun at the playground and flying fox
Picnic at the park
Music and Dance Day - 30th January
Make your own instruments
Disco dancing with disco ball and lights
Dress up costume play
Music and dance games
Talent quest
Programme Facilitator: Our facilitator has a wealth of experience creating rich, engaging activities for tamariki in Aotearoa. As well as being a qualified primary school teacher for six years, she also has a degree majoring in Psycholgy and Spanish, experience running a yoga and wellbeing student club at Victoria University and experience being a school Sports Coordinator. Additionally, she has taught in schools in Spain, been the Positive Behaviour for Learning Team Leader and has initiated mindfulness sessions for teachers at various schools. She was the second in charge coordinator for a holiday programme in Nelson and is now excited to combine all of her skills and experience to give your kids the best experience possible at Mindful Kids.
We hope to see you and your kids soon! :)

description:
Mum Club - Play Session Khandallah, Join us for a relaxed, welcoming mum & baby playgroup designed to make getting out of the house feel easier — not harder.
This is a low-pressure space for mums to connect while babies play, explore and just be themselves. There’s no structure, no expectations and absolutely no judgement — come as you are.
To create a calmer, more comfortable environment, sessions are split by developmental stage.
🌱 Little Ones Play Session - 9am - 10am
For non-crawlers & early movers (approx 0–7 months)
A calmer, slower-paced session focused on connection.
🚼 On the Move Play Session - 10.30am - 11.30am
For crawlers & walkers (approx 7–18 months)
More active play, movement and exploration — noise welcome!
Each session is limited to 10 mums to keep the space calm and supportive.
What’s Included
Open-ended play for babies
A welcoming, judgement-free environment
Light morning tea provided
Space to sit, chat or just observe
Time to connect with other local mums
☕ BYO coffee welcome (with lid to keep babies safe)
Pricing
$20 Standard
Founding session pricing for our very first playgroup 💛
What to Know
Feeding, crying and leaving early are all completely okay
Stay for 10 minutes or the whole session
No need to know anyone — everyone is welcome
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Native Plant Papermaking Kids Workshop, Native Plant Papermaking Kids Workshop
Do you know a child who loves craft and making a splash? Join us for a fun family papermaking session!

We’ll be getting our hands wet as we explore the creative world of handmade paper using native harakeke (NZ flax) pulp. You will start off learning the simple skills of how to form a sheet of paper from wet pulp, then develop these skills by making different shapes and sizes, such as sheets, cards, envelopes, and ornaments. Express your own flair by experimenting with bits and pieces to add different colours and textures to your creations.

This workshop is designed for kids and accompanying adults to enjoy together. Adults are expected to assist hands-on and join the fun. Ages 5 and up.

description:
Newlands Tamariki Playcentre Open Week, If you have tamariki aged 0-6, you’re invited to your local centre during Playcentre Open Week to experience early childhood education with a difference.

Come along for a free visit and support your tamariki to learn through play, while you meet other whānau in your community. From sand and water play, arts and music, to outdoor and messy play, there will be a range of resources and experiences on offer.

With over 400 centres across Aotearoa there is one near you. You get three free visits before enrolling, so why not try a few centres in your community to see what suits you best?

Make a booking at newlandstamariki@playcentre.org.nz or 04 478 8470 (phone attended during session hours only)

description:
North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Saturday, 20 December 2025, North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Saturday, 20 December 2025
Be whisked away on the North Pole Express to meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.

About this Event


Public sales commence 1 September 2025.
Nice List presale: 12pm, 25 June 2025 - 5pm, 1 July 2025. Password required.
No tickets will be held during presale, any remaining tickets will be offered to the public from 12pm on 1 September 2025. To join the 'Nice List' visit the .
If you would like to purchase a private carriage for your group on this service, please email prior to 15 June 2025.



Join The Magical Journey to meet Santa!
Your tickets include:
Entertainers
Carolling
Iced cocoa
Cookies
Souvenir Mug
A special souvenir from Santa
Santa
Extra surprises along the way
Our Candy Class and Claus Class Guests travel in comfort and receive extra treats along the way.


Prepare to be surrounded by the magic and wonder of the Christmas season!
Families will love the magical train ride in one of our specially decorated carriages. You’ll meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.
Set to the sounds of carols passengers are invited to join us to be whisked away on the North Pole Express. Delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a journey to collect Santa who has been magically transported to an undisclosed location along the tracks.
From the distance the North Pole Express arrives then the train Conductors invite you and the other passengers to climb aboard shouting “All aboard!”.


All Aboard
During the first leg of the journey wide-eyed children of all ages are invited to engage with characters who are eager to hear what makes the Christmas season special to them.
You’ll meet the conductor, and join in the fun singing and dancing with your hosts and a few other characters who will appear in your carriage on the journey.
At the 'North Pole' Cocoa Class passengers enjoy their iced chocolate from their souvenir mug, and a delicious cookie served by our North Pole Express hosts. Candy and Claus Class passengers will be served aboard the train on the way to the North Pole.
Along the journey Santa appears in your carriage to present each passenger with their very own Christmas ornament. During the trip, characters in each carriage lead passengers in carolling and entertainment as the train makes its way back home.
Children UNDER 2 years (0-23 months) and travelling on the lap of an Adult are FREE. All Passengers 2 years old and over must hold a purchased ticket.

Please note: Seating in our Candy and Claus Classes is strictly limited. Candy and Claus Class Guests receive some extra surprises and treats along the way.
Seating in all carriages is arranged in a configuration of 4 seats as per normal train travel. NPE always endeavour to ensure those who book more than 4 seats are seated in close proximity to each other to ensure they can enjoy the experience together. Children under the age of 2 and travelling on the lap of an adult travel for free.
Wheelchair access: Due to the age and design of the carriages it is not possible to board whist seated in a wheelchair as the entrance is stairs and the doorways are very narrow. However we will be pleased to convey passengers of limited mobility whenever possible provided they can step onto the train from the platform, climbing a step and move to their reserved seats with the help of an able bodied carer. Our crew would assist guiding the passenger up the step onto the train and arrange for the storage of the wheelchair in the guards van. The wheelchair must be able to be folded up and cannot be used on the train. Please let us know when booking if you need wheelchair assistance.

Photo credit: John Bovis
label: Kids & Parents

Prepare to be surrounded by the magic and wonder of the Christmas season!
Families will love the magical train ride in one of our specially decorated carriages. You’ll meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.
Set to the sounds of carols passengers are invited to join us to be whisked away on the North Pole Express. Delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a journey to collect Santa who has been magically transported to an undisclosed location along the tracks.
From the distance the North Pole Express arrives then the train Conductors invite you and the other passengers to climb aboard shouting “All aboard!”.


All Aboard
During the first leg of the journey wide-eyed children of all ages are invited to engage with characters who are eager to hear what makes the Christmas season special to them.
You’ll meet the conductor, and join in the fun singing and dancing with your hosts and a few other characters who will appear in your carriage on the journey.
At the 'North Pole' Cocoa Class passengers enjoy their iced chocolate from their souvenir mug, and a delicious cookie served by our North Pole Express hosts. Candy and Claus Class passengers will be served aboard the train on the way to the North Pole.
Along the journey Santa appears in your carriage to present each passenger with their very own Christmas ornament. During the trip, characters in each carriage lead passengers in carolling and entertainment as the train makes its way back home.
Children UNDER 2 years (0-23 months) and travelling on the lap of an Adult are FREE. All Passengers 2 years old and over must hold a purchased ticket.

Please note: Seating in our Candy and Claus Classes is strictly limited. Candy and Claus Class Guests receive some extra surprises and treats along the way.
Seating in all carriages is arranged in a configuration of 4 seats as per normal train travel. NPE always endeavour to ensure those who book more than 4 seats are seated in close proximity to each other to ensure they can enjoy the experience together. Children under the age of 2 and travelling on the lap of an adult travel for free.
Wheelchair access: Due to the age and design of the carriages it is not possible to board whist seated in a wheelchair as the entrance is stairs and the doorways are very narrow. However we will be pleased to convey passengers of limited mobility whenever possible provided they can step onto the train from the platform, climbing a step and move to their reserved seats with the help of an able bodied carer. Our crew would assist guiding the passenger up the step onto the train and arrange for the storage of the wheelchair in the guards van. The wheelchair must be able to be folded up and cannot be used on the train. Please let us know when booking if you need wheelchair assistance.

Photo credit: John Bovis
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Open Day, Explore Montessori Together at our Open Day.

Have you every wondered what Montessori is all about?

Come along to our Open Day to meet our teachers, learn about our philosophy, discover our specialist materials, and find out how Montessori helps children explode into learning.

Capital Montessori School offers an authentic, high quality Montessori preschool programme for children aged 3 - 6 and a playgroup for children aged 0 - 3. Many of our children move onto the Montessori Primary Unit at Berhampore School when they turn 6 years old. The primary programme at Berhampore School runs through to Year 8.

Our school is designed to open your child up to life - nurturing their independence, confidence, curiosity and creativity.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Open Day-Montessori at Otari Preschool and Playgroup, This is a great opportunity to see our beautiful Preschool environment nestled beside the native forest area of Otari Wilton's Bush which we utilise for our weekly bushwalk.

Meet our 100% registered teachers and ask any questions.

We are a not-for-profit, community Preschool and Playgroup offering affordable Montessori Early Childhood Education. Catering for children from birth to 6 years.

Small class sizes.

Our vision is to "nourish the human spirit to create a better world".

For more information call the Preschool on 475 9688 or visit our website.

Bring the whole whanau, we really look forward to meeting you.

Otaki Kids Market, Otaki Kids Market
🎨🛍️ Otaki Kids Market is back on Sunday, 5 October 2025 🎉 Rangatahi and tamariki get ready to showcase your creativity.
Let's celebrate the power of young minds and crafts! 🌟👦👧

The Otaki Kids Market is a vibrant and creative event that provides a unique platform for young entrepreneurs to showcase their talents and entrepreneurial spirit.

This special market invites tamariki and rangatahi from 5-19 years old to become stall holders, offering them the opportunity to sell their handmade art and crafts, delicious home baking, toys, and books.

#OtakiKidsCraftMarket #YoungArtistsUnite
www.otakiwomensclub.org/kidsmarket


Nau Mai Haere Mai, meet you at the Market. 🌞

Outdoor market located on State highway one in О̄taki, opposite New World. Come and say hi to our regular stall holders along with special guests from the community.
+ all our awesome regular stall holders!

Paint Time with Rapunzel, Paint Time with Rapunzel
Join Rapunzel for a magical painting session where young artists will create their own flower-filled canvas masterpiece!

About this Event

Paint Time with Rapunzel
Let your creativity blossom in this enchanting art workshop for kids aged 5 and up! 🎨🌸🌼 Join Rapunzel for a magical painting session where young artists will create their own flower-filled canvas masterpiece inspired by her colourful tower garden.
While your artwork dries, enjoy whimsical games with magical prizes and take some fairytale-worthy photos with the princess herself!
Includes:
🌼 Guided painting on canvas
🌷 Fun games and activities while paint dries
👑 Meet & greet photos with Rapunzel
🎨 Take-home flower artwork

Perfect for young artists, fairy tale lovers and anyone who dreams in pastel! 🌸🖌️✨

Paleontologist for a Day: 10.00am - 11.00am
Volcanologist for a Day: 1.00pm - 2.00pm

Free activity | Bookings are required | Email info@whirinakiarts.org.nz or call 04 527 2168 to secure your place | Adult supervision required | Spaces limited
