description:
Pavilion Open Day – Celebrate Spring with Us!, Pavilion Open Day – Celebrate Spring with Us!
Wednesday 24 September 2025, 10am – 2pm
Discovery Garden, Wellington Botanic Garden
Free
These September school holidays, welcome the season of new life and bright colours at our family-friendly Pavilion Open Day. Tamariki can explore the garden’s spring magic through self-guided, hands-on activities designed to spark curiosity and connection.
Activities include:
• Nature’s Colours Art Table – Create your own “spring colour” bookmark using petals, leaves, and other natural treasures.
• Spring Scavenger Hunt – Follow clues to spot signs of the season: sweet-scented flowers, fresh buds, busy birds and more.
• Spring Reading Nook – Relax on the grass mat with tree-stump cushions and enjoy a basket of spring-themed books.
• Bird’s Nest Discovery Table – Get up close to real nests (ethically sourced), soft bird puppets, and natural playdough to shape “eggs” and match them to their native bird owners.
Perfect for children aged 4–12 and their whānau. Dress for a day outdoors and celebrate te kōanga—the vibrant season of growth!
We’ll see you soon in the Discovery Garden, Wellington Botanic Garden!
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Pinhole Photography - Three Day Creative Arts holiday programme, Did you know that any object that can be made light tight can be turned into a camera? Come along to this three-day workshop and choose an object – it could be a tea pot, a book, a coffee jar – to turn into a pinhole camera to then create black and white photographs with.

We’ll work in the darkroom and explore the process of loading your camera with silver gelatin paper, before making exposures in the garden around the historic Inverlochy house, testing different angles and perspectives. We’ll then return to the darkroom to develop your photographic negative, and print it as a positive. You’ll leave the course with a series of atmospheric pinhole photographs, having experienced the magic of hands-on darkroom printing.

Bring a water bottle and morning tea. Recommended age for this course is tweens & teens ages 10 and above.

Monday - Wednesday, 22 - 24 September, 10 am - 1 pm daily.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including pottery, jewellery making, animation and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.
label: Kids & Parents

This school holidays, set sail for adventure at Johnsonville Shopping Centre!

Join Zappo the Magical Pirate for a swashbuckling good time—packed with laughter, magic, and pirate mischief!

And don’t miss the Rainbow Circus Magic Mermaid Bubble Show—it’s bursting with colour, fun, Mermaids and giant bubbles!

It’s all FREE fun these school holidays at Johnsonville Shopping Centre—perfect for little pirates and sea-loving mermaids!

2 shows each week day at 11am & 1pm – don’t miss the magic!

description:
Playcentre Open Week, If you have tamariki aged 0-6, you’re invited to your local centre during Playcentre Open Week to experience early childhood education with a difference.

Come along for a free visit and support your tamariki to learn through play, while you meet
other whānau in your community. From sand and water play, arts and music, to outdoor and messy play, there will be a range of resources and experiences on offer.

With over 400 centres across Aotearoa there is one near you. You get three free visits before enrolling, so why not try a few centres in your community to see what suits you.

To make a booking at Kelburn Playcentre please email kelburn@playcentre.org.nz

description:
Playgroup and Preschool Open Day, Playgroup and Preschool Open Day
Nau mai, haere mai!

We are excited to be holding an Open Day this term for families interested in finding out more about our Playgroup and Preschool (caregivers interested in other areas welcome too!).

Wā Ora is the only Montessori school in New Zealand that caters for children from playgroup through to Year 13. Mark the date in your diary and pop in to see our Montessori playgroup, preschool and primary environment. Teachers and current parents will also be available to chat. There will also be a sausage sizzle for hungry tummies.

More information about our school is available on our website, or if you have any questions, please feel free to contact . We look forward to sharing the benefits of Montessori for your child with you soon!
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Pottery for Tweens & Teens, This eight week after-school course introduces a range of hand-building techniques for pottery/ceramics. Students will discover the joy of working with clay while creating a variety of objects that will be glazed and fired in our kiln to be taken home to be enjoyed for years to come.

In this course you will learn to:

- prepare clay for use
- learn slab, pinch pot and coil construction techniques
- learn how to glaze your creations
- learn techniques to create art that will withstand the firing process

Eight week course: Mondays, 9 Feb - 30 March, 3:45-5:15pm
Suitable for ages 11 - 16
Materials, including glazes and firing included.

description:
Puppet Show: Once In a Full Moon, Be captivated these school holidays the gorgeous puppet show “Once in a full moon” performed by Anna Bailey of String Bean Puppets.
Deep in the bush a lonely kiwi looks up at the sky and mistakes the full moon for a giant egg. Can kiwis fly? Can moons fall from the sky? Can wishes come true? This magical string puppet adventure that introduces the audience to an intimate encounter with a few of Aotearoa New Zealand's special native creatures.
This show will be held in the Visitor Centre Foyer and is suitable for all ages, normal admission to the sanctuary applies. Overflow parking is available on Birdwood Street.

description:
Read to Kurī, Join us and our doggy guests from Canine Friends Pet Therapy for Read to Kurī at the library. You can book a 15-minute session to sit with one of our friendly dogs and read your favourite book, or one you've found at the library.
Read to Kurī aims to help children improve their literacy, self-confidence, and self-esteem in a relaxed, non-judgemental environment. This programme is perfect for tamariki aged 5+ who would like to practice their reading skills while making a new canine friend at the library.
To book your session, please call the library on 04 477 6151, or email johnsonville.library@wcc.govt.nz with your preferred date and time.
Bookings are for 15 minutes only. After you have booked, library staff will be in contact informing you what time to arrive for your session.

description:
Science Bites School Holidays Science Workshops, Get hands-on with some tasty, edible science these school holidays! Science Bites is an edible science workshop for tamariki aged 8-12 years old.

Learn about rainbow diffraction chocolate, make your own gummy worms, explore some glow-in-the-dark jelly, and more! All the projects in this workshop are safe to eat, meaning kids can taste their creations as they learn.

Tamariki will be excited to come home and share their new understanding of how science can be found in our everyday lives, even our kitchens!

Workshops include a complimentary planetarium show.

Tamariki can be dropped-off in the morning and picked-up afterwards; caregivers are not required to stay for the duration of the workshop. Tamariki should bring a packed lunch.

This workshop will involve handling and consuming some known allergens and substances your child may be sensitive to. Please refer to the list on the Space Place website.

Best suited for children aged 8-12. $65 per tamariki - 9am-1pm.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Sept Holiday Programme-BLENHEIM, 'Energy Engineers'
Join us for two exciting days of science, creativity, and discovery! In Energy Engineers, kids will investigate the amazing world of stored energy — and unleash it through rockets, racers, and hands-on experiments.
Energy Engineers is a perfect mix of science, technology, engineering, art, and maths — designed to spark curiosity and leave kids buzzing with excitement!

Marlborough Boys College: 1-2 October
This course is designed for tamariki aged 7-13.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Sewing - Creative Arts Holiday Programme for Tweens & Teens, Create your own bucket hat, tote bag or cushion. This two-day workshop is designed to introduce sewing to 10- 15-year-olds. Those with sewing experience will be extended.

Students will learn essential techniques to create their very own tote bag and or bucket hat! They will be guided through each step of the way and by the end of the workshop, they'll have handcrafted projects to take home and enjoy. Both functional and fun! Don't miss out on this opportunity to start your sewing adventure.

All materials included.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, animation and pottery head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

Monday & Tuesday, 29-30 September, 10 am -1 pm daily.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Spooky Wednesday's Slime Lab, Spooky Wednesday's Slime Lab
Celebrate the first day of October, the month of Halloween, with Wednesday Addams’ delightfully dark slime lab!

About this Event

Spooky Wednesday’s Slime Lab: A Creepy-Cool Workshop (1.5 hours)

Celebrate the first day of October, the month of Halloween, with Wednesday Addams’ delightfully dark slime lab! Guided by everyone’s favourite gothic icon, young scientists (ages 5+) will mix potions, stir eerie colours, and conjure up their own squishy, spooky slime to take home. 🖤🧪
This 1.5-hour experience is packed with creepy fun, morbid giggles, and just the right touch of weird — with gooey surprises, chilling stories, and plenty of hands-on slime play.
Includes:🖤 Slime making with Wednesday Addams🧪 Take-home spooky slime📖 Creepy-cool stories and gothic games✨ Perfect for kids aged 5 and up
Optional Add-on: $5 “Graveyard Goo” — a gloopy, colourful kids’ mocktail to add to the eerie experience 🍹
A slimy, spook-tacular time for every little misfit and monster-in-training! 🕷️👻

Please note that we are not registered childcare providers, which means an adult responsible for each child must remain on the premises. The venue is also a café restaurant with other areas where parents can chill while the workshop is running.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
St B's Holiday Club, October Holiday Club in Paremata
Kids (school years 1-8) are warmly invited to the St B’s Holiday Club!
1, 2 & 3 October, 9.00am – 3.30pm.
Theme: Lego!!
The St B’s Holiday Club is truly a fun time, with excellent facilities, a high adult-child ratio, hands-on crafts and creativity, music and jump jam, supportive small groups, games, challenges and movies.
Cost: $40 per day. Discount for 3 days.
St Barnabas Presbyterian Church, 106 Mana Esplanade, Paremata
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Street Dance Foundations with Shifting Centre at Māoriland, Manu Wairere is a school holiday programme at the Māoriland Hub in Ōtaki, designed to ignite the creative potential of tamariki and rangatahi Māori aged 5–18.

Rangatahi are invited to join Shifting Centre, a Wellington-based artist collective, for a 3-day Street Dance Foundations Workshop.

Participants will explore the foundations of street dance through cypher and Talanoa, building confidence, creativity, and connection.

The workshop will conclude with a performance for whānau and friends.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
String Bean Puppets: Nan and Tuna, The school holidays are here, so bring your tamariki along to the sanctuary for a puppet show performance! Wonder and fun couples with important messages about the world around us in stories by String Bean Puppets.

The story tells of Nan and Tuna, who have been friends for 70 years. Now it is time for one last adventure together, but before they leave they need to find someone to care for the river.

This free event will be held in the Visitor Centre foyer, normal entries to the sanctuary apply.

Overflow parking is available at Birdwood Carpark during the busy school holiday period.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
String Bean Puppets: Once In a Full Moon, Be captivated these school holidays by the gorgeous puppet show, Once in a Full Moon, performed by Anna Bailey of String Bean Puppets.

Deep in the bush, a lonely kiwi looks up at the sky and mistakes the full moon for a giant egg. Can kiwis fly? Can moons fall from the sky? Can wishes come true? This magical string puppet adventure introduces the audience to an intimate encounter with a few of Aotearoa New Zealand's special native creatures.

This show will be held in the Visitor Centre Foyer and is suitable for all ages; normal admission to the sanctuary applies. Overflow parking is available on Birdwood Street.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
String Bean Puppets: The Penguin and the Sea Monster, The school holidays are here, so bring your tamariki along to the sanctuary for a puppet show performance! Wonder and fun couples with important messages about the world around us in stories by String Bean Puppets.

The Penguin and the Sea Monster is a starry eyed stale about a little blue penguin who seeks help from the night sky when his friend his captured by a sea monster.

This show will be held in the Visitor Centre foyer, general admission fees to the sanctuary apply.

Overflow parking is available at Birdwood carpark during the busy school holiday period.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Take A Kid Tramping - Maketawa Hut Overnight, Family tramping.
Take a Kid Tramping Trip for our kids with extra stamina and ability to carry an overnight pack, this one has a lot of climbing. We will head up the translator track from North Egmont, turn off and follow the ridge down to the hut. The next day we will return via the Makatawa track down through the bush and across a few streams.
All participants must be equipped for tramping in alpine conditions. Overnight tramping equipment required.
Children must be accompanied by a parent or caregiver approved by their guardian.
Shared transport costs apply, unless own transport is provided.
$10 per adult passenger, kids or own car free + hut fee.
Hut Tickets or annual pass required.
If interested, please register by Thursday 11 September:
Jo-anne Mowat | takt@nptc.org.nz
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Take your child flyfishing, Take your child trout fishing
Where: Capital Trout Centre, Landfill Road, Owhiro Bay, Wellington.
When: Sunday 28th September 2025 between 9am and 3.30pm.
Who: A fishing experience for children aged 2 to 11 years. All gear and instruction provided, just turn up with your free Capital Trout Centre licence/registration.
*Get your child's free licence and registration form in advance from 16 September from either Hunting & Fishing, 8 Te Puni St Petone or Capital Fishing 49 Ghuznee St Wellington.*
The Capital Trout Centre is operated by volunteers from the Wellington Flyfishers Club and is funded by your donations.
Your generous donation is appreciated thanks.

description:
Tamariki Time: Rākau and Ngahere, Bring your little ones along for a free, interactive drop-in session designed especially for tamariki aged 5 and under.
This month, we’re exploring the world of rākau (trees). Together you’ll discover the shapes and textures of rau (leaves) from different trees, then use crayon rubbings to create a beautiful collection your tamariki can take home
We'll also be celebrating the new Te Papa Press book, Rākau: The Ancient Forests of Aotearoa.
Entry to Te Papa is free for all New Zealanders and people living in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Don’t miss out on our other whānau-friendly events! Stay in the loop at tepapa.nz/newsletter
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Tamariki Time: Toi Art, A free interactive drop-in session for tamariki aged 5 and under. This month, explore the new exhibitions in Toi Art
As hōtoke (winter) draws to a close, we will be exploring the new Te Whare Tapere, or house of entertainment, in the art studio in Toi Art.
Follow prompts to find seasonal stories in our exhibitions and make shadow plays using puppets.

Entry to Te Papa is free for all New Zealanders and people living in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Don’t miss out on our other whānau-friendly events! Stay in the loop at tepapa.nz/newsletter

description:
Toi Māori ki te ao atua with Raukawa Kiri, Manu Wairere is a school holiday programme at the Māoriland Hub in Ōtaki, designed to ignite the creative potential of tamariki and rangatahi Māori aged 5–18.

As part of this programme, local artist Raukawa Kiri will lead a 2-day arts workshop exploring the world of atua through Toi Māori. Participants will create artworks inspired by whakapapa, mana motuhake, and Te Ao Māori perspectives.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Try Something New - Build, Paint, Play - School Holidays, School Holidays are a great if you have always wanted to get into the Warhammer hobby or if you are you looking to Try something new & want help with your next activity on your Warhammer journey.
It's also great if you want to improve your hobby skills.
Below you will find a few of the many Free hobby lessons we run at Warhammer Wellington
Introductory demonstrations: pick between a free introductory Stormcast or Space Marine model and then you can learn to build, paint and play a game with it.
Warhammer Build, Paint, Play Workshops are between 15min - 45mins
Learn to Build:
Learn how to build your miniatures & build your first model or a Free Miniature of the Month.
Learn to Paint:
Learn how to use Base, Shade, Layers, Contrast & Technical paints.
Learn to Play:
Learn more about the rules of your favorite game or try out a
new game.
All great ways to do the next step in your hobby journey while also getting your Battle Honours activities stamped off so remember to bring your activity book with you when you visit!
New to the Warhammer hobby & want to discover more about collecting, building, painting, playing Warhammer?
Drop in and have a chat with us about grabbing a Free Battle Honours booklet.
No need to book, just drop in or give us a call 04 471 098 to find out more
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Upper Hutt Mall Holiday Programme, Upper Hutt Mall Holiday Programme
❄️ Winter Holiday Fun ❄️ Join us for a week of sparkling smiles, magical moments, and creative fun—perfect for kids and families!

🧤 Monday: Winter Wonderland Craft Workshop 11am – 1pm Get crafty with glitter, snowflakes, and frosty creations to kick off the week.

👑 Tuesday: Ice Princess Meet & Greet + Giant Bubble Show 11am – 12pm: Meet the Ice Princess 12pm – 1pm: Watch the sky fill with shimmering bubbles in our giant bubble show!

🎨 Wednesday: Winter Face Painting 11am – 1pm Transform into a snow queen, frosty fox, or icy explorer with magical face art.

🌊 Thursday: Moana Meet & Greet + Giant Bubble Show 11am – 12pm: Say hi to Moana and snap a photo 12pm – 1pm: Bubbles galore in another dazzling show!

🎈 Friday: Balloon Twisting Fun 11am – 1pm Watch balloon magic unfold—animals, swords, flowers, and more!
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: StoryWalk®, Turn reading into an adventure with your tamariki at this special StoryWalk® in Carrington Park, Carterton. A StoryWalk® transforms a children’s book into an outdoor journey—pages are displayed on stands along the path, and children can walk, run, hop, skip, jump, or be wheeled to each one as you read together. The StoryWalk® Wairarapa project was instigated by and is managed by Wairarapa Library Service.

Guiding this experience is local Speech Language Therapist Polly Newton, who will share simple, practical tips to help strengthen children’s speech, language, and literacy skills through the way you read with them.

The StoryWalk® is located on a flat, sealed path around the park, making it ideal for prams, wheelchairs, and scooters. Meet by the playground and enjoy a relaxed, family-friendly activity designed for children and their caregivers.

This event is part of the Wairarapa Walking Festival and is proudly supported by REAP Wairarapa, Chatterbox Wairarapa, and Speech Teacher. The StoryWalk® Project was created by Anne Ferguson in collaboration with the Kellogg-Hubbard Library, Montpelier, Vermont, and is a registered service mark owned by the Kellogg-Hubbard Library.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Weber Bros 'The Circus', Join us for an unforgettable experience at ’The Circus’, where excitement and wonder come alive under the grand big top! Prepare to be amazed by exhilarating performers showcasing death-defying acts that will leave you on the edge of your seat.

From the heart-pounding thrills of the Globe of Death to the jaw-dropping spectacle of the human cannon, each act promises a breathtaking display of skill and bravery. Marvel at our dazzling aerialists as they soar through the air, and don’t miss the delightful slapstick comedy that adds a lighthearted touch to this extraordinary show and so much more.

This 2-hour family-friendly event features international artists whose captivating performances will charm audiences of all ages. Bring your family and friends for a night filled with laughter, gasps of astonishment, and memories to cherish forever.

Experience the magic of the circus like never before.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Wellington SETPEMBER/OCTOBER School Holiday Camps, The September/October School Holiday camps line up is out and live to book! 1, 2 and 3 day school holiday programmes are open to book for the shredder in your family. From ages 7-17 - there is something for everyone over the two weeks.

2 and 3 day day Know your Local camps based at Makara Peak, Polhill and Mt Victoria
2 day Van Camps (SOLD OUT)
2 day Speed Flow and Style camp for 13-17's
Jump online and get your young persons holidays sorted! Guaranteed a fun time! 1:8 instructor ratio, super fun and talented instructors, and a amazing environment to grow and connect.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Whānau Day!, Whānau Day!
Kick off the school holidays with a bang!
Join us for a fun-filled family day inspired by our exhibition Me: Artists Paint Themselves.

Get creative with hands-on activities like collage, painting, and drawing as we explore poses, emotions, and colour. You’ll get to make your own unique artwork to take home!

And don’t miss the FREE face painting (10am-12pm) – what or who could you become!?

Access information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku (toilet) at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. You can find more accessibility information here. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Whānau Day: Kua hoki mai te koekoeā – The koekoeā has returned, Whānau Day: Kua hoki mai te koekoeā – The koekoeā has returned
Ka ako mō te Kōanga mā ngā mahi utukore pai mō te whānau, arā, ngā awheawhe me ngā whakaari.

Learn about kōanga with free family-friendly activities, workshops, and performances.


Kua hoki mai te koekoeā! The koekoeā has returned!


Join us for a day of free activities for tamariki, celebrating the return of kōanga. Watch kapa haka performances, make your own crafts, get your face painted and learn about the manu and plants that signal spring has arrived.

A full schedule, including information for Deaf whānau, to be released soon.


✨ Bookable NZSL session, 10.30am–11.30am

A free, bookable session for Deaf tamariki and their whānau led by a Deaf facilitator, with NZSL Interpreters. 18 places available.

More information will be shared soon. To book your places, please email


Kua hoki mai te koekoeā refers to the koekoeā, or the long-tailed cuckoo returning being a sign that spring is coming, as it is a migratory manu.


🎟️ Entry to Te Papa is free for all New Zealanders and people living in Aotearoa New Zealand.

📅 Don’t miss out on our other events! Stay in the loop at tepapa.nz/newsletter
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Whānau Sculpture with Clay - Creative Arts Holiday Programme, Children and their caregivers are invited to learn how to sculpt with clay!

Each term, Christine brings a different project for the class to work on and in this workshop you will be creating dinosaurs!

Our popular whānau workshops are designed to allow tamariki and their caregivers to work on their own projects side-by-side and learn basic hand-building techniques from experienced ceramicist Christine Winbush.

The pieces will be fired once, (bisqued) and can be decorated with paint at home.

Recommended age for children are 6 and up. The booking is for one child and one adult and an additional child can be added for only $29.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, animation and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Wilton Playcentre Open Week, Nau mau, haere mai! Come along on session and meet the crew. Each day for Open Week we run a different theme. You are welcome to come for each day, or just pick one. The theme of Playcentre Open Week this year is “Whānau tupu ngātahi – families growing together.”
We ask that you please bring a change of clothes, and a nut-free snack for your tamariki. Come along for as much or as little as you can. We are all parents so we know what it is like to work around sleep schedules and cajoling little ones to get out of the house. Come have a cup of tea and relax knowing your child is playing safely and having fun.
Monday - Hand prints (TBC)
Tuesday - Animal day! note no actual animals involved. Play themed around animals
Wednesday - Pāua playgroup for 2's and under will be cacao husk play
Thursday and Friday will make a decision on the week about the weather. One of the days will be Sandpit and the other day will be
obstacle course. We will update you via this page
Monday 9.00am - 12.15pm
Tuesday 9.00am - 12.45pm
Wednesday (younger tamariki) 9.00am - 12.15pm
Thursday 9.00am - 12.45pm
Friday 9.00am - 12.45pm

description:
Young Artist's After School Art Classes, Every Monday afternoon Rowena will drive this fun and vibrant after-school art programme for 6-11 year olds. Young artists will explore different mediums, experiment and learn whilst having fun producing wonderful pieces of art.

Our classes aim to build self-confidence, develop skills in creative thinking, experimentation, spontaneity and help students find their own creative voice. In this class, students will work on a variety of different creative projects that could include but are not limited to printmaking, drawing, fabric and paper arts and mixed media.

All materials provided.

Eight week course: Mondays, 9 Feb - 30 March, 3:30-5pm

Class is suitable for ages 6 upwards.

description:
Youth Dance Term Four, Looking for a fun, creative, and confidence-boosting activity for your young person? Our six-week Youth Dance program is designed for young people aged 7–16 (flexible) to learn, play, and grow through the art of movement.
Over the term, dancers will:
Build foundations in contemporary dance
Develop body awareness and coordination
Engage in social, team-building games and improvisation
Explore creativity with props and playful movement tasks
We celebrate individuality — each student is encouraged to move in their own way, discover new skills, and enjoy the magic of expressing themselves through dance. Whether a beginner or experienced, every dancer is welcome!
Term dates:
Saturdays 10.00 to 11.00am
8th November to 13th December(6 Sessions)
Cost: $55 term, $10 Casual.
For more information or to book:
Email: sumara@widance.nz
Phone: 021 050 1565
Who are we?
WIDance is one of Wellington's leading dance providers for disabled and non-disabled, striving to provide equal opportunities for all to dance. Established in 2010, we run open classes, workshops, and performance events throughout the Wellington region.
Our mission is to provide equal opportunities for diverse communities to experience dance, advocating for access and empowerment.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Āhuru Mōwai Trust High Sensory Session, Āhuru Mōwai Trust High Sensory Sessions are held weekly at Chipmunks Playland Tawa.
Session Details:
When: Thursdays (Yes, even in the school holidays!)
Time: 5:30pm-8:00pm
Cost: $10 per family (immediate, not extended)
Who: children/young adults with special needs and their parents, guardians, family members, carers, siblings.
On Thursday's we also host Music Therapy Taster Sessions with our friends from the Little Musical Caravan. There is an additional activity fee of $5 per child to participate in that activity and a booking is required, If you are interested in these sessions register your interest directly with LMC via https://www.littlemusicalcaravan.co.nz/contact/
If you are looking to have a birthday celebration at one of these sessions please txt Paul on 0272787087, or message us in advance. We would also encourage you to make use of a party room to host additional guests (an extra charge would apply to guests)
Come along in any dynamic that suits the family, to these relaxed and open sessions for families and kids living with special needs of all kinds.
Although we cannot cater to everyone's needs, we will do our best to support families to overcome obstacles to attend the sensory sessions.
Please speak with trustees regarding concerns.
(I.D or needs verification may be required at Trustee discretion).
Disclaimer: WE WILL GENTLY AND KINDLY TURN AWAY ANYONE WE FEEL SHOULD NOT BE THERE, AND WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO DO SO.
label: Kids & Parents

description:
Āhuru Mōwai Trust Low Sensory Session, Āhuru Mōwai Trust Low Sensory Sessions are held weekly at Chipmunks Playland Tawa.
Session Details:
When: Tuesdays (Yes, even in the school holidays!)
Time: 5:30-8:00pm
Cost: $10 per family (immediate, not extended)
Who: children/young adults with special needs and their parents, guardians, family members, carers, siblings.
On Tuesday's we also host a Brick Therapy session with Dan from Brick Engaged and there is an additional activity fee of $5 per child to participate in that activity.
If you are looking to have a birthday celebration at one of these sessions please txt Paul on 0272787087, or message us in advance. We would also encourage you to make use of a party room to host additional guests (an extra charge would apply to guests)
Come along in any dynamic that suits the family, to these relaxed and open sessions for families and kids living with special needs of all kinds.
Although we cannot cater to everyone's needs, we will do our best to support families to overcome obstacles to attend the sensory sessions.
Please speak with trustees regarding concerns.
(I.D or needs verification may be required at Trustee discretion).
Disclaimer: WE WILL GENTLY AND KINDLY TURN AWAY ANYONE WE FEEL SHOULD NOT BE THERE, AND WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO DO SO.

description:
2025 Open Day and Plant Sale, Our annual open day with entry by donation and fundraising plant sale is always a popular event!
The house will be open 10am-4pm with entry by donation, including our current exhibition '75 Tinakori Road: 'This marvel had come to the lane".
From 10am plants from our garden raised by our wonderful volunteers will be sold as a fundraiser for Katherine Mansfield House & Garden. Plants priced from $5. Cash and card accepted, you may like to bring a box or bag to carry your plants home in.
At 11am Gabor Toth, local and New Zealand history specialist at Wellington City Libraries, will give a talk about Thorndon during the years Katherine Mansfield and her family lived on Tinakori Road.
Throughout the day you'll be able to see members of Wellington Urban Sketchers creating new works.
At 2pm the Wellington Embroiderers' Guild will host our monthly Stitching Circle, feel free to bring along your WIP (work in progress) and join in!

description:
A Marvellous Miramar Christmas: 29 November (3 sessions), We've designed a Christmas experience for the whole family!
Come along and get into the Christmas spirit by joining in a marvellous Miramar Christmas extravaganza! As a family, come along and enter our amazing, indoor, interactive Christmas festival!
Enjoy hands-on crafts and activities together, get into some fun games at your own pace, listen and singalong to live music, let the younger tamariki have their space in a free-play area, tuck into our delish loaded free hot chocolates and cookie bar, get your annual whanau photo in our dress up photobooth, hear Christmas stories, take time to remember someone special at the remembrance tree... and many more merry and marvellous festivities!
Timing note: This year's Christmas event is a 'go-at-your-own-pace' session and you are welcome to leave when needed. Sessions/festival conclude 90mins after the start time.
Market note: While this event is designed to feel like a Christmas market/fair or festival - all experiences and crafts while in your session have no additional cost/are included. The only fee is the initial ticket fee.

TICKET DETAILS:
A Marvellous Miramar Christmas is all about getting into the Christmas spirit - our hope is that we can support families in the Miramar community through this event!
Tickets are $3 per child or adult / $13 for a group of 5.
Please note: if you require more than 5 tickets, please add any additional individual or group tickets to make up your group total.
All proceeds from this event will go towards providing Christmas gifts and support for families in the Miramar community. Thank you for your support!
Simply book tickets for your prefered session using this website! Please reserve tickets for any adults AND kids attending.


SESSION TIMES:
There are three A Marvellous Miramar Christmas sessions over the weekend. Each session is up to 90mins.
Saturday 29 November: 9.30 - 11am
Saturday 29 November: 11am - 12.30pm
Saturday 29 November: 1.30pm - 3pm
Please note: All children under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult.

RESERVE YOUR TICKETS ONLINE TODAY!
 Any queries, contact us on Facebook or email miramar.corps@salvationarmy.org.nz or call 04 388 8284

description:
Adopt a plant: Begonia House fundraiser, Support the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden and grab yourself a bargain. We’ve kept the plants we need for propagation, but we have many healthy plants left over that we can’t fit into our nursery. That’s where you come in – take home one of our plants and help the Friends fundraise to go beyond the basics with amazing new features like exterior landscaping and internal fixtures for the renewed Begonia House.

These plants are from the display end and thrive in indoor conditions (they are coming from a glasshouse after all). They should do just fine in your house. Have too many house plants? Wrong. You can definitely fit just one more. It’s for charity after all.

We’ll have some available for loose change and others for a minimum donation that won’t break the bank. Payment by cash or bank transfer only (no EFTPOS). All proceeds go to the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden to put towards the Begonia House enhancements https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/the-begonia-house-the-buildings-and-beyond

Get prepped:
- Share the love! 5 plants max per person.
- Plants come as they are – we practice integrated pest management but you may need to give them a quarantine before joining your other plant pals at home.
- Swap your pot – there will be a station where you’ll swap your plant to a different pot. We need all our A+ pots for our future plants. We’ll be around to help.
- BYOB – bring your own bag or box for transporting your new friend home.
- Early bird gets the plant – no holds.

We’ll post an update in our Wellington Gardens Facebook event page a few days out of what plants will be for sale. Make sure you RSVP to get notified.

A piece of Begonia House is awaiting your adoption; We’ll see you there!
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Age on the Go 2025, Age on the Go 2025
Organised by Horowhenua District Council, the 2025 Age on the Go Expo is the largest event of its kind in the region, featuring dozens of stalls offering information and education for the hundreds of visitors who attend.

Held as part of the Horowhenua Age Friendly Communities Strategy, the expo supports our vision that older people in Horowhenua are empowered to make choices that enable them to live well and age well. The event promotes positive ageing by showcasing activities and services that support good health, connection and wellbeing for older residents.

The expo will take place at the Horowhenua Events Centre, 33 Victoria Street, Levin, from 10am to 2pm.

Enjoy activities like:

description:
Artisan Craft Market, The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Come support local at our monthly market in Wellington City on the Waterfront at Wharewaka O Poneke venue.

description:
Blenheim Gypsy Fair, Blenheim Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

description:
Bogan Day Out 2026, Bogan Day Out 2026
🚨GET READY FOR THE BIGGEST, BADDEST, BOGAN DAY OF YOUR LIFE!

BOGAN DAY OUT is back for 2026! You are in for the most epic day of the year right here at Brewtown, Upper Hutt – official home of the Bogan!

For just 35 bucks – Get ready for a wild ride with BBQ, Trucks, Chilli Eating, Live Music and all the bogan fun you can handle. Whether you’re an all-out Bogan or just Bogan-curious, if you’re into loud music, drag races, or just living your best life in a flannel shirt, we’ve got it all. Grab your mates, crack a cold one, and come ready for a day full of mayhem, laughs, and top-notch bogan antics!

My Big Bad Bogan Wedding!
This Bogan Day Out at Brewtown, were doing what no sane wedding planner would ever suggest- Brewtown is officially on the hunt for a never been married, 100% authentic bogan couple to tie the knot live at Bogan Day Out in front of other full-blown bogans. Imagine that – thousands of uninvited Bogans at your ceremony watching you bogans marry and cheering you on! This is iconic Upper Hutt.

🍖Our annual Brewtown BBQ comp is back and bigger than ever.
With NZ’s BEST BBQ teams throwin’ down the meatiest, smokiest cook-off you’ve ever seen! Prepare for a sizzling showdown of mouthwatering grills, smoky flavours, and next-level BBQ skills.

🎤Enjoy a full-throttle day of live music on the main stage.
The absolute BEST tribute acts in NZ will be bringing the heat all day long!

LINEUP COMING SOON!

🌶️Think you can handle the heat?
Step up to the Fire Dragon Chillie’s NZ Chilli Eating Champs and put your tastebuds to the ultimate test! This is no ordinary spice challenge—only the brave survive! Grab your guts, gear up for fiery fury, and see if you’ve got what it takes to be crowned the chilli champion!

Limited spaces! Reserve your spot when you purchase your ticket.

Still want more? We got you…
🥩Get ready to master the art of BBQ at the Black Dog BBQ Demo Stage! Learn tips, tricks, and secret techniques from the best pitmasters in NZ, and take your grilling game to the next level. Whether you’re a seasoned pro or just starting out, this is your chance to cook like a legend!

🚛Rev your engines and check out the big rigs at the Truck Displays! Get up close to some of the most massive and impressive trucks on the road, with epic custom builds and roaring engines that’ll leave you in awe. It’s a must-see for truck lovers and gearheads alike!

👚Hit up the market for all your BBQ, spicy food, and bogan essentials! From sizzling spicy sauces and mouthwatering meats to rad gear and bogan merch, you’ll find everything you need to take your BBQ game and bogan style to the next level. Don’t miss out on the best deals and wildest finds!

👑Reckon your Bogan style beats all others? Strut your stuff and be declared the Best Dressed Bogan or Maddest Mullet and win cool sh*t.

🍔Craving some epic eats? Our food trucks have got you covered, with mouthwatering BBQ delights for the true meat lovers and fiery, spice-loaded dishes for the brave! Whether you’re all about smoky, slow-cooked meats, chasing the burn with hot and spicy flavours, or something on the milder side there’s something to satisfy every craving. Come hungry and get ready for a flavour explosion!

🍻Feeling thirsty? A Brewtown event wouldn’t be complete without the Brewtown Bar pumping out the best beers and spirits brewed right here on site, as well as a load of Bogan Specials just for this event and the return of the popular Lion brown Bar!

You don’t wanna miss this – it’s the ultimate day out for all you legends!🤘

All ages event
Pass-outs permitted until 6pm
Last entry is at 6pm
Cashless event for bar and food. Some market vendors may accept cash.

🎃 Ministry of Mischief presents - CBD Halloween Event 2025 🎃
📍 Blenheim CBD
📅 Saturday, 1st November 2025
⏰ 10:00 AM – 3:00 PM

👻 What’s happening?
Join us for a spooktacular day in the CBD! We’re bringing families, businesses, and the community together for a fun Halloween celebration.

✨ Event highlights:

Family Trick-or-Treating (10 AM – 3 PM)

▪️ Visit participating CBD shops displaying the official Halloween poster.
▪️ Around 40–60 shops expected to take part, each with individually wrapped candy and maybe even a riddle or activity!

Music & Entertainment 🎶

Marlborough Artisan Craft Market 🛍️

Charity Support ❤️

Bring your family, invite your friends, and let’s make this Halloween a day to remember in the heart of Blenheim!

description:

🌟 YOUR NEW FAVOURITE COMMUNITY MARKET IS HERE!

Get ready, Wellington — the Kelvin Grove Pop-Up Market is bringing energy, colour, creativity, and community spirit all into one incredible day!

This is more than just a market…

👉 And best of all — it’s completely FREE to enter!

Whether you’re keen to nab a bargain, tick off some Secret Santa shopping, support local neighbours and creators, or just enjoy a fun day out — this market has something for absolutely everyone.

County Lane Fair 2025, Join Us for Our Annual Fundraising Fair!

Come along to Brewtown and enjoy a festive day of Christmas shopping – all undercover! The County Lane Fair is back, bringing together a wonderful mix of local artists, crafters, and artisan makers, along with delicious food trucks to keep you fuelled while you browse.

This year, we’re proud to support two amazing causes:

Upper Hutt Autism Group
Wellington Hospital Foundation – Mental Health and Wellbeing

100% of profits will go directly to these charities, thanks to the efforts of the Silverstream Lions Club.

Over $5000 worth of raffle prizes
Free entry – a gold coin donation is appreciated

Heaps of parking available

Come shop, eat, and support your community – all in one festive day out!

description:
Creepy Cute Market, The Creepy Cute Market Returns to Wellington!
Get ready, Wellington — the Creepy Cute Market is coming back to town!
When: Saturday, 30 August 2025, 9:30am – 2:30pm
Where: Thistle Hall, Upper Cuba Street, Wellington
Indulge your love for the weird, whimsical, and wonderfully wicked at a market where spooky meets sweet. After a hauntingly successful run last time, we're thrilled to return with even more delightfully dark treasures for all you macabre-loving misfits.
Expect:
Spine-tingling art & prints
Spooktacular fashion & accessories
Morbidly cute homewares
Handcrafted oddities by local makers
And everything your gothic heart desires
Whether you're a long time lover of the bizarre or just creepily curious, this market is for you. Meet fellow oddity enthusiasts, shop from passionate creators, and embrace your spooky side in the heart of Wellington.
Free entry | All ages welcome | Costumes encouraged!
Don’t miss the return of the Creepy Cute Market — it's going to be wicked fun.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Cuba Street Summer Series Christmas Market, Cuba Street Summer Series is back with a series of free, open-street activations designed to celebrate community, creativity, and the unique vibrancy of Cuba Street!

Come to the first event on Saturday 29 November, 10am-5pm, on Cuba Street between Ghuznee and Vivian Streets.

You'll see live street performances, arts and crafts market at Swan Lane carpark, face painting, and new outdoor dining in the middle of Cuba Street.
For Christmas music and performances, pop along to Council's Christmas in the Quarters, running alongside our summer series, 11am-5pm in Glover Park on the same day.

Free bike parking and valet for those choosing to come by bike and prizes for active travel and PickPath users.

Support Local, Win Local.

You’ll also have the chance to meet Cyrus, the creative mind behind Dahl Designs, hear their story, and see the passion and skill that goes into every piece.

description:
Doughnuts & Katsu Chicken @ The Churton Park Craft Market, This is a great day out with heaps of things going on at the craft market, a festive cheer, and lots of fun and laughter.
We haven't run a stall in well over a year, with this being our first.
On the day, we'll have sourdough doughnuts and Katsu chicken available. Eftpos is always at our sales.
If you'd like to pre-order, go to our website, order, and then pick up on the day.
We also make mini-celebratory doughnuts, which are 70% the size of our originals, in a boxed selection of all six flavours.
All products can be pre-ordered and picked up on Saturday through our website, or purchased on the day.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/weekly-menu/
Eftpos and Paywave are always available.
Our regular doughnuts cost $6 each or $22 for a box of 4 doughnuts.
We also offer catering at Family Kitchen with Mark, so if you have a function or need for in-house dining, check out all our packages on our website.
Order our doughnuts from Monday to Saturday. Message Mark the day before (by 8 pm) and arrange pick up from 06:30.
All our doughnuts contain a lively sourdough & biga starter, for a fuller flavour profile and a springy texture.
Have you tried our sourdough doughnuts yet?
Our doughnuts can be pre-ordered and picked up on the day to avoid disappointment (should we run out).
With a new flavour every two weeks, we've created over 200 combinations since we started selling three years ago.
Support has been phenomenal, and we thank everyone so very much indeed for the weekly sales.
Our doughnuts do contain gluten and dairy. Due to production separation when producing dietary doughnuts, we've decided as a company that we won't make any of our doughnuts gluten-free or dairy-free for the time being.
We cater to all special dietary requirements with options available on all of our catering packages.

description:
EHS Twilight Xmas Gala, The Eastern Hutt School Twilight Gala is held every 3 years to raise money for the school and celebrate our vibrant school and local community.
In 2025 we are excited to bring you our biggest and best gala yet!

What to look forward to:
> Fun activities for all ages: Giant inflatables, ride-on cars, nerf wars and more.
> Delicious Food: A variety of food trucks and refreshments.
> Live Entertainment: captivating performances from our own students and local community groups.
> Raffles and Auctions: Win exciting prizes.
> All the stalls: Adopt a soft toy, grab a mystery bottle, don a lolly necklace and explore the carnival stalls.
> Xmas Market: A selection of external vendors to browse while the children are entertained.
> Santa's Grotto: Meet Santa and tell him what you want for xmas.

Emergency Services Expo, Emergency Services Expo
Join us for an action-packed day celebrating the incredible work of our emergency services!
This free, family-friendly event will include:
🚒Emergency vehicle and equipment tours
👩‍🚒 Meet-and-greet with our crews
🎨 Fun activities
🍔 Food trucks & refreshments

Whether you're curious about what goes on behind the sirens or looking for a fun day out, the expo has something for everyone!

✅ Free entry

Mark your calendars, bring the whole family, and come show your support for the amazing people who keep our communities safe. ❤️

description:
Erskine Chapel Market & Open Day, Erskine Chapel Market & Open Day
✨ Erskine Chapel Open Day & Craft Market ✨
📅 Sunday, 2 November 2025 | 10:00am – 3:00pm
📍 Erskine Chapel, 31 Avon Street, Island Bay, Wellington

Nestled high on the hillside in Island Bay, Erskine Chapel is a breathtaking and iconic landmark, with sweeping views across the hills and ocean, and a gothic charm that has captured hearts for generations.

Now in its third year, this much loved annual event returns as part of Heritage Month, celebrating the beauty, history, and cultural significance of one of Wellington’s most treasured buildings.

Foxtail Events and The Wellington Company are once again partnering to open the chapel’s doors for the community, inviting everyone to experience this remarkable space brought back to life.

Join us for a special Community Open Day and Craft Market, where you can:

* Explore a curated market of local artisans and makers
* Discover the chapel’s rich history and stunning architecture
* Enjoy live music, freshly brewed coffee, and delicious baked goods

Whether you're drawn by the history, the creativity, or the peaceful atmosphere, this is a day to celebrate local talent and honour the legacy of a true Wellington landmark.

🗓️ Mark your calendar and don’t miss this enchanting day at Erskine Chapel. A place of stories, memories, and timeless beauty, reawakened for a new generation to enjoy.

description:
Fabric-a-brac 2025, Fabric-a-brac returns to Wellington for our second event in 2025!

The first Fabric-a-brac was held in Wellington 15 years ago - we're sew excited to still be here, bring the sewing community together and raising money for Mary Potter Hospice.
Fabric-a-brac is a fun fabric and sewing supplies market where you can shop for vintage and modern sewing and upholstery fabric, patterns, haberdashery and more. It brings the sewing community together to share stashes, stories and delight in our mutual love of textiles.
Fabric-a-brac is volunteer-run, and is a fundraiser for hospice - in Wellington this is Mary Potter Hospice. All profits from this event are donated to their work. We've raised $80,000 since our first event in 2009.
Selling fabric
If you have a stash you'd like to sell, you can come and take a stall. You pay a stallholder fee (which goes to Hospice) but anything you make on the day is yours to keep. Stalls are allocated via a ballot, which will take place closer to the time. Go to our website to find the form. Closes mid August.

If you have fabric, haberdashery or patterns you'd like to move on, but don't want to have a table, you can donate items. This will all go onto the hospice table on the day, and all profits will go to their wonderful work.
Fabric donation points
- Made Marion
- Mary Potter Hospice - you can take donations to the Mary Potter Hospice in Mein St, Newtown

Pop-up cafe
The fabulous cafe is back with all of its gorgeous volunteers and fab food. There will be tea, coffee and sweet treats for sale, so you can sit down and chat over your new projects and fabric purchases. All proceeds from the cafe also go to Hospice.
Buying fabric
Bring cash - most stallholders and the cafe will be selling by cash only.
We look forward to seeing our fabulous fabric and sewing community soon!
*Saturday September 20 2025
*St Anne's Parish Hall, Emmett Street, Newtown, Wellington
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Fashion Designer Pranay Baidya – North Island Pop-Up Tour, We’re so excited to be hosting designer Pranay Baidya at Sable on Monday 8th September, and we would love for you to join us.
This is your chance to see and try on some of the most exquisite dresses, crafted with Pranay’s signature blend of tradition and contemporary style.
Aurea and I will be there, and Sarah Meikle from All India Permit Tours, together with Pranay himself, to personally welcome you to this exclusive showcase of handcrafted fashion.
Pop down from 2pm - 6pm.
We can’t wait to share this special afternoon with you.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Featherston Christmas Parade 2025, Get ready for a festive celebration in the heart of Featherston!

Decorate your ride-on mower or tractor, gather your friends, dress up in your best holiday style, and join the fun as the parade brings cheer to Featherston’s main street (SH2/Fitzherbert Street). The procession sets off from the corner of Revan and Wakefield Streets, travelling north along SH2 and finishing at Clifford Square.

Everyone is welcome — whether you’re marching, riding, or simply soaking up the atmosphere. Participation is FREE, so bring your creativity and festive spirit!

After the parade, make a day of it. Stay for lunch at one of Featherston’s cosy cafés, bakeries, or eateries, or turn it into a weekend getaway exploring South Wairarapa’s boutique shops, vineyards, coastal scenery, and country walks.

Not dressing up? That’s fine too — come along as a spectator, line the main street, and cheer on the parade participants as Featherston comes alive with Christmas joy complete with Santa in his sleigh.

Participants need to register here: https://form.jotform.com/252601211051841
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Foxton Christmas Fair, Foxton Christmas Fair
🎄 Get Ready for a Foxy Christmas Market in Foxton! 🎄

The holiday season is here, and Foxtail Events is bringing the festive cheer to Foxton with a fabulous Foxy Market! 🎅✨

Join us for a fun-filled day with something for everyone:

🍴 Food Trucks – delicious bites to satisfy all tastes
☕ Coffee Carts – warm up with your favourite brew
🎨 Art & Craft Stalls – find unique, handmade gifts
🧸 Kids Play Zone & Games – fun for the little ones
🦙 Petting Zoo – meet some furry friends
🎤 Open Mic Stage & Live Music – enjoy local tunes
🎅 Santa Claus – get a photo with the big guy
🎨 Face Painting – let your creativity shine
🎄 Wishing Star Christmas Tree – make a wish for the season
🚗 Classic Cars – a beautiful display for car enthusiasts

And so much more! ✨

It’s the second year of this magical event, and we can’t wait to celebrate with you all again. Local artisans and craftsmen will showcase their handmade treasures, from stunning ornaments, jewellery, and candles to unique home décor and scrumptious holiday treats.

With the aroma of fresh coffee, tasty food, and the sounds of joyful chatter filling the air, the market will be transformed into a festive wonderland. It’s the perfect place to find that special gift and embrace the community spirit of the season.

Come join us and experience the magic of Christmas in Foxton! 🎁

Enjoy a family-friendly evening of sunset wines, artisanal vendors, and music on the lawn, doggos welcome

We'll be serving up delicious food from Eclipse alongside sweet treats and snack plates from our vendors.

Our first night market is held on Friday 9 January from 4–8pm

Our full vendor lineup is coming soon — so tune in to our socials for more information!

description:
German Fair, Join us for fun and surprises at the German Culture Club's annual German Fair, 1st of November from 11am - 2pm.

Spoil your taste buds with German baking, sausages, Brezeln and other goodies.

Hunt for amazing bargains at our second-hand sale of German children's toys, clothes, books and more!

Meet the Märklin Model Railway Club and check out the smallest model train set in New Zealand, a replica of Munich Airport :)

Wear your Dirndl and Lederhosen if you dare!

More infos / stallholder contact: gcc.wellington@gmail.com

Entry: Koha / Gold coin at the door

Please note: All 2nd-hand-stalls are cash only

All proceeds go to the German Culture Club Wellington.

Find out more about the German Culture Club here:

www.gcc.co.nz

description:
Go Green Expo 2025, It’s New Zealand’s largest green living show. Go Green Expo is your one-stop shop for everything you need to live a sustainable life. The TSB Arena will be transformed into a showcase for all things environmentally friendly. Among the many booths and displays, you’ll find eco home/building solutions, advisory services, supplements, and organic products. Alternatives for health and wellness, beauty and personal care, and food and beverages are also featured. 
There are many more categories represented and plenty of knowledgeable people on hand to guide you on living a green life. Tickets are free if you book online.

description:
Greytown Country Market - 15 March 2026, Greytown Country Market - 15 March 2026
🌿 Greytown Country Market 🌿

Join us for a vibrant monthly market celebrating the diversity and creativity of Wairarapa and Wellington.

The Greytown Country Market is more than just shopping—it’s a place to meet friends, relax with family, and enjoy fine food in a welcoming community setting.

🛍️ Discover & Explore
Beautiful homewares, vintage finds, unique crafts, and fabulous treasures waiting to be uncovered.

🍎 Taste & Take Home
Local products including food stalls, home-made muesli, chutneys & pickles.

Plants, seedlings, sculpture, and garden pots to inspire your outdoor spaces.

Greytown Sidewalk Sale, The Annual Sidewalk Sale is back!

The annual Greytown Sidewalk Sale returns on Saturday 17 January, where Greytown’s boutiques put tables and racks outside their stores, with incredible finds and great bargains.

It’s the joy of the find, fuelled by great coffee and delicious local food, chatting with friendly owner-run businesses and discovering pieces you didn’t know you needed until you saw them.

Stroll the charming streets of Greytown, coffee in hand, a bit of cash and a tote bag at the ready and shop at your leisure with plenty of free, close parking.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Houghton Valley School Fair, Join us for our famous little school fair on Wellington's wild South Coast!

It's a fabulous day out for the whole family. We have something for everyone: bouncy castle, cute bunnies and lambs, candyfloss, pre-loved clothes, toys, book stall, raffles and silent auction, plants and exquisite handmade crafts. Enjoy an exciting array of games, activities, facepainting and live music for all.

For the foodies we have the family favourite sausage sizzle, legendary spit roast, and famous HVS Burger cart, plus Hangi! There’s fresh coffee to keep you caffeinated, and our wonderful ‘tea room’ for more relaxed refreshments.

It's all happening in our stunning school grounds with natural bush and birdsong on one side and the sparkling sea on the other.

This is a Zero Waste event, so please support us by bringing your own bags, keep cups, plates.
Bus numbers 23 and 29 will get you to Houghton Valley School.
We can't wait to see you there!
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Hutt City Night Market - Dowse Square - 11 Sepember 2025, Hutt City Night Market - Dowse Square - 11 Sepember 2025
Hutt City Night Market

📍 Location: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
📅 Date: Thursday, 11 September 2025
🕓 Time: 4:00 PM – 8:00 PM
💥 Cost: Free Entry

🌙✨ Join us for the Hutt City Night Market – a new weekly night market bringing food, flavour, and fun to the heart of Lower Hutt!

Come down to Dowse Square every Thursday from 4–8PM, rain or shine, and enjoy a handpicked line up of local food trucks serving a delicious range of cuisines. It’s the perfect way to unwind after work, catch up with friends and whānau, and support small local businesses.

Expect:
🍔 Tasty street food from around the world
🎶 Laid-back vibes and community spirit
🛍️ A weekly night out to look forward to

📢 We’ll be announcing weekly vendor line ups and tasty updates on our Wellington Street Eats Hub Facebook page — so be sure to like and follow us to stay in the loop!

This is just the beginning — we’ll be at Dowse Square for the first 4 weeks, before moving to our long-term home on Daly Street by the Riverbank Carpark with even more food trucks!

Bring your appetite, tell your mates, and we’ll see you there!

#HuttCityNightMarket #LowerHuttEats #StreetFoodVibes #SupportLocal #NightMarketNZ

description:
Hutt Japan Day 2025, Hutt Japan Day 2025
Hutt Japan Day is back!
Join us for a vibrant celebration of Japanese culture at the Hutt Japan Day festival, held at the Lower Hutt Town Hall, Dowse Square & Dowse Art Gallery on Sunday, 9 November.

Celebrating 30 Years of Friendship
This year's event is extra special, marking 30 years of partnership with Minoh City, our sister city in Osaka, Japan. The festival is organised by the Hutt Minoh House Friendship Trust, with support from the Hutt City Council and the Embassy of Japan.

What’s on offer?
• Be captivated by an array of Japanese performances and demonstrations
• Engage in hands-on activities and workshops
• Immerse yourself in the exhilarating rhythms of taiko drumming
• Indulge in delectable Japanese cuisine from one of our food vendors/stalls
• Explore our market area for unique Japanese treasures

Get Involved!
To participate in this special celebration as a performer, artist, cultural group, demonstration, market or food vendor, please visit our website for more details and registration forms: https://www.huttminoh.org.nz/participate-in-hutt-japan-day-2025

Save the Date - Sunday, 9 November 2025
Lower Hutt Town Hall, Dowse Square & The Dowse Art Museum

We look forward to celebrating the richness of Japanese culture with you!

description:
Kapiti Botanist Market, Kāpiti Coast, Get Ready – The Botanist Market is Coming to You!

Foxtail Events is beyond excited to bring the beloved Botanist Market to the Kāpiti Coast for the very first time — and we can’t wait to share it with you! Join us at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall for a lush, leafy celebration of all things green, gorgeous, and garden-inspired.

Whether you're a seasoned plant whisperer or simply love beautiful spaces filled with botanical charm, this market is your perfect winter escape!

Expect a vibrant mix of:
* Indoor & outdoor plants
* Botanical art, fashion & homewares
* Ceramics, planters & garden decor
* Natural skincare & eco beauty products
* Seedlings, garden tools & plant accessories
... and so much more!

This is more than just a market — it’s a community of plant lovers, creatives, and eco-conscious makers coming together in one gorgeous space.

Come see why the Botanist Market has captured hearts across Wellington — and now, it's your turn, Kāpiti! Bring a friend, bring your plant wishlist, and don’t miss this brand new local gem.
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026, Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026
Get ready for a day of love, celebration, and unforgettable inspiration at the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo 2026 – the Kapiti Coast’s premier event for anyone planning a wedding, special event, or milestone celebration. Taking place on Sunday, 19 April 2026, from 10am to 3pm at the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, this vibrant expo brings together over 40 of the region’s top wedding and event professionals, all in one beautiful space. Best of all? Entry is completely FREE!

From breathtaking florals and stunning venue styling to expert celebrants, creative photographers, world-class entertainment, and delectable food and drink offerings, this expo has it all. Whether you’re newly engaged, planning a birthday bash, organising a corporate event, or simply love all things celebration, the Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is your one-stop destination for inspiration and expert advice.

This year’s expo promises an immersive experience packed with exclusive show-only offers, giveaways, and dazzling live performances on the Main Stage. Meet the creative minds behind Kapiti’s most iconic celebrations, explore dreamy decor ideas, and uncover the latest wedding and event trends that will help you bring your vision to life. Our hand-picked exhibitors are the best in the business, offering fresh ideas and tailored solutions to make your event truly unforgettable.

But that’s not all – your free ticket also unlocks exclusive deals across the Kapiti Coast. From boutique shopping and cosy cafes to scenic stays and local attractions, our Explore Kapiti program gives you access to fantastic discounts and experiences from our local business partners. Simply show your expo ticket to take advantage of these offers while you’re in town.

The Kapiti Wedding & Events Expo is proudly brought to you by Kapiti Castles, experienced event organisers who understand how to make moments magical. With a deep love for creativity, community, and connection, we’ve crafted this event to help you dream big and plan with confidence.

So don’t miss out – grab your free tickets today and join us for an extraordinary day of discovery, excitement, and inspiration. Whether you're planning a wedding, a party, or something truly unique, this is where your perfect celebration begins.

description:
Kāpiti Food Fair 2025, All FOODIES and your tribe are invited to an exciting and indulgent day out that leaves a lasting impression on food lovers that will have you returning year after year. We take pride in our offering of GOOD food, GOOD music, and GREAT company for food enthusiasts – the ultimate Food Festival with something for everyone backed with a great vibe and professional entertainment to enjoy all day long!
On the menu for 2025 ……. up to 250 vendor sites including an off licence Liquor Zone, a licenced Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage, ANZ Kāpiti Kitchen Demo Stage, Kāpiti Ice Cream Dining Room, FREE Kid’s Zone, ZEAL Zone buskers, roving street performers and much more!
GETTING THERE: Walk | Bike | Drive | FREE bus from Paraparaumu Railway Station
ALL WELCOME + crowd friendly dogs on lead
LOOK out for the NEW shady picnic zone!
THAMES PACIFIC MAIN STAGE
9:45 AM – 9:50 AM | Official Mayoral Opening
10:00 AM – 10:30 AM | Devon Welch Music
10:45 AM – 11:15 AM | Intercite
11:45 AM – 12:45 PM | Jody & the Stowaways
1:15 PM – 2:15 PM | The Beat Girls
2:45 PM – 3:45 PM | The Relatives
4:15 PM – 5:15 PM | Love Shack
MERCHANDISE: $3 Bags, $5 T-towels, $10 Aprons (not sold online)
NOTE: Humanitix booking fees will be added to the cost of your ticket and paid at check-out.  Booking fees cover Humanitix costs, and everything else goes to their education projects that help to change lives.  Kāpiti Food Fair supports Manaiakalani Education Trust for Māori, Pasifika, and disadvantaged learners in Aotearoa to increase student outcomes and get equal access to digital education.
TOP TIPS for a FANTASTIC DAY at the Kāpiti Food Fair
Bring a gold coin for parking donations.
Pack a hat and sunscreen – complimentary SPF is available if you need it.
Bring a picnic blanket to relax, enjoy the ambiance, and savor your treats with plenty of seating and a NEW shaded picnic spot under the trees.
BYO your own chair if you wish and a chilly bin for purchases!
Plan your foodie route with the Site Map >>
Visit the Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage and relax over a craft brew, wine, local cocktails and delicious cider while enjoying the vibe of the 80's to 90's revival party all day long!  Children are welcome with their parent or guardian.  CHEERS to that!
MOST vendors accept EFTPOS or bank transfer.  BYO cash as there is no ATM available.
THANK YOU SPONSORS
Kāpiti Food Fair is a recipient of the Kāpiti Major Events Fund and is supported by numerous local businesses in-kind and reduced cost of services.  The Fair is a commercial event however we have a social agenda too.  We choose to support Kāpiti Community Patrol, Kāpiti Rotary Charitable Trust, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets, Paekākāriki Surf Lifesavers, Paraparaumu College, and Work Ready Kāpiti to help run key logistics on the day. 
Kāpiti Food Fair Ltd is privately owned and operated by Helene Judge and Jeanine van Kradenburg.  The Fair reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.
#KFF2025 #FoodFestival #KāpitiFoodFair #SomethingForEveryone #VisitKāpiti
Website >> | Facebook >> | Instagram >> | YouTube >> | TikTok >>

description:
Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective, Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective
✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective ✨

Saturday 6th September · 11am – 2pm · Paraparaumu

For one day only, Lightbody Jewellery is journeying to Paraparaumu.

We’re honoured to be welcomed into Copperfield Collective, bringing with us a collection of our most sought-after treasures.

💫 Meet the maker – learn the stories and symbols hidden in every piece.

💫 Try on sacred treasures – jewellery alive with meaning, energy, and transformation.

💫 Feel the magic woven into silver and gold – creations that choose their keepers.

About Lightbody Jewellery

We are a small New Zealand brand, born from nothing but vision and persistence, built piece by piece, story by story. Lightbody Jewellery grew out of a desire to carry ancient symbols into the present, weaving spirit into matter so that jewellery could once again guide, teach, and protect.

Every pendant, ring, and talisman is handcrafted here in Aotearoa with intention. They are not made to follow trends, they are made to awaken, to empower, to transform.

What began as a spark has grown into a living brand carried by intuition, mystery, and craft. Each piece finds its keeper when the time is right.

This pop-up at Copperfield Collective is more than a display.
It’s a rare chance to meet the maker, hold the work, and feel which treasure has been waiting for you.

✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up
📍 Copperfield Collective - 17 Seaview Road, Paraparaumu Beach
📅 Saturday 6th September
🕚 11am – 2pm

description:
New Voices of Aotearoa @ Newtown Community Centre, Join us for this fabulous event featuring three of our brightest new authors, all of them major New Zealand prize winners -- Una Cruickshank, Olive Nuttall and Michelle Rahurahu. We are very lucky to have acclaimed author Pip Adam as our host.
The rich diversity in current Aotearoa literature is very strongly in evidence in our younger writers. To celebrate and explore this in all its facets Wellington City Libraries in conjunction with The Coalition for Books and Te Herenga Waka University Press have brought together three of the brightest lights from the current scene to discuss their work and the state of Aotearoa writing now. This fabulous event promises to be unmissable for anyone interested in current writing in our own fair country.
Please note we expect this event to be extremely popular, and seating will be on a first come first served basis.
Meet the Panel:
Una Cruickshank was born in Tamaki Mākaurau Auckland and now lives in Pōneke Wellington. She has an MA in Creative Writing from the International Institute of Modern Letters at Te Herenga Waka Victoria University of Wellington, as well as another, earlier MA. When not writing outstanding non-fiction essays, she frequents the libraries and cinemas of Wellington, works at an audiovisual archive, and has a love of karaoke. The Chthonic Cycle is her first book and won the E.H. McCormick Prize for Best First Book at the 2025 Ockham New Zealand Book Awards.
Olive Nuttall completed an MA in Creative Writing in 2022 at Te Pūtahu Tuhi Auaha o te Ao, the International Institute of Modern Letters at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. Kitten (2024) is her first novel and win the 2022 Adam Foundation Prize.
Michelle Rahurahu (Ngaati Rahurahu, Ngaati Tahu-Ngaati Whaoa) is a writer who was raised by taangata turi. They were a co-editor of Te Rito o te Harakeke, an anthology of Maaori voices for Ihumaatao. They have a master’s in creative writing from the IIML, where they won the Modern Letters Fiction Prize. Michelle was shortlisted for the Michael Gifkins Prize for Poorhara, their first novel, published by Te Herenga Waka University Press. In 2025 Poorhara won the Hubert Church Prize for Best First Book at the Ockham NZ Book Awards.
Meet our Host:
Pip Adam is the author of four novels: Audition, Nothing to See, which was shortlisted for the Acorn Prize for Fiction, The New Animals, which won the Acorn Foundation Prize for Fiction, and I'm Working on a Building. Her short story collection Everything We Hoped For won the NZSA Hubert Church Best First Book Award for Fiction.

description:
Not Your Nana's Craft Market - R18 Art and Craft Market, *Strictly R18*
Are you ready for a unique and thrilling experience? Look no further! We invite you to the most captivating event of the year - the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!

What to Expect
Get ready to immerse yourself in a world where art and craft meet the dark and mysterious. This market is not for the faint of heart! Here's what you can expect:
1. Creepy-Cute Delights: Explore a wide range of art and craft creations that blend the creepy and cute aesthetics. From adorable monsters to spooky dolls, you'll find something to tickle your fancy.
2. Witchy Wonders: Dive into the world of witchcraft and magic. Discover spellbinding artwork, mystical jewelry, and enchanting potions. Embrace your inner witch or warlock!
3. Kinky Curiosities: For those who enjoy a touch of kink, we have a selection of unique and provocative art and crafts, and kink wear. Explore the boundaries of sensuality and embrace your desires in a safe and inclusive environment.
4. Sexy Sensations: Indulge in the world of sensuality and erotic art. Discover captivating paintings, sculptures, and photography that celebrate the beauty of the human form. Embrace your sexuality with pride!
5. LGBTQIA+ Friendly: This market is a safe space for all members of the LGBTQIA+ community. Celebrate diversity and inclusivity as you explore the wide range of art and craft offerings.
6. Alternative Art and Craft: Step outside the mainstream and explore the alternative side of creativity. From gothic to steampunk, from punk to cyberpunk, you'll find a variety of unique and unconventional art and craft pieces.
Join Us!

Don't miss out on this extraordinary event! Mark your calendars and invite your friends. Get ready to be amazed, inspired, and maybe even a little bit spooked. See you at the Creepy-Cute, Witchy, Kinky, Sexy, LGBTQIA+ Friendly Alternative Art and Craft Market!
It definitely will NOT be your nana's market! See less

description:
Old St Paul's Craft & Curio Market, Discover Wellington’s Most Enchanting Market!
Set against the breathtaking backdrop of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most iconic heritage landmarks, the Old St Paul’s Craft & Curio Market is a boutique shopping experience like no other.
As part of this year’s Wellington Heritage Festival, the grounds of Old St Paul’s will be transformed into a vibrant marketplace filled with handpicked stalls offering treasures and treats you won’t find anywhere else. Explore lovingly crafted leather goods, upcycled garments, wellness creations, handmade chocolates, collectibles and curiosities, houseplants, dyed wool, children’s accessories, fine embroidery, jams and preserves, artisan breads and baked goods, Christmas decorations, candles, and so much more.
But it’s not just shopping – this is a day steeped in atmosphere. The lawn and forecourt will come alive with heritage-themed games and activities, alongside captivating live demonstrations from the Wellington Embroiderers’ Guild and the Wellington Combined Society of Bellringers.
With its central location just minutes from the Railway Station and bus hub – and plenty of on-street parking – this is your chance to enjoy a heritage day out that’s easy to get to, and unforgettable once you arrive.
Fun for the whole whānau, supporting the ongoing care of this national treasure.
Schedule:

This is a kids-friendly day, with a childrens workstation, forbuilding and other family activities.
Workshops and acitvities include...
• Invertebrate studies

• Understanding fish passageways
• Stormwater networks
• Karaka berry foraging
• DIY Tracking tunnels
The day will also have a food truck and guided tours of the awa and forest trap line.
Come and celebrate the first year restoring the mauri and mana of this wāhi tūpuna urban stream and forest.
