description:
Sumac, Banished Music, Whammy Bar, and Valhalla are proud to present the long-awaited New Zealand debut of experimental post-metal trio SUMAC.

Formed in 2014, the powerhouse trio, comprised of Aaron Turner (guitar, vocals; Isis, Old Man Gloom), Brian Cook (bass; Russian Circles, Botch), and Nick Yacyshyn (drums; Baptists), are renowned for merging crushing heaviness with improvisational freedom, exploring the boundaries between structure and chaos.

SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band. Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation. In 2024, the band released their critically acclaimed album The Healer, a sweeping, transformative work spanning four monumental tracks. The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.

The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career. It’s dense and invigorating, highlighting the band’s dexterity, creativity, and clarity of purpose. - Pitchfork
Soon after the release, SUMAC teamed up with poet and sound artist Moor Mother to release The Film, a boundary-pushing collaborative album. Released via Thrill Jockey in April 2025, the record unfolds as a cinematic journey across eight “scenes,” merging SUMAC’s heavy, jazz-inflected textures with Moor Mother’s incisive spoken-word commentary.

SUMAC’s work has always been about the transition between different states of being. Our sense of normal, and indeed our sense of life, is now being shaken. We don’t know what is coming next. We are looking for pointers towards the future, as well as things to hold onto in the moment.
  
New Zealanders, don’t miss this rare and powerful journey into uncharted sonic terrain.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Summer Soirée: Psychedelic & Melodic Techno feat Kozy (CA), Aztoria (, Wellington, join us for a night of Psychedelic & Melodic Techno featuring 2 international artists, Kozy ( Canada), Aztoria (Australia), supported by Aadhi, Blair & Uday. This event will be hosted at the legendary venue, Valhalla on the 24th of January, 8pm onwards.

Kozy will be playing a 2.5 Hour Extended Set, Aztoria will be playing a 1.5hr set & local legends will be playing an hour each.

International DJ Bio's:
KOZY ( CA)

KOZY aka Jeff Koz is a Montreal-based DJ & Entrepreneur specialising in dark & groovy underground techno music.

KOZY's dedication to music is evident in his tight mixes, solid track selection and inclination towards groovy synths and heavy, disruptive bass.

In 2019, he founded AlpaKa MuziK, a Montreal-based record label pushing world-class underground progressive, minimal and psychedelic techno beats. With releases from some of the biggest names in the game, AlpaKa MuziK has been paving the way for this fast emerging genre with relentless quality music and has become one of the most prominent labels in the psychedelic techno sub-genre.
With over 125 releases and over 650 tracks under their belt, AlpaKa has quickly become a powerhouse label in the underground techno community.

Since early 2022, in a little over 2 years, KOZY has gone on 9 international tours, including 5 euro tours, Australia, South Africa Mauritius, India, Mexico and has played over 150 gigs in 24 months in over 30 countries and counting.

Some prominent festivals he has performed at include, Esoteric in Australia, Hadra in France, Texas Eclipse, Boom Festival and many others, bringing to many of them the AlpaKa MuziK takeovers that showcase the cutting edge psychedelic techno sound through countless live sets around the world.
He recently finished his 4-month long 2025 summer euro tour where he performed at Boom Festival in Portugal and many more AlpaKa Showcases all around Europe and beyond. His 2025-2026 world tour is in motion, with Japan and a large Southern Hemisphere schedule in the works. With an unstoppable arsenal of unreleased, cutting edge bangers, he'll leave you wanting more after every set.

AZTORIA ( AU)

Aztoria is the psytech project of Ashley Zadel, also known as Flow Theory.
For more than 16 years, his melodic bush techno sound has evolved through auditory storytelling on stages across the globe, from Cape Town to London, Israel to Brazil, Portugal, New Zealand and Australia.


Rooted in progressive soundscapes with an organic flavour, Aztoria blends melodic deep house grooves with minimal techno to craft psychedelic atmospheres that ignite the imagination.

Aztoria burst onto the scene with his debut EP Reborn (Dense Nebula Records), hitting #4 on Beatport’s Techno charts. His 2024 single Birds of Paradise (Soliq Records) soared to #33, while his Inner Groove remix landed at #23 in Progressive House (Techgnosis Records). With fresh releases on Techgnosis, Recovery Collective and Puzzles Records and more in the works, Aztoria is carving his path in the underground with relentless energy and innovation.


Whether in the depths of a forest or the heart of a concrete jungle, Aztoria’s tunes will captivate and elevate you with his storytelling magic.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
TARN PK - LIVE AT MOON, TARN PK - LIVE AT MOON
~ DON'T GET F.O.M.O ~

Tarn PK is bringing his new EP ’F.O.M.O’ to live audiences in Wellington on the 14th of September 6pm at MOON, with support from Sig Wilder & Friends and Josh Glennie.

With his newly formed 3 piece band, they’re stripping his sound down to the essentials; funky drum breaks, soaring synths and crunchy guitars, bringing a whole new dimension to the sound from the EP.

F.O.M.O, is a reflection on burnout, ambition, and identity in a digitally overwhelmed world. It draws inspiration from urban isolation and the weight of expectations. Tracks from the EP have landed on major Spotify and Apple playlists. Reflecting the office environment, familiar to many, this performance will bring to life the themes from the EP in a host of ways.

With over 2.2 million streams across platforms and 1.8 million on Spotify alone, his impact is growing. Releases have landed on global and regional editorial playlists. His EPs—Fantasy, Monarch, SugarCoated and now F.O.M.O —have consistently showcased his range and evolution as an artist.

Sig Wilder & Friends blend kiwi authenticity with American grit, bringing you a well-worn handwritten journal of lived experiences rendered through metaphor, poetic prose, and the stylistic conventions of folk, alt-country and late-night heartbreak radio.

Josh Glennie is a soulful singer/songwriter based in Wellington, New Zealand. He's made a name for himself playing in bands around Wellington and is now striking out with his own solo material. Together with Tarn, they have produced a new EP of songs that cut to the bone, focused around acoustic guitar and Josh's striking vocals. His New EP is expected late 2025/early 2026.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Techno Taster, Techno Taster
This year for the first of our annual pre-parties we’ve gone around the country to gather a lineup of creators working at the intersections of techno, delving into influences from bass, breaks, psychedelia, club music and beyond, all underpinned by elements of dance music's most enduring genre.

We believe each one of these acts is currently pushing the needle forward for underground club culture in Aotearoa, and are thrilled to host them all together at Valhalla to push their vision across the almighty Third Eye Hi-Fi soundsystem.


ELI HØFF — Abyssal Soundworks / PHTM

Producer and DJ, Eli is undoubtedly at the forefront of Aotearoa’s underground dance scene.
Those who have kept their ears tuned to the innovative underground have no doubt stumbled upon the tribalistic, psychedelic, and focused sounds emanating from the mind of Auckland-based producer Eli Høff. With a string of releases on Berlin-based PHTM, Tāmaki Makaurau-based Gypnotica, and an impressive catalog of self-releases, he consistently showcases his singular and original interpretation of dance music.

Instagram.com/e.li
elihoff.bandcamp.com
abyssalsoundworks.bandcamp.com


HUNTER — Hang the Saints / Haven

Raised in Kaikōura, Aotearoa, Hunter's dark and atmospheric sound often contrasts the beautiful environment she grew up in. Her direct approach to techno draws influence from heavy percussion, bold rhythm and industrial soundscapes. After spending two years finding inspiration in clubs overseas, she has returned to Ōtautahi with a refined style that’s ready to make people dance. As the co-founder of “Hang The Saints” and resident of “Haven”, Hunter is all about creating safe, inclusive spaces for people to connect through the music she loves.

https://www.instagram.com/sspoonsnake/
https://soundcloud.com/hunter-mccrory-334790608
https://on.soundcloud.com/bC3qeA6pUxBoMo7P9


LUDUS & RIZZO — Tonic Collective

Tonic Collective is the recent endeavour of Ludus and Rizzo, inspired by the people, places and spaces of their experience touring China with BIRDPARTY and Vera Ellen. Both acts are individually known for their versatile and innovative sound, bringing a wide range of influences and inspirations to the dancefloor. In the short time since establishing the collective, they’ve already hosted Kaishandao and Bone Chapel, established a space, and debuted a monthly radio show on Mouthfull that explores sound from across the genre spectrum, both in the club and out.

https://www.instagram.com/ludus.etc/
https://www.instagram.com/alicerizzoofficial
https://www.instagram.com/tonic.collective/
https://soundcloud.com/l-s-rizzo/416life-support-cl1n1c-chengdu
https://soundcloud.com/racquetclub-info/mix-series-016-ludus


SHLI — Echo Train Records / Warehouse Rave / Holding Hands

Shli is the alias of Ōtautahi-via-Pōneke DJ and Producer Tim Ward. Steadily releasing works over recent years through local labels like Echo Train and the Big Fresh Collective, he is carving out a sound of his own.

Stitching together infectious rhythms layered over low-end pressure, Shli’s sets draw influence from across the hardcore continuum and beyond. Creating dancefloor moments from trippy rhythmic states to unleashing sheer bass weight.

https://www.instagram.com/____shli/
https://echotrainer.bandcamp.com/album/ech009-bracing-set-pace-u-dont
https://soundcloud.com/1shli

description:
Teiwa - Rob Ruha with the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, TEIWA 

Rob Ruha with the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 

Platinum-selling, Silver Scroll-winning Maori artist Rob Ruha and the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra transform the Michael Fowler Centre into TEIWA - a supernatural performance house of tribal futurism that will transport the senses.From waiata you'd hear on the marae to the exhilaration of stadium anthems, this is Aotearoa music turned all the way up, amplified by the unmistakable haka power of special guests TOA (Te Taumata O Apanui).

All Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. 
Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

description:
Testpot presents - Friend of Friends, Wellington alternative indie rock trio Testpot present Friends of Friends. An afternoon-into-evening celebration of music, community, and connection. From afternoon grooves to electric evening highlights, this is more than just a gig; it’s a gathering, a celebration, and one we'd love you to join us for.
Pack a picnic, bring the whole family, bring your mates, bring drinks, bring a smile.

Friends of Friends is celebrating the connections that hold us together. Every band on the line-up is connected through friendships, side projects, and shared stages, making this a rare chance to see a community of musicians in one place.
So come meet some new friends, old friends, hang out with and get to know:
PLANET
BEANS AND DON
SAM R SAFFERY
BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO
TESPOT
AGATHA PANTHA
KINGSTON HIGH ALL STARS

Experience all of these great bands in the beautiful and iconic setting of Breaker Bay Hall.
BYO friend, food and drinks.
Seatoun village is a stone's throw away, so just nip out, grab some cold ones and some fish and chips or something to bring back to the hall and enjoy.

Can't wait to see you there.

* * * * T E S T P O T * * F R I E N D S * *O F * *F R I E N D S * * * *

PLANET - A mix of traditional bagpipe airs with post punk riffs and a dollop of vaudevillian good humour. It could be world music, it could be underground indie rock. It could be psychedelic folk music. But it's always approachable and certainly a lot of fun.
https://planetband.nz

BEANS AND DON - A dynamic duo beautifully sculpting a path of folky ballads through love, loss, and much, much more.
https://www.facebook.com/people/Don-and-The-Divorcees/61552936937584/

SAM R SAFFERY - From rural New Zealand to the subways and bodegas of New York, Samuel R. Saffery’s musical journey is unquestionably linked to place and movement.
Blending indie folk, alternative rock, and classical influences, his songs are delivered with a distinctive, melodic voice, as haunting as it is sweet.
Instagram: www.instagram.com/slamsafari
Bandcamp: www.samuelsaffery.com
Twitter: @samuelsaffery

BUFFLAO BUFFLAO BUFFLAO - A seven-piece herd of instrument addicts play a mix of electronic and acoustic to produce pop-rock that is equal parts playful and whimsical. Catchy indie-pop licks, lush harmonies, and hooks that stick, the enigmatic, multi-faceted group Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo – so good they named the band three times.
https://www.instagram.com/buffalothree/

TESTPOT - Alternative indie rock trio colliding sonic inspirations from bands such as Radiohead, Animals as Leaders, and Duran Duran. A sonic commentary on social media, corruption, AI, surveillance, and the other goodies we’re all told we have to live with. A side project of Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo member Hayden Overton, joined by the talented Scott Roy and the percussive brilliance of Lachie Kendric, doing whatever it is we do.

AGATHGA PANTHA - Expect the unexpected from Wellington-based Agatha Pantha - a folk/rock four-piece whose sounds range from bouncing rhythms to dark, tangled ballads to anthemic rock numbers. The product of four unlikely allies joined by musical fortitude and lived experience, here to provide a therapeutic soundtrack to the everyday.
https://agathapantha.bandcamp.com

KINGSTON HIGH ALL STARS - The Kingston High All Stars are a Wellington-based band founded by 5 friends who are inspired by the brilliant, hypnotic and incredibly rhythmic music coming out of the Western Sahara. description:
Testpot presents - Friends Of Friends at Breaker Bay Hall, Testpot presents - Friends Of Friends
Wellington alternative indie rock trio Testpot present Friends of Friends. An afternoon-into-evening celebration of music, community, and connection. From afternoon grooves to electric evening highlights, this is more than just a gig; it’s a gathering, a celebration, and one we'd love you to join us for.
Pack a picnic, bring the whole family, bring your mates, bring drinks, bring a smile.
Friends of Friends is celebrating the connections that hold us together. Every band on the line-up is connected through friendships, side projects, and shared stages, making this a rare chance to see a community of musicians in one place.
So come meet some new friends, old friends, hang out with and get to know:
PLANET
BEANS AND DON
SAM R SAFFERY
BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO
TESTPOT
AGATHA PANTHA
KINGSTON HIGH ALL STARS
Experience all of these great bands in the beautiful and iconic setting of Breaker Bay Hall.
BYO friend, food and drinks.
Seatoun village is a stone's throw away, so just nip out, grab some cold ones and some fish and chips or something to bring back to the hall and enjoy.
Can't wait to see you there.
* * * * T E S T P O T * * F R I E N D S * *O F * *F R I E N D S * * * *
PLANET - A mix of traditional bagpipe airs with post punk riffs and a dollop of vaudevillian good humour. It could be world music, it could be underground indie rock. It could be psychedelic folk music. But it's always approachable and certainly a lot of fun.
https://planetband.nz
BEANS AND DON - A dynamic duo beautifully sculpting a path of folky ballads through love, loss, and much, much more.
https://www.facebook.com/.../Don-and-The.../61552936937584/
SAM R SAFFERY - From rural New Zealand to the subways and bodegas of New York, Samuel R. Saffery’s musical journey is unquestionably linked to place and movement.
Blending indie folk, alternative rock, and classical influences, his songs are delivered with a distinctive, melodic voice, as haunting as it is sweet.
Instagram: www.instagram.com/slamsafari
Bandcamp: www.samuelsaffery.com
Twitter: @samuelsaffery
BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO - A six-piece herd of instrument addicts play a mix of electronic and acoustic to produce pop-rock that is equal parts playful and whimsical. Catchy indie-pop licks, lush harmonies, and hooks that stick, the enigmatic, multi-faceted group Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo – so good they named the band three times.
https://www.facebook.com/buffalobuffalobuffaloband/
TESTPOT - Alternative indie rock trio colliding sonic inspirations from bands such as Radiohead, Animals as Leaders, and Duran Duran. A sonic commentary on social media, corruption, AI, surveillance, and the other goodies we’re all told we have to live with. A side project of Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo member Hayden Overton, joined by the talented Scott Roy and the percussive brilliance of Lachie Kendric, doing whatever it is we do.
AGATHA PANTHA - Expect the unexpected from Wellington-based Agatha Pantha - a folk/rock four-piece whose sounds range from bouncing rhythms to dark, tangled ballads to anthemic rock numbers. The product of four unlikely allies joined by musical fortitude and lived experience, here to provide a therapeutic soundtrack to the everyday.
https://agathapantha.bandcamp.com
KINGSTON HIGH ALL STARS - The Kingston High All Stars are a Wellington-based band founded by 5 friends who are inspired by the brilliant, hypnotic and incredibly rhythmic music coming out of the Western Sahara. KHAS has since developed their signature style, blending desert blues, psych-rock, middle eastern classical, reggae and funk.

description:
The Antidote, Venom Presents: 𝕿𝖍𝖊 𝕬𝖓𝖙𝖎𝖉𝖔𝖙𝖊
Friday March 20th × 10pm-Late × Red Square Bar × Wellington
Techno all night long, moving through psy tech, driving techno, hard bounce and hard techno / neo-rave, with the energy building steadily as the night goes on.
After a successful NYE rave, we’re bringing you a Venom club night featuring techno across multiple styles from local talent.
Lineup:
No Way Jose
Stēvo
Narcotica
Dr. Dash
Malware
Dress code:
Techno vibes. Dark, edgy, black.
If you love techno and want a night that’s high energy, The Antidote is for you.
R18: Valid photo ID is required for entry.
Honour your energy: Hydrate, rest when needed, and pace yourself. Endurance is intentional.
Consent, always: Attention without invitation is not welcome. If it is not an explicit yes, it is a no.
The ritual is shared: Treat the space and each other with care. Stay aware of your body, your drinks, and those around you.
No space for harm: Harassment, discrimination, intimidation or violence have no place here. If something feels off, speak to a crew member.
Protect the collective: Check in on those around you. If someone needs support, help them find it.
Lighting & FX: Strobes, lasers, and visuals may be used throughout the night. These effects may not be suitable for those with photosensitivity.
Photography & Videography: Venom events may be photographed or filmed for promotional purposes. By attending, you may appear in content we share to celebrate and promote future events.
Have fun: The night is here to be enjoyed. Venom is alchemy — what you bring into the night shapes what it becomes.

description:
The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington, The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington
Ready to take these new tracks on the road, The Grogans new album Stagger is out, plus the band are excited to announce a headline tour across New Zealand. Exploring another side of The Grogans' music, Stagger is a patchwork of different sounds and sonic inspirations that all come together in the one album, "it came from this idea that it was a jagged and stylistically different album track to track", explain The Grogans.
Kicking off their tour at Loons in Christchurch on Wednesday 3 September, the band then head to Yonder in Queenstown on Thursday 4 September, San Fran in Wellington on Friday 5 September before wrapping up at Double Whammy Auckland on Saturday 6 September. Prior to their Aotearoa dates, the trio will also be playing a seven date tour throughout Australia along with stops in LA and New York for North American shows this June.

Capturing the magnetic energy of their live shows, Stagger touches on themes of mental health, taking care of yourself and your loved ones, the occasional love song, and more. As the catchy chorus first single and album opener ‘Oh Boy’ leads into
sonic powerhouse of a tune ‘Come Up (Goes Down)’, ‘In My Heart’ slows it down to a new easy listening direction, followed by ‘Have a Little Dream’ - as dreamy as the title suggests - and the big open echoed instrumentation of ‘Once In A While’. Adding new textural effects in ‘Roll Back’ and last single ‘Roundabout’, ‘Happier Man’ dips into a heavier psych realm with a reminder that "striving to be a better and happier person should be a goal for everyone." ‘Worry About Everything’ is an upbeat tune sure to have you worrying about nothing, and feel good album closer ‘All My Days’ ends on a more serious note that outlines the beauty and the beast of live music and the personal struggles that come with the lifestyle and touring.

Tickets go on sale 12pm, Wednesday 28 May.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Jesus Lizard - San Fran, Wellington, The Jesus Lizard Return to New Zealand this October:
The quintessential punk band of the 90’s - the Jesus Lizard, returns to New Zealand shores for the first time in 27 years this October! Playing two exclusive shows only at Auckland’s Tuning Fork and San Fran in Wellington on the 11th and 12th respectively.
After initially calling it a day in 1999, the Jesus Lizard officially return full time to save us from the current state of musical mediocrity with their latest album, Rack. A blistering resurgence of the so-called ‘noise rock’ they helped define alongside contemporaries Big Black, Flipper, The Birthday Party, with their previous and most noted albums Head, Goat and Liar. For those of us who live in fear of the reunion album and subsequent tour, the Jesus Lizard thankfully display not only the same chaotic and dark nihilism of their earlier careers but also the maturity and seasoning of a band riding a wave of renewed and reinvigorated form.
Once slated by famed engineer Steve Albini as “the greatest band I’ve ever seen’ the Jesus Lizard not only lived up to this lofty praise in their prime but continue to do so in their advancing years. David Yow still leads the charge as the maniacally possessed frontman entering crowds with reckless abandon and a stamina that much younger vocalists would kill for. The original rhythm section of David Wm Sims and Mac McNeilly further continue to prove why they were and are the best bass & drum combo since Jones and Bonham, anchoring the ship as Captain Yow and first mate Denison navigate the wild seas of their songs. And while he may not always feature (as he rightly should) on many modern music journalists ‘best guitarists lists’, Duane Denison could perhaps be the most innovative and idiosyncratic punk rock guitarist EVER. However, each member is a sum of their parts but combined they are as Albini also once said “the purest melding of the sublime and profane.”
Whether you are a longtime disciple of the Jesus Lizard, seeing them when last here in ‘98, or perhaps your fandom is more recent and have only seen videos of their legendary live performances, you will know that these shows are not to be missed.
Tickets available Thursday 8TH May at 12pm from:
Saturday 11th October 2025 - The Tuning Fork, Auckland (All ages):
https://moshtix.co.nz/.../the-jesus-lizard-nz-tour.../180227
Sunday 12th October 2025 - San Fran, Wellington (R18 unless accompanied by your legal guardian)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The King's Singers, C L O S E H A R M O N Y
For over half a century, The King’s Singers have been synonymous with impeccable blend, radiant tone, and joyful music-making. Formed in 1968 by six choral scholars from King’s College, Cambridge, the group quickly earned an international reputation for their unique approach to “close harmony” — a seamless weaving of voices across centuries and styles. Today, their performances continue to enchant audiences from London to Los Angeles, and now, back in Aotearoa.
This bespoke programme, created especially for their March 2026 tour, offers a journey through The King’s Singers’ remarkable musical history. Beginning with their earliest repertoire from the late 1960s, the evening will move through Renaissance sacred music, English folksong, jazz standards, pop classics, and contemporary works. Expect Byrd alongside Billy Joel, madrigals alongside The Beach Boys, Disney magic alongside dazzling new arrangements from the songwriters of today.
The concert also carries a special significance — it will be one of the final New Zealand appearances for long-standing baritone Chris Bruerton. A proud Kiwi, Chris has been a cornerstone of The King’s Singers for over a decade, touring the world and helping shape their modern sound. His farewell tour offers Wellington audiences a rare chance to celebrate his artistry on home soil.
A highlight of the night will be the “Something Borrowed” segment, where the ensemble will present a pair of songs chosen especially for Wellington — a personal gift to the local audience, performed in their signature style.
With wit, warmth, and unparalleled musicianship, The King’s Singers promise an evening that is both a celebration of their legacy and a showcase of their continuing innovation. Whether you’ve followed their journey for decades or are hearing them for the first time, Close Harmony at Wellington Cathedral will be a night to remember.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Miracle Tone | A Handpan Concert with Taylor Sol | Wellington, A live, seated handpan concert with Taylor Sol
Join Taylor Sol for a 90-minute handpan concert in 432 Hz, offering a deeply immersive listening experience through rhythm, melody, and resonance.
This is a concert-style event where guests are invited to sit comfortably and witness the music as it unfolds. The evening includes a brief spoken opening, one hour of live handpan music, and a gentle closing reflection to complete the journey. The handpan’s warm, organic tones create an ambient soundscape that supports relaxation, nervous system balance, and a sense of connection, both to nature and to the inner listening space. This offering is intentionally simple and inclusive. No participation, movement, or prior experience is required. Just arrive as you are and allow the music to carry you.
WHEN & WHERE
Date: Thursday 26 February 2026
Time: 6:30pm – 8:00pm
Venue: The Polish Association In NZ Inc - 257 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
WHAT TO EXPECT
• A 90-minute seated concert experience
• One full hour of live handpan music in 432 Hz
• Opening and closing reflections & storytelling
• Ambient, immersive soundscapes
• A calm, grounded atmosphere
• Space to rest, listen, and receive
WHO IS THIS FOR?
This concert is open to everyone, all ages and walks of life are welcome.
Perfect for those seeking:
• Deep listening and presence
• Calm and nervous system renewal
• Musical beauty and inspiration
• A unique live concert experience
No prior experience with sound journeys or meditation is needed.
Children, families, elders, and first-time listeners are warmly welcome.
WHAT TO BRING / SEATING
• Seating will be provided as well as a floor seated option (optional - bring chair cushion, shawl)
• Water bottle
• An open mind
See you there!
Taylor Sol

Hellenic Music Ensemble
Marking their Aotearoa debut, the Hellenic Music Ensemble brings Greece's unforgettable soundscape to life in a landmark global tour.
Led by acclaimed composer and conductor Panos Liaropoulos, this 21-piece orchestra honours the genius of Mikis Theodorakis ('Zorba's Dance') and Manos Hadjidakis ('Never on a Sunday'), joined by legendary voices Natassa Bofilou and Giannis Haroulis. You're invited on a soaring journey through a century of song celebrating the soul, poetry and passion of Greece.

description:
The Racket Lounge: Evolve, The Racket Lounge: Evolve
Come along to the FINAL Racket Lounge concert for 2025 to hear some brand new music written by local composers and soak in the good vibes!

🎸 The Racket Lounge: Evolve
📅 Wednesday 8 October, 6.30pm
🎟 Book now through the link above


Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!

Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!

A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.

All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.

Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.

Supported by Wellington City Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
This week! Dying Fetus + 200 Stab Wounds + Organectomy - Wellington - San Fran, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗴𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝘀 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦
𝗔𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗮𝗻 & 𝗡𝗲𝘄 𝗭𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗧𝗼𝘂𝗿, 𝗗𝗲𝗰 𝟱 – 𝟭𝟰, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱
DYING FETUS with 200 STAB WOUNDS performing at:
Dec 5th – Auckland, Galatos*
Dec 6th – Christchurch, Loons*
Dec 7th – Wellington, San Fran*
Dec 9th – Adelaide, Lion Arts Factory+
Dec 11th – Hobart, Altar+
Dec 12th – Melbourne, Northcote Theatre+
Dec 13th – Sydney, Metro Theatre+
Dec 14th – Brisbane, The Triffid+
*Organectomy appearing / +Ashen appearing
TICKETS ON SALE NOW at:
ADELAIDE, HOBART, MELBOURNE, BRISBANE – www.moshtix.com.au
SYDNEY – https://premier.ticketek.com.au
AUCKLAND – https://galatos.co.nz
CHRISTCHURCH – www.undertheradar.co.nz
WELLINGTON – https://moshtix.co.nz
Armed with undeniably some of the heaviest riffs known to mankind, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 has established a reputation for uncompromising integrity with a slew of classic albums and today rides a resurgence of respect and esteem with a new generation. The band continually refines its unique take on death, grind, and hardcore with a combination of virtuosity and ferocity, inescapably catchy hooks, punishing breakdowns and a complete lack of pretension.
After 12 horribly long years since their last tour in Australia and in only their second appearance in New Zealand since 2009, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 are well overdue to lash us unmercifully with their savage beatdowns and earth-moving grooves and grunt, equally designed to pulverize and mesmerize.
On their first slog into the antipodes, Cleveland death metal legends-in-waiting 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 serve up a brutal slab of old school death metal with a contemporary edge. Not for the faint-hearted, 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 craft classic gore-themed savagery for themselves and like-minded brethren: thrill-seekers, carnage cravers, horror fans, and aficionados of the most extreme of metal.
Warming up the circle pits and necks will be the slamming sonic signature of ORGANECTOMY in New Zealand and the old-school death metal grit and punishing ferocity of ASHEN in Australia.
www.facebook.com/DyingFetus

www.facebook.com/200StabWounds

www.facebook.com/organectomynz

www.facebook.com/ashendeath

https://swdpresents.com
label: Music & Concerts

description:
This week! Pig Destroyer + Glassblower + Post Natal Abortion- Wellington - San Fran, PIG DESTROYER Australian & New Zealand Tour
September 2nd – 14th, 2025
with guests WORMROT – Australia only
Sept 2nd – Perth, Amplifier Bar w/ Bile Cannon, Allocer*
Sept 4th – Adelaide, Lion Arts Factory w/ Meth Leppard
Sept 5th – Melbourne, Max Watts w/ Tongue Scum
Sept 6th – Sydney, The Factory Theatre w/ Crown Street Militia
Sept 7th – Canberra, The Baso w/ Blight Worms
Sept 9th – Brisbane, The Triffid w/ Awful Noise
Sept 10th – Townsville, The Warehouse w/ Varrim*
Sept 12th – Auckland, Galatos w/ Imperial Slave, Sawnoff*
Sept 13th – Christchurch, Loons w/ Vixen Execution, Unyielding Desolation*
Sept 14th – Wellington, San Fran w/ Glassblower, Post Natal Abortion*
*Wormrot not appearing in Perth, Townsville or NZ
TICKETS ON SALE at:
PERTH, MELBOURNE, CANBERRA, TOWNSVILLE – www.oztix.com.au
ADELAIDE, SYDNEY, BRISBANE - www.moshtix.com.au
AUCKLAND - https://galatos.co.nz
CHRISTCHURCH - www.undertheradar.co.nz
WELLINGTON - https://moshtix.co.nz
PIG DESTROYER boil metal down to its muscle, sinew, and bone - razor-sharp guitar, percussive pummelling, and a lone, stark howl - and use them to commit a vicious assault. The lyrics paint loathsome, frightening images of pitch-black self-hatred and the frailty of the human experience. These musical manifestations only serve to cement their already legendary status. Having not been in Australia and New Zealand since 2008, PIG DESTROYER’s long overwaited return has just one goal. To unnerve the unprepared with a deranged, grisly intensity which very few, if any, can match.
Recently reforming to the original line-up, Singapore’s WORMROT resume their genius in unleashing exquisite noise together, with the announcement of a new album 'TNT'. Grinding faces with the best of them, their performances are intense, spectacular, furious, with a barrage of unrelenting, head-caving abuse, honed by a singular determination to destroy the competition.
www.facebook.com/TheRealPigDestroyer

www.facebook.com/wormrot

www.swdpresents.com

description:
Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn, Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – big hearts, remarkable songs – on stage, with a collection of brand new tunes.
Doors at 7
Music at 7.30
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com
-----------------
Tom Cunliffe writes folk songs like short films; vivid, offbeat, and full of heart. Based in Tamaki Makaurau, Auckland, he crafts lyrical worlds, with a guitar tuned sideways and a voice that balances gravity with joy.
Cunliffe has supported a number of internationally renowned artists including M. Ward, Grace Cummings, and Reb Fountain, bringing his mix of warmth, wit, and slow-burning intensity to stages near and far.
-----------------
"Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible
bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be
accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community
space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to
others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.”
“The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a
table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com”
Ali Whitton is an Aotearoa-born, Yorkshire-raised and now Wellington based singer-songwriter who is stepping into his own as an artist. Ali is an artist who refuses to let go, blending raw storytelling with a sound shaped by decades of experience and dedication to his craft.
Performing for years under the name Lost Bird, Ali built a reputation for writing heartfelt, melancholic folk-pop, playing everywhere from Wellington bars to stadium stages — including opening for Ed Sheeran in Auckland in 2018.
Now, after years of performing behind an alias, Ali is stepping forward under his own name, embracing his identity as an artist with an invigorated sense of purpose, and tackling his artistry with newfound confidence and clarity.
-----------------
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Tom Cunliffe and Ali Whitton at R Bar, Doors open 7pm Music Starts 8pm
Tom Cunliffe returns with 'Spit Out Your Gum' – his fourth album and most intimate release to date. Vivid, offbeat, and full of heart, the record captures Cunliffe at his most direct, delivering a collection of songs that glow with warmth and humanity.
Across its tracks, Cunliffe takes listeners on a journey from the streets of London to the bright lights of Karangahape Road, and out into the cold green waves of the Irish Sea. Each song feels alive – steeped in imagery, character, and a quiet intensity that rewards deep listening.
Recorded live-to-tape at Roundhead Studios, 'Spit Out Your Gum' carries the unmistakable warmth of that hallowed room and the people within it. With Paddy Hill engineering, Cunliffe was joined by Dave Khan (violin, piano) and Cass Basil (bass, clarinet).
Together, they captured performances that unfold in real time – no edits, no digital polish, just songs recorded in single takes, preserving the intimacy, imperfection, and energy of the moment.
Ali Whitton is a New Zealand-based singer-songwriter. Born in Aotearoa and raised in rural North Yorkshire, his music blends introspective folk, alt-country, and acoustic storytelling, drawing inspiration from artists like Nick Drake, Bright Eyes, Johnny Cash, and Bob Dylan.
With poetic lyrics rooted in nature and emotional honesty, his songs explore themes of longing, resilience, and cosmic wonder. After an early career touring the UK and France – including sharing stages with Ed Sheeran – Ali settled in Aotearoa New Zealand, where salty sea winds and bush covered landscapes continue to shape his sound.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Transvision Vamp, Transvision Vamp announce first New Zealand tour in 31 years!
British pop rock band Transvision Vamp are bringing their hits down under for the first time in almost three decades. With shows in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch lined up for February 2026, the group will be playing their nostalgia-filled favourites.
‍
Formed in 1986, Transvision Vamp quickly rose to fame. Their songs 'Baby I Don’t Care', 'Revolution Baby', 'I Want Your Love', 'The Only One' and 'If Looks Could Kill' all hit the Top 50 in the New Zealand singles chart from 1988 - 1991. Wendy James, the lead singer and focal point of the group, attracted media attention with her sexually charged and rebellious image.

Transvision Vamp became known for their collision of brash punk and commercial pop, and joining James on this tour are some musical luminaries: Alex Ward (The Thurston Moore Group) on guitar, Dave Parsons (Transvision Vamp) on bass, and James Sclavunos (Nick Cave and The Bad Seeds) on drums.

Wendy James went on to pursue a successful solo career spanning an additional seven studio albums, including a notable collaboration with Elvis Costello. She served as a feminist symbol in the 80’s for unapologetic self-expression and fearless leadership.

James says, "I am so very excited to be coming back to New Zealand to play the songs which started my whole musical journey! I remember vividly so many incredible moments gigging in New Zealand, moments of enormous success, enormous love and enormous fun. I’m bringing with me a set full of music that will thrill and musicians who will amaze!"
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Traskforce! Ft. Wallace Gollan And Eugene Wolfin, Two of Wellington’s most enthralling vocalists perform with a powerhouse octet in a celebration of the sublime songs of the jazz repertoire.

Starring Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin on vocals, the octet will present a fizzing set of big band swing, Broadway hits, and gorgeous ballads. Hear the fine lyricism of the 20th century sung by two of Wellington’s most exciting performers.

Exhilarating original compositions and arrangements will tug at your feelings in new and compelling ways. Daring solos from some of the finest musicians in the country will awe and shock you as the turbulent horns sing out.

Witness the union of big band attitude and chamber music intimacy as this very special band play their hearts out to you.

The performers:
Consistently connecting the dots between genres and influences, Wallace Gollan’s artistic identity has become uniquely recognizable, with her jazz training and distinct harmonies captivating audiences around the globe.

For the last 8 years vocalist Eugene Wolfin has been a regular of Wellington music scene performing in a wide variety of genres including Jazz, Blues, and Rock ’n’ Roll. He has had a hand in a few local Musical Theatre productions performing lead roles in ‘Chess’ and the modern hit ‘If/Then', and is a regular in front of Jazz Orchestras including the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and the Rodger Fox Big Band.

Traskforce! is bandleader Alex Trask’s most swinging musical organisation. They play fresh arrangements of original compositions, classic swing, and Broadway love songs. This includes songs from the Basie repertoire, Bob Mintzer, Oliver Nelson, Quincey Jones, and Lionel Bart's Oliver! to name a few. The five horn arrangements allow for the power of a big band and the subtlety of a quartet to shine side by side. The band is made up of Wellington’s top players, including members of the Rodger Rox Big Band, the RNZAF band, NZSM faculty, and rising stars.

Personnel:
Wallace Gollan – vocals
Eugene Wolfin – vocals
Alex Trask – alto saxophone, arrangements
Mike Taylor – trumpet
Oscar Laven – tenor saxophone
Kaito Walley – trombone
Daniel Yeabsley – baritone saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
John Rae – drums

Door sales available for $20
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Twisted Frequency - Techno Taster, Twisted Frequency - Techno Taster
This year for the first of our annual pre-parties we’ve gone around the country to gather a lineup of creators working at the intersections of techno, delving into influences from bass, breaks, psychedelia, club music and beyond, all underpinned by elements of dance music's most enduring genre.

We believe each one of these acts is currently pushing the needle forward for underground club culture in Aotearoa, and are thrilled to host them all together at Valhalla to push their vision across the almighty Third Eye Hi-Fi soundsystem.


ELI HØFF — Abyssal Soundworks / PHTM

Producer and DJ, Eli is undoubtedly at the forefront of Aotearoa’s underground dance scene.
Those who have kept their ears tuned to the innovative underground have no doubt stumbled upon the tribalistic, psychedelic, and focused sounds emanating from the mind of Auckland-based producer Eli Høff. With a string of releases on Berlin-based PHTM, Tāmaki Makaurau-based Gypnotica, and an impressive catalog of self-releases, he consistently showcases his singular and original interpretation of dance music.

Instagram.com/e.li
elihoff.bandcamp.com
abyssalsoundworks.bandcamp.com


HUNTER — Hang the Saints / Haven

Raised in Kaikōura, Aotearoa, Hunter's dark and atmospheric sound often contrasts the beautiful environment she grew up in. Her direct approach to techno draws influence from heavy percussion, bold rhythm and industrial soundscapes. After spending two years finding inspiration in clubs overseas, she has returned to Ōtautahi with a refined style that’s ready to make people dance. As the co-founder of “Hang The Saints” and resident of “Haven”, Hunter is all about creating safe, inclusive spaces for people to connect through the music she loves.

https://www.instagram.com/sspoonsnake/
https://soundcloud.com/hunter-mccrory-334790608
https://on.soundcloud.com/bC3qeA6pUxBoMo7P9


LUDUS & RIZZO — Tonic Collective

Tonic Collective is the recent endeavour of Ludus and Rizzo, inspired by the people, places and spaces of their experience touring China with BIRDPARTY and Vera Ellen. Both acts are individually known for their versatile and innovative sound, bringing a wide range of influences and inspirations to the dancefloor. In the short time since establishing the collective, they’ve already hosted Kaishandao and Bone Chapel, established a space, and debuted a monthly radio show on Mouthfull that explores sound from across the genre spectrum, both in the club and out.

https://www.instagram.com/ludus.etc/
https://www.instagram.com/alicerizzoofficial
https://www.instagram.com/tonic.collective/
https://soundcloud.com/l-s-rizzo/416life-support-cl1n1c-chengdu
https://soundcloud.com/racquetclub-info/mix-series-016-ludus


SHLI — Echo Train Records / Warehouse Rave / Holding Hands

Shli is the alias of Ōtautahi-via-Pōneke DJ and Producer Tim Ward. Steadily releasing works over recent years through local labels like Echo Train and the Big Fresh Collective, he is carving out a sound of his own.

Stitching together infectious rhythms layered over low-end pressure, Shli’s sets draw influence from across the hardcore continuum and beyond. Creating dancefloor moments from trippy rhythmic states to unleashing sheer bass weight.

https://www.instagram.com/____shli/
https://echotrainer.bandcamp.com/album/ech009-bracing-set-pace-u-dont
https://soundcloud.com/1shli
label: Music & Concerts

description:
UPCHUCK: Australia & New Zealand 2026, If you’ve been waiting for a band that hits hard, means it and leaves nothing behind, this is it. I OH YOU and MG Live are pumped to announce provocative punk powerhouse Upchuck are bringing their explosive live show down under. The ferocious five-piece from Atlanta will make their Australian and New Zealand debut next March, with shows in Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, Auckland and Wellington, as well as a featured set at Victoria’s Golden Plains festival.
The tour follows the release of their blistering third album – and Domino debut – I’m Nice Now, out now here. Produced and mixed by Ty Segall, the album is a bold evolution of their sound – a raw, urgent and emotionally charged statement of survival and resistance. Formed in 2018 by a crew of Atlanta skaters in their early 20s – KT (vocals), Mikey Durham (guitar), Hoff (guitar), Ausar Ward (bass) and Chris Salado (vocals/drums) – they quickly became hometown legends. Their debut Sense Yourself (2022) and Ty Segall-produced follow-up Bite The Hand That Feeds (2023) cemented their fearless reputation. Early singles Freaky and Facecard earned praise from punk icons Iggy Pop and Henry Rollins, who both played tracks on their radio shows, while support slots for Faye Webster (who calls Upchuck “her favourite band”), Amyl and the Sniffers, Soul Glo, Osees, King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard and a breakout Coachella 2024 performance further solidified their status.
A fierce lineup of local acts will join Upchuck around Australia and New Zealand. Captivating fourpiece Blue Diner kick things off in Brisbane on Wednesday 4 March; Post-punk rockers Xiao Xiao open in Sydney on Friday 6 March with secret guests in tow! Punk Naarm trio CLAMM bring their raw and visceral sound to Melbourne on Wednesday 11 March, while Aotearoa rockers DARTZ take over Auckland on Friday 13 March and Wellington on Saturday 14 March with their signature fiery live set! Like your punk loud, honest and unfiltered? This is the tour you’ve been waiting for. Don’t miss Upchuck’s debut down under.


MG LIVE TERMS OF SALE

https://mg.live/termsofsale
label: Music & Concerts

description:
VEGYN | WELLINGTON | MEOW, VEGYN | WELLINGTON | MEOW
Sprawling with obtuse bass lines, sharp digital peaks and asymmetrical drum machines, Vegyn’s music doesn’t walk a straight line so much as trip over itself beautifully.

The London-born producer, artist, DJ and label head returns to Australia and New Zealand this October for a rare run of headline shows, supported by NYC producer amr*.

Sign up to our presale here to gain first access to tickets on Wednesday 27th August

---> http://go.astralpeople.com/vegyn-ps


Across everything he touches - from surreal club sets to production work for Travis Scott, JPEGMafia and Frank Ocean - Joseph Thornalley makes music that’s hard to pin down and harder to forget. His productions are jagged and abstract, built from negative space, ambient haze and rhythms that never quite resolve. There’s hip hop in the DNA, but it never plays by the rules, always veering towards something stranger, softer, rawer.

Through his label PLZ Make It Ruins, Vegyn has built an entire world. His 2019 debut Only Diamonds Cut Diamonds felt like a manifesto; the 71-track Text While Driving If You Want To Meet God! followed as a chaotic, genre-agnostic statement of intent. Since then, he’s ventured further leftfield, releasing The Head Hurts but the Heart Knows the Truth under the alias Headache, followed by the 2024 masterpiece The Road to Hell Is Paved with Good Intention, and the unexpected arrival of Blue Moon Safari - an output that feels made more for himself than for any audience. Dreamlike, disjointed and deeply personal.

As a DJ, Vegyn shifts between industrial breaks, ambient drift and warped club memories. This October, he returns to Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Wellington and Auckland - a rare chance to slip through the cracks and step inside his world.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Waiora Te Ukaipo - The Homeland, A landmark piece of New Zealand theatre by acclaimed writer and director Hone Kouka, Waiora explores the impact of colonisation, the urban drift, and the tension between past and future. An "urgent and vibrant story" (Stuff), Waiora is a powerful reflection on family, culture, and belonging.

All Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. 
Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

Please note: There is no elevator in the Opera House and access to the Dress Circle and Gallery are via stairs. The Gallery may be unsuitable for patrons with accessibility requirements or experience vertigo. For further information, please contact us on 04 916 1205.

description:
Wellington Heads @ the Hokowhitu Bowling Club, Wellington Heads @ the Hokowhitu Bowling Club
BENT HORSESHOE AND THE HOKOWHITU BOWLING CLUB PRESENTS
WELLINGTON HEADS ON SATURDAY THE18th OF OCTOBER AT 7.30 AT A COST OF $25

Wellington Heads have been playing for us for many years and always put on a great show.
and with a frontman like Neil Worboys how could they fail to.
They are also one of the few bands that have a brass section which is always great to hear.
They have a great time on stage and that comes across in their nusic.
If you have not seen them before take this opportunity ,you won't be disappointed.
Named after the striking features on Wellington’s rugged southern coastline, Wellington Heads have been playing in and around the capital city, and in venues further afield, for over 20 years.



Wellington Heads consists of three core songwriter-musicians (Geoff Keith, Neil Worboys, and Bill Wood) who combine with key musicians to form a larger live and recording band. Their songs comment on life experiences with a distinctive Wellington and New Zealand flavour.



Wellington Heads have evolved their own sound through the influences of Kansas style blue jazz, the swinging rhythm n blues of Louis Jordan and Ray Charles, Chicago blues and infused with Pacific/Hawaiian rhythms, New Orleans grooves and Latino feels.



Sharp and energetic, Wellington Heads entice people to the dance floor, regularly delighting audiences at Wellington venues, and playing festivals, corporate and private functions. They are frequently invited to perform outside of Wellington, and over the years have played Auckland, Tauranga, Manawatu, Nelson and Wellington Jazz and Blues Festivals.



Wellington Heads have recorded six albums, their latest, ‘World Keep On Turning’ was released in December 2023. This album continues their unique sound with a mix of rhythm n’ blues, swing, soul and latino grooves. In combining this with their previous albums, Wellington Heads have built an extensive repertoire of eclectic original songs.



Wellington Heads’ regular six piece line up is: Neil Worboys – vocals, guitar, harmonica, Bill Wood – guitars, Geoff Keith – bass, Nic Deighton – drums, Phil Costello – saxophone, Andy Weir – trumpet.



For more information about the band and to check out photos, videos and Wellington Heads music please visit our website www.wellingtonheads.co.nz
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal, Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal
Wendyhouse are Bryce Galloway and Daniel Powell (AKA Mr Pudding and EE monk). The pair met at the Elam School of Fine Arts. Wendyhouse got their name from debut performances at Art Space (Tāmaki Makaurau) where they sang songs set in the year 2032 from inside a Wendy house (Soundwatch ’92). A prolific creative period followed before EE monk relocated to Europe in 1995. Wendyhouse output has been somewhat sporadic ever since, but with EE monk’s recent return, the pair have returned to performing live.

Wendyhouse music was initially played on toy musical instruments, the kind that fit inside a Wendy house. Real instruments were added as the band moved out of the house and onto the stage.

The music is best described as lo fi inverted pop music, with lyrics about unlikely topics. For example, the two newest songs in the Wendyhouse are an existential treatise on real estate and a love/hate ode to Futurist Luigi Russolo. Guitar, toy keyboard and vocals are the Wendyhouse instruments of choice.

---


DSLB

DSLB is the solo project of Chrissie Butler (the shouty bass playing half of the now sleeping duo, mr sterile Assembly). An offshoot from Chrissie's other band Ditzy Squall, DSLB (Ditzy Squall's Lunch Box) is a showcase for a love of long endings and the hum things make when you hold them close to your ear. Performed live, DSLB is an improvised mash-up of ancient record players, purring keyboards, kitchen utensils and found objects. Soundtracks for short films and hand drawn comics are also residents in the lunch box. Recordings are released by skirted Records.

https://skirtedrecords.com/dslb/

---

vegetable.machine.animal

New solo project courtesy of Mr Sterile, in which living fungal and plantlife inform a modular synthesiser with biofeedback. This signal acts upon the synth changing the pitch, tone, rate and more in the delivery of sound. These ‘curated’ sounds are then responded to with percussion. VMA explores the intersections between spontaneous playing, electronic music, and science-informed inter-species collaboration.

https://mrsterileassembly.bandcamp.com/album/my-daughter-the-spider


$17.50 presales available via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wilson Blackley 'Remain' Tour With Oscar Ladell, Wilson Blackley returns to Aotearoa alongside Oscar LaDell and King Leo this summer to celebrate the release of his new song 'Remain' (Co-written by Troy Kingi).

Wilson Blackley is an Australian multi-instrumentalist and producer currently based in Melbourne. Born and raised in Poowong (Victoria), Wilson was surrounded by music from an early age. At just 2 years old he started playing the drums along to his mother’s music collection consisting of old soul, funk and r&b from the 60’s and 70’s. He started learning the guitar as soon as he could, and had the habit of making anything he could get his hands on into an instrument. Growing up far from the city instilled a strong sense of curiosity and work ethic in him from a young age, leading him to produce his first batch of demos in his teenage years. A stand-out among these demos was the song ‘Home’. ‘Home’ found its way to Sam Teskey (The Teskey Brothers) who would go on to co-produce the song alongside Wilson when he was just 18.

Following the release of ‘Home’, he went on to sell out The Gasometer and play a string of festival slots alongside a variety of artists including The Teskey Brothers and Boy and Bear. At this time, Wilson moved to St Kilda and in the heart of Melbourne began collaborating with Sensible J (Sampa The Great, Remi, Immy Owusu) on his debut EP ‘Material Plane P1’ which was released to critical acclaim in August 2022. After that, he co-produced Oscar LaDell’s EP ‘No Blue’ and subsequently embarked on a co-headline tour of Aotearoa and Australia with LaDell. After a three year break from releasing music, Wilson Blackley returns to Aotearoa alongside Oscar LaDell and King Leo this summer to celebrate the release of his new song 'Remain'
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Ziggy Alberts tickets, Presented by: Commonfolk
ARIA-accredited and APRA Award-winning artist Ziggy Alberts will return to New Zealand this November as part of his New Love World Tour, following three years of extensive touring across Europe, the UK, North and South America, Asia, and regional Australia. Celebrating the release of his seventh studio album, New Love, Ziggy will return to New Zealand for the first time since 2023, with three special shows in Christchurch, Wellington, and Auckland.
From his early days busking the streets of Byron Bay to selling out venues like London’s Royal Albert Hall, Ziggy’s journey has been defined by grassroots touring, heartfelt songwriting, and an unwavering independent spirit.
The New Zealand leg of the tour kicks off on Thursday 13 November at Christchurch Town Hall, followed by Meow Nui in Wellington on Friday 14 November, and concludes at Auckland’s Powerstation on Saturday 15 November. This tour will showcase Ziggy’s signature solo style - spirited, raw, and deeply authentic - the kind of direct connection that has earned him over one billion streams, multiple awards, and a loyal global fanbase.
Fans can look forward to favourites like ‘Days in the Sun’ and ‘Runaway’, which recently surpassed 100 million streams, alongside new tracks from New Love - an album crafted for live performance. Featuring hit singles 'New Love’, 'Where Does the Love Go?' and latest single, ‘I’m With You’ the record marks a return to simplicity and authenticity, blending folk, rock, and country influences to create a cohesive yet dynamic listening experience.
Alberts’ year of New Love is not one to miss. This leg of the world tour will celebrate connection, authenticity, and music’s ability to bring people together. Don’t miss the chance to see Ziggy Alberts live on the New Love World Tour 2025

description:
the Jesus Lizard, After initially calling it a day in 1999, the Jesus Lizard officially return full time to save us from the current state of musical mediocrity with their latest album, Rack. A blistering resurgence of the so-called ‘noise rock’ they helped define alongside contemporaries Big Black, Flipper, The Birthday Party, with their previous and most noted albums Head, Goat and Liar. For those of us who live in fear of the reunion album and subsequent tour, the Jesus Lizard thankfully display not only the same chaotic and dark nihilism of their earlier careers but also the maturity and seasoning of a band riding a wave of renewed and reinvigorated form.

Once slated by famed engineer Steve Albini as “the greatest band I’ve ever seen’ the Jesus Lizard not only lived up to this lofty praise in their prime but continue to do so in their advancing years. David Yow still leads the charge as the maniacally possessed frontman entering crowds with reckless abandon and a stamina that much younger vocalists would kill for. The original rhythm section of David Wm Sims and Mac McNeilly further continue to prove why they were and are the best bass & drum combo since Jones and Bonham, anchoring the ship as Captain Yow and first mate Denison navigate the wild seas of their songs. And while he may not always feature (as he rightly should) on many modern music journalists ‘best guitarists lists’, Duane Denison could perhaps be the most innovative and idiosyncratic punk rock guitarist EVER. However, each member is a sum of their parts but combined they are as Albini also once said “the purest melding of the sublime and profane.”

Whether you are a longtime disciple of the Jesus Lizard, seeing them when last here in ‘98, or perhaps your fandom is more recent and have only seen videos of their legendary live performances, you will know that these shows are not to be missed.

Saturday 11th October 2025 - The Tuning Fork, Auckland (All ages)

Sunday 12th October 2025 - San Fran, Wellington (R18 unless accompanied by your legal guardian)

description:
A Dialogue with a Movements Catalyst (Wellington), Discover What God Is Doing in Movements Around the World
Join us for an inspiring session with Ryan A., missionary, church planter, and movements catalyst.
For the past ten years, Ryan and his family have served among unreached peoples in South Asia and Southeast Asia. In 2017, Ryan helped catalyze a church-planting movement that has since multiplied into 10,000+ churches and 100,000+ baptisms—and continues to grow rapidly.
Today, Ryan serves as a mentor to movement leaders across Asia, helping ordinary believers multiply disciples and churches. His experience spans both the unreached world and the urban Western context, giving him a unique perspective that speaks powerfully into the New Zealand setting.
Why Attend?
Ryan’s message directly addresses two urgent needs in New Zealand today:
Reaching our lost communities with the good news of Jesus.
Revitalizing overseas missions sending, which has significantly declined in recent years.
If you long to see disciples and churches multiply—both here and to the ends of the earth—this workshop is for you.

description:
A Journey Through the Chakras Workshop - Journey 1- the Root Chakra, A Kundalini Yoga and Gong Bath workshop to provide grounding, safety and stability

In 2026, I’ll be guiding a journey through the chakras — a series of workshops designed to support balance, awareness, and nervous system regulation throughout the year.

The Root Chakra Journey is the first step in this series and focuses on creating a strong, steady foundation from which everything else can grow.

The Root Chakra (Muladhara) is the base of our energy system. It governs our sense of safety, stability, belonging, and connection to the physical world — home, body, trust, finances, and basic needs. By strengthening this energetic centre, we cultivate resilience, stability, and a deeper sense of being held and supported in life. When it’s out of balance, we may experience anxiety, restlessness, fatigue, or a sense of disconnection.

This workshop is an invitation to slow down, reconnect with your body, and strengthen your inner foundation through movement, breath, sound, and rest.

- Kundalini Yoga - to awaken and stabilise the root chakra: 1.30pm – 3.00pm

- Break: Herbal tea, healthy snack & oracle cards

- Gong Bath - a restorative practice to settle the body and mind: 3.30pm – 4.30pm

** Come for one session or enjoy the full workshop experience.

** Open to all levels – no experience with yoga or sound healing needed.

** Bring an open heart, a yoga mat, blanket, water bottle and anything you need to feel cozy + supported.

Investment: $35 Yoga | $30 Gong Bath | $55 Both

*** 3 workshop special: $150 to attend both the Yoga and the Gong Bath sessions for Chakra Journeys 1 - 3 (being held on 21 Feb, 3 May and 31 May).

Lay down strong roots, regulate your nervous system, and begin a year-long journey of energy awareness and self-connection.

The Wellington Interfaith Council is hosting a hybrid online national forum for our community this year. We understand travel costs can be a barrier to in-person gatherings, so we're creating a unique way to connect!

The forum will be opened by two accomplished speakers. Then, each regional council will host their own in-person meeting, simultaneously linking up online for a shared discussion (kaupapa). description:
Art @ The Cathedral: Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion. You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded embroiderer who graduated from the Royal School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells her work, as well as accepting commissions. She has had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered 3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

description:
Astrology: More Than Just Sun Signs, Astrology: More Than Just Sun Signs
Astrology is a beautiful and powerful way to journey inward and discover more about yourself. It helps us find the light within and recognize that same light in others.
In this workshop, we will open the doorway into the world of astrology. We will explore what astrology truly is, and discover the differences between traditional and modern Western approaches. Together, we’ll enter the natal chart to understand its key elements and the wisdom they hold.
We will uncover how all twelve zodiac signs live within each of us, reminding us that no soul is ever defined by a single sign. Along the way, you will also gain insight into why two people with the same Sun sign can feel so different. By the end of our time together, you will understand the meaning of the seven traditional planets, the twelve zodiac signs, and the twelve astrological houses—and see how they interlace to reveal the hidden patterns and the unique story of your soul.
Whether you are just beginning your journey with astrology, or already walk with some knowledge, this workshop will offer you guidance, clarity, and a deeper sense of connection—to yourself, to others, and to the stars.
Plus - your ticket includes a plant-based dinner & dessert!
Whats on the menu?!

Meet Jelena, your host
Jelena has been passionate about astrology and was fortunate to begin her studies under the guidance of one of New Zealand’s most respected astrologers, who helped her start on the right path. From the very beginning, she has pursued her learning independently, drawing extensively from recommended books. Last year, she completed a course in Horary Astrology through the School of Traditional Astrology (STA). She is currently continuing her studies through a one-on-one course with a traditional astrology teacher in the UK while also receiving mentorship from an astrologer based in Perth, Australia.

description:
Astrology: Your Personal New Year, Astrology: Your Personal New Year

Have you ever wondered why the same year can feel completely different for each of us?

Across the world, different cultures mark the New Year at different times — the Western New Year, the Chinese New Year, the Buddhist New Year. Alongside these collective beginnings, there is also your personal New Year. In this workshop, we’ll explore when the New Year begins for you individually. Your birth chart can highlight which areas of life may come into focus and what influences them. We will also discuss why planetary movements and transits affect some people more strongly than others.

We’ll explore the 12-year cycle, where a different area of life becomes the main focus each year. You will see how this pattern repeats every 12 years, and why — even as the cycle returns — each experience can feel unique.

By the end of the workshop you will get some ideas about why your New Year is personal to you from an astrological perspective. The workshop will be interactive, so feel free to share your stories and, if you would like, bring your natal chart with you.

Plus, there’s an amazing plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket!

Meet Jelena, your host
Jelena has been passionate about astrology and was fortunate to begin her studies under the guidance of one of New Zealand’s most respected astrologers, who helped her start on the right path. From the very beginning, she has pursued her learning independently, drawing extensively from recommended books. Last year, she completed a course in Horary Astrology through the School of Traditional Astrology (STA). She is currently continuing her studies through a one-on-one course with a traditional astrology teacher in the UK while also receiving mentorship from an astrologer based in Perth, Australia.

description:
Bach Choir, Nota Bene, Chiesa Ensemble - Bach's Christmas Oratorio, The Bach Choir of Wellington, in collaboration with Nota Bene and the Chiesa Ensemble, presents Bach’s Christmas Oratorio (Parts I, II, III & VI).

Bach’s Christmas Oratorio, BWV 248, is a spiritually rich masterpiece composed during 1723 and 1724 and first performed in its entirety during the Christmas season of 1734–1735 while Bach was serving in Leipzig. Drawing on earlier secular cantatas and a now-lost church cantata (BWV 248a), this oratorio weaves together a vibrant tapestry of sacred music celebrating the birth of Christ.

This performance features four of the six cantatas:

Part I opens with a dazzling transformation of secular music into sacred celebration. Drums, strings, winds, and triumphant trumpets set the stage for the Evangelist’s narration and a sequence of expressive recitatives and arias, including the beloved “Bereite dich, Zion” and the majestic “Großer Herr, o starker König.” Chorales, including the Passion Chorale, frame the cantata with solemn beauty.

Part II begins with a pastoral, tender tone, portraying the shepherds’ encounter with the angel. The sinfonia evokes a rustic charm with oboes and flutes, leading into serene chorales and the exquisite slumber aria, where the flute hovers like a halo above the alto voice. The cantata concludes with a joyful “Glory to God” and a reprise of “Vom Himmel hoch.”

Part III returns to grandeur with trumpets and drums, as the shepherds journey to Bethlehem. The Evangelist’s narration is interwoven with contemplative chorales, a duet for soprano and bass, and an aria reflecting Mary’s inner thoughts. The cantata closes with a reprise of its opening chorus, reinforcing its celebratory tone.

Part VI, written for Epiphany, shifts to a darker mood as the story turns to Herod’s treachery. The music is dramatic and unpredictable, mirroring the tension of the narrative. The arias and recitatives explore divine power and moral conflict, culminating in a triumphant final chorus embedded with the Passion Chorale—symbolically linking Christ’s birth to his eventual sacrifice.

This is the first time in over a decade the Christmas Oratorio is being performed in Wellington, making this a special opportunity to experience one of Bach’s most joyful and profound creations. We hope you will join us for an evening of radiant music and festive spirit.

description:
Blessing of the Animals, Show your love and appreciation for your pet and all animals, great and small, by joining us for the Annual Blessing of the Animals ceremony!
Unite with families, canines, and other creatures great and small, for the special opportunity to have your pets blessed.
At this joyous event, you can celebrate and give thanks for our companion animals and recognise the life of St. Francis of Assisi, their patron Saint. You can also light a candle in remembrance.
It also marks World Animal Day, celebrated on 4th October.
All pets are welcome – whether it is dogs, horses and donkeys on leads, cats in carriers, or birds and other small critters in cages.
This event is free and open to everyone, and all ages.
Please note: There will be a lot of animals, people and noise at this blessing. If your animal is not comfortable in this type of situation you may decide it is best to leave them at home. Instead, please bring a photo of your pet to have blessed.

description:
CTRL_ALT_DEL, CTRL_ALT_DEL
Can we CTRL ourselves? ALT our reality? Or must we DEL everything else?

About this Event


Strap in for this emotional rollercoaster! Let voice, music and movement take you through a journey of resilience and self-discovery, to a wild, high-energy house party, to a powerful exploration of love, grief, and revenge. Three stories; one powerful connection.

Note to God - Jjohn Nickle
Note to God follows five individuals in therapy, each facing personal struggles. As they bond through shared pain, healing begins — until a twist tests their trust. A moving musical about connection, resilience, and finding hope in life’s darkest moments.
My House - Olivia Watts
My House is a high-energy show that takes you on a Saturday night and shows the heart of a house party. From the first guest to the final beat, experience explosive choreography, unforgettable characters, and music that moves your soul. It’s more than a party, it’s My House.
No Way Back? - Bryce Blackmore
No Way Back? explores one man’s experience with loss and what it means for his humanity. When everything is ripped away, how do we respond? In the wake of tragedy, we all face a choice: confront the pain and move forward or let it consume us.

description:
Cacao Ritual & Aromatherapy Candle-Making Workshop, Cacao Ritual & Aromatherapy Candle-Making
A ritualUNION event

Join Rosenda of Cultivate You and Melanie from Poet Botanicals for a relaxing day at beautiful Mangaroa Farms. Connect with nature and community, while experiencing some beautiful self-care practices.

Cacao with Rosenda

Rosenda will guide you on an intimate journey with cacao; beginning with its sacred story and path to the Pacific, and flowing into a hands-on experience in the kitchen. Together, we’ll explore cacao not just as food, but as medicine and ritual, a way to slow down, connect, and return to what feels true.

Aromatherapy Candle-Making Workshop

Discover the beauty of natural scent and the therapeutic power of essential oils in this hands-on workshop. This beautiful experience will be an invitation to slow down and reconnect with your senses. Learn the art of scent layering and with Melanie’s guidance, design a blend that reflects your own unique energy and intention. You’ll be taken through the process of making your own clean-burning aromatherapy candle, infused with the blend you’ve created. Your candle will serve as a lovely reminder of the day and inspiration to weave the therapeutic benefits of scent into your everyday rituals.

____

A nutritious, light lunch and refreshments will be provided.

____

When: Sunday 9th November

Time: 10am to 4pm

Where: Woodcote at Mangaroa Farms, Whitemans Valley (located just 40minutes from Wellington's CBD).

Investment: Earlybird price $169 until 9 October | $195 full-price

Bookings essential.

____

Cancellation Policy

If you can no longer attend the day please contact us at least 72 hours prior for a full refund. If you cancel within 72 hours we can only provide a refund if we're able to rebook your spot. Thank you for your understanding.

description:
Cacao and Soundscape with Kellie and Chelsea, This offering seeks to hold you in a space where you will be wrapped in warmth, and the healing alchemy of sound for two restorative hours. This will be an evening of inward reflection and deep nervous system nourishment, an opportunity to down regulate and tend to your inner world landscape.
The evening will begin with a cacao ritual and gently guided yoga nidra. Then guests will be cocooned in blankets, eye masks & bathed in sound alchemy for 90 uninterrupted minutes.
Chelsea and Kellie weave a story utilising an array of instruments in their collaborative offerings, as well as their love of voice activation and the power of mantra.
Over the course of this event, you will encounter the alchemic sounds of:
Two full sets of crystal singing bowls
The handpan and its earthy, resonant tones
Angelic harp melodies
Shamanic drumming
Soft and gentle wind chimes
Crystal pyramid and alchemy bowl with deep, ancient resonant frequencies
The shruti box and acoustic guitar, coupled with voice activation and sacred mantra
Previous attendees have described Kellie and Chelsea's soundscape journeys as unique, powerful, mesmerising and deeply soothing.

There is something so special about gathering with intention, to allow sound to move through you, to soften you, to bring you back home to yourself. We cannot wait to welcome you into the studio.

With all our love,
Chelsea & Kellie
Xx
