description:
Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of
St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and
stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion.

You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of
Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded professional embroiderer who graduated from the Royal
School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells
her work, as well as accepting commissions from churches, fashion designers and private
individuals. She has also had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan
and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered
3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of
New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

Venue: Loaves and Fishes Hall, Wellington Cathedral of St Paul.

Fittingly called “St John Paul the Great”, in this talk we will explore why this title was given to him and how prayer was foundational in all that he did.
Introducing the Sisters of the Immaculata. Sr Gemma Marie is a perpetually professed member of the Sisters of the Immaculata and Sr Mary Josephine is a temporary professed member of the community. description:
EYA Presents: The Bible and the Sacraments Bible Study, What are the Sacraments? Where do they come from? What do they mean? And why are they so central to our Catholic Faith?
In The Bible and the Sacraments, you’ll discover the deeply biblical roots of the Seven Sacraments and how they are more than mere Church rituals, but streams of life flowing from the living Body of Christ.
Throughout this study, you’ll discover how God has always dealt with His people through “sacraments,” and how the sacraments of the Old Testament find their ultimate fulfillment in the Seven Sacraments instituted by Christ and celebrated in the Catholic Church to this day.
Eucharistia Young Adults (EYA) introduces our second Bible study for 2025! This eleven-lesson Bible study by St Paul Center will delve into the beauty of the sacraments of the Catholic Church.
Please bring your Bible, journal, pen - and of course, your lovely self! Bring your friends, co-workers, family members, the more the merrier!
__________________
Every Wednesday | 16 July 2025 - 08 October 2025
St Mary's of the Angels Parish Hall
Everyone is most welcome!

description:
Earth & Embers: Women's Beltane Gathering, Earth & Embers: Women's Beltane Gathering
Join Tamsin & Sofia for an afternoon of connection, ritual, and celebration beneath the spring blooms. Beltane marks the height of spring, the half way point between the Spring equinox & Summer solstice. It’s a time of celebrating the union between the flowers and the bees, the sun and the land, and rekindling the creative fire within. It’s the season of fertility, joy, and remembering the sweet pleasures of being alive.

Together we’ll gather in sisterhood to honour the earth’s abundance and our own inner blooming. Through shared ritual, creating a heart opening elixir on the fire, movement, and nature craft, we’ll awaken the life force that moves through all things.

🌿 Our Circle Includes:
~ Opening Circle & Intention Setting
~ Cycle Wisdom & Seasonal Teachings
~ Foraging & Earth Altar Creation
~ Heart Opening Elixir & Journaling by the Fire
~ Embodiment & Celebration

You’ll leave feeling grounded, open-hearted, and reconnected with the beauty and vitality that lives within you, and all around you.

When: Sunday 2 November, 3:00–6:00 PM
Where: The Yurt, Mangaroa Farms (Upper Hutt)

Come as you are.
Let the earth remind you how to rekindle the pleasure of being alive. 🌷

description:
Ecstatic Dance Wellington, 💫 Move. Release. Connect. 💫
🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington ✨🌟
With DJ Kimba Jade @ Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington
Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to be hosting Ecstatic Dance Wellington! 🎉
💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.
Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.
🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, expect an immersive journey through deep bass, tribal rhythms, and global soundscapes that awaken both body and spirit. With over 24 years behind the decks—including 8 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection. Originally from Auckland, she curated Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years, now co-runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival, and teaches Alchemic Ecstatic Dance DJ Trainings. She’s thrilled to share her magic and move with you on the dance floor!
🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!
🗓 Event Details
📍 Vogelmorn Hall, 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 9:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)
🎟 Tickets
$25 online
$30 cash on the door
**If you would like to come but are unwaged or struggling, please send us a message directly, we'd love to help.
☀️ Extra Info
- Doors will open at 6.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 7pm.
We are very much looking forward to co-creating with the conscious dance community in Wellington and sharing our magic.
❤️ What to Bring
Water bottle
Loose, comfy clothes
Warm layers for afterwards
A pillow and Blanket if you wish
A friend!
🌟 Guidelines
Drug & alcohol free event
Silence on the dance floor
Without phones/cameras on the dance floor
Respect the space & each other 😊
🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/
✨ Come dance with us at Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨

description:
Face of the Feminine, ~ FACE OF THE FEMININE ~
She is it all!

Two women, one powerful celebration of the feminine. An evening of embodiment, bringing to life the rich depth and diversity the feminine nature beholds.

You are invited to join Jennifer (Jennifer Moss Joy) and Marigold (Marama Medicine) for an evening traversing the diverse landscape of the feminine.

Through the body and voice, you will witness song, sound, ancient language, movement, storyweaving and expression, as we venture through the feminine village together hand in hand, walking ourselves and each other home.

PS: it’s a show, you are the audience, we do stuff, you watch….

Includes nudity and strong language.
---------------------------------------------------------

About Jennifer: Jennifer is a musician, photographer, and soulful guide who celebrates the beauty of the human journey. Through music, images, and deep presence, she helps women embrace aging, honor their uniqueness, and discover joy in every season of life.

At the heart of her work is a devotion to joy, authenticity, and connection.

She's busting with excitement to be bringing this delicious offering to the stage with gorgeous Marigold.
------------------------------------------------------------

About Marigold: Marigold is a weaver of the Feminine, Temple Keeper, and Priestess.

She holds many years experience working with the mysteries of the Feminine - she is a Yoni Massage Practitioner, Mother, Midwife, and Witch, working with energies of the unseen and the human form.

Her mission is to raise the Feminine in all beings. The Feminine being the key holder to our innate body wisdom, medicine and healing.

She is honoured to work with and bring this Feminine offering to the stage with Jennifer!

description:
Fairy Reiki Level 1 & 2, Fairy Reiki Practitioner Level 1 & 2 Certification
Awaken Your Inner Nature Healer in the Heart of Tauranga
Are you feeling the deep call of nature? Ready to move beyond self-healing and step into your power as a certified energy practitioner?
Join us for this sacred, 10-hour intensive course where we blend the traditional Usui Shiki Ryoho Reiki lineage with the gentle, potent magic of the Fae—the elemental beings and nature spirits.
This is not just a course; it's a spiritual activation and a journey back to the deep, intuitive wisdom of the earth.
Held at the beautiful Sacred Firebird Retreat in Tauranga, this weekend provides the perfect sanctuary to connect, heal, and transform.
What You Will Experience & Learn (Total 10 Hours of Training):
Level 1: The Foundation of Self-Healing & Earth Connection
• Attunement: Receive your first sacred Reiki Attunement, opening your energy channels to the Universal Life Force.
• Self-Mastery: Learn the traditional 12 hand positions for self-treatment and healing loved ones.
• Fairy Ethics: Discover the core Five Fairy Principles (your Reiki Precepts) for living a life of joy and alignment with nature.
• Grounding: Practice powerful grounding meditations inspired by the ancient wisdom of the forest and the Sacred Firebird energy.
Level 2: Practitioner Status & Elemental Magic
• Practitioner Attunement: Receive the Level 2 Attunement, dramatically increasing your energy channel and preparing you for professional practice.
• Sacred Fairy Symbols: Learn to draw and apply the three powerful Reiki symbols, each with a specific Fairy Reiki interpretation, to:
• Amplify power and protection.
• Clear deep emotional and mental blocks.
• Send Distance Healing across time and space (to people, the past, or future goals).
• Professional Practice: Gain the foundational knowledge for working with clients, including ethics, boundaries, and energetic cleansing rituals.
Course Details
• Dates:
• Day 1 (Level 1): Saturday, February 14, 2026 | 10:00 AM – 4:00 PM
• Day 2 (Level 2): Sunday, February 15, 2026 | 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM
• Venue: The Sacred Firebird Retreat, Tauranga, NZ
• Total Investment: NZD $444
(Includes comprehensive manual, both Level 1 & 2 Attunements, and Certified Practitioner Certificate)
Who is This Course For?
This accelerated intensive is ideal for those who are highly sensitive, intuitive, or feel a deep, urgent pull towards nature and healing. You do not need any prior experience—only an open heart and a willingness to embrace the gentle magic of the Fae.
Step into your power. Embrace your path. Become a Fairy Reiki Practitioner.
(Limited Spaces – Bookings Essential to secure your spot in the circle.)
Food and Refreshments included

description:

𝗙𝗜𝗥𝗘 • 𝗕𝗥𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗛 • 𝗦𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗 & 𝗚𝗢𝗡𝗚 𝗕𝗔𝗧𝗛

“𝗙𝗹𝗮𝗺𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: 𝗕𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗵 & 𝗥𝗶𝘁𝘂𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱” 🔥🌌🪐🏕

Sacred Flame | Elemental Sound | Breath of Rebirth

🔥 𝗜𝗚𝗡𝗜𝗧𝗘 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗙𝗜𝗥𝗘 𝗪𝗜𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗡 🔥

Surrounded by the elemental force of fire, come home to your power through breath, ritual, and vibrational sound healing.

This immersive ceremony weaves together:
• Transformational Breathwork to awaken your inner flame
• Sacred Fire Ritual for release and transmutation
• Sound Journey with Gong, Drum, and Ancient Tones
• Rapé Ceremony (optional) to anchor presence and clear the mind

Held beneath the night sky, by the glow of sacred fire, this experience catalyzes deep emotional clearing, energetic realignment, and the courage to rise in your truth.

𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗘𝗟𝗘𝗠𝗘𝗡𝗧 𝗢𝗙 𝗙𝗜𝗥𝗘

Fire burns away illusion. It purifies, transforms, and resurrects. As you breathe with intention, the body opens to release suppressed emotions, energetic blockages, and stories ready to be alchemized.

Through sound therapy—gongs, elemental drums, and channelled vocal frequencies—you are guided into a trance-like state where cellular memory can shift, and higher guidance may emerge.

𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗝𝗢𝗨𝗥𝗡𝗘𝗬 𝗠𝗔𝗬 𝗜𝗡𝗖𝗟𝗨𝗗𝗘:

• Transformational Fire Breathwork
• Guided Fire Invocation & Ritual
• Gong Bath with Ascended Master Gong + Elemental Sound Tools
• Light Language & Channelled Sound Transmissions

description:
Gong Bath at Newtown Community Centre, ***$25***
Limited door sales for $30
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth*
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and frequencies of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.
Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground
**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 20 PEOPLE ONLY**
Disclaimer
Gong baths are safe and supportive for most people. However, please consult your doctor or mental health professional before attending if you:
-have a pacemaker or other implanted medical device
-live with epilepsy or a sound-sensitive condition
-are in the first trimester of pregnancy
-are experiencing severe or unmanaged mental health challenges (such as psychosis, schizophrenia, or PTSD)
If you have recent injuries, surgeries, or other health concerns, let me know so we can make sure you’re comfortable.
Everyone responds differently to sound. If at any point during the session you feel overwhelmed or uncomfortable, you are welcome to sit up, move gently, or step outside. Your wellbeing always comes first.
About Me
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 30+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice

description:
Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio SOLD OUT!, We invite you to a special evening of Sacred Harmonic Sound with multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia. This immersive sound journey offers a deeply restorative experience that invites you to settle into stillness, reconnect with the heart, and explore a sense of inner spaciousness through vibration and tone.
Claudio skilfully layers the sounds of gongs, crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other traditional instruments, enhanced through high-quality audio equipment so the sound can be both heard and felt throughout your body.
Harmonic sound and vibration offer the nervous system a chance to truly rest. In this state of relaxation, the thinking mind softens, and we find connection to citta — the heart-mind. From this place, silence arises naturally through the vehicle of sound.
This experience is open to everyone. No previous yoga or meditation practice is needed.
What to bring:
You are welcome to bring your own yoga mat, though studio mats are also available. We will provide bolsters, blankets, and eye pillows for your comfort.
Booking is essential — spaces are limited and this event often fills quickly.
About Claudio
Claudio is a multi-instrumentalist musician originally from Mexico City and now based in Wellington. Born into a family of musicians, he began playing music at a young age and later studied classical guitar. His journey led him to Montreal, where he explored jazz, world music, and spiritual sound traditions.
Extensive travels in Asia and Europe deepened his connection with Indian music and yogic philosophy. He studied Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu and Varanasi, and has since worked with a wide range of instruments including the sitar, esraj, bansuri, harmonium, flutes, gongs, and voice.
Claudio’s work blends technical skill, deep presence, and a profound respect for the healing power of sound.
Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:
SoundCloud https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing
Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio

Hypnosis for a Manifestation Mastermind, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

This workshop invites you to explore the deeper roots of abundance, beyond effort, beyond control. Together, we’ll look at how inner clarity, energetic alignment, and conscious detachment open the flow of true prosperity.

Instead of chasing outcomes, you’ll learn to move with life, to act from purpose rather than pressure. We’ll reflect on how attention shapes reality, why stillness restores vitality, and how joy itself becomes a magnet for success.

This experience isn’t about manifesting more things, it’s about aligning with the movement of life, where fulfillment, freedom, and natural abundance unfold with ease.

Meet Gopi, your host

Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity and overcome challenges on their path through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.

It’s more than yoga — it’s an experience.
Immerse yourself in the radiant world of chakras with this transformative yoga event designed to awaken and balance your inner energy. Blending traditional yoga with modern immersive visuals and sound, this session takes you on a sensory journey from the root to the crown.
Aromatherapy and soundscapes will harmonize with each chakra as you move through your practice, supporting a deep sense of alignment and flow.
Throughout the session, the space will come alive with dynamic color projections — grounding reds, creative oranges, golden yellows, soft greens, tranquil blues, intuitive indigos, and luminous violets. Created in collaboration with a visual artist, these shifting hues mirror the energy of each chakra, deepening your awareness and connection to self.
Feel your energy awaken as movement, breath, and color merge into a meditative rhythm — a deeply relaxing and revitalizing experience for body and mind.
Plus, your evening includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, a delicious way to conclude your journey.
Meet Nicola, your teacher
The essence of Namaste Nicola’s teaching is soulful, gently guiding you through the yoga experience to a deeper connection with yourself.
She has over 20 years of teaching in Australia and New Zealand, and over 300 hours of training with International lead trainers, and forever expanding her knowledge. The yoga philosophy, the poses, the movement now interweaves through her entire being, thinking, relationships with others and herself. Yoga isn’t something she does, it is who she is, and it is a joy to guide others in their hatha or yin practice.

In our uncertain, confusing and challenging world where can we turn to find inner strength and mental peace?
In his teachings on training the mind, Buddha taught many methods for transforming difficult situations into opportunities for spiritual growth. By applying these teachings, we can learn to cultivate a peaceful and positive mind, even in challenging times.
In this day course we will explore powerful and practical techniques that help us navigate whatever arises in our daily lives, including the more difficult moments, and transform them into opportunities for cultivating lasting inner peace and happiness.
We will also explore ancient meditations that have been practiced and proven for centuries, that are just as effective today in resolving our personal challenges.

description:
Journey into Om, Yoga without mantra is a bit like cake without the icing !
By now we all know that everything essentially is vibration. Yoga knew this 1000's of years ago, that is why sound is the first tool of Yoga.
Learn about the pranavah mantra ( om) as it relates to your Yoga Practice.
In this 2-hour workshop, you will understand the traditional and respectful way to use this sacred sound: both theoretically and practically.
We will draw on the ancient texts of Yoga as our point of reference.
The use of a mantra is a powerful tool for healing, emotional and mental clarity, and spiritual development. You will be guided in a variety of accessible practices to experience the effects of this mantra.
This workshop can open new dimensions to your practice, or it is also a great way to start on the Yoga Journey.
I teach from the Viniyoga tradition of Krishnamacharya, where mantra is used as an integral aspect of Yoga, whether it be asana, pranayama, or meditation.
This workshop will be nourishing to all the dimensions -heart, mind, and body.
You do not need to be a singer at all-just be willing to have a go at making a sound, even in your head if out loud feels too weird.

description:
Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu, Come and be held in a ceremony of sound.
Sunday 14th, from 2:22 PM to 4:04 PM at Lotus Yoga, Papamaru, an immersive Sound Journey awaits you.
This is a time and space to breathe, release, and be nurtured by the deep vibrations of medicinal instruments including Didgeridoo, HandPan, Jaw Harps, Shamanic Drone Flute, Shamanic Drum, Mongolian Throat Singing (Sygyt and Khoomei), and more — all amplified and layered through a loop station.
Comfortably lying down, you’ll be guided on a relaxing, clearing, and rejuvenating inner journey. This transformative experience supports your nervous system, helping to release tension and restore calm and presence.
Benefits of Sound Healing
Mental clarity and emotional balance
Deep relaxation and revitalization
Enhanced focus and memory
Better sleep quality
Strengthened immune response
Boosted creativity
Heightened self-awareness and environmental sensitivity
What to Bring
Comfortable clothing
A mattress, pillow, blanket, eye mask — anything to support your full comfort
Water bottle
An open heart
Event Guidelines
To create a held and focused space:
Please silence your phone before entering
Arrive on time — we recommend 2:12 for a smooth, grounded start. Doors close at 2:22 PM sharp.
This offering is part of the Kohael Project, where I (Justin) and fellow co-creators offer well-being practices in exchange for koha or donation — supporting personal transformation and collective healing.
More info : https://kohael.com/
Live music and more : https://www.youtube.com/@kohaelproject/playlists
https://www.instagram.com/kohaelproject/
Support the project and the Kohael Truck : https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/kohaelprojectonwheels
Thank you for reading, and see you soon.
With gratitude and love,
Justin

description:
Kundalini Flow Movement Meditation, Kundalini Flow Movement Meditation - Sunday SEPT 14TH ~ Doors Open at 4:30pm for gentle warm-up and soft arrival into the space.

Opening Circle begins at 5:00pm ~ 90 mins ~ This is a gentle vibrating, dancing meditation to sacred music with breathing awareness; We shake off all that no longer serves us to make space, the body remembers its own rhythm, we find room for Joy to fully express itself. This is 1 of 3 FLOW Movement Meditaitons before Christmas. Katie Te Ani first learned these powerful movement meditations at an ashram in India and shares them alongside breath awareness exercises and the healing vibrations of mantra singing.

description:
LIQUID PRAYER - Somatic Dance, LIQUID PRAYER
(more than) a somatic dance journey...
Join embodiment facilitators Jenna Joan & Sonic Sutra for an evening of ritual, connection, ceremonial cacao, freeform movement, and live soundscape.
🌑 Friday 16 January
🕕 7–9.30pm
📍 Thistle Hall, Wellington
🎟️ $35–$55
✨ Sober · Non-judgemental · All welcome · No experience needed
No door sales - tickets must be purchased online prior to the event.
As we land in the new year, we gather in reverence of what it means to be human...each of us; the entire ocean in a drop. When we connect to the rivers that flow within, we are reminded of our divinity: we are nature and we can find liberation in our sense of belonging as a part of the whole.
This is a space to FLOW FREELY, FEEL FULLY and anchor in any new year intentions as we transition from the year of the snake to the year of the fire horse.
We’ll begin our ritual with ceremonial cacao and a grounding meditation, then drop into a guided movement journey with live soundscape. There are no steps to learn, no performance—just presence, curiosity, and letting your body move as it feels. Barefoot and phone-free, you’re invited to drop deep into free-form movement, awakening the divine currents that flow through you.
Come as you are.
Move with what you feel.
Leave feeling empowered, connected, and alive.
Somatic dance is a guided movement practice that helps you tune into your body’s wisdom and move from the inside out. Unlike ecstatic dance, which is typically an open, DJ-led space with no facilitation, somatic dance offers gentle guidance to support you in exploring sensation, emotion, and embodiment in a safe, intentional way. You’re not learning steps or performing—you're being invited into presence, curiosity, and feeling. With a focus on nervous system regulation, personal expression, and inner listening, somatic dance creates a nurturing space to come home to yourself.
Your Hosts...
Jenna Joan | Embodiment Facilitator
Jenna Joan is a somatic family constellation therapist, yoga teacher, and group facilitator who has been leading movement spaces for over 15 years. With a background in yoga, somatic dance, and therapeutic embodiment, her work blends play, authenticity, ancestral healing, and deep nervous system awareness. Jenna is also a cacao alchemist and ceremonial facilitator, known for creating safe, soulful spaces that invite freedom, connection, and inner exploration. She has been hosting workshops, retreats, and community events for nearly a decade, and also works 1:1 in more therapeutic settings.
Sonic Sutra | Somatic Dance DJ
Sonic Sutra is a sound artist and somatic dance DJ who creates immersive musical journeys designed to support authentic movement, emotional release, and deep embodiment. With a focus on somatic dance and therapeutic soundscapes, their sets are intentionally curated to guide dancers through an inner experience—honouring the body’s natural rhythms and the intelligence within. Their offerings create safe, accessible spaces for people of all bodies, backgrounds, and experience levels to explore movement, presence, and connection. Rooted in play, precision, and deep listening, Sonic Sutra brings music that moves beyond entertainment—into healing and transformation.

description:
Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts, Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts
If you’ve been through a redundancy, restructure, or a big shift in your working life - or if you’ve been out of work for a while and are looking ahead to something new - this gathering is for you.
We’ll spend an hour outdoors (weather permitting) in a gentle, guided ritual to help you release some of the heaviness that comes with change and open up to what’s next. You can expect moments of quiet reflection, light movement, and simple nature-based activities designed to connect you with yourself, the land, and a sense of possibility. There’s no chanting, costumes, or anything too out-there - just a safe, thoughtful space to mark what you’ve been through and welcome in the next chapter.
The ritual will be hosted by Tamara Buckland - Leadership Strategist, Chief People Officer, and Druid - who blends leadership wisdom with nature-based practices to create meaningful, accessible experiences for people in transition.
After the ritual, we’ll wander to Picnic Café for coffee or tea (you’ll just need to cover your own drink) for those who’d like to keep connecting.
Details
📅 Friday 29 August (rain date: Friday 5 September)
🕛 12:00–1:00pm ritual
☕ 1:00pm coffee/tea at Picnic Café
💸 Free (pay for your own drink at the café)
📍 Wellington - location shared on registration
This is for anyone ready to put down some of the weight they’ve been carrying, connect with nature and themselves, and make space for the next chapter.

description:
Light Language Healing Transmission, Light Language Healing Transmission
Susan Crystal Diamond is inviting you to join her circle for a sound and light language multidimensional transmission that will guide you to a deeper inner alignment through channeled light codes and wisdom to receive more peace and love.

In this sacred seated space you will be guided through gentle breath opening you to receive source energy, practice a fun intuitive exercise, choose an oracle card, receive a channeled light language activation to either release, activate, expand or heal for your highest good.

Experience this journey with Susan, which will support your inner strength and invite you into a state of divine neutrality. This relaxing, uplifting experience is designed to help you navigate the changes we are all facing offering a new template for peace and balance and return to your true nature.

Please note this is a seated event however you are welcome to bring a mat and blanket to lay down for the transmission, wear layered clothing for comfort and bring a water bottle.

Energy exchange $30 021 608913 To book
Transfer payment to 06-0773-0271726-00

Susan is a seasoned practitioner and channel of light with decades of experience in the healing arts bringing experience, wisdom and compassion to her work. Over the last 10 years Susan has refined her unique gifts of light language which she brings through for private clients and in group sessions. Her light language is a powerful tool working on subtle energetic levels to assist individuals in transforming on a cellular level and connecting to their higher selves. Paired with sound instruments Susans sessions are always unique and intuitively guided.

Susans’ commitment to guiding souls with humility and compassion has made her a trusted source of support and wisdom in the healing community. Allow her to help you navigate your own journey with grace and light.

In the circle we will weave our unique soul essence together to experience the oneness of our new earth frequency.

Namaste

description:
Little Revolutions 2026 - Wellington, Little Revolutions 2026: Renewed Neighbourhoods
We follow the One who “became flesh and moved into the neighbourhood.” The way of Jesus calls us over the fence, across the road, and to the ends of the earth. True revival never ends in a Sunday gathering—it spills into transformed neighbourhoods where there is “good news for the poor, release for the captive, recovery of sight for the blind, and liberty for those who are oppressed.”
This year we’re delighted to welcome Dave Mann from Bonny Downs, London. Together with his wife Sally, Dave serves as a Baptist pastor planting new faith communities in lower socio-economic and Muslim-majority neighbourhoods. They also established the Bonny Downs Community Association, a vital vehicle for neighbourhood renewal. Their story is beautifully told in Sally’s book, Looking for Lydia.

description:
Medical Astrology Workshop - Your Blueprint for Health, Medical Astrology Workshop - Your Blueprint for Health
Your chart’s not just about your personality, t’s your health manual.

Sick of vague health advice that doesn’t feel like you? Your body has its own energetic blueprint, and astrology can help you read it.

In this unique one-day event, I’ll show you how to connect your birth chart, chakras, and planetary patterns to real-life health insights. We’ll talk about what causes energetic imbalances, how the planets influence your body systems, and what astrology can tell you about the timing of illness, fertility, even surgery.
This is ancient science + modern health insight, with practical tools you’ll actually use.

🗓️ 5th October 2025 at the Newton Community Centre, Colombo Street and Rintoul Street, Newton, Wellington. 10.30 - 3pm - for more info and to register please email me

What others have said:
“I attended Christina’s Blueprint for Health course and absolutely loved the info. Her nursing background adds an extra boost. I’ve made several changes to my health as a result.” – gentlebec1978
“My experience at Christina’s workshop was amazing! The way she teaches is captivating, fun, and interactive. I’ll be attending any future ones.” – Melissa M.

description:
Mexican Prehispanic Experience at AWHI, Join Claudio in his Mexican project called Xochipilli´s Eye. Xochipilli (Pronounce: Zo-chee-pee-lee) is the Mexica god of music, flowers, arts, and sacred plants.
Claudio´s last trip home to Mexico was full of inspiration, reconnecting him to his ancestral roots in Mexico City. He was fortunate to meet a prehispanic musician and instrument maker who plays and crafts beautiful traditional instruments. Claudio returned to NZ with many special new instruments; and continues to be inspired and guided by the cultural wealth, wisdom, and knowledge of the ancient cultures of the Americas.
This event will be extraordinary and unique. You will learn about Mexican prehispanic cosmology and spirituality. Experience simple and powerful rituals together with unique musical instruments used by Olmecs, Toltecs, Aztecs, and Mayans. The instruments include clay flutes, clay drums, medicine drums, ocarinas, wooden flutes, shells, and shakers skilfully arranged to create magical shamanic atmospheres.
We will be sharing Cacao which is an energetic traditional Mexican prehispanic drinks that help open the heart, reconnect with the earth element, ignite your fire, and get you up and moving.
What to expect:
Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.
Talk about the use of music in the ancient times.
An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions.
Cacao ceremony: Claudio will offer the cacao drink as a connection with the earth, to yourself, and the moment.
Live music that invokes many emotions and imagery, from contemplative natural and mystical environments to uplifting and empowering rhythms. You are free to project and explore within and/ or express and liberate projecting outwards.
We will finish with a shamanic atmosphere relaxation and close the event with a traditional chant.
No previous experience is required.
What to bring:
Wear comfortable clothing! Bring an open heart and a mind ready to learn and receive. You are also welcome to bring a fruit and or a flower to contribute to the altar.
Date & Time: Saturday, April 13th, 6-7:30pm
Location: AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing, Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington Central
Investment: $55

description:
Monk & Munchies, Monk & Munchies is where plant-based eats meet meaningful conversation.

We’ve got mantra music to set the vibe, a live Q&A with Chaitanya Charan on Living Spirituality, and a plant-based dinner. Think stuffed-crust pizza, wedges, Hawaiian skewers, fresh salad, topped off with chocolate mudcake with ice cream and mocktails!

We’re super stoked to host Chaitanya Charan in Wellington! He’s a monk, global speaker, and author of over 25 books, and has shared his insights at top universities like Yale and Princeton, as well as companies including Microsoft and Intel. What really sets him apart is how practical and relatable his wisdom is—making timeless teachings easy to apply to everyday life. Take this chance to meet a monk in person and hear his insights firsthand!

Good food, live beats, and insights that will leave you with something to think about.

6:30 QnA with a monkl
7:05 mantra music

Monthly Astro Meetup, Wellington's Monthly Astrology Meetup
A Monthly gathering for all Astrologers, enthusiasts, and the astro curious - All Welcome!
Featuring a new speaker/topic each month.
This month: Jayn Verkerk - Finding our Locations
We all have places that we vibe with, and those we don't. Which places in the world do you align with – for work, holiday or relocation?
For this session I will share techniques(using astro.com) that I've learnt in readings. Bring along your chart and we can map it onto the earth to locate your best places for travel or relocation, and generally share experiences of location and astrology.
Jayn Verkerk is a mostly modern astrologer. Self-taught, along with courses with Graham Ibell, she was active at the Wellington Astrology Centre. Jayn is a researcher with a PhD in critical digital humanities and creative practice.    
$10 entry fee, includes tea, snacks and presentation.
For more info, contact Erika at erikaegrant@gmail.com

description:
New Moon, New Year, New Energy: Kundalini Yoga and Gong Bath Workshop, Step into the first New Moon of 2026 with clarity, grounding, and an open channel for possibility, setting the seeds of intention for 2026. A nourishing way to begin the year in alignment.

Join Mel for a restorative and empowering Kundalini Yoga class, utilising the Opportunity & Green Energy Kriya—a sequence that awakens fresh potential, clears stagnant energy, and aligns you with abundance and opportunity.

After yoga, sink into deep rest with a 1 hour healing Gong Bath — where you lie down and let the soothing vibrations and sounds of the gong support inner renewal, nervous system reset, and integration of your intentions.

During the break between yoga and the gong bath, there will be time for guided journalling and a herbal tea break - creating space to plant the seeds of your intentions for 2026 or for the month ahead. This reflective moment helps you anchor your vision and consciously direct your energy for the new cycle.

Kundalini Yoga: 1.30pm – 3.00pm
Break: Herbal tea, healthy snack, guided journalling & oracle cards
Gong Bath: 3.30pm – 4.30pm

Come for one session or enjoy the full workshop experience.

Open to all levels – no experience with yoga or sound healing needed.

Bring your intentions, an open heart, a yoga mat, blanket, water bottle and anything you need to feel cozy + supported.

$35 Yoga | $30 Gong Bath | $55 Both | January special: $100: 2 people for Both sessions (must be booked together)

description:
Palmistry: Exploring Planetary Energies, Palmistry: Exploring Planetary Energies
Learn the art of palmistry and enjoy a plant-based dinner afterwards - all included in your ticket!
In this workshop, we’ll explore how the mounts of your hand reveal the influence of different planetary energies, such as Jupiter’s connection to ambition and Saturn’s role in discipline. Each mount reflects unique qualities and patterns of behaviour, offering insight into your personal traits and how you navigate challenges.
By the end of the session, you’ll have a good understanding of how these planetary energies can be identified and interpreted in your own hands. You’ll leave with practical tools to start reading these energies, providing a deeper appreciation for how planetary forces shape different aspects of your life

description:
Pastor From Gaza, St John’s is collaborating with Central Baptist to host this Pastor from Gaza, as he shares about being the Church amidst conflict.
Born and raised in Gaza, he now ministers across the Gaza and Middle East, providing pastoral support and practical aid to persecuted Christians, refugees, orphans, and widows.
This tour is not political—it is about the Body of Christ. The Pastor will share his own testimony, speak to the ongoing challenges faced by Christians in Gaza, and highlight his wider ministry in the Middle East. It is a message of hope, forgiveness, and perseverance—one that will challenge the Church in Aotearoa.
This event is to raise awareness of the spiritual and practical needs of believers in Gaza and the Middle East, as well as invite us to give in support of his ministry, with funds going directly to help persecuted Christians with food, shelter, and outreach.

description:
Pleiadian Encoded Attunement Circle | Wellington, Pleiadian Encoded Attunement Circle | Wellington
A Boutique Galactic Group Experience to Uplift, Activate & Attune Your Energy

Are you ready to connect with loving cosmic support, raise your vibration, and anchor powerful light codes that you can access again and again in your daily life?

Join me for a deeply transformative and high-frequency group healing and attunement experience — the Pleiadian Encoded Attunement Circle.
This sacred circle is designed to open your energy field to the uplifting and joyous frequency of the Pleiadians, guiding you into deeper alignment, soul activation, and vibrational expansion. Because I work and hold space within a high vibrational field, everyone present is able to access, attune to, and receive these elevated frequencies too - opening a gateway to higher states of awareness and multidimensional reconnection.
This is a multi-layered energetic journey that will support your soul’s evolution and empower you with tools to continue accessing these frequencies whenever you need them.

In Ancient Atlantean Times...
Healing was simple.
People would sit before sacred, light-infused paintings, allowing frequency, sound, and intention to restore balance and harmony.
I’m bringing this ancient practice back.

Join me for a group Healing Session in Wellington • a beautiful multidimensional experience for deep new-code absorption, renewal, and alignment. You’ll sit in sacred space before my Pleiadian Portal Painting, surrounded by gentle frequency music, sipping ceremonial Kakao, and immersed in high-vibrational energy.
Each person will receive a clearing and then be guided through a powerful meditation and activation, with time to journal and share afterwards.

• What’s Included in This Sacred Attunement Journey
• Individual Galactic Clearing
We begin by preparing your field for higher frequencies. Each participant will receive a personal energy clearing to release stagnant or lower vibrations, supported by channeled light language to open you to deeper transformation.

• Heart-Opening Kacao Ceremony
Once the clearing is complete, we’ll share a gentle ceremonial Kacao experience to expand the heart, deepen receptivity, and create a sacred container for Pleiadian frequencies to flow through.

“Raise Your Vibration” Pleiadian Wisdom Talk
I’ll share insights into who the Pleiadians are, their role in humanity’s awakening, and how their joyous, supportive energy can help you in everyday life. You’ll also receive simple, powerful tools to help you reconnect with this frequency long after our circle.

• Guided Meditation & Activation
We journey through a deeply guided meditation supported by my Pleiadian Encoded Artwork and light language transmissions. This works on a soul level to activate deeper layers of your light body, anchor wisdom, and align you with higher frequencies. The energetic transmission continues to integrate long after the session.

• Personal Angelic Attunement & Integration
To complete our journey, each participant will receive a personal ANGELIC attunement to anchor the frequencies received and integrate them into their unique energetic system, supporting lasting transformation and soul alignment.

• Why This Circle is Unique
This is an intimate, boutique-style event limited to just 10 participants to ensure a deeply personal and supportive experience for everyone. Smaller groups allow me to focus the energy on each individual, maximising the depth and potency of the transformation you’ll receive.
You will leave feeling uplifted, attuned, and supported — and with the ability to reconnect with these higher frequencies whenever you need.
To help extend and nurture the energy beyond the circle, supportive tools will be available and to order - including aura sprays, light-encoded scarves, and art prints, so you can continue to connect with and access the Pleiadian frequencies in your own space.

Event Details

Location: Whitby, Wellington (address supplied upon booking)

Exchange: NZ$65

🎟️ $𝟒𝟎–$𝟓𝟎

***TICKETS ESSENTIAL - NO DOOR SALES***

As the season turns to spring, we gather in remembrance—an invitation to embody the strength within and 𝐟𝐞𝐞𝐥 𝐡𝐨𝐰 𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐥 𝐰𝐢𝐬𝐝𝐨𝐦 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡 𝐮𝐬. When we connect to our inner foundations, we touch the support of those who came before and deepen our sense of belonging to life itself.

We’ll begin with ceremonial cacao, then drop into a guided movement journey with live soundscape. There are no steps to learn, no performance—just presence, curiosity, and letting your body move as it feels. 𝐁𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐟𝐨𝐨𝐭 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐩𝐡𝐨𝐧𝐞-𝐟𝐫𝐞𝐞, 𝐲𝐨𝐮’𝐫𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐝𝐫𝐨𝐩 𝐝𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐟𝐫𝐞𝐞-𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭, 𝐚𝐰𝐚𝐤𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐦𝐚𝐲 𝐡𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐠𝐨𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐧.

𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐞 𝐚𝐬 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐚𝐫𝐞.
𝐌𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐰𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐟𝐞𝐞𝐥.
𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐝, 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐞𝐝, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐚𝐥𝐢𝐯𝐞.

𝐒𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐢𝐬 𝐚 𝐠𝐮𝐢𝐝𝐞𝐝 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐩𝐫𝐚𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐡𝐞𝐥𝐩𝐬 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐨 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐛𝐨𝐝𝐲’𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐬𝐝𝐨𝐦 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐝𝐞 𝐨𝐮𝐭. Unlike ecstatic dance, which is typically an open, DJ-led space with no facilitation, somatic dance offers gentle guidance to support you in exploring sensation, emotion, and embodiment in a safe, intentional way. You’re not learning steps or performing—you’re being invited into presence, curiosity, and feeling. With a focus on nervous system regulation, personal expression, and inner listening, somatic dance creates a nurturing space to come home to yourself.


𝐘𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐇𝐨𝐬𝐭𝐬...

𝐉𝐞𝐧𝐧𝐚 𝐉𝐨𝐚𝐧 | 𝐄𝐦𝐛𝐨𝐝𝐢𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐅𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐨𝐫
Jenna Joan is a somatic family constellation therapist, yoga teacher, and group facilitator who has been leading movement spaces for over 15 years. With a background in yoga, somatic dance, and therapeutic embodiment, her work blends play, authenticity, ancestral healing, and deep nervous system awareness. Jenna is also a cacao alchemist and ceremonial facilitator, known for creating safe, soulful spaces that invite freedom, connection, and inner exploration. She has been hosting workshops, retreats, and community events for nearly a decade, and also works 1:1 in more therapeutic settings.

𝐒𝐨𝐧𝐢𝐜 𝐒𝐮𝐭𝐫𝐚 | 𝐒𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐃𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐃𝐉
Sonic Sutra is a sound artist and somatic dance DJ who creates immersive musical journeys designed to support authentic movement, emotional release, and deep embodiment. With a focus on somatic dance and therapeutic soundscapes, their sets are intentionally curated to guide movers through an inner experience—honouring the body’s natural rhythms and the intelligence within. Their offerings create safe, accessible spaces for people of all bodies, backgrounds, and experience levels to explore movement, presence, and connection. Rooted in play, precision, and deep listening, Sonic Sutra brings music that moves beyond entertainment—into healing and transformation.

description:
Rangatiratanga for Life - Becoming the CEO of Yourself, The day is designed to stretch and grow you! In the whakatauākī of Tā Apirana Ngata (Ngāti Porou), E tipu, e rea, he exhorts us to 'grow and flourish'. Grow and flourish! More than survive, get by, do ok. Flourish! This day will explore ways to fully engage with the beautiful moemoeā this whakatauākī speaks to.
E Tipu, E Rea
E tipu e rea mō ngā rā o tō ao
Ko tō ringa ki ngā rākau a te Pākehā
Hei ora mō te tinana
Ko tō ngākau ki ngā taonga a ō tīpuna Māori
Hei tikitiki mō tō māhunga
Ko tō wairua ki tō atua, nāna nei ngā mea katoa
Grow and branch forth for the days destined to you
Your hands to the tools of the Pākehā for the welfare of your body
Your heart to the treasures of your ancestors as adornments for your brow
Your spirit to God, who made all things
— Sir Apirana Ngata

You may like to think about how the day can help you align your professional work-based objectives (often expressed as KPI’s) with your personal vision, mission and goals.
The aims of the Course are to:
1. To host a mana ake wānanga exploring your unique future;
2. To bring together a group of people interested in creating rangatiratanga in their lives;
3. To draw from mātauranga Māori to support participants to create a 12-month personal strategic plan (drawing on moemoeā, pūrakau and pūtake);
4. To facilitate learning using Māori learning and teaching styles;
5. To connect people to the power of lifelong learning; and,
6. To add to the network of dedicated, Treaty based nation builders who have the goal of 'Becoming a CEO' on their radar for themselves or someone they know, whether that be at the personal, whānau, hapῡ, iwi or organisational level.
Our programme is interactive and delivered through a range of teaching / learning techniques which also include: facilitation; small group discussion; critical analysis; reflection; and, reporting back.

description:
Real Power - Buddha Vajrapani empowerment and teachings, Real Power - Buddha Vajrapani empowerment and teachings
Buddha Vajrapani empowerment and teachings
with Kadam Birgit

Buddha Vajrapani is the Buddha of spiritual power, sometimes referred to as the Buddha of skillful means.
With the development of spiritual power, we possess the confidence, inner strength and skill not only to take on and defeat our own delusions, but to be of great benefit in helping free others from their delusions as well.
Nothing could be more meaningful.

The empowerment is a beautiful and inspiring guided meditation and ritual in which we are introduced to Buddha Vajrapani from whom we then receive many blessings, adding great power to our own practice as well as sowing seeds for our future attainment of enlightenment.

In the afternoon Kadam Birgit will give a commentary on the beautiful Tantric practice and sadhana of Buddha Vajrapani.

description:
Reiki Healing Training - Level One, ❤ Reiki has had an extremely powerful positive influence on my life, and on the lives of my clients and students, helping us all to heal and change mindset, physical and emotional conditions, and to see life in a new light.

Reiki helped with my recovery from Chronic Fatigue syndrome and Mental stress ❤ I will share this with you in this course and help you open your life to the positive transformation that Reiki can bring.

I am a Usui Reiki Master and Teacher with 27 years experience working consciously with energy and a growing number of happy students. I offer an accessible, supportive training experience which enables you to easily benefit from the natural healing experience.

This TWO DAY course offers 12 hours of in person training including attunement, a full manual, certificate of completion and ongoing support. Maximum of 7 participants to enable close support and interaction.

The Reiki Level 1 Course focuses on energy and how we use it, it involves being attuned to the Reiki energies and using them for self-practice. Reiki is a great tool if you want to feel centered in your life, it helps to balance and align our energy bodies, and can cause positive changes in many areas of our lives.

When you receive your Reiki First Degree attunement you become a channel and are able to bring through healing energies ongoingly for yourself and friends and family.
Reiki can be used to help heal a wide number of conditions and to initiate and support positive life changes. Further details on enquiry.

Dates are specially chosen to be auspicious for firstly bringing energy to a new focus and purpose and the second date holds energies conducive to alignment.

SUNDAY 30th November and SUNDAY 7th December, 10am-5pm

Discover the Gift of Reiki with Usui Reiki Level One

Usui Reiki is a gentle yet powerful method of natural healing, rediscovered by Mikau Usui over 100 years ago. It uses the flow of Universal Life Force energy to heal and rebalance the mind, body, and spirit. The beauty of Reiki lies in its simplicity and accessibility—everyone has the ability to connect with these healing frequencies. Reiki is a lifelong tool, ready to support you whenever you need it most.

In this Reiki Level One course, you will:
🌟 Learn how to perform a self-Reiki session and offer one-on-one Reiki to family and friends.
🌟 Receive the sacred Usui Reiki Level One attunement in person.
🌟 Begin a 21-day spiritual cleanse to integrate the energy shifts.
🌟 Study the history of Reiki, basic anatomy, chakra systems, and the frequencies of language and emotional states.
🌟 Gain practical tools to incorporate Reiki into your daily life.

This comprehensive course exceeds all standards set by Reiki NZ Inc. The training includes 12 hours of tuition spread over two days (both dates must be attended), with a 21-day integration period supported by ongoing guidance and a private Facebook group.

Includes:
✨ 12+ hours of expert tuition over 2 days
✨ Comprehensive manual and certificate
✨Cacao Ceremony to expand our hearts in preparation for our attunement
✨ Light healthy afternoon tea and herbal teas each day
✨ Access to a private Facebook group for support
Payment options, including plans, are available—please email me for details at .

Class size is kept small to ensure an intimate and personalized learning experience. A commitment to home study and self-Reiki practice is required for 21 days following the course.

🌟 When & Where:
📍 Capricorn Spirit, Willis St, Wellington
📅 Two days attendance required - 10.45am to 4.45pm, Saturday, December 13th and Sunday, December 14th.

🌟 About Your Teacher
Gina Noetica is one of New Zealand’s most experienced and dedicated Reiki Master/Teachers. Teaching all levels since 2008 and working as a professional Energy Healer (Quantum Energy Alchemy) since 2001, Gina brings a wealth of knowledge and a deeply intuitive approach to her courses. Her grounded, heartfelt teaching style empowers students to embark on their own journeys of healing and self-discovery.

I would be honoured to share this sacred practice with you.

Namaste,

Gina Noetica
Founder of the Centre for Expanding Consciousness
Professional Quantum Energy Alchemist & Reiki Master/Teacher, Consciousness Coach, Cacao Ceremonialist, CE5 Ambassador, Breathwork Facilitator.

description:
SOLSTICE FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY, SOLSTICE FULL MOON SONG AND SOUND CEREMONY
Come and Sing, Sound and Meditate!

Want to mark the important time of the Solstice full moon?

Come and join with us on Sunday the 7th December for a group ceremonial gathering in Paraparaumu.

We will explore sacred conscious sounding practices to balance and align the energy system, sing healing chants and songs from different traditions, and explore guided vocal improvisation for freedom, upliftment and joy!

Ceremonial cacao will be served with focus and healing inTention.

There will be guided journal prompts around the energy of the Solstice and the whole session will finish with a full sound healing.

Everyone is welcome and there is no need for any particular preparation or pre existing skill.

Please get in touch with any questions or to book. Come and enjoy Song, Chant, Sound and Healing!!

So looking forward to gathering for the Solstice Full Moon on December 7th. Come and join with us to invoke and celebrate the energies of balance and creation at this profound time of year.

This session will explore singing, chanting, sounding and conscious voice empowerment practices. We will also explore energy practices like Qigong and meditation. All within a ceremonial framework.

Everyone is welcome. Limited spaces. Get in touch soon

You are warmly invited to book to join this powerful sound and voice ceremony which will work with Spirit, the forces of Nature and Bryony's skill and expertise in creating sound for growth and transformation.

This is a special opportunity to tune into the sacred energies and potentialities of this time of the Solstice: opening us to balance, healing, nourishment, new growth and positive change.

Bryony will invoke and work with the healing power of the supportive energies of Spirit, ancestors and our highest Selves. Bryony's has an extensive background experience with Spirit, the Earth forces and sacred lands; these forces are central to her practice and Self.

She will lead you firstly in a process of meditation, conscious sounding, toning and singing healing chants.

This use of our voices to co-create a sacred group sound is uplifting and transformative and will support you in your process of healing, releasing and visioning.

There will be time for guided journaling and intention setting.

The second section of the workshop will be a focused and dedicated sound bath which will bring balance and deep relaxation, into a sense of stillness and peace. There can be a sense of gratitude and appreciation.

Both the conscious use of the voice and the sound healing have many benefits, which are verified by science and which can effect us positively on the physical, mental, emotional, energetic and spiritual levels. A document which has more information about these benefits can be provided on request.

All are welcome:
I look forward to sharing with you and supporting you in this ceremony.

Investment for full 2.5 hours

$59 - concession - https://buy.stripe.com/8wMaItcvY6oV0Kc7ti

description:
Sika Sound Journey, This powerful experience is like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.

Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.

Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.

Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements. A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.

An epic adventure deep inside yourself.

Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.

Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.

There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so once again, please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket to get really comfortable.

A journal is also recommended.

description:
Somatic Dance Wellington ~ Hara Rising, HARA RISING ~ FRIDAY EVENING SOMATIC DANCE
This month, we dance from the deep.
From the low-lit well within the pelvis, where instinct, intuition, and our inner fire reside.
Breath descends, awakening the Hara, our life force energy, clearing what no longer serves us.
Movement rises, carrying what wants to be felt, freed, and transformed, opening space for more joy and vitality.
We dance not to perform, but to reclaim our energy, our presence, our aliveness.
To sink into the molten center where your belonging, your power, and your knowing dwell.
Let your hips answer.
Let your breath carve.
Let the Hara lift you, guiding you toward the embodiment of your truest self and the year ahead.

~ Friday 5th December
~7pm -9 pm
~Te Whaea National Dance and Drama Centre, Newtown
~Limited Spaces Available
~No door sales 
✨ We are a passionate group of certified Somatic Dance facilitators, eager to get you grooving on a Friday evening and set the perfect mood for your weekend.
What to Expect:
Somatic Dance: A guided, free-form movement journey, delving deep into the layers of the body, supported by a carefully curated soundscape.
Non-Judgmental Space: Let it all go! All of you is welcome to explore your own unique expression.
No Dance Experience Necessary: There are no routines or steps to follow here, simply an invitation to discover how your body wishes to move.
Come and move to the rhythm of you, ready to deepen your connection with self and others.
This is a space free of booze, shoes and talking on the dance floor. Let the epic music and steady voice of your facilitator carry you out of mind and into body, slipping away to the transformative power of somatic dance. The music takes the form of a wave, beginning gently before building to a peak, then settling softly and slowly. You'll leave feeling refreshed and high-vibed for the days ahead. 
What to Bring:
Comfortable clothes for movement (layers are recommended)
A drink bottle
A drop or two of curiosity!
Please arrive 5-15 minutes early to settle into the space. We welcome you from 6:45 PM for a prompt 7PM start.
We can't wait to dance with you!
~Wellington Somatic Dance Collective x

description:
Somatic Sanctuary: Exploring self-care through movement, touch & listening, "The experience and the venue were very restorative for my nervous system. Connectivity through a delicious winding path of interactive games and movement expression experiences lead me to a very open and receptive creative space. Highly recommend. Amazing facilitation." - Lily
“Thanks to this workshop, I was able to let go more than ever before, and really let in touch that was non-sexual, loving, and supportive. Thank you so much for offering another step up the mountain of growth & healing” - Amanda
*****
Imagine a day where you can drop deeply into embodied awareness, show up authentically with other heart-centred humans, and get straight to the core of what truly matters, through connective somatic practices designed to nourish your body & replenish your spirit.
Welcome to Somatic Sanctuary, a full-day experience where you are invited to self-regulate & co-regulate through a range of complementary modalities: Yin Yoga, Authentic Relating & Contact Improvisation.
This February, you are invited to The Wellington Meditation Centre, a beautiful & cosy urban sanctuary complete with a tranquil garden. Come explore the many layers of yourself and others through a journey of deep yet playful communication and contact games.
After taking this precious day for yourself, you are likely to step into the week ahead with a profound sense of well-being, a remarkable connection to your body and an experiential toolkit that you can use right away to make your everyday life even better.
WHO is this day for?
In essence, Somatic Sanctuary is for you if you want to connect on a deeper level with your body, your desires, your boundaries, your emotional reality, your empathy skills and your ability to feel compassion for yourself. This day will enhance your interpersonal relationships and enrich your self love within.
Whether you are a seasoned workshop/retreat goer or it’s your first time ever exploring the bespoke practices, you are sure to get something valuable out of this workshop.
You are also most welcome if you’ve been recently feeling blocked, anxious, lacking purpose or direction, and need to reground and remind yourself what's truly important and who you truly are.
Our experience includes working with Highly Sensitive People (HSPs); neurodiverse people; people suffering from anxiety and depression; people going through major life shifts; and members of the LGBTQ+ community.
If you have any questions about whether the event would suit you, pop us a message and we’ll get back to you within 24 hours.
WHAT will actually happen?
Activities will explore movement, conversation and physical contact, through the modalities of Yin Yoga, Authentic Relating & Contact Improvisation.
Yin Yoga focuses on deeply relaxing the nervous system, by bringing fresh life force (prana) to your connective tissue and vital organs. Through deep stretches, long holds, and mindful breathing, your body is given permission to fully release any tension that has accumulated over time.
Authentic Relating is a ground breaking social tool that invites you to courageously step into open hearted connection, through radical honesty and active listening. The practice invites you to drop deeper into presence, embodied awareness and permission to express whatever is alive within you and the ‘we-space’ between you and other(s), as well as any boundaries that emerge within the connection field.
Contact Improvisation is a dance form that emphasises both self-regulation and co-regulation, through spontaneous movement and physical connection between people, as well as the non-human physical space (such as the floor). It encourages exploration of balance, weight-sharing, and communication through touch, inducing a deeply aware state of surrendered fluidity.
Consent will be emphasised throughout the weekend. You will continually be reminded to listen to your body and only do what is within your personal boundaries. While you will be encouraged to stretch yourself and widen your window of tolerance, you will practice identifying your stress zone and will learn tools to help you self-regulate if you push yourself too far.
There will also be a support team on hand if you need to co-regulate at any point.
WHERE will it be?
The workshop will take place at Wellington Meditation Centre, 31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand.
The FACILITATORS
Laurie King
Laurie (he/him), is a queer British-Kiwi who’s current home-base is Wellington, NZ. His passion is creating spaces that cultivate healthy, thriving human-to-human relationships, helping people take off their masks, feel their sensations and celebrate their aliveness on Earth. Since 2019, he has organised and facilitated hundreds of Authentic Relating, Dating and Embodiment workshops in Oceania and Europe.
His training includes The Embody Lab, Authentic Revolution, Connection Institute, Body Electric and World Peace Yoga School. He has facilitated at internationally acclaimed festivals such as Stretch and Ignite, and organisations such as ART International and Authentic Bay Area.
His workshops have sparked thousands of nourishing connections, turning many strangers into life-long friends. He looks forward to holding space for you!
For more information, check out itoiauthenticrelating.com.
Laurie’s workshops have already touched & impacted many lives. Here's what others have shared:
“This was a game changer for me. I'm blown away on a daily basis as to how easy communicating and relating has been since doing Laurie's incredible workshop" - Andy
"I live with complex PTSD and anxiety so in the past I have really struggled to open up to people and build meaningful connections. Discovering these workshops has been a life changer and both my therapist and I are thrilled with how my confidence has blossomed in recent months. Laurie's time and generosity really means the world to me" - Sarah
“Laurie created a beautiful, safe space in no time! making it an ideal environment to be present and engage meaningfully with the activities. Even though all participants were strangers to me, I felt a deep sense of belonging developing over the day.” - Julie
“The exercises allowed me to center myself in heartspace - free to be held by others in love and in my own experience while also able to hold them in their experience. As such, it’s a perfect space for co-regulating.” Justin
“I am still digesting the ripples from this profoundly moving workshop, and am beyond grateful for the aligned new connections that have come out of it” - Rachel
“I love Laurie’s energy, wisdom, execution and light touch” - Tess
Sam Baker (she/her)
Sam is an experienced facilitator and has seven years of experience with somatic modalities, including contact improvisation and somatic experiencing. She previously ran ‘Embodied Empowerment’ with Laurie and wrote the ‘Hierarchy of Physical Needs’ (which the workshop was inspired by) based on observations and conversations around “Why does Contact Improv feel so safe & satisfying?”
Here’s what others have shared about Sam’s work:
“Learning about the Hierarchy of Physical Needs really made sense to me. I realise how I’ve impulsively entered into relationships or romantic encounters when really I was just craving playfulness, or connection, or touch” - James
“I really enjoyed the exercises as an opportunity to get out of my mind and into my body. To feel, not just to think” - Meaghan
HOW MUCH will I invest?
$109 - Low income ticket
$139 - Medium income ticket
$159 - High income ticket
In order to make the event as accessible as possible, there are three ticket types available. It is up to you to decide which ticket you purchase, depending on your own feelings about your level of disposable income and how much you would like to contribute for the event.
If you would really like to attend but do not have the above funds available, please get in touch and we can figure something out!
Practicalities:
Where: 31 Hobson Crescent, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand.
When: Saturday 14th February (10am to 5pm)
Dresscode: Comfortable clothing that's easy to move in.
Food: Tea, coffee & snacks are provided. Lunch will be potluck style so bring something to share!
Refunds: Full refund if cancelled three weeks or more before event. 50% refund if cancelled up to one week before event. If you need to cancel within the week before, you can transfer your ticket to a friend.

description:
Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau, Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau

Experience Sound Bath Experience: Ngā Wā o te Tau, a journey through the seasons inspired by the natural rhythms of Aotearoa. “Ngā Wā o te Tau” means “The Seasons,” and this sound bath, guided by Smita and Peter with the rich tones of taonga pūoro and waiata, invites reflection on the cycles of nature and our connection to the world around us.

This immersion takes you from winter’s stillness, through spring’s blossoms, summer’s warmth, and autumn’s release, attuning to the changing energies of each season. Unique sounds encourage reflection, connection, and inner calm, while gentle karakia and mindful intention weave the journey together, creating a meditative space to pause and breathe.

After the sound bath, enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket — a wholesome way to close the evening in good company.

Meet your hosts & musicians, Smita & Peter, Smita (Ngāi Te Rangi) was born and raised in Aotearoa. From a young age she was drawn to music as a means for reflection and self-expression. During her music studies at university, she was introduced to taonga pūoro, and this sparked a personal journey of reconnection to te ao Māori and her own whakapapa. Following university, she lived in an ashram for several years where she was introduced to the wonderful practice of bhakti yoga. She now lives with her husband in the Wellington region, where they regularly participate in kirtan (mantra music meditation) at Bhakti Lounge.

Peter is Pākehā, with grandparents from England and Ireland, and has been on a four-year journey learning the art of taonga pūoro — the traditional Māori musical instruments of Aotearoa. Guided by the wisdom and generosity of expert makers and players, he has learned both to craft and to play these unique instruments. For Peter, taonga pūoro offer a way to connect deeply with sound, story, and the natural world, and he is excited to share their voices as part of this sound bath experience.

What’s on the menu?
Jackfruit Rendang

Satay Seitan Skewer

Gado Gado salad with peanut sauce

Rice

Banana cake with caramel sauce

Hot "chocolate"

Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia
Immerse Yourself in a Journey of Sound & Stillness

Join us for a special evening of harmonizing pure sounds, inspiring music, and deep relaxation at our beautiful space. Let the transformative power of sound guide you into a state of peaceful awareness and inner connection.

- 5:00 PM – 7:00 PM, Saturday, 4th of October
- Investment: $49
- Book here: https://www.wellnessliving.com/rs/event/wild_wellbeing?k_class=100000004277

What to Expect
Give yourself the gift of stillness as you surrender to the healing vibrations of:
- Gongs • Tibetan & Crystal Singing Bowls
- Native American Flutes • Harmonium • Sitar & Esraj
- Bells • Mantra chanting • Sacred Silence

Claudio’s high-quality amplification ensures you *feel* the sound as much as you hear it, creating a fully immersive experience. Allow the waves of resonance to:
- Release physical, mental & emotional tension
- Guide you into deep meditation & heart-centered awareness
- Restore balance & invite inner peace

How to Prepare
- Bring a pillow, blanket, or anything to ensure comfort
- Come with an open heart and an intention (optional)
- Wear loose, cozy clothing

About Claudio Escutia
A 3rd-generation multinstrumentalist from Mexico City, Claudio’s journey spans classical guitar, jazz, and global spiritual traditions. Trained in Indian classical music and Tibetan sound healing (studied in Nepal and India), he brings over a decade of expertise as a Sound Healing practitioner. His music is a bridge between ancient wisdom and modern therapeutic soundscapes.

**Experience the Magic of Sound Healing with Claudio Escutia – First Time in Mandala Yoga**

Discover the transformative power of sound at *Mandala Yoga Studio* with the multi-instrumentalist **Claudio Escutia** in his first time **Sound Healing Experience** in Paremata. This is your chance to unwind, recharge, and immerse yourself in a deeply restorative sonic journey like no other.

### **An Evening of Deep Relaxation & Inner Harmony**
Claudio masterfully blends the resonant vibrations of **Gongs, Crystal & Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other sacred instruments**, creating an immersive soundscape that soothes the nervous system, quietens the mind, and opens the heart.

- **Feel the sound** as much as you hear it—every note washes through you, releasing tension and restoring balance.
- **No experience needed**—just lie back, breathe, and let the waves of harmonic sound carry you into deep relaxation.
- **A rare opportunity** to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing vibrations—right here in Paremata!

Bring your own yoga or camping mat, pillow and blanket for ultimate comfort. Come in cozy clothes, ready to melt into the sound.

description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 11th October, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 11th October
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness. Discover the power of your own voice, mantra and silence working to find inner peace and contentment. Bring an intention, get comfortable and let the sound waves take over. Invite the sound to take you into a journey within, into your heart, to rest, to release physical, mental and emotional tension.

Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc..Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.

Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.


About Claudio: Claudio is a 3rd generation Multinstrumentalist Musician from Mexico City now based in Wellington. Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years. When he finished music school as a classical guitarist he moved to Montreal, Canada and explored new genres such a Jazz, World Music, and Spiritual Music. Traveling he discovered Indian Music and the Yoga Tradition and they became a very important influence on his career and lifestyle, and allowed him to study Music and Yoga with teachers in Europe and Asia. He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer. He has been playing the Tibetan bowls for more than 10 years now.

description:
Sound Healing Experience, Step into an evening of restorative soundscapes, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply calming and rejuvenating experience. Your ticket also includes a delicious plant-based dinner and dessert to complete the evening.

Ancient instruments—from Gongs to Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls and Native American flutes—come together in a rich tapestry of sound, inviting you to slow down, breathe, and reconnect with yourself.

With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it vibrating through your body, encouraging profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—simply arrive as you are and let the music carry you into a space of calm and presence.

What to Bring
Yoga mats, blankets, and cushions are provided, but you are welcome to bring your own mat or extra comforts for a truly personal experience.

Meet Claudio Escutia, your host
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.

Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?

Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:

SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio

description:
Sound Healing Journey + Intro to Fascial Manuevers, Join me on an afternoon of Sound Healing and an introduction to Fascial Maneuvers.
We will be starting the afternoon at 5:15pm for half an hour of fascial manuevers (think stretch with gentle movement and breathing) to relax and get the body into rest mode, and at 5:45 we will start a 60-minute Sound healing Journey with crystal and Tibetan bowls, drums, voice, and more.
Seeing that the end of the year is approaching soon, I thought we could focus on letting the old (that no longer serves) out, to make space for the new in.
When? Sunday 30th November from 5:15-6:45
Where? Hataitai Centre (157 Hataitai Road, Hataitai, Wgn)
Suggested koha $20, but pay what you can.
Everybody is welcome. No previous experience in anything is required, only your presence.
Bring a mat, blanket, pillow, a friend, and/or anything you want to be comfy and warm!
Looking forward to sharing this afternoon with you!
You are welcome to RSVP via DM (Instagram or Facebook) or email me at soundhealingnz@gmail.com
